Drive performance -Collaborate cross functionally with buying and planning and other departments An analytical mindset- you are proficient in the use of Excel/MS Office tools and can translate data into decisions and strategies Remarkable problem-solving abilities- you thrive in a high-pressure environment and can maintain focus  What we have to offer: The chance to work with an incredibly diverse, dynamic and flexible team that understands the need to step back and recharge The opportunity to be part of brand energy moments in some of the most exciting cities in Europe A position in an industry leading team offering a broad career path An amazing employee discount and regular sample sales at our Foot Locker HQ Experience sneaker culture at its best and have fun while doing it

title: Corporate IT Trainee (DA)
summary:
You can be a project manager, a data analyst, a platform analyst, in the PMO, etc.
In this role, you have the opportunity to.
You are a part of.
description: Job Title Corporate IT Trainee (DA) Job Description In this role, you have the opportunity to Learn and grow as a professional within the corporate IT domain of Philips Domestic Appliances (DA). As a trainee, you will join a 2-year program, in which you will be fulfilling 3 challenging assignments in different departments within IT. The Traineeship focusses on ‘learning on the job’, mentoring and training. You will benefit from ample opportunities to learn and share with other IT trainees and employees, while expanding your business network. After two years of accelerated learning and gaining valuable experience, you are in the driver seat of your career. You will get the chance to use the network you have built to find the perfect next step in your IT career. Your responsibilities Domestic Appliances (DA) will become a separate legal entity per 1st of July 2021. From an IT point of view, this means two things, during the first year of separation we will rely on the services provided by Royal Philips, while in parallel we define our own target landscape. As a trainee you will be part of the teams that will make sure that the “lights stay on”, and will develop and deploy the next-gen architecture. You can be a project manager, a data analyst, a platform analyst, in the PMO, etc. We will organize your first assignment and you will choose your next steps. You are a part of The corporate IT domain of Philips Domestic Appliances (DA). Philips’ Domestic Appliances business is a global leader with EUR 2.3 billion in sales in 2020 in kitchen appliances, coffee, garment care and home care appliances, with successful products such as the Airfryer, Perfect Care Steam Generators, Automatic Coffee Machines with LatteGo and SpeedPro Max Aqua vacuum cleaner. To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience Have recently graduated or will graduate latest August 2021 with a Master’s Degree in the fields of Information / Data analytics, Business Information Management, Business Information Systems, (digital) Marketing, Business Administration, Digital Business and Innovation, or related Finalized a Bachelors in Information Technology, or related field to Digital Technologies Maximum 1 year of work experience Excellent inter-personal and communication skills Driven by operational excellence and have an eye for detail Experience in problem solving and change management techniques is a plus International experience and mindset is a plus The ability to use internal and external resources to maximize the value for the company and its customers Project management skills Speak and write fluent English A daring mind-set. Willing and able to challenge the status quo. Strong in stakeholder management capabilities (both remote as F2F) Team player, a collaborator putting consumer first, DA second and team third In return, we offer you A meaningful career, with new challenges in our dynamic organization, working in an encouraging multinational and multicultural environment. We are happy to provide you with this opportunity to work with new technologies. You will be surrounded by passionate and committed, colleagues who share your ambition to create outstanding customer experiences. Your work will be ambitious and full of opportunities for growth. Variety and challenge will be part of your daily routines. As a trainee you will receive a contract for the period of 2 years, with excellent labor conditions. Recruitment Process Please apply online and Upload your CV, motivation and grade list by the 14th of May 2021 If you pass the pre-selection round an online ability test can be part of the recruitment process; If you achieve the required score on this test, you will be invited for a short recruiter interview in April / May 2021; The most suitable candidates will be invited for the Selection Day in the Netherlands, Amsterdam (ideally in the week of June 21-24, might adjust pending COVID regulations); your presence during the Selection Day is required. When you successfully complete the selection process, you will start your first assignment per September 2021 Why should you join Domestic Appliances? Philips’ Domestic Appliances business is a global leader with EUR 2.3 billion in sales in 2020 in kitchen appliances, coffee, garment care and home care appliances, with successful products such as the Airfryer, Perfect Care Steam Generators, Automatic Coffee Machines with LatteGo and SpeedPro Max Aqua vacuum cleaner, and many more that are used by millions of people every day across the world. In January 2020, Philips announced that it would be considering new ownership options for Domestic Appliances, as it is not a strategic fit for the company’s future as a health technology leader, and committed to finding the right home for the business to ensure that it is set up for continued success serving customers, leveraging the Philips brand and driving growth across the markets that it serves. In its 128-year history as a leading innovator, Philips has had to reinvent itself a number of times to remain competitive. This has involved several high-profile divestments, resulting in the company’s successful track record in managing complex change of this scale. Such transformations offer unique opportunities for employees to ‘make their mark’ and gain expertise in a specific and dynamic environment - those who can deliver results while navigating and contributing to changes will gain unique skills and perspective that will prove valuable for the rest of their careers. Contact If you forgot your password, you can click the Forgot Password button on the Sign In screen to reset it.

title: Data-analisten
summary:
Ben jij onze nieuwe data-analist?
Wij zoeken een gedreven en leergierige data-analist met autisme.
Als data-analist gebruik je de data van onze klanten om…
description: Wil je nu werken in een professioneel en sociaal bedrijf waar je jezelf kunt zijn en je autisme wordt gezien als een kwaliteit? Wij zoeken een gedreven en leergierige data-analist met autisme. Dit is een uitdagende baan voor iemand die het leuk vindt om te puzzelen met data. Let op: deze functie is op dit moment ingevuld. Omdat Swink een groeiend bedrijf is, zijn we (voor de toekomst) altijd op zoek naar buitengewone data specialisten. Pas jij in de functieomschrijving en wil je graag bij ons werken? Vul dan het sollicitatieformulier in dat onderaan deze pagina staat of mail voor meer informatie naar werken@swink.nl. Wie zijn wij? Swink is een social enterprise (sociale onderneming) en een buitengewoon internetbureau dat de kwaliteiten van mensen met autisme en een afstand tot de arbeidsmarkt inzet voor haar diensten. Ons team bestaat uit zowel mannen als vrouwen, waarvan de meeste autisme hebben en minimaal een HBO-denkniveau. Ze hebben zich bij ons ontwikkeld tot bijvoorbeeld contentspecialist, data-analist of SEO-specialist. Wij werken voor (middel)grote organisaties. Dit zijn bijvoorbeeld het Erasmus MC, Nyenrode en Gemeente Amsterdam. Waarom werken bij Swink? Wij zijn een bedrijf dat gelooft in je kwaliteiten en waar tegelijkertijd rekening wordt gehouden met zaken waar je door je autisme moeite mee kunt hebben, zoals omgevingsgeluiden of overzicht houden over je taken. Je werkt of bij Swink op kantoor maar het kan ook zijn dat je bij de klant op locatie werkt. Wel zorgen wij er altijd voor dat je een omgeving werkt waar optimaal rekening wordt gehouden je autisme. Wij stimuleren je om jezelf te ontwikkelen, bijvoorbeeld met (online) vakopleidingen of door je nieuwe taken uit te laten voeren. Bij Swink ben je nooit uitgeleerd. Lees ook het blog over solliciteren en werken met autisme. Wat ga je bij ons doen? Als data-analist gebruik je de data van onze klanten om hiermee inzicht te geven in zaken die in het verleden hebben plaatsgevonden of om voorspellingen te doen. Dat houdt in: Bepalen van informatiebehoefte bij klanten en vertalen naar benodigde brondata; Maken van ontwerpen; Ontsluiten van databronnen; Opstellen datamodellen; Bouwen van database programmatuur; Bouwen van rapporten en dashboards; Opstellen van beheerprocessen. Wie zoeken wij? Iemand die een vorm van autisme heeft en gemotiveerd en gedreven is. Je herkent jezelf in het onderstaande profiel: Je hebt minimaal een HBO-denkniveau; Kennis van en ervaring met SQL; Kennis van een reporting tool (SSRS, Power BI, Tableau of Qlik); Kennis van een ETL tool is een pré; Kennis van een programmeertool (C#, C++, .NET, Javascript, R, Python, Matlab) is een pré; Kennis van Data Vault modellering en/of Kimball is een pré; Je bent gedreven, leergierig en vindt het leuk om je te ontwikkelen tot data-analist; Je houdt ervan om te puzzelen en oplossingen te bedenken; Je kunt je goed focussen en langere tijd op een onderwerp richten; Je hebt oog voor detail en bent perfectionistisch. Wat bieden wij? Een werkplek waar rekening wordt gehouden met je autisme. Een salaris dat past bij je kennis, ervaring en vaardigheden. Een contract van minimaal 28 uur per week met doorgroei naar 32 uur of meer. Ben jij onze nieuwe data-analist? Let op: deze functie is op dit moment ingevuld. Omdat Swink een groeiend bedrijf is, zijn we (voor de toekomst) altijd op zoek naar buitengewone data-analisten. Pas jij in de functieomschrijving en wil je graag bij ons werken? Vul dan het onderstaande sollicitatieformulier in of mail voor meer informatie naar werken@swink.nl.

title: Operations Lead Data Compliance
summary:
Create coherence between data management strategy, data platforms, data-driven processes and (requirements set by) regulators;
About what we are looking for.
description: Are you seeking a career in an inspiring, enthusiastic, international, entrepreneurial and agile environment? Want to work at one of the largest Global Financial Institutions? If you thrive in a fast-paced, hands-on, and team-oriented environment where you can have a big impact on the organization, Aegon should be your next employer! Overview Aegon is committed to balancing innovation while protecting individual privacy and has embraced privacy and data protection as core to the successful execution of its business strategy. As part of that commitment, Aegon has established a top-notch privacy organization and is currently adding talent to its global team which is based in The Hague. The Operations Lead, Data Compliance will support the Group Chief Privacy Officer. You will work with the members of the Global Privacy Office in the execution of their duties globally to help ensure that our businesses and business partners fulfil their regulatory and organizational requirements regarding the protection of personal information, while simultaneously enabling business, data and technological innovation. You will ensure that Data Management organizations and processes consider (privacy) compliance as a key pillar for their success. You drive the implementation, monitoring and continuous improvement of data compliance operations throughout the 1st line organizations and where needed the Data Protection Officers. You further support the procurement and implementation of technical solutions to enable efficient operational processes. For these activities, you work with the Global Data Office, with local Data Management teams and their Chief Data Officers, (Data) Privacy Offices, Compliance Departments and with the Global Technology Services (GTS) organization. The Operations Lead, Data Compliance will work as part of a cross-functional global team of privacy and data protection professionals, dedicated to ensuring compliance while continuing to enable (business) solutions and innovation. Role and Responsibilities Is responsible for working with the general reporting and admin support capabilities on the coordination of and overseeing all reporting (e.g., Aegon Privacy Control Framework) and metrics that are created by the Global Privacy Office and integrates relevant metrics created by e.g., Global Information Security Teams, Global Data Office, etc.; Leads efforts in the build and optimization of 1st line Privacy Operations across the Enterprise, together with e.g., the Global Data Office leadership; Provide advice to Aegon’s Global Technology Service teams which include the Global Information Security Officer, Global Procurement Officer and Global Chief Technology Officer as well as our Global Head of Architecture; Provides guidance in the establishment and implementation of Data Compliance controls such as third-party risk management, data clean-up programs, etc.; Acts as sparring partner to the first line privacy teams regarding their duties in enabling the Data Organizations and the local Businesses while acting as guardians of privacy compliance; Acts as catalyst of continuous collaboration and alignment between Data Analytics, Data Management, Privacy Operations and Compliance teams throughout the Enterprise; Leads global Training & Awareness initiatives on Compliant Data Usage and Privacy. Assesses upcoming demand and opportunities; Represents Privacy Compliance in Data Management-related global/regional implementation programs and related SteerCo’s and governance bodies; Represents Privacy Compliance in multi-unit discussions regarding data management topics such as Retention and Deletion; Privacy Classification, Data Lifecycle Control including Data Lineage; Data Quality Standards (incl. eliminating Dark Data), Master Data Build and Optimisation; Metadata Management; Works closely with the Global Data Office and the Global Enterprise Architecture team in Data Management and Data Compliance tooling discussions and selections; Create coherence between data management strategy, data platforms, data-driven processes and (requirements set by) regulators; Appreciate the nexus between data privacy, data protection, and the use of data to advance major corporate strategic goals; Is responsible for working with the general reporting and admin support capabilities on the coordination of and overseeing all reporting (e.g. Aegon Privacy Control Framework) and metrics that are created by the Global Privacy Office and integrates relevant metrics created by e.g. Global Information Security Teams, Global Data Office, etc. About what we are looking for Education: BA or MA Degree is required Certification(s) from the IAPP desired PMP/Prince2 certification Six Sigma/Lean certification is a plus Experience and Skills: experienced (at least 6 years) in the field of change management and has at least 3 years’ experience managing complex multi-system/department projects or change initiatives Proven track record and strong drive to establish, structure and continuously improve operations (people, process, technology); Vast experience in dealing with the complexities of multinational matrix organizations Excellent communication skills (verbal and written) in English and preferably in other Aegon languages; Experience with structured presentations and storytelling, to influence key stakeholders, from the operational teams to C-suite executives throughout the enterprise; Demonstrated teamwork and collaboration skills, in particular in supporting global and multi-functional teams; Excellent analytical and problem solving skills; Highly motivated to contribute and grow within a complex area of emerging importance; Has the ability to learn and educate others, takes the time to explain complex matters and transfer his/her knowledge; Has the ability to effectively collaborate (virtually) with colleagues from multiple (country) units, functions (analytics to compliance) and levels (analyst to C-suite). Can translate content and context between several disciplines (Analytics, IT, CDO, Risk, Legal, Compliance, etc.); Is able to apply the existing compliance structure on processes within (country) units and does so proactively; Strong experience with vendor management and with major software implementations. Knowledge Knowledge of Data Management principles and solutions; Understanding (or able to understand and learn quickly) laws and regulations to privacy compliance, with special focus on the GDPR; Understands (or able to understand and learn quickly) Privacy Operational processes and tooling (e.g. OneTrust, PowerBi and reporting structures); Organizational savviness; Good understanding of the Compliance Management tooling offered by MS/AWS, is a plus Proficiency with MS Office/O365 suites. Interested? Does this role appeal to you? We then look forward to receiving your cv and motivation via our application form on this website. An online assessment is part of the selection process. For more information about the application procedure you can contact Anne van Busselen, Sr. Talent Acquisition Manager anne.vanbusselen@aegon.com or +31 (0)6 23 79 27 26. #LI-FAD

title: CRO Analist
summary:
Hoeveelheid data die beschikbaar is.
OVER E-LUSCIOUS • Aantoonbare affiniteit met data, jij beschikt over sterk.
Jij draagt continu bij aan de verbetering van.
description: De continue ontwikkeling en groei van e-Luscious vraagt om innovatie, flexibiliteit en ondernemer- schap. Om uitvoering te geven aan onze ambitieuze CRO strategie zoeken wij een: CRO Analist Als CRO Analist ben je verantwoordelijk voor het vergaren van inzichten uit diverse bronnen van klantdata. Deze inzichten leiden uiteindelijk tot een serie testhypotheses. Jij draagt continu bij aan de verbetering van de klantervaring van alle bezoekers in onze shops. OVER E-LUSCIOUS • Aantoonbare affiniteit met data, jij beschikt over sterk e-Luscious, Top 35 Twinkle genoteerd en in 2020 analytisch denkvermogen bekroond met het World-class Workplace keurmerk, • Vermogen om van groot naar klein te denken en is een snelgroeiende e-commerce organisatie in de inzichten op een overzichtelijke en duidelijke manier wijn- en koffiebranche. Met succesvolle labels zoals te presenteren Koffievoordeel.nl, Wijnvoordeel.nl, Wijnbeurs.nl en • Het vermogen een sociale team player te zijn terwijl Colaris.nl, is e-Luscious de pureplay marktleider in de je klant- en resultaatgericht handelt Benelux. Door de klanten centraal te stellen en dagelijks nóg beter, meer persoonlijk en efficiënter in te spelen op WIJ BIEDEN JOU: hun behoeften, is geen dag hetzelfde. Onze dynamiek • Een uitdagende functie met veel ruimte voor eigen en bedrijfscultuur karakteriseren zich als mens- en initiatief in een hard groeiend bedrijf resultaatgericht, transparant, plezierig, leergierig en • Een creatieve, positieve en dynamische werksfeer in met een bescheiden hiërarchie. een resultaatgericht, no-nonsense team Een competitief salaris bij een World-class Workplace JOUW UITDAGING • Ruimte om jezelf verder te ontwikkelen binnen je Als CRO Analist maak je het verschil door met eigen vakgebied verbeteringen en aanbevelingen te komen uit de grote • Korting op alle artikelen die wij verkopen binnen hoeveelheid data die beschikbaar is. Met deze inzichten e-Luscious kan de klantervaring steeds verder geoptimaliseerd worden. Dit doe je voor alle labels, over alle landen. INTERESSE? title: (Junior) Investment Analist Hypotheken
summary:
Als investment analist maakt je deel uit van het Fundmanagement team.
Je meet performance en risico van de diverse beleggingsportefeuilles met behulp van…
description: Over deze vacature Bouw jij mee aan de groei van ons hypothekenbedrijf?  Sinds 1 oktober 2020 is in Amsterdam het nieuwe hypotheekbedrijf van Achmea gevormd. Syntrus Achmea beheert voor ruim 50 institutionele beleggers de diverse hypotheekportefeuilles verdeeld over 5 merken (Centraal Beheer, Woonfonds, Syntrus Achmea, Attens en Tellius). In deze dynamische omgeving met gedreven, professionele collega's, met een focus op onze klanten, bieden we een uitdagende functie van Investment Analist.  Als investment analist maakt je deel uit van het Fundmanagement team. Jij maakt analyses en rapportages die het realiseren van rendementen van de diverse hypotheekportefeuilles voor beleggers ondersteunt. Zoek jij een afwisselende en uitdagende rol, waarbij je de spil bent tussen de institutionele beleggers (funders) en de diverse hypothekenportefeuilles? En als expert mee kunt bouwen aan de performance en het risicoprofiel van de beleggingen? Solliciteer dan direct en wellicht begin jij binnenkort in deze uitdagende functie!  Jouw dagelijkse werkzaamheden omvatten onder meer: Je analyseert de portefeuilleresultaten voor beleggers, opdrachtgevers en beheerder binnen de vastgestelde fondsstrategie, de beleggingsrestricties en de afgegeven mandaten van fondsen en separate accounts. Je meet performance en risico van de diverse beleggingsportefeuilles met behulp van beschikbare data Je verzorgt scenarioanalyses en stimuleert en begeleidt het gebruik ervan Je verzorgt rapportages richting opdrachtgevers, participanten en management Je verzorgt portefeuilleanalyses en presentaties voor opdrachtgevers participanten of interne afdelingen Je beoordeelt benchmarkdata en voert attributieanalyses uit  Wat jou uniek maakt als (Junior) Investment Analist Hypotheken  Je hebt een afgeronde wo opleiding in een economische of kwantitatieve richting Aangevuld met een vervolgopleiding zoals VBA of CFA, of de ambitie om deze te volgen Je beschikt bij voorkeur over 2 jaar relevante werkervaring in het veld van (vastrentende) beleggingen Je beheerst de Nederlandse en Engelse taal goed in woord en geschrift. Je neemt initiatief en pakt dingen zelf op. Je houdt rekening met de wensen en behoeften van de klant en streeft naar het behalen van de afgesproken resultaten. We hebben deadlines die gerespecteerd moeten worden en samen maken we dit waar voor het team, de organisatie en natuurlijk onze klanten. Wat wij bieden Naast een goede werksfeer bij een solide bedrijf bieden we je uitstekende primaire en secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden. Ook vinden we het belangrijk dat je je blijft ontwikkelen tijdens je loopbaan en bieden je daarom diverse opleidingsmogelijkheden.  Een marktconform salaris met naast 136 verlofuren per jaar obv 34-urige werkweek, een persoonlijk keuzebudget opgebouwd uit 8% vakantietoeslag, 8,33% eindejaarsuitkering en 3,85% bovenwettelijk verlof. Je kiest zelf of je dit budget laat uitbetalen, spaart of dat je er verlofuren van koopt Uitstekende pensioenregeling van 1,875% met een vaste jaarlijkse premie Een aantrekkelijke reiskostenvergoeding voor auto, openbaar vervoer én fiets Korting op je zorgverzekering bij Zilveren Kruis voor jou én je gezin. Je krijgt ook nog een extraatje van €250 bruto per jaar Korting op je schadeverzekering bij Centraal Beheer en Interpolis.  Rozhan Omer  rozhan.omer@achmea.nl  +31683171818

title: Data Modeller/Analyst
summary: Advanced understanding and experience in the area of data management and/or IT, data modelling- technics, architecture and agile way of working;
description: ING is looking to recruit a Data Modeller/Analyst within the Chief Data Management Office (CDMO Office). Your work environment The Global Data Area team is a newly formed head office function within the CDMO Office and is responsible for activities that support effective data management at ING. The Global Data Area team is responsible for running the Data Definition Process (DDP) following an agile way of working. The Goal of the process is to govern the creation, usage and adoption of ING Esperanto. ING Esperanto is the globally standardised set of business terms and definitions to realise a common understanding and uniformity of business terms across ING and to make it possible to exchange data between data lakes, in a uniform and industrialised way. The last is realised by creating the Esperanto logical- and physical data models and exchange structures. The Mission The Data Modeller/Analyst will drive, define, develop and maintain the ING Esperanto Business terms and logical and physical data models. You will be part of multi-disciplinary squads formed around business initiatives. Key responsibilities Execute the Esperanto process based on an Agile way of working and alignment with the other chapters and stakeholders; Set up and maintain design principles, standards and guidelines for Esperanto components and way of working; Support the Business Analysts in creating conceptual models. Deliver conform agreed principles and quality criteria: ING Esperanto business terms, Conceptual Data Models, data requirements, Logical- and Physical Data Models, requirements mapping and documentation necessary for shipping via Esperanto deployment packages to the Data Lakes; Supporting, coaching and training of colleagues in ING on ING Esperanto; Report on the process and communication to stakeholders. Maintaining and supporting the usage of the data models in the ING organization; Maintaining business terms and definitions, including data quality requirements and additional metadata; Who are we looking for? You are pragmatic, structured, problem-solving and quality-driven, yet have an eye for data management and standardisation in a complex organisation. You master the principles of model-driven data logistics and are able to practice these. You are comfortable working in an international context and shared development teams of modellers. You have outstanding social skills and can communicate effectively. Collaboration and facilitation skills are key in this role and accelerate in planning and organisational skills. You are transparent and flexible and able to act at the operational and tactical level. Experience and Knowledge Required Advanced understanding and experience in the area of data management and/or IT, data modelling- technics, architecture and agile way of working; Advance knowledge of banking processes and products; Broad experience with data modelling tools and methods; Excellent communication and didactical skills and English language skills both spoken and in word are required; Strong Data Warehousing / Data Modelling / Database Design skills Experienced in writing business terms, understanding of the importance of definitions and meaning of words; A Bachelor degree or equivalent through experience Desired Knowledge of and experience with the IBM’s BDW models and data modelling tools like Power Designer, InfoSphere Data Architect Knowledge of and experience acting within business area of financial institutions and within data management organisations. Experience as Senior Database Developer, Solution Designer or Data Architect (architecture, planning & roadmap, solution definition, solution follow-up & guidance) Understanding of Entity / Relationship Data Modelling, being able to interpret logical and conceptual data models and able to explain these models in a natural language. Knowledge of and a vision on data management and affinity with IT. Job specific requirements Required competences Candidates must possess the following core competencies and experience: Results Orientation as evidenced by a track record of delivering solutions which routinely exceed the business process expectations. Persistence and assertive: you deal with conflicts of interest, and obtain a good and acceptable end solution and are not afraid to challenge Collaboration and Influencing: able to demonstrate the ability to build meaningful relationships in a large and complex enterprise across functions, levels and geographic borders. He/she must be skilled in communicating complex ideas and solutions, at all levels of the organization and must be open to ideas from others.

title: Fulltime data analist bij bank/verzekeraar in Noord-Brabant en Limburg
summary:
Je hebt minimaal 2 jaar werkervaring als financieel data analist;
Solliciteer dan direct als fulltime data analist voor een bank of verzekeraar in de regio…
description: Al ervaring en wil jij jezelf uitdagen bij topwerkgevers? Solliciteer dan direct als fulltime data analist voor een bank of verzekeraar in de regio Eindhoven. Wat ga je doen?  Zeg je data analytics, dan zeg je een goudmijn voor banken en verzekeraars. En zie je deze vacature, dan zie je een goudmijn voor jouw cv en ontwikkeling. Jij kunt namelijk via ons aan de slag als fulltime data analist bij verschillende finance-bedrijven. Zo kun jij jezelf volledig uitdagen en je cv en netwerk flink uitbreiden.  Hoe zit dat?  Dat jij als fulltime data analist bedrijven met jouw analyses helpt te blijven innoveren, dat hoeven wij jou met je ervaring niet te vertellen. Wat wel interessant voor jou is, is wat er gebeurt als jij solliciteert op deze vacature. We plannen dan namelijk een kennismakingsgesprek in. Vinden we allebei dat er een match is? Dan plaatsen wij jou in onze finance-pool. Vanaf dat moment zijn onze accountmanagers jouw ogen en oren op de arbeidsmarkt. Hebben ze een goede kans voor jou in het vizier, dan nemen we direct contact met je op.  Persoonlijke ontwikkeling en talentmanager  En om nog even terug te komen op de ontwikkeling. Je doet namelijk niet alleen werkervaring op verschillende werkvloeren op, maar je gaat ook aan je persoonlijke ontwikkeling werken. Via ons persoonlijk leiderschapstraject ‘Take Charge’. Je leert jezelf nog beter kennen, bent je nog bewuster van je sterktes en werkt bewust aan de punten die nog beter kunnen. En dit allemaal onder begeleiding van je persoonlijke talentmanager. Bij wie je overigens met al je vragen en opmerkingen terechtkunt.  Wat wij bieden  Aan de slag als fulltime data analist bij een bank of verzekeraar in de regio Eindhoven (36 of 40 uur per week); Minimaal een brutomaandsalaris van € 2.300,-; Persoonlijke begeleiding en coaching door talentmanager; Jezelf nóg beter leren kennen met een persoonlijk leiderschapstraject; Je hebt recht op 25 vakantiedagen en 8.33% vakantiegeld; Reiskostenvergoeding; Het Wft Basis-certificaat al op je cv staan? Puntje extra. Nog niet? Je kunt ’m via ons gratis behalen  Wat wij vragen: Minimaal een hbo-diploma; liefst in de richting finance & control, econometrie of wiskunde; Je hebt minimaal 2 jaar werkervaring als financieel data analist; Analytisch, cijfermatig, secuur en gedreven: het zit allemaal in je; Al met Datalakes, machine learning, SQL, R en/of Python gewerkt? Dan sta je 1-0 voor. Je spreekt en schrijft goed Nederlands;  Solliciteren  Ben jij de perfecte kandidaat voor deze vacature en voldoe je aan de eisen? Klik dan op de knop 'Solliciteer direct!' en we nemen zo snel mogelijk contact met je op!

title: Data Analist
summary:
De Data analist stelt de exacte wensen van de organisatie en ziekenhuizen vast op het gebied van data.
Je bent sterk in zowel data analyse als functionele…
description: Jij bent een Data Analist die met nog 2 collega's het data gedreven werken naar een hoger level gaat tillen binnen deze organisatie. Met jouw data-analyse, datamodellen en heldere dashboards ondersteun je de bedrijfsvoering als interne business partner van de directie. Met ongeveer 2 jaar ervaring kan deze baan in de regio Delft van jou zijn! Wacht niet en solliciteer snel op deze vacature met doorgroei mogelijkheden. De functie De Data analist stelt de exacte wensen van de organisatie en ziekenhuizen vast op het gebied van data. In deze baan werk je samen met nog 2 data analisten op de afdeling bedrijfsvoering en je rapporteert aan de directie. Samen met je collega’s ga je aan de slag om het data gedreven werken binnen de organisatie naar een hoger level te tillen. Jouw taken en verantwoordelijkheden bestaan uit het ondersteunen van de bedrijfsvoering door middel van data-analyse, het beheren en up-to-date houden van data modellen en het ontwikkelen van dashboards en KPI’s. Tevens fungeer je intensief als interne business partner. Je bent eveneens verantwoordelijk voor het maken van uiteenlopende rapportages. Wat verder belangrijk is binnen deze organisatie? Zij staan voor klantgerichtheid, verbinden, eigenaarschap nemen en hechten veel waarde aan respect en integriteit. Dit zijn ook voor jou belangrijke waarden. Dit is een baan met goede doorgroei mogelijkheden. Deze baan is uitstekend geschikt voor een Data Analist die op zoek is naar een vervolgstap in zijn/haar carrière. Jouw profiel Jij bent een Data Analist met een afgeronde WO Bachelor/Masteropleiding in de richting van Econometrie, Informatica, Bedrijfskunde. Je hebt minimaal 2 jaar ervaring met Business Intelligence tools zoals Qlikview of Qliksense. Je bent sterk in zowel data analyse als functionele analyse. Binnen deze organisatie is het belangrijk dat je enige ervaring hebt met logistieke processen. Je kunt goed communiceren in het Nederlands en Engels. Natuurlijk kan je zelfstandig werken. Verder heb je nodig: Ervaring met SQL query’s; Applicatiekennis en praktijkkennis van SAP is een vereiste; Dit is een baan met goede doorgroei mogelijkheden. Deze baan is uitstekend geschikt voor een Data Analist die op zoek is naar een vervolgstap in zijn/haar carrière. Bedrijfsprofiel Onze opdrachtgever met ongeveer 108 medewerkers zorgt voor optimaal assortimentsbeheer en professionele inkoop binnen de zorg. Betrouwbare, efficiënte, flexibele en volgbare goederenstroom voor en in zorginstellingen. Veilig, full-control, transparant en geautomatiseerd betalingsproces aan de leveranciers. Maximale samenwerking met zorginstellingen en inkooporganisaties. Hiermee neemt men de regie in een optimale samenwerking met alle belanghebbenden. Het resultaat is dat zij op het gebied van inkoop en logistiek gezamenlijk de kwaliteit en service verbeteren en tegelijkertijd de integrale kosten verlagen. Het aanbod Je treedt direct in dienst bij deze opdrachtgever; Je werkt 36 uur per week € 3200-4000 bruto per maand op basis van 36 uur. Salariëring valt onder de CAO voor ziekenhuizen FWG60 en inschaling gaat naar opleiding en ervaring; Een 13e maand. Gedurende de Corona periode werkt men 100% vanuit huis. Er is een goede onboarding regeling gedurende deze periode. Ben jij de Data Analist die op zoek is naar een 2e stap . Wacht niet en solliciteer snel op deze vacature. Wil je eerst meer informatie? Dat kan: bel over deze vacature met Peggy Kooper, e-Recruitment Specialist, telefoon +31629537153.  Het sollicitatieproces Lees meer op onze website over het sollicitatieproces bij Exact.  Exactpi Referentienummer: .

title: Senior Financial Analyst NN Life & Pension
summary:
You drive changes proactively with new ideas and you are looking for improvements in the data flow landscape.
NN Life & Pension is looking for finance talents!
description: NN Life & Pension is looking for finance talents! For our reporting and valuations team we are recruiting Senior Financial Analysts. A salary depending on your knowledge and experience: salary between € 3.566 - € 6.009 based on 36 hours. Senior Financial Analyst You will be senior member of one of our Liability Reporting teams within NN Life & Pension. These teams are under the umbrella of the Finance Transformation & Reporting department that consists of 6 teams that work in close cooperation. We are responsible for the financial and regulatory reporting of liabilities and the execution of significant change programs such as the implementation of IFRS 17. As a Senior Financial Analyst your main responsibility is to create and analyse top-notch IFRS & SII liability figures, evaluate new business contribution and explain the results to our internal and external stakeholders. You will support your peers in their development and you have strong ability to content wise coach your team members. Your impact as a Senior Financial Analyst at NN One of your key challenges is to drive our rapidly changing environment. The new IFRS 17 standards expose us to a key change in the reporting landscape. Strategic changes in the business require revolutionary engineering in our financial processes. Pension buy-outs and reinsurance improve our competitive advantage where your crucial role is inevitable. Who you are As Financial Analyst you have a diverse set of skills: You have a high learning agility and you can easily adapt and absorb new information in a changing environment You have excellent analytical skills, combined with good communication skills in English You are change minded and always looking for improvement You like to take ownership and proactively like to achieve the best results You have deep technical experience in the field of reporting and/or actuarial sciences You like to coach junior team members and help them to understand financial processes and results Master’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g. econometrics, actuarial sciences, mathematics, finance) At least 5 years relevant working experience in Finance and/or Risk departments Initiative mindset and passion about improvement and automation Your responsibilities As a specialist in your field of expertise, you like to achieve excellent results: You have a deep understanding of the financial results of an insurance company You are able to provide clear explanations of the results to our stakeholders, including senior management You ensure timely and quality delivery of the financial results You drive changes proactively with new ideas and you are looking for improvements in the data flow landscape You are able to engage with a great variety of stakeholders, such as actuarial function holder, head office finance, auditors, etc. Your colleagues About the team: The Liability Reporting teams consist of professionals in econometrics, quantitative, controlling, actuarial fields. We closely work together with other departments at NN and communicate with several stakeholders such as external auditors. From the projects ongoing in respect of financial transformation currently the largest one is IFRS 17, the new financial accounting regime for insurance contracts.  About NN We help people care for what matters most to them. The world in which we live may change, but what really matters to people remains the same. Family, friends, love, health, home and of course work. You help to make our services more personal and relevant. As an organisation we can really make a difference with all our brands: Nationale-Nederlanden, NN Investment Partners, ABN AMRO Verzekeringen, Movir, AZL, BeFrank, Zicht and OHRA. Continue developing It is important to us that you continue to develop yourself. We give you the space and the confidence to grow in your career as well as a person. We help you with: Plenty of training and learning opportunities in our Learning & Development Centre A large (international) network of colleagues who are keen to share their knowledge with you The autonomy to set out your own development path Employee Benefits You are more than a colleague and we understand that very well at NN. You have different roles in life and that involves choices. We give you the opportunity to select the employee benefits that are important to you and that match your personal situation. This includes buying additional leave and flexible working hours. Your holiday allowance and 13th month are paid with your salary monthly, so there is no need to wait.  Because of coronavirus, all NN colleagues are currently working from home fully digitally. It is currently not yet clear when we can return to the office. The official location for this job is Rotterdam.  Will you be our new colleague? If you are enthusiastic about this vacancy and think that you would be a good fit for the team at NN, we would like to invite you to apply. We are very keen to find out who you are, what motivates you and what you can contribute to this role at NN.  Apply now Questions about the application procedure? Then please mail recruiter Danitscha Mahadew via danitscha.mahadew@nn.nl Just to be Clear, because we Care and Commit This is a permanent position. A candidate will receive a NN contract and we are not open to interim/ freelance assignments,- candidates or an introduction of profiles by any type of agency. Thank you for your interest and understanding!

title: Working Student / Bijbaan
summary:
Good Excel and data analysis skills.
You will be part of Picnic's fleet team, and work together with analysts, area managers, hub managers, and Runners.
description: At Picnic, we offer quality part-time jobs throughout the organization. This is the chance to earn extra cash while applying everything you've learnt. From supporting a groundbreaking distribution system, forecasting the growth of our company, to joining the determined operations team - there's plenty of opportunity to dive into interesting topics, develop abilities, and learn new skills. We expect everyone at Picnic to fit into a demanding atmosphere. You'll be treated as a full-time employee, receive invaluable experience in a challenging environment, and grab a drink with the whole team on a Friday. With a foot in the door and an expanding professional network, you'll create a solid platform from which to embark on a career. This page will constantly be updated with the newest available projects for working students. If you can't find a suitable project but you still match the requirements, please send us an email and tell us where you can fit in. What you need Capable Mind: Desire to learn on the go Quick Thinking: You identify issues and come armed with a solution Adaptable: Ready to change plans and restructure the day Independence: you'll take ownership of a project Professional Attitude: Smart and well-mannered Interdisciplinary Skills: You love the intersection of theory and practical implementation Working students needed: Distribution Team Picnic is pioneering in urban logistics. With a fleet of electric Picnic vehicles and efficient distribution models we deliver to a fast-growing customer base. Our distribution model constantly evolves and becomes more complex. We want fresh minds to bring creative ideas to help us plan and optimize our distribution. Picnic's distribution system sets us apart from the other players in retail logistics. We offer next day delivery, and our fleet of electric vehicles arrive within a 20-minute time window. On top of that we maximize distribution efficiency by only visiting neighborhoods once a day. As a Distribution Model Working Student, you analyze the performance of our distribution model. You improve existing delivery areas and help us optimally design new ones. Furthermore, you help us to implement measures against planned and unexpected events (e.g. Kings Day or heavy snowfall) and help us spot new efficiency gainers for our distribution model. Specific requirements: Studying a Bachelor or Master's in an analytical field of education Good Excel and data analysis skills Interdisciplinary skills: you love the intersection of theory and practical implication Fluent in Dutch and English Availability: for a minimum of 2 days a week, preferably more Duration: nine months of time or more from February onward Location: Amsterdam  Fleet Operator Picnic has one of the fastest-growing full-electric vehicle fleets in the world and we're attracting worldwide attention. Our 1,400+ electric vehicles are the visible connection between our hubs and customer households in the Netherlands and Germany. If there are issues with the fleet or with tools used by fleet operators, deliveries don't get to the right place and customers will be unhappy. That's a big responsibility – it requires ingenuity and continuous innovation to keep the fleet running and to deliver to an ever-expanding customer base. That's where you come in! Where you fit in As Fleet Operator, you ensure that the infrastructure that supports our operations to function safely and efficiently becomes better every day. You keep the overview over the fleet performance and together with the fleet team, mechanics and service providers you identify opportunities to improve the way of working, the hardware equipment or the software solutions we use. You bring structure and prioritization to weekly routines and short-term improvements, while keeping your eyes on longer term game-changers for the way we operate our fleet. You will be a linking pin connecting Picnic operations and third party service providers to keep our fleet running. You will be part of Picnic's fleet team, and work together with analysts, area managers, hub managers, and Runners. You know how each role fits into the operation and you stand firm to bring your vision to life. With a solid engineering understanding and a "roll-up your sleeves" attitude, you fix problems and grasp opportunities. When there are recurrent issues you quickly identify the cause, go to the drawing board, and come up with inventive solutions. Your skills and determination keep the wheels turning and our orders delivered. You will join our fleet team working jointly on the continuous improvement of the current vehicle and the next generation vehicle that will suit the wishes of our customers even better. This is a major opportunity to disrupt the current standards of last-mile delivery! Your role is instrumental to our company, and together we will shape the future of last-mile distribution. What you do Ensure daily continuity of our fleet operations in NL together with our fleet manager, by balancing our capacity with the demand for vehicles Work with our maintenance team to ensure we solve any issues in time for our operations to deliver on time Structure and prioritise weekly fleet activities for efficiency and effectiveness Interact with our hub locations to keep a continuous view on how our fleet is performing Ensure proper stakeholder engagement with all fleet parties involved Follow-up after incidents to ensure all necessary paperwork is completed Maintain an excellent overview of all our vehicle documentation What you need Pursuing a Master's in Engineering, or a different Master's degree with a clear interest in the technology behind our vehicles Fluency in Dutch and English Experience in an operational environment Quick Learning: Intellectual horsepower to learn on the go Eagerness to "build a better machine", you won't rest until it's optimal Practical vision: Hands-on, process-oriented, roll-up-your-sleeves attitude Independent, confident and proactive Ambition: Nothing-is-impossible mindset

title: Web developer
summary:
Het team bestaat uit twee applicatiebeheerders, twee systeembeheerders, een webdeveloper en een data analist.
Automatisering, Bedrijfsweg 8 in Best.
description: WEB DEVELOPER (medior)  Automatisering, Bedrijfsweg 8 in Best 40 uur HBO  Het verder ontwikkelen van onze webshops en applicaties is iets waar je blij van wordt. Je gaat je bezig houden met het maken van volledig geïntegreerde webshops (B2B en B2C), full API koppelingen maken voor de uitwisseling van gegevens (intern en extern), de UX (re)design van onze huidige werksites en applicaties en het uitbouwen van interne websites ter ondersteuning van de business. Kortom; een afwisselende baan met veel uitdaging!  Waarom werken bij Verano®? Verano® is toegewijd, aan haar werknemers en aan haar klanten. Samenwerken, beloftes nakomen, wederzijds vertrouwen en respect staan centraal binnen onze no-nonsense cultuur. Bij Verano® kun jij jezelf zijn en invulling geven aan jouw ambities. Wij willen dat het gaat om jou. En, niet geheel onbelangrijk: je bouwt samen met ruim 250 collega’s aan de toekomst van een ambitieuze organisatie!  Hoe ziet het team eruit? Het team bestaat uit twee applicatiebeheerders, twee systeembeheerders, een webdeveloper en een data analist. Ter uitbreiding van ons team zijn we nu opzoek naar een web developer.  Hoe kan jouw dag eruit zien? Je begint je dag met een stand-up met je IT collega’s. Hier hebben we het over welke functionaliteit we deze week gaan opleveren. Afhankelijk van je lopende projecten start je je dag met het ontwerpen van wireframes of het programmeren aan je huidige project. Je doet een analyse van de hotjar van de huidige website om zodoende de user experience te verbeteren. Tussendoor heb je ook overleg met andere afdelingen, denk aan marketing, sales en productie. Ook zij geven input over hoe de website er uiteindelijk uit moet komen te zien. Aan het einde van de dag heb je nog een overleg met de afdeling over de resultaten van de dag. Leuk om te horen waar je collega’s mee bezig zijn.  Wie ben jij? Wij vinden het belangrijk dat jij over de volgende kwaliteiten beschikt: Je hebt een afgeronde hbo opleiding. Je hebt aantoonbare werkervaring. Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse taal in woord en geschrift. Voldoende beheersing van de Engelse taal in woord en geschrift. Ruime kennis en ervaring met PHP en bijbehorende frameworks (Laravel en Symfony). Ruime kennis en ervaring van HTML/ CSS. Ruime kennis en ervaring met Ajax / Jquery / Bootstrap. Kennis van JSON/XML. Kennis van Python. Kennis van SQL.  Jij bent sociaal en weet op een uitstekend niveau te communiceren met relaties. Dankzij jouw flexibele houding kun je goed anticiperen op veranderingen en ben je in staat om altijd oplossingsgericht te werken. Jouw creativiteit inspireert jou en je collega’s om mooie ontwerpen te maken. Je bent in staat om verschillende belangen samen te brengen en zo een mooi resultaat neer te zetten.  Wat kunnen wij jou bieden? Naast een inspirerende werkomgeving en –sfeer bieden wij jou het volgende:  Een verantwoordelijke en zelfstandige functie bij een A-merk. De doorgroeimogelijkheden om jouw ambities waar te maken. Arbeidsvoorwaarden conform CAO-metaalunie.  Vanzelfsprekend wordt er dagelijks gewerkt aan mooie momenten, maar er worden ook enkele keren per jaar gezellige personeelsuitjes en –feesten georganiseerd. Opleidingsniveau HBO Provincies Noord-Brabant Branches Industrie/Techniek Publicatiedatum 5-2-2021

title: Master Data Performance Analyst
summary:
Ongoing data clean up and entry of additional data.
Propose solutions to complex master data related questions for projects.
Do you value a healthy lifestyle?
description: Are you looking for a dynamic and interesting new challenge? Do you value a healthy lifestyle? Looking for a team spirit that pushes each other to go above and beyond to win the game? Join the world leader in fitness and help us on our mission to inspire healthier lives by creating the best products, services and experiences for our customers. The Master Data Performance Analyst will be responsible for (1) internalizing, (2) documenting, (3) executing and (4) continuously improving (CI) the processes of proper data entry and maintenance in MS Dynamics AX and Exact. In addition to ensuring that master data quality meets the expectations of the stakeholders, the role holder is required to pro-actively contribute to the building out of DQ management and reporting within the team. The data management areas maintained include; item master, bill of materials, configurations, cost changes, pricing and any other functions related to item management within MS Dynamics AX and Exact. Quick turnaround of internal requests is extremely important. Candidate must deliver accurate information in a timely fashion serving our “internal customers” properly. The individual in this role will interface with cross-functional team members and external vendors/partners as needed. Therefore, effective team communication and outstanding attention to detail are required as well as being eager to learn new systems. Candidate must have the ability to prioritize effectively and have a natural feel for solving problems. Tasks and responsibilities: Accurately manage data within MS Dynamics AX and Exact as described above. Item setup: Set up Items, make changes and control interfaced information. Document and maintain process flows and develop any internal and external training material required. Pricing: Create and maintain Sales Price List (Base Prices). Document and maintain Process Flows. Other tables: create and maintain user tables such as segmentation, item groups, item categories etc. Document and maintain Process Flows. Customer facing documents: create and maintain training documents, checklists and smart forms to support internal customers and help improving the input FTR Work closely with other employees (purchasing, product management, sales, logistics, OPMs, and IT) as needed to resolve questions, issues, etc. Process requests via the ticketing system in various topics – within the agreed timelines. Work with manufacturing locations and vendors to resolve missing data issues so that items, vendors, costs changes and BOM changes can be processed in a timely fashion. Hold internal assets and vendors accountable for providing accurate information. Run system reports and distribute to appropriate personnel. Ongoing data clean up and entry of additional data. Propose solutions to complex master data related questions for projects. Decide upon and execute improvement activities. Propose process and operational improvements when needed. Actively share knowledge and best practices. Support colleagues in doubt, and ask for help when in doubt. Develop a complete understanding of Life Fitness’ MS Dynamics AX and Exact Systems as it relates to the job duties. SKILLS & ABILITIES Bachelor Degree Minimum 3 years of experience in a Master Data Management role. Excellent oral and written communication skills in Dutch and English. Previous experience using MS Dynamics AX, Exact is a preference. Thorough working knowledge of Windows and Microsoft Office applications. Ability to uptake new application software and train end-users accordingly Must be a team player and have the ability to manage multiple tasks and projects. Excellent interpersonal skills, including the ability to interact across the organization. Outstanding analytical skills.  What we offer: You’ll be working in an inspirational and active environment empowering everyone to work-out but also work hard to push themselves. For short: We offer a challenging position in an international environment, competitive compensation and a great work atmosphere! If you are confident that you are the person we are looking for, please send your application and resume directly through the form on this page! For any further information you can WhatsApp/ Call Nina Boender, HR Coordinator telephone number +31(0)652714443.

title: Data Governance Analyst
summary:
Knowledge of data concepts would be considered an advantage.
You will become the data specialist; help build awareness across the enterprise and support both…
description: The Data Governance Analyst is a member of the Data Governance team which forms part Information Security department, you will be reporting to the Head of Data Governance and support the delivery of eBay Classifieds Group’s overarching Data Management strategy.  As a team player, you will actively engage in tasks related to the Data Governance application Collibra, metadata management and standardizing metadata management processes.  You will become the data specialist; help build awareness across the enterprise and support both central teams and platform teams in various countries around the world with data governance deliverables.  Be the central expert for the data governance tool Collibra. This includes but is not limited to Communities, Data Domains, Data Dictionaries, Glossaries, Business Terms, Lineage, Logical Data Model, Roles, BPMN workflows. Support the connection of systems and processes metadata to Collibra and confirming the output is aligned to Data Governance and Change Management needs. Support the Data Management strategy and implementation, working cross-functionally with business and central departments to ensure alignment and progress towards overarching objectives. Identify and implement the optimum means to collect, process, analyze and report on metadata and ensure ongoing accuracy, integrity and security. Provide advice and guidance on the implementation of a business glossary and technical and business metadata solutions. Provide support on metadata process and implementation. Develop follow up training material and provide coaching. Develop stakeholder communications and training in support of metadata process implementation. Conduct requirement assessments, identify gaps and provide suggestions to improve and streamline metadata processes based on operational insights.  What do you need to do the job?  A bachelor or master degree and/or relevant proven work experience is required. Basic understanding of working with Data, appreciation of Data Governance. Ability to work in an international, dynamic and mostly informal setting. Knowledge in working with Excel – importing and exporting data. Excellent oral and written communication skills are required (English). Ability to influence and build consensus across organizational boundaries. Understand and be capable of effectively communicating the role of Data Governance to both business and technical audiences. Experience in project-based working, including tasks, dependencies, priorities and deadlines. Quick and agile learner, ability to adapt to changing priorities and circumstances Knowledge of Collibra or similar metadata management tooling, data concepts and best practices would be considered an advantage Knowledge of data concepts would be considered an advantage.  Personal characteristics  Flexible, curious and creative, open for new things and able to propose innovative ideas. Independent and autonomous judgment. Structured and well organized. Team player, open and positive in a group dynamic. Intercultural competence and experience of working in more than one country and/or multi-cultural teams. Driven, hard-working, entrepreneurial, proactive and productive. eBay Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, and disability, or other legally protected status. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at talent@ebay.com. We will make every effort to respond to your request for disability assistance as soon as possible. For more information see: EEO is the Law Poster and EEO is the Law Poster Supplement  This website uses cookies to enhance your experience. By continuing to browse the site, you agree to our use of cookies View our privacy policy and accessibility info

title: Data Quality Manager
summary:
The CoE is still relatively small and currently consists of 4 analysts, 2 data engineers, and a data scientist.
Our team of analysts is relatively young.
description: Mendix is on a mission to enable anyone in any organization – from the marketing coordinator to the software developer to the CEO – to create things that are transformational for their company. We are fundamentally reinventing the way applications are created and we’re reinventing the future of software development. Sounds ambitious, right? We agree.  Not to brag, but nearly 4,000 organizations worldwide, including KLM, Medtronic, Merck, and Philips, rely on Mendix to build web and mobile applications. Thousands of our customers use our platform to delight their clients and empower their employees. It’s no surprise that we’re a recognized Leader by Gartner and Forrester in a red-hot market expected to exceed $21 billion by 2022. Ok, maybe we did want to brag a little. But we’re proud of what we’ve accomplished…and…we’re humble enough to admit that we need you to make us even more effective.  Are you the experienced Data Quality Manager to help create Mendix’s analytics center of excellence? Do you have a good view on what an analytics center of excellence within a pioneering tech company should look like? Then we are looking for you.  What is our analytics center of excellence (CoE)? Mendix has doubled in size in only a year and a half. As such, the need for analytics insights and automation are becoming increasingly important. The analytics center of excellence will be providing different business units with dedicated partners that create new analytics products and insights to improve the performance of their units and make the right decisions. The COE is supported by a technical data engineering team who are responsible for the Mendix’s data landscape (datalake & data warehouse). The CoE is still relatively small and currently consists of 4 analysts, 2 data engineers, and a data scientist. However analytics has been recognized as an incredibly important area of investment by Mendix’s management. Therefor we will be hiring several new members in the CoE this year and hope to more than double the size of the team by the end of the year.  What job would you be applying for? You should expect to become the ‘go-to’ person for data. Any person in the organization that has a question about data will probably end up with you and you need to be able to assist them or steer them in the right direction. We expect that you will establish data governance processes and frameworks in the organization that will truly empower the business to use data, instead of having conversations on whether this is ‘good’ or ‘bad’ data. We are looking for someone that can partner up with the business. Mendix is a young and dynamic organization that does not have many established business processes or governance frameworks in place. It will be your challenge to help the business see the value of establishing these governance frameworks and to create them. Mentoring people in the business as well as younger members of our CoE is an important part of your role. We are looking for people with new ideas and several years of experience that can help enrich the CoE and raise it to the next level. Overview of activities: Establishing governance frameworks within Mendix that introduces data ownership within each business unit (responsibility and accountability); Establishing governance frameworks and processes around data creation, processing, and reporting within each business unit; Coordinating with stakeholders to gather, map, and document meta data from each business unit (master data management); Coordinating with stakeholders to create a clear overview of data flows between systems and data used in reporting; Setting standards for data quality and data accuracy for products created by the analytics CoE; Monitor and improve data quality and being able to identify and improve the reliability of the data; Being a key consulting stakeholder when the business has questions related to the internal data landscape; Identifying risks and solutions for projects where the internal data landscape is involved; Planning and creating the internal data landscape roadmap and strategy. About you: You are a senior data professional that can help shape our new center of excellence. Our team of analysts is relatively young. Our organization is also new to data driven decision making. We are therefore looking for people that can bring industry best practices into the CoE and have several years of experience working in an agile work environment. If you have several years of experience in a variety of data related roles and you are eager to bring your experience in a young, thriving, and quickly scaling organization, then you are the person we are looking for! Technical requirements: 5+ years’ proven experience and excellent understanding of data administration, (master)data management functions (collection, analysis, distribution etc.), regulatory aspects (GDPR, HIPAA) and experience with FAIR, data governance and data stewardship principles; Experience with data processing languages or scripting languages such as: SQL, R or Python. Business requirements: You are a hands-on person with a “can do” mentality and you are not afraid to set up collaborations, make decisions, set priorities and put them into action in a dynamic environment; You are a critical thinker that is not afraid to challenge the business and move the organization to a new maturity level in data driven decision making; Experience with quickly learning about and familiarizing yourself with different business domains; Experience as a trusted advisor for data related questions or inquiries (the “go-to data person”); Experience with working in an agile scrum environment; Experience with mentoring and/or teaching subject matter to colleagues; Able to speak fluent English; Speaking Dutch is a plus. Personal character traits: A good understanding of business needs and the ability to act accordingly, taking measured risks into account and the ability to take the organization to a next maturity level. The ability to remain fully functional by adapting to changing circumstances (environment, procedures, people). Absorb new information readily and to put it into practice effectively. Assertiveness; the ability to bring one’s views across clearly without damaging the relationship with stakeholders. Creativity; the ability to come up with original and innovative ideas and solutions, to adopt points of view outside the usual parameters. The ability to ask further with the ambition to deeply understand other perspectives and views in order to generate support.  If you don’t comply with the following criteria please do not respond to this job offer: All technical requirements; Experienced as a trusted advisor for data related questions or inquiries; Experienced in challenging the business and moving the organization to a new maturity level in data driven decision making.  Get a taste of Mendix Blue culture and see the latest updates to our product by registering for our annual flagship event, Mendix World 2020 launching on September 1st. Attend live Q&A sessions with leaders from R&D, watch demos of the product in action, and meet the Makers who use Mendix everyday. Registration link: www.mendix.com/mendix-world/?&utm_medium=sales&mxworld=mxrec&utm_campaign=GL-CE-2020-09-01-Mendix-World  Our Guiding Principles  While we live on different continents, speak different languages, and work on different things, we are bound by our “MendixBlue” guiding principles. Being “MendixBlue” means that you live the culture, and you consistently improve it as we grow. It’s kind of a big deal.  We put the customer first. Without our customers, we have no business. So, if you act in the best interest of our customers, always…you belong here.  We think big. We work to have a meaningful, lasting impact on the world. So, if you aim high and think long term…you belong here.  We innovate. We want to be what happens next. So, if you ask “what if?” and work to find a way or make one…you belong here.  We nurture talent. We look, not just at the sum of what an individual has done, but at the potential of who they can be. So, if you’re up for learning from your failures…you belong here.  We hear every voice. Inflated egos don’t last here, humility does. So, if you share credit and ensure that the best ideas win – regardless of who they come from…you belong here.  We own it. If something needs doing, we do it. So, if you focus on the outcome, and take initiative to get it done…you belong here.  We have fun. We use laughter as a common language. We can ask for help and we’re happy to give it. So, if you find joy and purpose in what you do…you belong here.  Make your career at Mendix.  There are precious few jobs that let you create the future. But you’ll find one at Mendix. We are at a pivotal time in our company’s existence: where rapid growth meets stable funding. This is the time for industrious people to raise their hands to solve the next generation of problems. Mendix is a place where ambitious people can thrive; where you can identify an issue, propose a solution, and build the structure to make it happen.  Important to know: Mendix is a Siemens business, which means we’re backed by the resources and stability of one of the world’s largest and most forward-looking enterprises. Think: job security.  Since our company was founded in 2005, our aim has been to create a great work environment for people at all stages in their careers. That’s why we are so pleased and honored that we were rated a top Cloud Computing Company to work for in 2019, based on feedback from our employees on Glassdoor. With offices in the Netherlands, the UK, Germany, and the US, (and more coming), we provide an international playground to truly impact the world through low-code.  Organization: Digital Industries Company: Mendix Technology B.V. Experience Level: Experienced Professional Job Type: Full-time

title: Data Analyst - PS
summary:
Experience in data management, data visualization and quality.
Is familiar with the larger data ecosystem at Booking and how it relates to their data and the…
description: Data Analysts are the drivers of how data is leveraged in solving business problems within their area. They are able to use their experience to consult with stakeholders in problem-definition, setting success metrics and shaping the way forward through data insights and effective communication with their audience. Data Analysts are able to manage stakeholders largely autonomously (seeking for help in complex scenarios) based on their experience by prioritizing business impact, efficiently adapting to business needs, and managing expectations accordingly. They can use their deep practical understanding of the data, workflows, methods and tooling to autonomously drive analysis and reporting within their scope. They can adapt their tooling and approach based on business and user needs. This involves reporting, visualization and taking ownership of workflows and structures to make their solutions scalable, reproducible and long-term focused. They collaborate with peers in their craft and support initiatives for data quality and stability, using their experience to think of scalable solutions. B.Responsible Works independently on data collection and preparation.   Uses their past experience and seeks for help in complex scenarios to translate business problems into data stories   Maintains and drives key reports, metrics and workflows running within their scope.   Is able to communicate results and outcomes clearly to stakeholders based on their knowledge and experience.   Communicates effectively, collaboratively and challenges constructively to create rapport and establish trust.   Actively participates in business and/or analytics team activities and suggests ways of achieving objectives (standup, planning meeting, retrospectives)   Networks and proactively connects with craft peers beyond the team scope   Uses previous knowledge and experience on data analysis and visualization to answer business questions in the most efficient way   Is aware and has experience working in our experimentation culture, process and results interpretation   Is aware of statistical models used within their scope   Is familiar with the larger data ecosystem at Booking and how it relates to their data and the work they do.   Collaborates and is open to giving and receiving feedback with peers and direct stakeholders.   Is flexible in adopting and proposing new approaches and expanding their technical competencies when a more efficient way presents itself.   Expected to get significant deep knowledge about the operational, tactical and strategic workings of the department. Has a main focus on business and technical opportunities.  B.Skilled Driven and results oriented personality Open to feedback and always looking for ways to improve own performance Able to understand details while keeping an eye on the bigger picture Analytical and curious mindset Strong interpersonal skills Open and friendly attitude Strong knowledge and experience on data analysis. Experience in data management, data visualization and quality. Knowledge and experience using data analysis and visualization tools (e.g: tableau, data studio, powerbi, mixpanel, etc) Knowledge and experience with at least one data analysis language (e.g: R, SQL, Python, etc)

title: Data Scientist
summary:
Creëren van data visualisaties/ business intelligence dashboards t.b.v. data analyses.
Als data scientist helpt dit jou de beschikbare data rondom de processen…
description: We zijn op zoek naar nieuwe collega’s die geloven dat we met data technologie de wereld kunnen veranderen. Wij worden enthousiast van techneuten die de nieuwste ontwikkelingen volgen op gebied van processimulaties en data analyses door middel van Predictive analytics, Prescriptive analytics en Machine Learning methodieken. Met deze kennis bedienen wij graag bedrijven in diverse markten, bijv. High Tech, Finance, Energie, Logistiek, overheidsinstanties, Telecom en E-commerce. Bij Bright Cubes geloven wij dat onze professionals het proces van onze klanten moeten begrijpen. Als data scientist helpt dit jou de beschikbare data rondom de processen beter te begrijpen. Je bent hierdoor in staat modellen en analyses te ontwikkelen die nieuwe inzichten geven in complexe business processen. Vervolgens communiceer je de nieuwe mogelijkheden door middel van presentaties naar diverse stakeholders. Om deze activiteiten te kunnen realiseren is kennis en het overdragen hiervan een kerncompetentie. Onze professionals ontwikkelen zich dan ook voortdurend, door studie, training en door technische kennissessies met andere Bright Cubes collega’s. WERKZAAMHEDEN Simulatie en optimalisatie van business processen door middel van data. Ontwerpen, implementeren van data analyse methodieken. Creëren van complexe algoritmes en queries om diepe inzichten te verkrijgen. Creëren van data visualisaties/ business intelligence dashboards t.b.v. data analyses. Proactief adviseren van de klant tijdens het ontwikkeltraject. Klant ondersteunen in de doorontwikkelen van huidige business- en dataprocessen. Kennisoverdracht m.b.t de gekozen oplossingen en de technologieën. FUNCTIE EISEN Je hebt een afgeronde HBO of WO opleiding die aansluit op het vakgebied Informatie Technologie, Data Science, Wiskunde, of Econometrie. Daarnaast heb je kennis en ervaring in onderstaande of vergelijkbare technologieën: SciKit-learn, Keras, CNTK of vergelijkbaar Eén of meerdere programmertalen: Python, R, SQL, SAS, etc. Matplotlib, Bokeh, D3.js of vergelijkbaar Eén of meerdere database technologieën: SQL databases, MongoDB, Redis Bonus: Power BI, Tableau, Qlik View/Sense of vergelijkbaar Bonus: Ervaring als Business/Data analist Bonus: Ervaring met Spark, REST-Api’s en vergelijkbare data connecties ONS AANBOD  Vast contract Direct bieden wij meer zekerheid  Goed salaris Boven marktconform  Mobiliteit Auto, OV-kaart of reisvergoeding  Laptop Laptop van de zaak  Telefoon Telefoonvergoeding  Vakantie 25 vakantie dagen per jaar  Pensioen Een goede regeling voor je pensioen  Training Budget om meer te leren  Labomgeving Eigen GIT Hub blogomgeving  Kennisdeling Deel je kennis met je collega's  Meedenken Denk mee over de bedrijfsstrategie  Uitjes Wordt deel van een creatieve cultuur ORGANISATIE Bright Cubes is een “kennisthuis” voor creatieve en ambitieuze IT-consultants en opdrachtgevers. Wij werken met passie en creativiteit aan grensverleggende dienstverlening, waarmee wij voor onze opdrachtgevers een IT-ecosysteem creëren en onderhouden dat waarde toevoegt en organisaties versnelt in een veranderende wereld. Het IT-ecosysteem van de toekomst is niet alleen faciliterend, maar juist steeds meer richtinggevend aan bedrijven.  Bij de variërende technologische projecten komt een grote mate van complexiteit en creativiteit kijken. Belangrijk voor de functie van Software Engineer is dat je het uitdagend vindt om met afwisselende technieken te werken. Omdat innovatie zo centraal staat wordt veel aandacht besteed aan kennisdeling, training en groei op technisch vlak. SOLLICITATIE PROCEDURE In onze gespreken besteden we naast je concrete capaciteiten veel aandacht aan waar jouw motivatie vandaan komt en wat je persoonlijke doelstellingen zijn op zowel korte als lange termijn. Eerste gesprek: Algemene en persoonlijke kennismaking. Hebben we een goed gevoel bij elkaar? Een persoonlijke klik is bij ons het allerbelangrijkst om jarenlang met plezier samen te werken. Tweede gesprek: Al dan niet gecombineerd met een technische test gaan we inzoomen op je technische kennis en ervaring. Voorstel: Als we na het tweede gesprek beide enthousiast zijn krijg je binnen een dag een voorstel.

title: Senior Resource Planning Analyst
summary:
Verify Verint data/profiles applying special events etc.
Analyse historical data (volumes, shrinkage levels, handling times) using Power BI, Genesys and Verint.
description: Company Information  When you’re part of Thermo Fisher Scientific, you’ll do challenging work and be part of a team that values performance, quality and innovation. As part of a successful, growing, global organization you will be encouraged to perform at your best. With revenues of $25 billion and the largest investment in R&D in the industry, we give our people the resources and opportunities to make significant contributions to the world.  Visit www.thermofisher.com  Job Title: Resource Planning Analyst Reports To: EU Resource Planning Manager Group/Division: RSD Career Band: 6 Job Track: Professional Position Location: Any EU site Number of Direct Reports: 0  Position Summary: This role is responsible for delivering a high-quality resource planning model for the internal operational teams. You will focus on planning resources in line with demand from a period of 16 weeks out to support the operational decision making on recruitment, capacity and daily plans. You will provide optimum agent schedules up to 4 weeks in advance in line with demand profiles to ensure an efficient workforce and support the Operational Management team on resource allocation decisions. You will support your Line Manager in the production of the high level Annual Operating Plan and Quarterly Reviews.  Your responsibilities: Be accountable for delivering the Resource Planning service offering to the operational teams. Ensure high quality planning recommendations are delivered to the operational teams at each stage of the planning process. Analyse historical data (volumes, shrinkage levels, handling times) using Power BI, Genesys and Verint. Derive FTE requirements from the Forecast for Recruitment and Capacity Planning. Provide direction to Operational Management teams on short term resource allocation to optimise delivery of service goals. (Day Plus 1) To effectively manage telephony and email routing to enhance customer experience and productivity in a cost effective manner. Provide insights by means of periodical and ad hoc reports and / or analyses to optimise cost to serve Create volumes profiles (interval/day/week) linked to contact drivers. Verify Verint data/profiles applying special events etc. Provide best fit agent schedules to optimize performance. Effectively manage Stakeholder engagement through daily and weekly Planning meetings.
