/ reports fitting their needs Translates data into actionable reports and Tableau dashboards, Able to analyze trends that support our business questions, and helps to further develop our various products/ Games Collects terabytes of data from different platforms, merges it into data sets, and identifies actionable insights Works on new projects and apply cutting edge technology to further improve analytics across departmentsCreates automatic processes to verify the quality of our Data Understand our business and its various products, translate its needs into actionable data analysis and dashboards Work on new projects and apply cutting edge technology to further improve analytics across departments  Educational & (Work) Experience Bachelor or Master degree in IT, Math or Statistics Minimum 2-4-years’ experience in an analytical field – Video Games is a plus (internships not included)  Key Skills Required Ability to Create / Optimize SQL code on a bigdata environment Knowledge AWS Redshift / PostgreSQL is a plus Ability to create visualizations of your code, solid knowledge of Tableau is required Excel | Pivot tables, table structure, formula creation Experience with Python (2.x,3.x) and creating ETL scripts  Additional qualifications Fluent in English, both written and verbally Comfortable in presenting analysis to higher Management  What do we have to offer We offer a competitive package packed with pension benefits, a lunch arrangement and a fun and casual work environment, frequent team building events and lots of more fun and perks! We have a casual international work environment in a beautiful historical building in the middle of the center of The Hague!  Contact Do you have what it takes? Submit your resume and motivational letter explaining your history and why you think you should be a good fit for this role, our team. If you would like more information regarding this unique position within GamePoint B.V. please contact Inge van der Burg (HR Manager) by phone: +31 (0)70 – 3110110 or by e-mail: iburg@gamepoint.com.  See for more info information our corporate Website: www.gamepoint.biz  Please do not contact us for sales purposes

title: Research Analyst
summary:
Advanced understanding of how the data is represented.
The research analyst will be responsible for supporting the team’s efforts to produce company and…
description: To apply for the above roles, please forward your CV to recruitment@b-2-beurope.com  c) Research Analyst: The research analyst will be responsible for supporting the team’s efforts to produce company and industry research. This includes maintaining BI models and forecasts, valuation matrices, writing industry research. Strong attention to detail and work ethic are key to this position. It would be your job to analyse statistics that have been collected through market research surveys. Contribute to the development of supporting documentation and ensure that this information is current and up to date.  To support the process of product development for information products through initial research, requirements gathering, screening, benchmarking, testing and launch.  To fit this unique position, applicants will have 2+ years experience in research  Candidate Requirements Ability to interpret and comprehend detailed information resources Knowledge of information databases Advanced understanding of how the data is represented Excellent written and verbal communication skills Well organized; ability to meet deadlines Excellent analytical skills; adept at problem solving Ability to work on projects at all levels BA Degree required If you join us you can make great idea's happen for some of the most dynamic companies. Enjoy an innovative environment where challenging and interesting work is part of daily life.

title: Junior Sales Analyst
summary: Extract data (from a variety of sources including BI systems, and SalesForce.com) and perform detailed data analysis on internal processes and productivity.
description: Rubrik has become one the fastest growing enterprise startup in Silicon Valley. We are seeking a highly strategic, driven, and analytical individual to join the Sales Operations team! The Junior Analyst, Sales Analytics and Reporting role reports into the Sales Planning Manager. The Sales Operations team is integral to the success of the Sales organization by helping to drive bookings and sales productivity. This is a full-time position located at Rubrik EMEA HQ in Amsterdam, Netherlands. Where you can make an impact: You will be responsible for working with all levels of management, Directors, and Managers in an analytical role to optimize the business performance of our Sales organization. You will participate in the development of models and reporting structure for sales KPIs; run analytics projects to proactively identify trends and areas of opportunity to improve, deliver recommendations to the sales team, and drive outcomes that improve revenue and productivity at an EMEA level. You will enhance and develop data analysis frameworks that will support daily/weekly/monthly operational reporting and Leadership dashboards. Extract data (from a variety of sources including BI systems, and SalesForce.com) and perform detailed data analysis on internal processes and productivity. You will use sales programs, business intelligence tools, and maintain departmental reporting & dashboards to increase efficiency and aid operations. You will work with the CRM tool Salesforce.com and BI tools including Tableau and Clari. You will assist with scalable data quality strategy, policies, processes, and automation needs. Support contains: Field onboarding, working closely with different teams across the organization (Channel, Marketing..), partnering in building a strong end to end view of our sales process. Who you are: You are a motivated and ambitious self-starter. You love learning something new every day and solving problems. You consider yourself an analytical / abstract thinker: You ask the questions that others aren't asking and draw connections between data and business impact. Identify the 80/20 opportunities to reach insightful, actionable answers without boiling the ocean with analysis overload. You have a high-energy, company first, positive attitude: Passionate and motivated to make a massive impact and work hard in a fast-paced environment. "Outside-of-the-box" mentality: You constantly think of ways to streamline and innovate. You can multitask and thrive in a fast paced environment.  Ideal background: Background in Business and an obvious interest in data analytics. Strong oral and written communication skills German and/or Dutch language is a plus. Experience with Salesforce.com is a plus. High level of organization and detail-orientation Good attitude toward teamwork as well as the ability to work independently Strong work ethic and willingness to take initiative.  Great company to work with. Collaborative place to work and fun office/work culture (when in the office, employees have access to lunches, snacks beverages and happy hour). We believe in working from home and provide a flexible (and face paced) environment! We want our employees to have the chance to develop their career and offer mentorship programs as well as overall support. Rubrik provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Rubrik complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

title: Threat Analyst
summary: Analyze technical data to extract attacker TTPs, identify unique attributes of malware, map attacker infrastructure, and pivot to related threat data.
description: Company Description  FireEye is the intelligence-led security company. Working as a seamless, scalable extension of customer security operations, FireEye offers a single platform that blends innovative security technologies, nation-state grade threat intelligence, and world-renowned Mandiant® consulting. With this approach, FireEye eliminates the complexity and burden of cyber security for organizations struggling to prepare for, prevent, and respond to cyber attacks. Learn more about FireEye's world-class solutions and global footprint at https://www.fireeye.com/company.html.  Job Description  If you have a strong background in analysis and are looking to be at the forefront of technical threat tracking, then we want to hear from you! As a Technical Threat Analyst, you will be part of a rapidly growing and successful Frontline Applied Research and Expertise (FLARE) team focused on operationalizing today’s emerging cyber security threats. The successful candidate should be an independent, critical thinker skilled in using data to solve analytic problems with an ability to integrate threat knowledge into operational support and solution to help drive FireEye – including Managed Defense, Mandiant Intelligence, and Mandiant consulting. You will be responsible for tracking advanced threats through researching, modeling, developing, and integrating threat data into FireEye’s core platforms. The curation of threat data enables a cohesive intelligence-led approach in our products, detections, services, deliverables, and support. We encourage contributions back to the security community and strongly support sharing of expertise. Our team members are encouraged to author whitepapers, develop free tools, and speak at conferences. What You Will Do: Develop into the company expert on tracking the most advanced groups we encounter Provide threat context and integration support to multiple FireEye service lines Maintain expert knowledge of advanced persistent threats tools, techniques, and procedures (TTPs) as well as forensics and incident response practices Analyze technical data to extract attacker TTPs, identify unique attributes of malware, map attacker infrastructure, and pivot to related threat data Identify and hunt for emerging threat activity across all internal/external sources Establish standards, taxonomy, and processes for threat modeling and integration Provide threat research and context to global service delivery for Mandiant and Managed Defense investigations Drive FireEye detections and technology through threat expertise and knowledge Perform threat research and analysis during high-severity cyber-attacks impacting FireEye customers globally Cross-coordinate threat data and trends between internal teams for rapid inclusion into customer deliverables Be the final arbiter for the technical attribution of every key organic FireEye event Requirements: 7 + years of experience in an analytical role of either network forensics, threat analyst, or security consultant/engineer 2 + years of experience in Investigative or Incident Response environments Technical experience in at least three of the following areas: Windows disk and memory forensics Network Security Monitoring (NSM), network traffic analysis, and log analysis Unix or Linux disk and memory forensics Static and dynamic malware analysis Applied knowledge in at least one scripting or development language (such as Python) Understanding of enterprise security controls in Active Directory / Windows environments Tracking threats in an intelligence function Additional Qualifications: Excellent communication and presentation skills with the ability to present to technical and non-technical audiences Exceptional written communication skills Strong decision making skills with the ability to prioritize and execute Ability to set and manage expectations with senior stake-holders and team members Strong problem solving, troubleshooting, and analysis skills Experience working in fast-paced development environments Excellent inter-personal and teamwork skills Self-driven, proactive, hardworking, creative, team-player with a good sense of humor

title: Data analist/architect
summary:
Voor jou als data analist / data architect geldt: hoe meer data hoe beter!
Jouw taken als data analist/architect.
Dan zijn wij op zoek naar jou!
description: Data analist/architect Locatie: Dordrecht Ben jij een kei in data-analyse en het vertalen van wensen naar de juiste data gedreven oplossing? Dan zijn wij op zoek naar jou! Onze afdeling Data zoekt een collega die enthousiast wordt van data en alles wat je ermee kunt. Van data analyse tot het structureren van data in een datawarehouse. Dit ga je doen Data een doolhof? Voor jou als data analist / data architect geldt: hoe meer data hoe beter! Jij weet als geen ander wat de waarde van data is. Met jouw kennis help je onze afdelingen met het vertalen van de vraag naar een data gedreven oplossing. Jij vertaalt, ontwerpt en ontwikkelt een technische oplossing die voldoet aan de vraag van de afdelingen en de organisatie. De tool die je hiervoor gaat gebruiken is TimeXtender. Daarbij zorg je er ook voor dat toekomstige vragen beantwoord kunnen worden. Je speelt een belangrijke rol in de ondersteuning van collega’s en eindgebruikers in het gebruik van de tool. Ook ben je ervaren met de back-end tools van Microsoft. TimeXtender vergt technische kennis en vaardigheden van de tool zelf. Als data analist / data architect ken jij alle ins- en outs. Of je bent bereid je hierin helemaal onder te dompelen. Daarnaast is het belangrijk om kennis te hebben van het modelleren van een datawarehouse. Jij werkt als architect mee aan het modelleren en organiseren van data om er later analyses op te kunnen uitvoeren. Jouw taken als data analist/architect Modelleren middenlaag Mede architect voor het datawarehouse Teamlid van ons projectteam Data Gesprekspartner voor stakeholders en business Opstellen en uitvoeren van trajecten voor kwaliteitsverbetering Aanspreekpunt Operationeel   Zo werken wij op onze afdeling Data Je werkt in een projectteam. Dit zijn collega’s binnen de groep Data, maar ook collega’s uit aangrenzende afdelingen zoals Operationeel en specialisten uit de teams. Het team bestaat uit 5 andere collega’s waarin je altijd de vrijheid hebt om ideeën aan te dragen. Gezelligheid, enthousiasme, maar ook verantwoordelijkheid en zelfstandigheid gaan hier hand in hand! Op onze afdeling Data hebben we twee manier van werken: Proactieve manier: waarbij we de data benaderen, ontsluiten en modelleren aan de hand van de beschikbare bronnen. We zorgen dat er data beschikbaar komt in de daarvoor bestemde middenlaag. Reactieve manier: wanneer we de teams te woord staan en in de concrete informatie behoefte gaan voorzien. In dit geval halen we data op en aan de hand van de gestelde vraag en modelleren we dit. Je brengt mee Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring in een soortgelijke functie. Basiskennis van en ervaring met databases, Excel, T-SQL en MS SQL Server. Een analytische blik en ben je communicatief sterk. Zin om zowel zelfstandig als in teamverband te werken. Kennis van en ervaring met TimeXtender (pre). Kennis van en ervaring met Tableau (pre).   Dit krijg je van ons Een goed salaris dat past bij deze functie. 25 vakantiedagen per jaar (op basis van een 40-urige werkweek). Reiskostenvergoeding en pensioenregeling. Korting op alle verzekeringen die wij aanbieden (inclusief hypotheekadvies). De mogelijkheid om opleidingen te volgen. Gezellige vrijdagmiddagborrels en leuke bedrijfsfeestjes.   Wie zijn wij National Academic is onderdeel van de CAK Groep. Een succesvolle speler in de verzekeringsbranche met verschillende producten, merken en platformen. Met ruim 250 collega's zijn we elke dag bezig om het leuker en beter te maken voor onze 300.000 klanten. Onze kantoren zijn gevestigd in Dordrecht en Amersfoort. Beide locaties zijn goed bereikbaar met de auto, het ov en de fiets. Wij zijn een informele organisatie, waarin je de vrijheid hebt om mee te denken en ideeën aan te dragen. En... enthousiast? Stuur dan snel een overtuigende e-mail met je cv en motivatie naar onze recruiter Femke via vacature@nationalacademic.nl. Wie weet nodigen wij jou uit voor een gesprek! Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld. Aan het zonder opdracht voorstellen van kandidaten kunnen geen rechten c.q. verplichtingen worden ontleend.

title: Junior Business Analyst
summary:
You are willing to execute thorough data analytics and document accordingly;
This is achieved by providing the banker key data elements from the business…
description: Imagine… You work in a challenging international environment with the mission to enable the bank to provide relevant financial services to our clients, so that we can Grow a Better World Together. You are a business analyst and part of a T-shaped DevOps team that realizes the digital ambitions for Rabobank within the international wholesale domain, while closely collaborating with business and IT stakeholders. Please note that this position is coupled with the Young Professional Program IT. Besides working as a Junior Business Analyst, you get an 18-month programme where you carry out challenging projects and get personal and professional development trainings. We will help you discover your strengths and challenge you to evolve further. We teach you to form an independent opinion, but also to experience the value of cooperation. You grow together with nine other young IT professionals and you get to also challenge the status quo. To know more about the programme: https://rabobank.jobs/en/programs/young-professional-programme-it/ Specify your interest for the Young Professional Programme IT and the Junior Business Analyst position in your application! Making a difference As a Business Analyst for Bankers Cockpit you help bankers in managing and executing their day-to-day activities. The Bankers Cockpit is a digital tool designed to capture and alert bankers on changes of events in client, product, and contract lifecycles, enabling real-time holistic monitoring of the performance of their portfolio from one simple application. This is achieved by providing the banker key data elements from the business functions: Sales management Client relationship management Risks and income management Additionally, a news aggregation service provides relevant news articles to keep bankers aware of daily updates from diverse sources. With each other Collaboration is at the heart of everything we do. Our DevOps team aims to bring talented people together to execute change and run activities for the product Bankers Cockpit. With you included, the team will consist of six diverse colleagues with a variety of skills and backgrounds. As a business analyst, you contribute to both the maintenance and further development of the product. The team’s main drivers are autonomy, challenge, focus on results, as well as quality. Your activities You see yourself as a part of a DevOps team where analysis is an integral part of the development process and you are expected to be multidisciplinary; You take responsibility in identifying high-value needs and requirements, modelling those into feasible, acceptable and high-quality solutions and document that properly for future references; You contribute and support the team in achieving product and team goals; You support the product owner in identifying and managing dependencies and solving impediments; You proactively participate in team events, discussions and challenges regarding solutions and decisions; You strive for continuous improvement and are eager to share knowledge. You inspire and convince your colleagues with your vision on sustainable solutions and work closely together with the software engineers. As an effect of the above, you will have the opportunity to explore the organisation by: Talking to business and IT stakeholders; Gaining knowledge and experience on a wide range of offered products and services; Getting detailed insights into crucial processes, architecture, data, and business functions. Your contribution You have a good command of English and are confident to interview or present to stakeholders at different levels within the organisation; You are customer-focused, with an eye for detail, but can look at things from a broader perspective; You are willing to execute thorough data analytics and document accordingly; You are vocal, energetic, not afraid to share your thoughts, and happy to learn from your mistakes; You are a T-shaped professional and you have therefore a natural drive to dive into other related areas in the team, like operations, development and/or testing; You have great stamina and manage setbacks to find new routes towards results; Affinity with business processes and objectives of international clients is a plus; Affinity with API’s, XML, JSON or the ability to read/interpret data is a plus; Knowledge of and experience with Agile, Scrum, Microsoft Power Platform, DevOps and ITIL is a plus; 0-2 years of overall work experience and a work permit for the Netherlands Growing a better world together You are already be aware that Rabobank is a financial services provider for more than 8.5 million customers in 40 countries. But did you know that we aim to contribute to real change with our 'Growing a better world together' mission? We do so in countless ways, such as: Together with the World Wildlife Fund, we’re helping to create a harmonious balance between nature and the agricultural sector in Brazil. We help producer organisations and saving- and credit organisations to become more professional and efficient. Thanks to the trade loans, these organisations can now pay their farmers in cash as soon as they deliver the coffee. Interested? Do you want to become the ideal version of yourself? We would love to help you achieve this by focusing firmly on your growth, development, and investing in an environment where you keep learning every day. We give you the space to innovate and initiate. In this way, we offer you numerous opportunities to grow and help you exceed your expectations, to do the right thing exceptionally well, and to therefore grow as a professional. In addition, with us (on the basis of a 40 -hour working week), you can also expect: a gross monthly salary between €3057 and €3200; a thirteenth month and holiday pay; an Employee Benefit Budget (9% of your monthly salary). You decide how to spend this budget. This may include purchasing extra leave days, making extra pension contributions or even receiving a monthly cash payout; a personal budget that you can spend on activities related to your personal development and career; 100% reimbursement of commuting costs if you travel by public transport! Do you still prefer to travel by car or motorbike? Then choose a commuting allowance; a pension scheme, to which your contribution is only 5%. coaching from experienced colleagues! Let's meet Are you the person we're looking for? Are you ready to join Rabobank and make a difference to yourself, our customers and society? We are looking forward to receiving your application for this vacancy in Utrecht. Good to know: Applications are open until 16th March, 2021. If you have any questions about the specific details of this position, please contact Robbert Langeveld via Robbert.Langeveld@rabobank.com. Ujjvala Britto, Recruiter, would be happy to answer any questions about the application procedure via ujjvala.britto@rabobank.nl or + 31 6 29 23 14 96 The application process includes screening. Based on the screening procedures in place at Rabobank, we assess whether new staff are reliable enough to work at Rabobank. The application process for this vacancy includes an individual assessment. Everyone is different, and it is exactly those differences that help us become an even better bank. That's why we want to know who you really are!

title: Applications Analyst SAP BW
summary:
Due to this strong growth, we are dealing with ever-increasing amounts of data.
“As an Application Analyst SAP BW you ensure a robust, easily maintainable Data…
description: Applications Analyst SAP BW (Fulltime 38h) “As an Application Analyst SAP BW you ensure a robust, easily maintainable Data Warehouse environment. You are therefore the contact person for questions about this fast-growing SAP BW environment and you are alert to possible impacts on your system. ” This is your daily action Action grows at approximately 30% per year and our stores are now located in 8 different European countries. In addition, our 10th distribution center in Bratislava will open soon, and we have plans to continue the expansion. Due to this strong growth, we are dealing with ever-increasing amounts of data. Together with the supplier, you ensure that our SAP BW (7.5. On HANA) can handle this growth, that the system remains up-to-date, and that therefore the insights for our business are available in a timely manner. You participate in the various projects and changes related to the growth of Action, such as the opening of new stores and DCs, and ensure that the impact is analyzed and that the correct changes are made secure the continuity and performance of SAP BW. In short: You make sure that our organization can continue to facilitate rapid international growth! Meet your team Action provides a positive workplace with a highly committed, cost-conscious, and customer-oriented, culturally diverse population. We like to work as a team; we live up to our company values with a simplicity mindset in all we do. Our Technology & IT department adds value with centralized teams for Enterprise Architecture, IT Project & Portfolio Management, Development & Operations, and multiple Business Technology (BizTech) teams. You are a member of the Management Team of Technology & IT, and contribute to a clear vision on IT, which translates into practical innovations. Keeping up with the challenges and expansion objectives at Action requires the best talent. Do you want to work on challenging projects within the dynamic world of retail with state-of-the-art technology? Take Action! Curious about your new team members? Manon Stemerdink, Randy de Heus and Martijn Tack can’t wait to work with you! This is you You have a service-oriented mentality, a proactive and change-minded attitude and you are able to quickly and adequately determine the impact of proposed changes in projects. You can also communicate effectively at different (international) levels within the organization. You could call yourself the SAP BW domain owner and thus ensure a robust, maintainable and future-oriented SAP BW environment. You are the contact person for all questions regarding SAP BW. You are aware of everything that happens within Action and notice impacts on the SAP BW environment. You are alert to business opportunities and future wishes. And furthermore: HBO or academic education (for example business information science, or a combination of business administration and technical information science); At least 5 years of relevant work experience in the field of SAP BW; Experience with SAP BW on HANA; Experience with modeling in SAP BW, knowledge of LSA and LSA ++; Experience with optimizing loading processes in SAP BW; Basic knowledge of SAP Business Objects is an advantage; Experience in Retail or Consumer Products is an advantage. What we offer You will work in a team of Business Intelligence & Analytics professionals in an international environment. Action has more than 1600 stores in 8 European countries and opens a number of new stores every week. The rapid growth of the organization carries on continuously. Not only Action is growing, but there are also growth opportunities for you to develop within the company. And furthermore; An attractive salary (based on a 38-hour working week); An annual bonus; A laptop and telephone; 15% staff discount on your purchases at Action. Interested? Are you ready to take Action? Apply now! Curious what’s next? Our recruiter will review your application and will get back to you asap. We’ll invite you for a first job interview. We’d like to get to know you better. Depending on the position, we might ask you to take an online assessment. We’ll invite you for a second interview to discuss your assessment and you will meet with perhaps one of your future colleagues. Are we still a great match? Then we’ll make you an offer you can’t refuse!

title: Inventory Cycle Count Analyst
summary:
Report all cycle count data to warehouse manager for review and publication.
Masimo (NASDAQ: MASI) headquartered in Irvine, California, a global medical…
description: Masimo (NASDAQ: MASI) headquartered in Irvine, California, a global medical technology company that develops and manufactures innovative noninvasive patient monitoring technologies, including medical devices and a wide array of sensors, is looking to recruit in the Netherlands the position of: Inventory Cycle Count Analyst  Job summary: The Inventory Cycle Count Analyst is responsible for maintaining accurate inventory levels throughout the organization. Conduct and verify on-going cycle counts daily to meet this goal in accordance with company procedures. Duties and Responsibilities: Conduct cycle count activity in all functional areas, raw materials and finished goods areas. Audit counts as needed Schedule time with the warehouse supervisor each day to review variances Reconcile each count, performing root cause analysis and trending. Track errors and report information to the parties responsible Maintain rotation of inventory to ensure FIFO picking of lot number sequences Report all cycle count data to warehouse manager for review and publication. Determine accuracy percentages based on lines counted, units counted, and variance cost Interface with the Management of each functional area as needed Review ABC classifications annually or at Management’s discretion based on component criticality Maintain all files, spreadsheets and systems pertaining to cycle counts and physical inventory Troubleshoot areas where regular counts can’t be made in a timely manner. Make recommendations to improve the management of inventory Cooperate with Finance in the performance of semi-annual audits Cross train in Warehouse functions. Assist in regular Warehouse operations between cycle count duties Performs other duties as assigned Develop inventory KPI’s  Minimum & Preferred Qualifications and Experience: Minimum Qualifications: Excellent attention to detail Multiple location, RF and bar-coding experience helpful Warehouse and prior experience in manufacturing facility +, but not required Good housekeeping and record skills PC skills Prior experience in standard inventory controls and practices General mathematical skills Ability to read, understand, and follow Company quality policy Fluent in English Excel spreadsheet experience Preferred Qualifications: Familiarity with software based cycle count and physical inventory programs Experience in control of documents and material tracking Ability to drive a forklift /Reach-truck  Education: MBO / HBO Physical requirements/Work Environment This position primarily works in a technical service workshop and warehouse environment. It requires frequent sitting, standing and walking. Daily use of a computer and other computing and digital devices is required. Some task required stand for extended periods or walking in the facilities. Minimum of 50 pounds lifting is required and some use of a forklift. The physical demands of the position described herein are essential functions of the job and employees must be able to successfully perform these tasks for extended periods. Reasonable accommodations may be made for those individuals with real or perceived disabilities to perform the essential functions of the job described. Masimo is proud to be an EOE/, M/F/D/V, and we are committed to Diversity at every level  Are you looking for uncommon opportunities with an extraordinary company? We are looking for people who can, do and will make a difference. Are you interested to hear more about this position?  Please send your full application through our website. To learn more about us, please visit: www.masimo.com Back Share Apply Now

title: Process Improvement Project Manager
summary:
Working with the Quality Improvement Program’s data analyst, facilitates the development of warranty specific dashboards.
You are a part of.
description: Job Title Process Improvement Project Manager Job Description In this role, you have the opportunity to Support the Image Guided Therapy Warranty Core Team (CT) to deliver on the ambitions described in the Project Charter. The project teams are based in the Netherlands and across the globe. Your focus areas are split into change management as well as leading process improvement projects across the E2E value chain. On the process improvement side: Leading process improvement initiatives by teaming up with E2E stakeholders. Creating and maintaining overviews on deployment activities such as workshops, PRIDE Problem Solving, and Kaizen events. You will collaborate, and be exposed to, stakeholders across all levels of the organization, and the E2E chain. You will work across Business, Market, and Functions to own and drive process improvements from the process improvement backlog. On the change management side: You will drive change by collaborating with key change agents across the E2E chain. This involves influencing a diversity of stakeholders while being conscious of diversity across the organization. For this you will use the change management and business transformation toolkit as per PBS 3.0. You are responsible for Supporting the Core team and Integral Project Manager to deliver on the project assignment Using the Change management toolkit, influence E2E stakeholders around customer impact Executing on the process improvement back-log by using standards as defined in Philips Continuous Improvement Toolkit Organizing and leading x-Functional workshops, sessions, and Kaizens with E2E stakeholder involvement Facilitating E2E process improvements that enable Warranty reduction Working with warranty coordinator and Customer Value Chain Management Team to deploy and mature processes Working with Key Market teams (warranty champions) to influence and drive the IGTS customer experience in warranty Driving ideation with the markets to maintain healthy process and product improvement funnels geared towards the first year of use Working with the Quality Improvement Program’s data analyst, facilitates the development of warranty specific dashboards. You are a part of The Quality Improvement Office (QIO). The QIO sets the standard for E2E Quality Improvements, KPI’s and processes, as well as the daily management cadences that go along with it. The QIO team consists of project managers, Customer Value Chain Managers, application and data analysts and specialists for project management processes. The PMO team is tasked to successfully bring new product innovations to the market. This includes product development, validation, regulatory approvals, commercial launch, production ramp up, service introduction, and breakthrough transformations. To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience Masters level of thinking, technical affinity, knowledge of project management methods, techniques, and tools >10 years of experience in applying project management methodologies specifically & tracking to be demonstrated by a successful track record; Learner’s mindset with an eagerness to solve problems across silos and lead change Proven application of Continuous Improvement methodologies e.g. 6-Sigma, Lean, PRIDE PS, PDCA etc Solid stakeholder management and ability to connect at all tiers of the organization including a pronounced understanding of culture and diversity Conceptual understanding of different project management methodologies such as (Scaled) Agile, Scrum, incremental waterfall, Lean applied in a project environment. Quality mindset: sound knowledge of project management documentation practices and ability to drive process improvements; Dynamic and enthusiastic team player who can drive actions, eager, ambitious and self-propelling; Flexibility and positive attitude towards change is important to ensure we can continuously improve our performance. Fluent in English with strong communication skills. In return, we offer you A path towards your most rewarding career. Succeeding in this market-based role in a complex environment will open many doors for your long term career, in other areas in Philips or otherwise. We also believe that we are at our best as a company when you are at yours as a person. Thus, we offer competitive health benefits, a flexible work schedule and access to local well-being focused activities. Furthermore, Philips University is available to all employees for learning and development opportunities. Why should you join Philips? Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 2.5 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across the health continuum. Our people experience a variety of unexpected moments when their lives and careers come together in meaningful ways. Learn more by watching this video. To find out more about what it’s like working for Philips at a personal level, visit the Working at Philips page on our career website, where you can read stories from our employee blog. Once there,you can also learn about our recruitment process, or find answers to some of the frequently asked questions. #LI-EU Contact If you forgot your password, you can click the Forgot Password button on the Sign In screen to reset it. If you have any other questions regarding the recruitment process please refer to our FAQs. In case of technical difficulties with the website, please send an email to careersite@philips.com. (Note: To ensure fairness and legal compliance in our recruitment processes, only technical issues will be monitored through the above inbox. Please do not submit resumes or applications to this email, as they will not be reviewed. Only applications received through the online application process will be considered.)

title: Master Data Junior Analyst
summary:
Chart of Accounts Maintenance (COA): set up new COA data, update COA data, deactivate COA data, etc.
Employee Maintenance: set up new employees, update employee…
description: In our Amsterdam Finance Center (AFC), we strive to deliver excellent customer service to our internal and external partners. Daily, we are responsible for Stryker’s European Business Services serving more than 20 countries. Do you want to be part of a driven and multicultural working environment? Do you want to join a company which improves people’s lives on a daily basis? Yes? So, we probably have a career opportunity for you! The Master Data Junior Analyst performs responsibilities related to the integrity of master data in the ERP system. The main responsibilities of this professional include but are not limited to the following: Operations management: Responsible for the quality and integrity of master data owned by Europe (EME): Vendor Master Data Maintenance + Intercompany Supplier: set up new suppliers, update supplier data, deactivate suppliers, supplier database review and maintenance, etc. Employee Maintenance: set up new employees, update employee data, etc. Chart of Accounts Maintenance (COA): set up new COA data, update COA data, deactivate COA data, etc. Ensures Master Data request responsiveness, respecting SLA time frames Ensures relevant policies and guidelines are followed and embedded into day-to-day operations Works closely with different departments and proactively manages stakeholders Adopts process excellence methodology (lean six sigma, MDI, change control) and ensures compliance to it Control and compliance: Responsible for preparing SOX controls as defined by AFC controls framework Maintains a quality-oriented culture within the team Reviews, creates and maintains internal processes and controls documentation What are we looking for? Bachelor or HBO degree in Finance/Business-related subjects 1 year of experience in the areas of finance master data, such as: vendor, customer, items, employees, chart of accounts or shared service organization Fluency in English Preferably familiar with Service Now or similar workflow management tooling Experience with ERP systems (such as Oracle, SAP, MFG pro, BPCS, PRMS, etc.) – preferable Competencies: Continuous-improvement and Customer Service orientation Ability to establish and communicate priorities Natural problem solving and process improvement capability Ability to adapt to a quickly changing environment and priorities Strong communication (verbal and written), attention to detail and ability to communicate complicated issues effectively Our offer: This role is based in our newly established offices in Amsterdam 40 working hours/week Competitive salary + bonus opportunity 8.5% holiday allowance 27 holidays per year on a full-time basis Commuting allowance/NS Business Card Subsidized lunch Collective Health insurance available through Stryker with ONVZ Being part of a Finance Center in Amsterdam with career possibilities in several financial areas. Opportunities to learn and develop your career in a direction which you aspire International working environment (30+ nationalities) Social Committee activities: Holiday party, free gym classes on-site, monthly after-work drinks, free fruit, foosball table etc. Fortune has named Stryker a World’s Best Workplace Stryker is one of the world’s leading medical technology companies and, together with our customers, we are driven to make healthcare better. Stryker offers a diverse array of innovative medical technologies including Reconstructive, Medical and Surgical, Neuro Technology and Spine products to help people lead more active and more satisfying lives. Our products and services are available in over 100 countries. Over the last number of years, we have invested in building a regional support structure in The Netherlands by creating a European Regional Head Office, expanding the Regional Distribution Centre and establishing the Amsterdam Finance Center. Find out more about us: careers.stryker.com

title: Senior Pricing Analyst
summary:
Data gedreven waardesturing heeft geïmplementeerd of uitgebouwd.
Je rapporteert aan de Manager Product & Pricing en helpt hem om het vakgebied op te zetten op…
description: Senior Pricing Analyst   Fulltime Senior Pricing Analyst, werkgebied Nederland  Met jouw kennis op het gebied van pricing en slimme pricingtechnieken help je mee het expertise gebied Product & Pricing op te zetten en succesvol te maken. Je speelt een belangrijke rol bij de verdere professionalisering van het pricing vakgebied richting fact based waarde sturing en het ontwikkelen van nieuwe concepten in de afvalrecycling industrie. Als strategische en inhoudelijke Pricing Analyst zie jij de juiste kansen voor ons in de markt en denk je mee over nieuwe diensten en pricing strategieën. Dat je daarvoor de juiste tarieven moet berekenen, slim nadenkt en rekening houdt met verschillende (commerciële) belangen en regels, hoeven we jou niet te vertellen. Jij weet als geen ander hoe de dynamiek van de markt in elkaar steekt. Van rol containers tot het recyclen van matrassen, van multinational tot consument: jouw focus ligt op de pricing van deze nieuwe diensten. Zo houd jij onze businessmodellen up-to-date en draag jij bij aan het creëren van een optimale dienstverlening voor onze klanten. Wat ga je o.a. doen? Je bent een senior. Daarom weet je met jouw kennis, ervaring en inzet van slimme pricing strategieën en technieken de afdeling naar een hoger niveau te tillen. Jij verzamelt en interpreteert cruciale marktinformatie en brengt de invloed hiervan op de tarieven van Renewi in kaart. Vanuit jouw expertise adviseer je management over het optimale prijsbeleid en marketeers van Renewi over prijstellingen en proposities. Tactisch, strategisch en gedreven werk je nauw samen met je collega’s van het team Pricing en collega’s van Sales, Marketing, Operatie en IT om nieuwe diensten te realiseren. Je speelt een (inhoudelijk) leidende rol bij diverse strategische projecten zoals het rationaliseren van de productportfolio en het implementeren van waarde sturing binnen de divisie. Samen met je team zorg je voor de vaststelling van de prijzen van de producten van Renewi Jouw profiel Om onze dienstverlening (nog) beter te maken en nieuwe bundels en pakketten bij Renewi op de kaart te zetten, is lef, aanpakken en een hands-on mentaliteit onmisbaar “walk the talk”. Je hebt een stevige persoonlijkheid, die eenvoudig de verbinding legt en conceptueel denkt. Je staat bekend om je haarscherpe analytische vermogen en je sterke consultancy- en communicatie skills. Jij bent een positieve, overtuigende, sociale expert op je vakgebied, die: een wo-opleiding heeft afgerond, denk aan economie, econometrie, bedrijfskunde of bedrijfseconomie; minimaal 8 jaar ervaring meebrengt, opgedaan bij een organisatie die hierin al bewezen succesvol is (zoals telecom, energie, retail) precies weet hoe je succesvol nieuwe proposities ontwikkelt, prijst en optimaliseert; de ontwikkelingen in de markt op de voet volgt - sterker nog: je zet ontwikkelingen om in kansen en concrete actie en proposities; de juiste knowhow heeft als het gaat om pricingtechnieken, zoals value based pricing, pakket pricing, dynamic pricing, commodity pricing, marktonderzoek technieken zoals conjunct en nomadic; en ervaring heeft met handel en next level risicomanagement data gedreven waardesturing heeft geïmplementeerd of uitgebouwd een agile mindset heeft, gecombineerd met denken, doen en humor. Naast bovenstaande punten herken je jezelf in de volgende competenties: Overtuigingskracht, Analytisch, Nauwgezet, Integer, Innovatief, Besluitvaardig, Planmatig, optimistisch en open minded.  Waar kom je terecht? Je komt terecht in het nieuwe team Product & Pricing. Je rapporteert aan de Manager Product & Pricing en helpt hem om het vakgebied op te zetten op een data gedreven manier. De werkomgeving is dynamisch, de circulaire economie is immers volop in beweging, en uitdagend. Er heerst een open en directe cultuur waarin veel waarde wordt gehecht aan enthousiasme, humor en resultaat. Samen met jouw collega’s help jij mee aan onze missie: marktleider zijn op het gebied van waste-to-product. We willen marktleider blijven en daar hebben we ook jouw talent bij nodig! Hoe maken we jou blij? Een goed primair salaris, laptop, mobiele telefoon en goede pensioenregeling. Minimaal 27,5 vakantiedagen! De vaste feestdagen ben je al vrij. Overige arbeidsvoorwaarden conform cao Beroepsgoederenvervoer. De allerleukste online trainingen, waarbij je zelf kan bepalen wanneer, wat en hoe je leert! Een standplaats in overleg, waarbij je minimaal 2 dagen thuis mag werken (momenteel werken we fulltime thuis). Een leuk team en collega’s die zich dagelijks hard inzetten voor een betere wereld. Een uitdagende werkomgeving - met veel ruimte en vrijheid - die volop in beweging is en waarbinnen je jezelf nog verder kunt ontwikkelen en kunt doorgroeien.  Kun jij niet wachten om als Pricing Analyst aan de slag te gaan? Neem dan contact op met Michael van de Ven (Senior Recruiter) en/of Thijs de Bruijn (Manager Product & Pricing), via het contactformulier. Ben je zo enthousiast dat je direct wil solliciteren? Reageer dan uiterlijk 28 maart via de solliciteerbutton. We kijken uit naar jouw sollicitatie! De eerste gespreksronde staat gepland voor: donderdag 1 en vrijdag 2 april via MS Teams.  Side note voor bureaus: Wij geloven in de kracht van onze eigen medewerkers, dus ook in die van onze Recruiters. Om deze reden wordt Acquisitie niet op prijs gesteld. Mail je ons toch een CV dan kunnen daar geen rechten aan worden ontleend.

title: Personal Data Protection and Business Analyst
summary:
Experience in analysis of personal data in data flows.
Determine data flow throughout its lifecycle.
Identify data processors involved in business processes.
description: On behalf of ESA, we are currently looking for a Personal Data Protection and Business Analyst to work in its Site (ESTEC) in the city of Noordwijk, The Netherlands. The key person will support the analysis of data processing operations, data flow, services, applications, etc. and to contribute to the identification of risk, risk mitigation in order to comply with regulatory requirements and ESA policies. Tasks and Activities The scope of work will include: Support on the inventory of all business processes that involve personally identifiable data. Identify what personal data is processed in which business process. Define the legitimate purpose, for each business process. Identify any personal data not meeting the processing purpose criteria (incl. backups). Determine and document legal grounds for processing. Determine data flow throughout its lifecycle. Identify data processors involved in business processes. Identify by what means data is processed for each process. Propose amendments to existing business processes to ensure data minimization. Identify risk assessment and mitigation. Update templates to reflect changes. Support documentation, reporting and monitoring. Skills and Experience The following skills and experience are mandatory: Master’s Degree from a recognised Institute of secondary studies or equivalent qualification in Engineering, Business Administration or relevant discipline. At least 4 years of experience. Business Analysis and legal background. In depth knowledge and experience in EU personal data protection law. Experience in analysis of personal data in data flows. Experience in information systems auditing, risk and mitigation of risk. Practice in Data Protection Impact Assessments. Attention to detail. Capability to manage confidential information. Capability to manage a large amount of analysis work-load in multiple topics. Proficiency in English, both written and spoken.  RHEA Group is a growing international company, focusing on providing innovative, market-ready solutions and services in our key sectors of Space and Security for both commercial and institutional customers. We have over 600 staff working across 11 different countries. We work with distinguished clients such as the European Space Agency, EUMETSAT, NATO, European Commission, Canadian Government and national space agencies. When you work for RHEA, you will have the opportunity to work alongside some of the best talented minds and experts in our industries, either working at our clients sites on some of the most exciting space missions or on cutting-edge projects in security, concurrent design, data and ground systems within our own offices. To attract the best candidates, RHEA offers our employees competitive remuneration packages, unique career opportunities, individualised training and development programmes and local relocation support to take the stress out moving to another country or city. We are recruiting now. We understand your concerns during this period of a global pandemic and we will work with you, at your pace ensuring your questions are answered and maximum flexibility is offered.

title: Business Analist
summary: Minimaal 5 jaar relevante werkervaring als bijvoorbeeld business analist, data analist, BI Specialist of informatieanalist binnen een commerciële en…
description: Combineer jij bedrijfskundig en commercieel inzicht met een sterk analytisch vermogen en goede IT kennis en vaardigheden? Werk je gestructureerd en heb je een proactieve en ondernemende werkwijze? En heb jij zin in een uitdaging binnen een gedreven en ambitieuze organisatie? Dan zijn we op zoek naar jou voor de functie van Business Analist! Wie zijn wij? Wij zijn ALLSAFE. We geven extra ruimte aan iedereen die dat nodig heeft. Ruimte voor thuis of voor op het werk, door opslagruimte bij ALLSAFE en door je huis slim in te richten. Bij ALLSAFE blijven we altijd leren. We innoveren, we inspireren en richten ons daarbij op service en kwaliteit. Dat doen wij net iets slimmer dan anderen. En daarom groeien we hard. Keihard. Bij ALLSAFE zoeken we talenten, die met ons mee willen groeien. Naar 70 vestigingen in 2023. Sluit je aan bij ALLSAFE. We hebben je hard nodig. Keihard. Wat ga je doen? Als Business Analist zal jij een cruciale rol gaan spelen in onze groei. Jij adviseert gevraagd en ongevraagd over wat je allemaal met beschikbare data kan doen. Door intern en extern beschikbare data te koppelen zorg jij dat het management de correcte data en informatie heeft om de juiste beslissingen te kunnen nemen. Zie jij een nieuwe ontwikkeling in de markt die van invloed is op onze business? Dan vertaal je dat naar efficiënte oplossingen voor onze organisatie. Je helpt verschillende afdelingen zoals: Finance, HR, Marketing, IT en Operations met het verkrijgen van nieuwe inzichten op basis van data. Daarnaast werk je nauw samen met onze BI specialist en rapporteer je aan de CFO. De belangrijkste taken en verantwoordelijkheden zijn: Je maakt zelfstandig analyses van data en datastromen ten behoeve van de commercie (marketing, sales), finance en operations. Hierbij moet je denken aan klantanalyses (customer journeys), marktanalyses, churn-analyses, business plannen, sales forecast en businesscases. Dat doe je door data uit verschillende bronnen te ontsluiten, samen te voegen en weer te geven in tabellen, visualisaties en actiegerichte werklijsten. Je bent verantwoordelijk voor zowel de ontwikkeling als het beheer van dashboards en rapportages. Je adviseert gevraagd en ongevraagd de business op basis van analyses die je maakt; Het verder ontwikkelen, opzetten en onderhouden van Dashboards voor de directie en het management. Je analyseert de output van deze rapportages en komt proactief met adviezen en verbetervoorstellen!; Je levert een bijdrage aan de data kwaliteit binnen ALLSAFE en de inrichting, het onderhoud en het functioneel beheer van het Data WareHouse. Dit bieden we jou! Salaris en bonusregelingen; Uitgebreid aanbod van ALLSAFE Benefits: o.a. flexibele vakantiedagenregeling, pensioenregeling, reiskostenvergoeding, vitaliteitsbudget, ziektekostenregeling, sportabonnement, iPhone; Doorgroei- en ontwikkelmogelijkheden in de ALLSAFE Academy; Gezamenlijke lunch, geregeld borrels, onvergetelijke bedrijfsuitjes (zoals jaarlijkse wintersport en onlangs ons jubileumreisje naar Ibiza) en sportavonden; Een hip, professioneel en gezellig kantoor inclusief super lieve kantoorhond; Hecht team met leuke, gedreven en ambitieuze collega’s. Wat vragen we van jou? Een afgeronde HBO- of bij voorkeur een WO-opleiding; Minimaal 5 jaar relevante werkervaring als bijvoorbeeld business analist, data analist, BI Specialist of informatieanalist binnen een commerciële en pragmatische omgeving; Je bent een expert op gebied van Excel (draaitabellen/matrixformules/power BI/macro’s); Je hebt ervaring met MS SQL databases, Data Warehouse omgevingen en moderne BI tooling; Je bent inhoudelijk gedreven, zeer nieuwsgiering, sterk gericht op resultaat en proactief. Je beschikt over bedrijfskundig inzicht waar anderen jaloers op zijn, je bent analytisch sterk en je schakelt snel en makkelijk tussen abstract en concreet. Je bent doortastend, weet de juiste informatie boven tafel te krijgen en kunt mensen bewegen tot actie. Je werkt zeer accuraat, planmatig en gestructureerd en bent goed in het stellen van prioriteiten. Verder ben je communicatief sterk en heb je een groot verantwoordelijkheidsgevoel. Sluit jij je bij ons aan? Stuur je motivatiebrief en CV door via de knop 'Solliciteer'. Heb je vragen? Neem contact op via het formulier 'Stel een vraag' in het contact menu. Voor meer informatie kun je kijken op www.werkenbijallsafe.nl. Soort dienstverband: Fulltime Aanvullende betalingen: Bonusregeling Vakantiegeld Arbeidsvoorwaarden: Bedrijfsfeesten Budget voor professionele ontwikkeling Extra vakantiedagen Flexibele werkuren Gezondheidsprogramma Lunchkorting Pensioen Personeelskorting Reiskostenvergoeding Telefoonplan Vrijdagmiddagborrel Werkschema: Dagdienst ma-vr

title: Data Analyst - User Growth
summary:
We’re looking for a data-savvy individual to join our User Growth team.
As an analyst on a rapidly growing team, you’ll have lots of ownership and the chance to…
description: Do you want to help take our brand to the next level?  Hey - we're Poki. Every day, 2 million users and 200 game developers come together on our web platform to play and create games. In the upcoming years, we want to establish our brand as the ultimate online playground and welcome players from all over the world. We’re looking for a data-savvy individual to join our User Growth team. You’ll pioneer our User Growth analytics projects around topics ranging from attribution, LTV, segmentation, and much more with the goal of helping us uncover insights that allow us to effectively grow our worldwide player base to 10M daily players and beyond. As an analyst on a rapidly growing team, you’ll have lots of ownership and the chance to have a big impact on our business. Is this you? Then read on!  Do you recognize yourself in the following? I’m self-motivated and highly responsible – I thrive on freedom I enjoy working fast, in a dynamic and agile environment  I'm always open to new ideas, perspectives, and solutions  I’m eager to learn and love to share  I'd love to work with a fun, informal, and diverse group of people Then we're looking for you! TL;DR:  We are looking for an analytical thinker who knows how to extract insights to build a connected story. You’re good at distilling complex information into digestible thoughts, and breaking down complicated topics in ways that make them understandable for diverse stakeholders. You keep a curious mind, always striving to understand more about the patterns that we see and are excited about testing those theories as a means to learn more and drive our goal to build the number one global brand in a sustainable way. Your challenge: #1: Generate insights - Looking into user behavior, you generate tactical and strategic recommendations to improve effectiveness of our User Growth efforts. From running experiments and creating user segments to deep diving into the journey of a single user, you’re eager to understand how we can consistently improve. #2: Present insights - Taking the team along in the insights you find. From presenting general user insights to the company to presenting dashboards with actionable campaign opportunities for the User Growth team, you know who to involve and how to present your findings. #3: Data enrichment - Connecting the dots in a smart and efficient way. From technically setting up tracking for new traffic sources to improving the logic we use for attributing value to those sources, you get that most value is in making the right connections. #4: Alignment - Aligning with the team that works on data infrastructure and key metrics, you help out with creating a unified structure that enables speed, agility, and alignment across the organization—one that reduces fragmentation. #5: Strategy - Checking in with the other analysts on a weekly basis, you understand the growth dynamics of a multi-sided platform like ours. You’re aware of our product strategy, experimentation, and the latest product releases. You: Have 4+ years work experience in an analytical role involving data extraction, reporting, analysis, and helping your team take action based on the analysis  Have experience in a user-centered digital product  Have exceptional analytical skills and attention to detail, with the ability to clearly communicate results and to define next steps  Have the ability to work independently and with a team in a fast-paced and dynamic environment  Have experience being accountable for and leading analytical projects  Have experience with marketing analytics concepts like LTV, segmentation, ROI analysis, etc. Have a strong background in SQL, basic proficiency in programming/scripting and knowledge of statistical packages like R or Python Are already based in The Netherlands, preferably around Amsterdam.  Bonus experience Have experience working in user growth (marketing) teams Have affinity with analytics for playful experiences or brands Have experience using: BigQuery, Data Studio, Google Adwords, DBT  We offer: A chance to build your career with our fast-growing tech company Deep understanding of how a multi-sided platform works, opportunity to broaden your knowledge/skills through education A diverse, talented and self-motivated team A full-time contract (32-40 hours/week) A competitive salary No formal hierarchy and a lot of personal responsibility and freedom Direct impact on the experience of our 30 million+ users, on our community of 200+ game developers, and on our network of brands

title: Sales Operations Analyst - Strategic Planning & Analytics, Uber Eats - EMEA
summary:
Exceptional data analysis/spreadsheet skills.
Ability to distill sophisticated data sets into simple and digestible takeaways for senior leaders and managers.
description: The Sales Operations Associate role is a unique opportunity to work closely with our merchant sales teams in EMEA to drive productivity, effectiveness and compliance. Sales Operations is the nerve center for all things related to the merchants which join and operate on our Uber Eats platform with a primary focus on empowering our Sales teams in all EMEA markets to achieve their business goals. In this role, you will help build best-in-class, compliant sales processes, design standard operating procedures, and support cross-functional projects. In doing so, you'll make a direct impact by turning Uber Eats into the most trusted, go-to service for as many merchants as possible. Sales compliance is top of mind and you will work closely with regional leadership and have a wide range of stakeholders from different departments and countries. About the Role: The Uber Eats EMEA Sales Operations Strategic Planning & Analytics (SP&A) team enables sales and sales leadership to amplify their sales performance via robust analyses, sales plans, and automations. The SP&A analyst is responsible for building, analyzing, and communicating sales performance results to empower decision making & sales strategy. What You'll Do: Develop business insights. Work closely with operations, marketing, sales, finance and teammates, globally, to identify important trends, problems and opportunities across regions Work with Commercial leadership, Global Analytics & Sales Systems to analyze and improve the systems that help us understand sales productivity & merchant performance on the platform Improve and automate processes: Identify administrative tasks that impede sales from achieving their target, scope & partner with various teams to build automations that eliminate the tasks completely Sales Planning & Target Setting: Collaborate with in-region Sales Leadership, Sales Ops, Onboarding & Sales finance to provide achievable yet ambitious sales targets for the year Analytics Support: Maintain critical reporting infrastructure to minimize downtime of core sales insights & dashboards What you will need: 2 years of experience in Strategy & Planning, Operations, Analytics, Strategic Finance and / or Consulting. Bachelor degree in related field required Data-driven decision making mentality, sound business judgment, and the ability to back your analysis up with relevant analytical thinking. Extraordinary attention to detail, particularly when it comes to validating numbers & metrics SQL - Able to write SQL queries within their first month that benefit the sales teams Exceptional data analysis/spreadsheet skills Project Management experience - independence in scoping and facilitating work across remote teams to meet deadlines Bonus points if: Experience with Salesforce. You should be able to navigate Salesforce comfortably and be able to complete an entire sales flow yourself Ability to distill sophisticated data sets into simple and digestible takeaways for senior leaders and managers Ability to thrive in ambiguous and fast paced environments. A bias towards action, phenomenal collaborator and excellent simplifier - you're constantly pushing toward transparency and delivery At Uber, we ignite opportunity by setting the world in motion. We take on big problems to help drivers, riders, delivery partners, and eaters get moving in more than 10,000 cities around the world. We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone and everything can move independently. If you have the curiosity, passion, and collaborative spirit, work with us, and let's move the world forward, together. At Uber, we ignite opportunity by setting the world in motion. We take on big problems to help drivers, riders, delivery partners, and eaters get moving in more than 10,000 cities around the world. We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone and everything can move independently. If you have the curiosity, passion, and collaborative spirit, work with us, and let's move the world forward, together.

title: Data Engineer
summary:
Experience (5+ years) with coordinating with data analysts / business analysts to help operationalize KPIs and Metrics.
Ok, maybe we did want to brag a little.
description: Mendix is on a mission to enable anyone in any organization – from the marketing coordinator to the software developer to the CEO – to create things that are transformational for their company. We are fundamentally reinventing the way applications are created and we’re reinventing the future of software development. Sounds ambitious, right? We agree.  Not to brag, but nearly 4,000 organizations worldwide, including KLM, Medtronic, Merck, and Philips, rely on Mendix to build web and mobile applications. Thousands of our customers use our platform to delight their clients and empower their employees. It’s no surprise that we’re a recognized Leader by Gartner and Forrester in a red-hot market expected to exceed $21 billion by 2022. Ok, maybe we did want to brag a little. But we’re proud of what we’ve accomplished…and…we’re humble enough to admit that we need you to make us even more effective.  What is our analytics center of excellence (COE)?  Mendix has doubled in size in only a year and a half. As such, the need for analytics insights and automation are becoming increasingly important. The Analytics Center of Excellence will be providing different business units with dedicated partners that create new analytics products and insights to improve the performance of their units and make the rights decisions. The COE is supported by two Technical Data Engineering teams who are responsible for the Mendix’s data landscape (one datalake team and one data warehouse team). You will be a valuable member of the Data Warehouse and Engineering team. The team is currently being formed, so you will be one of the first members of the team. But this is a key investment area where we plan to hire several people to form a fully functioning team within the year.  Are you the experienced Data Engineer that can help us build the foundation for Mendix’s Analytics Center of Excellence? Do you have experience building data warehouses, creating architectural designs, doing ETL, and crafting datamarts that form the basis for reporting and advanced analytics? Then we are looking for you.  We are looking for someone who can help create the data transformation and warehousing strategy for our Center of Excellence. Once data is in our datalake, we need to decide what we do with it. We hope that you will bring in best practices and experience that will help us use and transform data in the right way. We are not necessarily looking to create a traditional data warehouse, but we are looking for an infrastructure and strategy that will help us report on metrics and data consistently and accurately.  You will be one of the first members of the team. Your role will be to help setup the infrastructure and create all the necessary data transformation and reporting layers to help our analysts create BI solutions that are nicely aligned with one another. Your team’s data warehouse solution should be the central source of truth for all reporting.  Currently the analysts dive into a lot of raw data themselves. This takes time, and also means that not all reports are fully aligned at times. This is something your team is going to solve.  Mentoring other members of the COE and helping build the foundation of our COE best practices will also be an important part of your role. We are looking for people with new ideas and several years of experience that can help enrich the COE. Responsibilities Helping make decisions about what type of cloud data infrastructure solutions we should adopt within the data engineering team & implementing these solutions Helping decide how our data transformation infrastructure is organized (e.g. how do we store metrics, how do we store raw data, how do we store other transformed datasets) Working together with data analysts to operationalize KPIs and other metrics Transforming data using SQL, R, Python, or any other tool or language that you think would be best Setting up quality checks on the solutions you provide to ensure that our reporting and data is reliable Creating automated solutions that reporting data is readily available on a recurring basis (not necessarily real time, but the closer we can get to that, the better) Mentoring and teaching younger members of the COE Introducing new techniques, tools, and best practices for the COE Technical Requirements Relevant experience (5+ years) with: Data processing languages or scripting languages such as: SQL, R or Python Designing ETL processes Creating and maintaining large complex data sets that meet business requirements Data modelling / data warehousing / cube development / database design Working with cloud solutions (AWS preferred) Working with both structured and unstructured data Business Requirements Experience (5+ years) with coordinating with data analysts / business analysts to help operationalize KPIs and Metrics Experience with working in an agile environment Experience with quickly learning about and familiarizing yourself with different business domains (ability to show a clear understanding of “what’s behind the data”) Some experience with stakeholder management between different business units and management levels Experience with mentoring and/or teaching subject matter to colleagues Able to speak fluent English Speaking Dutch is a plus, but not required Our team is relatively young, therefore we are looking for people that can bring industry best practices into the COE and have several years of experience working in an agile work environment. If you have several years of experience in a data engineering related role and you are eager to bring your experience in a young, thriving, and quickly scaling organization, then you are the person we are looking for!  Our Guiding Principles  While we live on different continents, speak different languages, and work on different things, we are bound by our “MendixBlue” guiding principles. Being “MendixBlue” means that you live the culture, and you consistently improve it as we grow. It’s kind of a big deal.  We put the customer first. Without our customers, we have no business. So, if you act in the best interest of our customers, always…you belong here.  We think big. We work to have a meaningful, lasting impact on the world. So, if you aim high and think long term…you belong here.  We innovate. We want to be what happens next. So, if you ask “what if?” and work to find a way or make one…you belong here.  We nurture talent. We look, not just at the sum of what an individual has done, but at the potential of who they can be. So, if you’re up for learning from your failures…you belong here.  We hear every voice. Inflated egos don’t last here, humility does. So, if you share credit and ensure that the best ideas win – regardless of who they come from…you belong here.  We own it. If something needs doing, we do it. So, if you focus on the outcome, and take initiative to get it done…you belong here.  We have fun. We use laughter as a common language. We can ask for help and we’re happy to give it. So, if you find joy and purpose in what you do…you belong here.  Make your career at Mendix.  There are precious few jobs that let you create the future. But you’ll find one at Mendix. We are at a pivotal time in our company’s existence: where rapid growth meets stable funding. This is the time for industrious people to raise their hands to solve the next generation of problems. Mendix is a place where ambitious people can thrive; where you can identify an issue, propose a solution, and build the structure to make it happen.  Important to know: Mendix is a Siemens business, which means we’re backed by the resources and stability of one of the world’s largest and most forward-looking enterprises. Think: job security.  Since our company was founded in 2005, our aim has been to create a great work environment for people at all stages in their careers. That’s why we are so pleased and honored that we were rated a top Cloud Computing Company to work for in 2019, based on feedback from our employees on Glassdoor. With offices in the Netherlands, the UK, Germany, and the US, (and more coming), we provide an international playground to truly impact the world through low-code.

title: (Technical) Business Analist
summary:
Je hebt kennis van (big)data-analytics ontwikkelingen en data-gedreven processen en kunt business en techniek op dit vlak verbinden.
In deze rol ben je;
description: OVER DENKAVIT Denkavit is de specialist in voeding voor jonge dieren en leverancier van ingrediënten voor diervoeders. Vanuit vestigingen in Nederland, Frankrijk, Duitsland, Spanje en Italië leveren wij kennis en producten aan veehouders en diervoederleveranciers in meer dan 50 landen. Internationaal is Denkavit gerespecteerd vanwege ons hoge kennisniveau en toponderzoek. Onze eigen laboratoria en onderzoekscentra zijn uniek in ons sector. OVER DE FUNCTIE Ben jij die leergierige, gedreven business analist die onze productie en TD helpt in het ontwikkelen van productie automatisering (Manufacturing Execution Systems MES) en RealTime productie performance oplossingen (Manufacturing Intelligence MI)? Spreek je de taal van onze eindgebruikers en technische ontwikkelaar? Én ben je daarnaast de specialist die in staat is om mass-data te analyseren en verbeterpotentie te identificeren en kwantificeren? WAT GA JE DOEN? Binnen deze rol werk je mee in het (functioneel en technisch) ontwerpen van nieuw te ontwikkelen automatisering (MES) en Productie Performance (MI) oplossingen. Je analyseert de relevante bedrijfsprocessen en ziet als geen ander de verbeterpotentie. In deze rol ben je; De aanjager voor de MES/MI ontwikkeling, dit doe je met oog voor de uitdaging van vandaag en de ambities van de toekomst. Je ontwikkelt een roadmap voor MI - data analytics toepassing binnen productie en onderhoud. Je ontwerpt functionele oplossingen vanuit geïdentificeerde behoefte en ontwikkelt technische concepten op dit gebied. Je werkt samen met het team Productie en TD in het vertalen van functionele behoefte in technisch oplossingen. Je bent in staat om complexe oplossingen op een eenvoudige manier in de organisatie te introduceren. Je hebt zelf ervaring in MI-software ontwikkeling / configuratie om in-house verbeterslagen te kunnen maken. Je bent mede vormgever van het (KPI) Performance Management proces binnen productie en onderhoud. Je weet als geen ander data te vertalen naar bruikbare informatie / inzichten. De implementatie van een Overall Equipment Effectiveness (OEE) oplossing krijgt een hoge prioriteit. In de tijd ontwikkel je diepere kennis van onze processen om van daaruit functionele opportunity’s te herkennen en te vertalen in technische oplossingen binnen het domein van MES/MI. WIE BEN JIJ? Relevante HBO opleiding Ervaring/Kennis van project management, -technieken en business analyse binnen een operations omgeving Je hebt ervaring/kennis met productie automatiseringssystemen (MES), je kent de begrippen ANSI/ISA-88/95. Je hebt kennis van (big)data-analytics ontwikkelingen en data-gedreven processen en kunt business en techniek op dit vlak verbinden. Je hebt zelf ervaring in MI-software ontwikkeling / configuratie om in-house verbeterslagen te kunnen maken. Je bent sterk in het analyseren, uitdragen en verdedigen van verbetermogelijkheden. Je hebt al ervaring/kennis van Overall Equipment Effectiveness (OEE) Je bent bekent met Business Intelligence oplossingen (bijv. Oracle BI) Ervaring in Feed/Food Productie omgevingen is een pré. Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal. Beheersing van de Franse taal is een pré. WAT BIEDEN WIJ Wij bieden je een veelzijdige baan met brede ontwikkelingsperspectieven. Je werkt in een dynamische organisatie van een gezond, groeiend bedrijf. Wij bieden de mogelijkheid om jezelf te ontwikkelen, naast uitstekende primaire en secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden. Je komt in een gedreven team terecht waarin collegialiteit en samenwerken voorop staat. NIEUWSGIERIG GEWORDEN? Voor meer informatie kun je contact opnemen met Francois van Hal, Plant Manager, telefoonnummer: 0342-479311. Solliciteer direct via onze website! Soort dienstverband: Fulltime, Onbepaalde tijd Aanvullende betalingen: 13e maand Vakantiegeld Arbeidsvoorwaarden: Kerstpakket Pensioen Reiskostenvergoeding Werkschema: Dagdienst

title: Data Analyst
summary: All this data is being collected and stored, and used extensively by our team of 10 analysts and data scientists that want to build a better company by using…
description: Catawiki's purpose is to enable people to discover and obtain special objects that help them fulfill their passions. In doing so, we add some color & make the world a more interesting place. Our Data Story With thousands of active lots every day, hundreds of thousands of daily bids, millions of users, and billions of events, the Catawiki platform generates vast amounts of data every day. All this data is being collected and stored, and used extensively by our team of 10 analysts and data scientists that want to build a better company by using data in a smart way. At Catawiki, we believe in using data for making decisions, and the Data Science & Analytics team plays an important role in that.  What you will do: We're looking for a Data Analyst that can help us make sense of all our data, and find actionable insights, patterns and relations by combining data from multiple sources and working closely together with your colleagues in other departments.
