Experience defining a clear Game Roadmap and strategy based on current trends. Experience in the MVP approach, whilst ensuring that every release improves the Game’s quality and KPI’s. A sound understanding of Game Design principles and the ability to work closely with Game Designers, Artists, and Developers. Worked on a released mobile game. Experience with Unity. A good sense of humor! What We Offer Diverse and challenging projects. The chance to bring and realize your own ideas. A competitive salary, pension, and a bonus system. Direct hire. An extensive benefits package and a work environment that encourages excellence. Great opportunity to grow and expand your knowledge within the industry. Full-time position with opportunities for growth within the company. Free daily lunch and events. Covered transportation costs and 28 paid vacation days. A stocked kitchen of fruit, beer, and treats! Game-designed, awesome office with table football, arcade machine, consoles, darts, and board games. Friday entertainment evenings - every Friday you can hang out at the office with your colleagues and make use of the games collection with free drinks & snacks. About Us Founded in 2014 and based in Eindhoven, The Netherlands, ChimpWorks is a game development company with popular titles for mobile platforms. With an ambitious young team of over 40 individuals from over 10 different countries, we are working in an autonomous team-based culture. We have realized more than 5 #1-ranked games and reached more than 250 million downloads. We create exciting, fun, free-to-play mobile games, enjoyed by millions of players worldwide. We continue to raise the bar through a data-driven, player-centric, and super-iterative approach. Our mission is to provide novel and unique games to create outstanding player experiences and fill the customer's life with joy and excitement. Apply Now! Seize this opportunity and become a part of the ChimpWorks family as a Product Owner! Don’t wait, send us your CV now and we will contact you as soon as possible!

title: Informatie Analist
summary: Daarnaast zijn we recentelijk ook gestart met de ontwikkeling van data management tools die door verschillende afdelingen van onze klanten worden gebruikt.
description: Wil jij als Information Analyst bijdragen aan onze ambitie om wereldwijd marktleider te worden in software voor exploitanten van openbaar vervoer? Zie jij jezelf bij een ambitieuze en innovatieve organisatie waarvan de software wereldwijd wordt ingezet? De functie Het team waar wij een Information Analyst voor zoeken houdt zich specifiek bezig met S3 Portal en frontends voor klanten van onze S3 Passenger Suite. S3 Portal wordt door callcenters van zowel onze operators als derden gebruikt en speelt een cruciale rol als visitekaartje van S3 Passenger bij de verkoop van onze software suite. De huidige backlog van S3 Portal biedt meer dan 2 jaar werk, er is dus nog genoeg te doen! Daarnaast zijn we recentelijk ook gestart met de ontwikkeling van data management tools die door verschillende afdelingen van onze klanten worden gebruikt. Het team werkt met moderne front-end tooling zoals ReactJS, Redux, NodeJS en Typescript en streeft naar hoge kwaliteit door middel van geautomatiseerde testen, continuous deployment en het monitoren van de applicaties in productie. Wat ga je doen als Information Analist bij Sqills? Een Information Analyst staat aan het begin het softwareontwikkelingsproces, maar wat doe je als Informatie Analist bij Sqills? Jouw primaire rol is om de specificaties uit te werken in user stories/interactie modellen die specifiek genoeg zijn om ontwikkeld of ontworpen te worden en zorgt voor een goede balans tussen nieuwe user stories, meedenken met technische innovaties en het ondersteunen bij vraagstukken vanuit klanten of het team. Daarnaast fungeer je als klankbord en aanspreekpunt voor andere teams wanneer er mee gedacht moet worden over de API’s die voor S3 Portal van belang zijn. De belangrijkste uitdagingen voor dit team is de balans vinden tussen usability versus functionality. Daarnaast ben je verantwoordelijk voor documentatie binnen Jira en Confluence en denk je mee over de APIs die door de andere teams ter beschikking worden gesteld aan het S3 Portal team. Wij zoeken iemand met: Minimaal een afgeronde HBO opleiding; Aantoonbare ervaring als Analist; Ervaring met Frontends; functioneel en technisch Ervaring met Jira en Confluence is een pré; Het vermogen analytisch en conceptueel te denken; Goede communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels; Een teamspeler met ‘wij-mentaliteit’ en sterke organisatorische en probleemoplossende vaardigheden. Wat gebeurt er als je solliciteert? Benieuwd naar onze sollicitatieprocedure? Klik dan hier!

title: Data analist
summary: In de rol van data analist ben je als informatie engineer in staat om binnen het project zorg te dragen een eenduidige werkwijze in het aanleveren van data,…
description: Over de functie Word jij onze nieuwe data analist (information engineer) en kom jij ons team versterken? Wij zijn op zoek naar een Informatie Engineer die op een van onze projecten de rol van data analist op zich kan nemen. Daarnaast wil jij je in ons bedrijf inzetten voor de verdere ontwikkeling van semantische modellen in graph databases en het ontwikkelen van informatiekwaliteit dashboards.  In de rol van data analist ben je als informatie engineer in staat om binnen het project zorg te dragen een eenduidige werkwijze in het aanleveren van data, valideren, classificeren en harmoniseren van deze data. Hiertoe maak je een semantische analyse en vertaling van exports uit een breed scala ontwerp software. Je ontwikkelt informatiekwaliteit-dashboards op basis van analyses over de opgeslagen data. Je communiceert met databewerkers teneinde kwalitatief hoogwaardige aanlevering van informatie te bewerkstelligen.  Binnen Mobilis zijn we voortdurend bezig met het ontwikkelen, functioneel inrichten en verbeteren van onze eigen applicaties. Als informatie engineer kan je aan de slag met het ontwikkelen, inrichten en beheren van onze eigen informatiemodellen, informatie dashboards en datawarehouse. Hierbij maak je gebruik van de kennis en ervaring uit het project en pas je deze toe in bedrijf bredere ontwikkelingen. Dit doe je in nauwe samenwerking met je collega informatie engineers en verschillende disciplines binnen Mobilis. Daarnaast zoek je hiervoor ook afstemming met onze TBI-collega bedrijven. Waar kom je te werken? Werk je bij Mobilis, dan werk je bij een slimme verbinder. Belangrijk, want alles in de bouw draait om verbinding. Als civiele aannemer zijn wij gespecialiseerd in projecten in de betonbouw. Als onderdeel van TBI heeft Mobilis het vermogen om het juiste team te koppelen aan de juiste technieken. Wij snappen hoe partijen zo samenwerken dat ze telkens tot hun meerwaarde komen. Of het nou om partners of onderaannemers gaat. Of een project nou duurzaam, tegen minimale hinder of met een maatschappelijk doel gerealiseerd wordt. Dankzij goede voorbereiding maken wij onze beloftes waar. Samen staan we voor kwaliteit van bouwen, wat betekent dat je continu bekijkt welke innovaties je kunt toepassen.  Met een team van 370 Mobilianen bouwen we al ruim 100 jaar aan de infrastructuur van Nederland. Dit doen wij vanuit de vestigingen in Apeldoorn, Nederweert en Rotterdam maar vooral vanuit de mooie projecten door heel Nederland. Een greep uit onze uitdagende infra-, water, industrie- en energieprojecten: de A13 – A16 (de Groeneboog), Oosterweel-verbinding (Antwerpen), Theemswegtracé, de RijnlandRoute en onderdoorgang Assen en RWZI in Weert. Ervaring Je hebt enige relevante ervaring als Informatie engineer of in een gelijkwaardige functie; Je hebt een sterk analytisch en abstract denkvermogen, (WO niveau) Je hebt een brede technische achtergrond, bij voorkeur in ontwerp en realisatie in de bouw Je vindt het een uitdaging om met data validatie en data classificatie vraagstukken bezig te zijn; Je hebt enige ervaring met semantiek/ semantisch modelleren in W3C standaarden (RDF/OWL/Turtle/Sparql) of je bent bereid om dit te leren; Je hebt enige kennis of ervaring met Graph databases; Je hebt enige kennis van Systems Engineering in techniek en bouw; Je bent communicatief sterk en een teamplayer. Herken jij je helemaal in het bovenstaande, dan is deze functie zeker iets voor jou! Wat wij bieden Naast een plezierige werksfeer, bieden wij een goed salaris conform de functie en hebben wij een zeer aantrekkelijk pakket aan secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarde waaronder 20 vakantiedagen, 10 roostervrije dagen en 13 individuele budgetdagen, een aantrekkelijke pensioenregeling. Als je bij Mobilis komt werken, komt jouw zoon of dochter mogelijk in aanmerking voor een studietoelage van stichting studiefonds TBI. Deze stichting heeft als doel om, in de vorm van een gift, een bijdrage te leveren aan de scholing, vorming en studie van kinderen van werknemers van de TBI-ondernemingen. Daarnaast biedt Mobilis je alle mogelijkheden om binnen de organisatie te werken aan jouw persoonlijke en professionele ontwikkeling door middel van opleidingen. Doorgroeimogelijkheden zijn er volop bij Mobilis, afhankelijk van jouw ambitie en inzet. Interesse? Ben jij na het lezen van deze vacature net zo enthousiast geworden, als dat wij zijn en wil je samen met ons aan verder aan jouw toekomst bouwen? Solliciteer dan via de button. Voor vragen kan je contact op nemen met onze HR-adviseur: Franka Braakman via f.braakman@tbi.nl.  We zien wij je sollicitatie graag tegemoet!  Acquisitie wordt niet op prijs gesteld. Aan het zonder opdracht voorstellen van kandidaten kunnen geen rechten c.q. verplichtingen worden ontleend.

title: Operational Excellence Analyst
summary:
Knowledge of data warehousing and data structure principles.
Great analytical skills with data-driven approach.
Your role as an Operational Excellence Analyst.
description: Vacancy: Operational Excellence Analyst  Looking to work in an international company with more than 35 different nationalities where collaboration and innovative ideas are key to drive future success? Seeking a role where you can add value and have the opportunity to develop and grow?  Office Depot E urope has an exciting opportunity for an Operational Excellence Analyst to join our European headquarters in Venlo , the Netherlands. The role is a fulltime, permanent position offering an excellent salary and benefits package. Your role as an Operational Excellence Analyst As an Operational Excellence Analyst, you will analyse the department’s operations and provide recommendations on ways to improve productivity and customer satisfaction levels. With input and regular communication from the other roles within the Operational Excellence team, you are responsible for drawing conclusions from all the data we have at our disposal and reporting back to the business on how we can improve. You will need to have a keen eye for data, trends and the ability to interpret that in a way that you can draw inferences and make recommendations for the future. This will require you to learn the business at an intricate level of detail in all areas in order to make the best advice for change, and change will be your primary focus. In short, how do we take what we have now, and make it better. Responsibility for compiling all daily, weekly, monthly and annual reports, decks and documentation in Customer Service. This is not focused on specific areas of Customer Service, you will analyse every aspect of the Operational Excellence remit and be responsible for understanding the complete business at a granular level Using those reports, you will analyse the data and present to Senior Management within Customer Service and other business areas on a daily basis with your findings and must have the persuasion and conviction to advise others of a change of course where needed The reports and analysis you provide must be both tactical (focusing on immediate improvement) and strategic (focusing on the long-term goals and vision). This will require you to be able to wear both hats and constantly be focused on improvement and never accepting the status quo Provide advice to internal stakeholders on data and / or insight related matters (pro-actively and on request) Internally within the CSC your main areas of engagement will be with the Knowledge Base Specialist and Training Coordinator, ensuring that the conclusions and recommendations you are drawing are represented in all material and documentation within the CSC as you are the vehicle for change Be able to clearly and visually structure and present your findings to all business areas regardless of their understanding of the subject matter Will need detailed knowledge of departmental and local procedures Receives minimal supervision in a well-structured environment What do you need to be successful in this role Higher vocational level of thinking with 2-5 years’ experience or a higher academic achievement and up to 2 years’ experience Previous working experience as a Business Analyst Lean Six Sigma Yellow Belt Certification MA in Business Management, Information Technology, Financial Management or similar relevant filed Great analytical skills with data-driven approach Knowledge of data warehousing and data structure principles High level understanding of IT infrastructure and architecture Thorough working knowledge of the contact centre environment and culture Excellent organisational and time management skills to be able to take a project through scoping, analysis and through to delivery Outstanding communication and presentation skills Critical thinker that acts as a creative problem solver What do we offer As we care about our people we will reward you with an excellent salary and additional benefits package. A good work-life balance with 36 days of leave per year, based on a 40 hour workweek Flexible working hours in regard to starting your day between 07:00 and 09:00 am Good travel expenses allowances Solid company pension scheme Collective health insurance and discount on private insurances Several initiatives to stimulate your well-being like contributions for sport memberships Interested? Click ‘ Apply’ today and take your next step towards a career with Office Depot Europe.  Want to know more about Office Depot in the Netherlands? Visit our career-website: https://careers.officedepot.eu/nl

title: Graduate Insights Analyst
summary: At Britvic we are proud to make, market, and sell soft drinks that help millions of people around the world to enjoy life’s everyday moments.
description: At Britvic we are proud to make, market, and sell soft drinks that help millions of people around the world to enjoy life’s everyday moments. Britvic is a UK based soft drinks company with global presence. Britvic Teisseire International, where this role resides, is responsible for the BeNeFraLux home market and the global expansion of Britvic owned brands including Teisseire, Mathieu Teisseire, London Essence, and Britvic Mixers. Britvic Teisseire International will be a critical driver of growth for Britvic to achieve its ambition of joining the FTSE 100 index on the London Stock Exchange. As Britvic Teisseire International continues to grow we are now looking for a Graduate Insights Analyst to support the Insights Manager and provide the business with accurate information on the performance of brands in the market. This role will be based in Amsterdam with occasional international travel required. Key responsibilities of a Graduate Insights Analyst: Define and maintain reporting setup: topline-reporting, in-depth reporting, self-service reporting Retail performance reporting (Nielsen) – setup reports, provide updates, analyse performance and pro-actively recommend on actions Promotional analysis with the RGM-manager Support the trade marketing managers / commercial team on category analysis Total market / On-trade reporting: ensure up to date reporting on “total market” performance is in place (Global Data; other sources when relevant). Ensure easy to access information for the teams Ex-factory performance reporting: ensure there is one database from which all details can be accessed: market, brand, package, and SKU-level. Perform in-depth analysis based on insight needs (e.g. category/brand/market deep dive). If necessary, commission research externally (e.g. Nielsen/Global Data)  Knowledge & Skills required: Proven, strong analytical skills. Experience and/or affinity with ad-hoc and continuous research Experience with Nielsen/IRI databases and reporting. Excel expert. Presentation skills Experience in FMCG ideally within the food & beverage industry Great communication skills (Fluent in Dutch and ideally English & French) Ability to travel, hold a valid passport (and visa if applicable) to do so Ability to multi task and act & deliver at pace in fast paced and volatile business environment Ability to build strong internal relationships and partnerships Appreciation of cultural differences and working across different international geographies Results driven and business oriented Masters degree preferable or other relevant marketing qualification  We’re committed to providing equal opportunities to all applicants and employees – in fact, this is at the heart of our company culture and values, and we welcome applications from candidates with diverse backgrounds.

title: Data Analytics Lead, Uber Payments
summary:
Love of data - you just go get the data you need and turn it into an insightful story.
Experience as a risk analyst in a financial organisation.
description: About the Role Uber Payments BV (UPBV) is Uber's payments subsidiary in the EU processing all of Uber's payments in the EU (EEA) under a licence from the Dutch Central Bank. As a licensed financial institution Uber Payments BV has stringent compliance obligations and this role is crucial for ensuring that these are met. The Data Analytics team would be a new team within UPBV's Risk and Compliance team. Its objectives are to integrate data intelligence capabilities to identify, monitor, alert and respond to risks relevant for Uber Payments BV. As a Data Analytics Lead, you will be responsible for gathering actionable and comprehensive insights into key operational and control gaps across Uber Payments BV resources and support Uber Payments BV to reduce its risk exposure and operational effort. You will be instrumental in optimising the speed of detection of risks and policy deviations, while enabling automation and digitally transforming Uber Payments BV's compliance, risk and control program. This role requires frequent interaction and communication with cross-functional partners and presentation to managers and executives. What the Candidate Will Need Education in Engineering, Computer Science, Math, Economics, Statistics or equivalent experience More than 10 years experience in modern programming languages (Matlab, Python) or statistical languages (SQL, SAS, R) Proficiency with multiple analytical and database tools (e.g Hive, Presto, Vertica, Tableau) More than 8 years experience of analytical and database experience More than 3 years of experience within a managerial role Proven ability to manage large dataset, explore and utilize raw data feeds Excellent data visualization skills Love of data - you just go get the data you need and turn it into an insightful story. You know how to convert data into decisions without getting stuck in paralysis by analysis Well-organised, structured approach to problem solving Strong sense of ownership, accountability and entrepreneurial spirit Able to drive change and solution oriented Great communicator, quick thinker & confident in decision making Independent & autonomous, while still a strong team player Enthusiastic, self-starting and thrives in changing, agile environments Fully comfortable working in English, both written and spoken Bonus Points If You Have Experience creating dashboard reporting in Tableau or a similar visualization tool. Experience as a risk analyst in a financial organisation Experience within the payments industry Experience working with Git Knowledge or experience with Jira

title: Global Infra IT Analyst
summary:
Maintain appropriate data backup and disaster recovery procedures;
Find what drives you on a team with a 70+ year history of being recognized for discovery,…
description: Find what drives you on a team with a 70+ year history of being recognized for discovery, determination, and innovation. As a global leader in high-tech filtration, separation, and purification, Pall Corporation thrives on helping our customers protect people. Our portfolio is broad, so if your interests lie along the spectrum of Life Sciences to Industrial, you’ll find a rewarding role here. Our career opportunities are as diverse as our products and they are all focused on creating better lives and a better planet. At Pall, we believe that innovation is our legacy, our privilege, and our destiny. If that resonates with you, join us!  Goal of the Position: The IT Analyst deploys and supports hardware, network and telecommunications projects for Pall's Medemblik site. He/She develops, implements, supports network security policies and safeguards. Not only for the current infrastructure, but also to support the future needs of the site!  Key Responsibilities: Provide user and administrative support for desktop and local server systems; Provide technical guidance to users and management for desktop support and local server systems; Perform maintenance and troubleshooting of all relevant hardware and software; Implement and support network operating systems and services; Configure, install & deploy all PC’s and PC related peripherals; Maintain appropriate data backup and disaster recovery procedures; Develop a solid understanding of site's specific applications; Participate in projects or teams; Support project implementations and roll-outs; Recognise opportunities and recommend solutions for improving service, efficiency, and effectiveness; Contribute to meeting the departmental key performance indicators; 1st / 2nd level Customer Helpdesk support.  Education, Skills and Competencies: Up-to-date professional certification would be a plus; Experience of desktop support; Experience of network applications / operating systems / hardware; LAN / WAN fostering measures; Good Team-Player; Proficient in Dutch and English. #LI-KM1  Diversity & Inclusion  At Danaher, we are dedicated to building and sustaining a truly diverse and inclusive culture. These are not just words on a page—Diversity and Inclusion is a top priority for the company, and it ties deeply to each of our core values. Danaher Corporation and all Danaher Companies are equal opportunity employers that evaluate applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, age, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or other characteristics protected by law.  Pall Corporation is proud to be part of the Danaher global family of more than 20 operating companies, driving meaningful innovation in some of today’s most dynamic, growing industries. Danaher is a global science & technology innovator committed to helping our customers solve complex challenges and improve quality of life worldwide. Our world-class brands are leaders in some of the most demanding and attractive industries, including life sciences, medical diagnostics, dental, environmental and applied solutions. Our globally diverse team of 71,000 associates is united by a common culture and operating system, the Danaher Business System, which serves as our competitive advantage. We generated $19.9B in revenue last year. We are ranked #162 on the Fortune 500 and our stock has outperformed the S&P 500 by more than 5,200% over 25 years.  At Danaher, you can build a career in a way no other company can duplicate. Our brands allow us to offer dynamic careers across multiple industries. We're innovative, fast-paced, results-oriented, and we win. We need talented people to keep winning. Here you'll learn how DBS is used to shape strategy, focus execution, align our people, and create value for customers and shareholders. Come join our winning team. Danaher is committed to competitive compensation that typically has key components including base salary, variable annual incentive compensation based on personal and company performance, and long-term incentive. Equal Opportunity Employer  Danaher Corporation and all Danaher Companies are equal opportunity employers that evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, age, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or other characteristics protected by law. The “EEO is the Law” poster is available at: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf.

title: Senior Data Analyst eCommerce
summary: In this team we deliver scalable data products and building bridges between the different data science & analytics teams from our brands.
description: Your new job and office Do you want to make impact, work for various international brands within Ahold Delhaize (e.g. Albert Heijn, Bol.com. Delhaize, Stop & Shop and Food Lion) and help shaping our global data science and analytics team? Then we're looking for you.  As a Senior Data Analyst eCommerce at Ahold Delhaize, you will be part of our newly formed global Data Science & Analytics team. We work closely together with our data science and analytics teams from our brands and the regional US team. We seek mutual opportunities, work together on implementing state-of-the-art data solutions and help them taking data science and analytics to a higher level.  In short; you will gather insights using your strong data analytics skillset and with that, you’ll seek opportunities for our brands. Mining large datasets, you test whether applications, data insights or models work in other countries and collaborate with local teams to deploy them. You will join scrum teams as a global advanced data analyst to accelerate the development and productionizing of algorithms and make sure they are scalable and portable to other teams. You share your knowledge with our brands, acquire knowledge and experiences from them and set up tight collaborations. This way you will improve numerous processes and the experiences of millions of customers every single day.  Within this job your core focus will be on advanced analytics within eCommerce. Through your smart integrations, new models or innovative analyzes, you will improve the operating systems of our Brands. You will be using data analytics to work on topics as customer acquisition and retention and improving operational efficiency and delivery. How can we improve the end to end eCommerce chain with your strong data analytics insights? This includes the use of data science, experimental design, the development of models and algorithms to automate work and continuously optimize our way of working. The focus is always on impact on the customer and extreme efficiency and quality. We’re looking for an analytical leader who creates impact at scale. You’re encouraged to see mutual opportunities and you’re a pragmatic analyst who likes getting his/her hands dirty.  As Senior Data Analyst at Ahold Delhaize you will:  Get impactful insights through your own strong analysis from a brand (by example Albert Heijn, Peapod or Bol.com) and deploy them to our other brands over the world. Experiment and iterate with data driven solutions and evaluate success. Only then we can continuously improve our data solutions and create impact within our brands. Use your data analytics experience and knowledge to mature our teams. Identify impactful areas based on strong data analyses. Develop ideas for new algorithms or methods that make the operation / eCommerce more efficient.  Office.  As a Senior Data Analyst, you will work at and across Ahold Delhaize where approximately 370,000 employees worldwide serve over 50 million customers a week. Locally, you’ll be working with 1,500 colleagues in Zaandam, the Netherlands. We improve and innovate every day, supporting our trusted local brands and reinforcing our role as a leader in retail and e-commerce.  Everything you do with your colleagues is directly visible in our internal departments. You will be joining the newly formed Data Science & Analytics team. In this team we deliver scalable data products and building bridges between the different data science & analytics teams from our brands. Themes we are working on are loyalty, personalization, merchandising, eCommerce and self-service analytics.  Normally, we work from our bustling head office in Zaandam. However, due to the current situation, all employees are working from home. We hope to be able to return to Zaandam together soon.  What do we offer?  At Ahold Delhaize, we aim to grow, and that’s only possible if you grow with us. That’s why you get access to best-in-class guidance and inspiring training to shape your development and career. As we work together to build on our brand and your career, you can count on (based on 40 hours per week): A competitive salary Flexible working hours and the possibility to work from home when schedule permits An excellent pension plan with a personal contribution of 5.3% A travel allowance for traveling to and from Zaandam 20 vacation days A budget choice in which you can decide whether you spend it on extra days (+12,5 days), discounts or pay-outs A bonus on top of your salary Attractive discounts on various insurance policies A laptop and telephone 10% discount on your grocery shopping in our Albert Heijn stores, up to € 300 per year Requirements  At Ahold Delhaize, you'll be working for one of the world's biggest retailers, and we know you are bursting with the ambition to keep up with us. You supplement this ambition with: A Master in Engineering, Data Science, Econometrics, Computer Science, Analytics or other relevant studies. If no relevant study, demonstrably relevant experience and interest. At least 5 years of experience as Data Scientist or Advanced analyst. A pragmatic mindset; you prefer getting things done above a perfect model or analysis. Experience with data science in a business setting, preferably within eCommerce; you can build and test (small) models. Advanced experience in Python or other programming language and SQL Experience in leading a project or team and work together with various stakeholders. You are based in The Netherlands.  Apply. Seeing is believing. This is true in our stores, as well as in our head office. It could be your new (home)workplace, where you, as Senior Data Analyst have influence over the most renowned global retail markets. In order to apply for this role, we request an updated resume (preferably in pdf). In addition, we would like to ask you not to send a standard motivation letter, but to formulate an answer to the following questions:  Why would you like to work for Ahold Delhaize? Why do you think you will be successful in this position and what kind of technical skills do you bring with you for this role? What is one of your personal strengths and one skill you wish to improve or develop? Last but not least: what are your salary expectations?  Want to learn more first, before you apply to this position? We are happy to tell you everything about this vacancy. Therefore you can contact Caroline Fluit, hiring manager via caroline.fluit@aholddelhaize.com or Micha Lekawael, Talent Acquisition Partner via micha.lekawael@ah.nl  Master Senior Data-science NLD-Zaandam, Provincialeweg 11 You will work at

title: Covid-19 Specialist Supervisor
summary:
Focused on the protection of employee safety and maintaining privacy in employee data.
This role supports the management of case trends across Stryker sites…
description: Position Summary This role supports the management of case trends across Stryker sites including trending reports, potential training needs, communication with stakeholders and reviewing of escalated issues from Covid –19 Case Reviewers. Provides support to tier 1 reviewers and LIRTs on escalated cases. Serves as an expert in our personal exposure and response guidance and IRT process execution. Focused on the protection of employee safety and maintaining privacy in employee data. Supervises Covid Case Reviewers. Essential Duties & Responsibilities Meets daily with team/ Covid-19 team to review incident trends across sites Communication and direct interaction with employees and customers Confirmed positive phone calls Employee business travel and case management Support case reviewers with incident questions, protocol clarification, escalation, deep-dive related discussions Partnership with Medical team on escalated cases and response / quarantine guidance evolution Contribute to weekly LIRT communications: including email and content preparation Connection point with key stakeholders (Sites/ HR Operations and HRBP’s) Facilitate formal and adhoc trainings for LIRTs and Covid-19 team member(s) Function as a key contact for questions/concerns from HR leaders and LIRTs Analyze trends from the deep dive and site discovery discussions and provide exec summaries to SLT. Provide input to Covid –19 guidance in collaboration with SMEs and key stakeholders Alert to any potential HR or EHS policy changes that need to be made based on information coming out of the Covid –19 team Support the COVID Process Analyst on process change feedback and requirements Contribute to the Confluence knowledge base content People management; supervise a team of COVID case reviewers and provide support for incident overflow in the case of team capacity constraints or vacation coverage needs Education & Special Trainings Bachelor's degree, in any discipline Problem solver with creative approach to proactive identification and resolution of issues Execution-oriented, self-starter and self-navigator who can prioritize high-value projects versus tasks in a fast-paced environment and balance demands of multiple projects Very responsive, with a customer-centric/solutions-oriented approach and the ability to serve a wide range of needs within the organization and at all levels

title: Data Infrastructure Engineer
summary: Every day you work close with data analysts, data scientists and collaborate and advice how to use the data in the most optimal way.
description: RTL is looking for a Data Infrastructure Engineer / Data Platform Engineer to join the team that provides the foundation for all our intelligence activities. We’re experiencing strong growth and need your help making our vision of infrastructure-at-scale a reality. RTL collects a wide range of data (for example, video views, navigation clicks, social media data, subtitles, weather data et cetera), and there are many different end users of the data. Your role The data are stored in our cloud-based data platform. We process high volumes of data in both streaming and batch fashion. The Data Engineer at RTL is responsible for creating, maintaining and innovating the underlying infrastructure of the data platform as well as implementing pipelines that will handle all the information that needs to be processed. They troubleshoot and identify. Even more importantly they write software to detect and even mitigate the same problem early the next time around. Every day you work close with data analysts, data scientists and collaborate and advice how to use the data in the most optimal way. As an example, together with the data science team you bring all kinds of algorithms, like recommendations for RTL Nieuws or Videoland, into production. This is where you’ll be working You will be part of the Data Platform team within the Technology business unit of RTL Nederland - reporting to the Head of Data Technology. The media industry is changing rapidly. People watch content more and more on demand - what, when and where they like it. The use of online video services such as Netflix and Videoland are growing in popularity. At RTL Nederland, the largest commercial media and entertainment company in the Netherlands, the role of intelligence increases. There is a wide variety of use cases like customer segmentation, churn prediction, recommendations, forecasting, price optimization, video analyses and many more. The Data Platform team consists of engineers with top talents from all around the world. The team builds data science products that are creating business value for RTL and explores new data-driven innovations. Interested? At RTL there is plenty of room for individual initiative and personal responsibility in a challenging and changing environment. In addition, RTL has extensive secondary benefits such as retirement, career development and profit sharing elements. Responsibilities Data has a bright future at RTL. Together with your team you develop a truly scalable platform for any type of data that is used within RTL. To do this, your stack includes Kafka, Kubernetes, Terraform, Docker and AWS/Azure Within the team you are responsible for: Creating, maintaining and innovating the underlying infrastructure of the data platform. Helping making our vision of infrastructure-at-scale a reality; Explore root causes for incidents / investigate and diving deep into issues to determine major contributing factors and apply fixes; Pro-active in start building and maintaining several infrastructure components, sometimes using new technology / come forward and start new initiatives, together with colleagues inside and outside the team / drive innovations and steer on value creation; Working with internal stakeholders to ensure that we have the right infrastructure to address our current needs and future wants; capacity planning for both short and long-term growth; Support internal stakeholders using the services in their day to day tasks / intake and process requirements from key stakeholders and push back on their requirements, if needed / provide training to end users and presentations to key stakeholders; Support end users (data scientists, data analysts) with the usage of the data platform with Q&A sessions, trainings, workshops and presentations. Qualifications Thorough understanding of GitOps and troubleshooting Thorough understanding of Kubernetes and Docker Experience with cloud environments, eg AWS or Azure Experience developing API’s (Golang preferred) Experience in using Terraform or similar tools "Writing software is fun, but then working on how to setup continuous integration, deployment and scalability for this software is even more fun! Nothing is more satisfying than when you push new code onto GitHub and then everything is taken care of automagically. Working on these engineering challenges with up-to-date open-source tools ensures that every day is challenging, fun and educational. Also it's cool that if you created something useful, at RTL you're encouraged to open-source it and share it with the world ”! Niels ten Boom (data engineer RTL).

title: Junior Consultant Forensic Technology
summary:
Forensische Data Analyse: als data analist detecteer je incidenten door het analyseren van financiële en administratieve data.
Duiken in data en techniek.
description: Cybercrime, witwaspraktijken en terrorismefinanciering: als consultant maak jij onderdeel uit van hét CSI-team op het gebied van fraude. Wil je samen met collega's verdachte zaken tot in de puntjes uitzoeken? Ben je analytisch en nieuwschierig van aard? Dan is dit de juiste functie voor jou. Jouw uitdagingen Hoe kan men fraude plegen binnen een organisatie? Hoe haal je verdachte transacties uit de data? Hoe identificeer je relevante e-mailcommunicatie? Hoe bepaal je de aanwezigheid van malware? Kortom, hoe krijg je de onderste steen boven? Dit neem jij mee 0-3 jaar werkervaring MSc. in bijv. Computer Science, AI of andere technische richting Affiniteit met fraude, cybercrime en witwassen Een analytische, kritische en nieuwschierige blik Programmeer skills Een absolute teamplayer Wat ga jij doen als Junior Consultant Forensic Technology? Als consultant geef jij klanten uit diverse sectoren inzicht in frauderisico's en help je mogelijke incidenten op het gebied van fraude, witwassen en cyber te detecteren. Daarnaast kun je je bezighouden met het ontwikkelen van nieuwe tools en/of data-gedreven oplossingen die hierbij kunnen worden ingezet. "Als je van puzzelen houdt, dan ben je bij Forensic Technology op de juiste plek." Afhankelijk van je achtergrond zul je actief zijn in één of meer van de volgende vakgebieden: Cyber Incident Response: als cyber specialist onderzoek je cyber incidenten en help je bedrijven zo goed mogelijk te reageren; Witwasbestrijding: jij richt je op de preventie en detectie van witwaspraktijken; Forensische Data Analyse: als data analist detecteer je incidenten door het analyseren van financiële en administratieve data.  Meer weten over onze Forensic Technology afdeling? Lees dan dit artikel: https://www.werkenbijkpmg.nl/verhaal/als-je-van-puzzelen-houdt-ben-je-bij-forensic-technology-op-de-goede-plek Dit bieden wij Een marktconform salaris 30 vakantiedagen Een leaseauto of mobiliteitsbudget Een laptop en Iphone die je ook privé kunt gebruiken Een premievrij pensioen Korting op sporten en verzekeringen Veel trainings- en opleidingsmogelijkheden Duiken in data en techniek 60% Je social skills inzetten en verder ontwikkelen 30% Meewerken aan de toekomst van Forensic Technology 10% Training on the job Training courses Coaching

title: Data Scientist Insights - Customer Insights
summary:
The Customer Insights department is looking for data savvy professionals to join our team of data scientists.
At Booking.com, data drives our decisions.
description: At Booking.com, data drives our decisions. Technology is at our core. And innovation is everywhere. But our company is more than datasets, lines of code or A/B tests. We’re the thrill of the first night in a new place. The excitement of the next morning. The friends you make. The journeys you take. The sights you see. And the food you sample. Through our products, partners and people, we make it easier for everyone to experience the world. The Customer Insights department is looking for data savvy professionals to join our team of data scientists. You will have the opportunity to build data products that will be used across various departments of our business to help us predict and understand our customers’ behaviour, enabling us to offer them the most relevant personalised experience. The NITS team (No-Intent-To-Stay) works on our machine learning models that predict the probability of a cancellation. As a Data Scientist Insights in the NITS team, you’ll have the chance to work with one of the most established and widely used ML models at Booking.com and play an integral role in taking it to the next level! You’ll have the chance to collaborate closely with other Analysts, Developers, Product Managers and various business stakeholders and take full ownership of your work - from the initial idea generation phase to the implementation of the final product. You will thrive at Booking.com if you are result-focused, innovative, and with a solid quantitative background, but most of all by understanding our complex business model and the logic behind it. B.RESPONSIBLE Utilize ML and other statistical techniques, to continuously generate insights related to the performance of the model and advise the team on potential improvements. Generate cancellation related insights to influence the model development. Communicate regularly with the model’s stakeholders and assist with answering their questions. Develop insightful metrics, dashboards, reports. Continuously evolve your craft by keeping up to date with the latest developments. Actively contribute to the Data Science Insights craft at Booking.com through training, exploration of new technologies, interviewing, onboarding and mentoring colleagues. B.SKILLED At least 2 years of relevant work experience. Masters, PhD, or equivalent experience in a quantitative field (Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Artificial Intelligence, etc.) Fluency in at least one programming language, with a strong preference for Python. Strong working knowledge of Spark and SQL. Strong knowledge of reporting/visualization techniques (e.g., Tableau, Graphite, Power BI, etc.) Excellent English communication skills, both written and verbal; the ability to convey your message to team members and other stakeholders. Good understanding of fundamental machine learning concepts. Experience with forecasting techniques is a plus. Team player with strong interpersonal skills. Solution oriented and result driven. Excellent organizational skills, attention to detail and analytical reasoning. What’s in it for you? The DSI role is open to worldwide candidates. We provide assistance for you and your family with a generous relocation package, ensuring a smooth transition to working and living in Amsterdam. We have successfully relocated 300+ technology professionals to Amsterdam in the last year. Headquarters located in one of the most vibrant cities in Europe: Amsterdam Performance-based company that offers 29 vacation days, career advancement, and lucrative compensation, including bonuses and stock potential Discount on Booking.com accommodations with the “Booking Deal” including other perks and benefits Company-sponsored family and social activities to help our employees become integrated with each other and Dutch culture Diverse, unique colleagues from every corner of the world Booking.com is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. We strive to move well beyond traditional equal opportunity and work to create an environment that allows everyone to thrive.

title: Contractmanager Inkoop Jeugdhulp
summary: Het samenwerken met onze data analist en onze backoffice om te zorgen voor integrale samenwerking en informatievoorziening.
description: Ben jij als contractmanager inkoop jeugdhulp een uitstekende netwerker met een hoog verbindend vermogen? Ben jij in staat om naast een controlerende functie actief mee te denken hoe de zorg op een goede manier kan worden vormgegeven! Dan zoeken wij jou! Als contractmanager inkoop jeugdhulp word jij ingezet bij complexe vraagstukken en ben je eerste aanspreekpunt en sparringpartner op het gebied van hoog specialistische jeugdhulp voor onze jeugdhulppartners. Je denkt actief mee met onze contractpartners om het beste uit de jeugdhulp te halen voor onze inwoners.  Wij werken samen met verschillende aanbieders en andere instellingen die jeugd- en opvoedhulp bieden / ondersteunen. Je bent hét aanspreekpunt voor de externe afstemming met jeugdhulppartners en monitort de ontwikkelingen in het jeugdhulpdomein. Waar nodig stuur je op gewenste veranderingen in de werkwijze van de aanbieders of doe je verbetervoorstellen ten aanzien van de werkwijzen. En dat is nog niet alles, want als contractmanager ben je ook druk met: Het controleren van de kwaliteit van de geleverde diensten; Het zorgen voor een efficiënt verloop van contractprocessen; Inhoudelijke besprekingen met jeugdhulppartners. Op de hoogte zijn wat er speelt binnen het sociaal domein; Het leveren van een bijdrage aan het nieuwe inkoopkader 2022 en input voor periodieke wijzigingen op het open-house model; Het samen met gemeenten ontwikkelen van contractbeheer 3.0; Het samenwerken met onze data analist en onze backoffice om te zorgen voor integrale samenwerking en informatievoorziening. Een fulltime functie voor 36 uur (in overleg is ook minder uur bespreekbaar) per week waarin je het verschil kan maken voor onze jeugd. Je start met een jaarcontract, dat bij goed functioneren wordt omgezet in een arbeidsovereenkomst voor onbepaalde tijd. Formeel krijg je bij ons de functienaam Adviseur Contracten.  Het salaris is afhankelijk van je opleiding, kennis en ervaring en bedraagt maximaal € 4.494,- bruto per maand (schaal 10) op basis van een 36-urige werkweek. Voor een zeer ervaren collega is een arbeidsmarkttoelage bespreekbaar.  Jij krijgt bij ons uitstekende arbeidsvoorwaarden op het gebied van reiskosten, flexibele werktijden, verlofregelingen, pensioen en studiefaciliteiten. Daarnaast beschik je als medewerker over een Individueel Keuze Budget van 17,05% van je bruto jaarsalaris. Je maakt onderdeel uit van het team Beleid & Inkoop. Binnen het team, dat geleid wordt door de manager Beleid & inkoop, zijn ca. 12 personen werkzaam. Een deel van het team heeft als aandachtsgebied het adviseren van gemeenten en maakt samen met verschillende partners beleid en geeft bijvoorbeeld leiding aan projecten het ander deel houdt zich voornamelijk bezig met inkoop/contractbeheer. Overlap komt echter steeds vaker voor.  Wie zijn wij? De regio Zuid-Holland Zuid heeft gekozen voor een kleine, flexibele en hooggekwalificeerde regieorganisatie. De opdracht van deze regieorganisatie is het in goede banen leiden van en sturen op de transformatie van de jeugdhulp terwijl de kwaliteit en de continuïteit van de zorg gewaarborgd blijven. De kernwaarden van de organisatie zijn zakelijkheid, aanspreekbaarheid, resultaatgerichtheid en transparantie. De organisatie wordt geleid door een eindverantwoordelijk directeur die samen met het MT de koers van het SOJ bepaald.  Waar staan wij voor? De Serviceorganisatie Jeugd ZHZ is een netwerkorganisatie die sinds 1 januari 2015 operationeel is. De Serviceorganisatie maakt onderdeel uit van de Gemeenschappelijke regeling Dienst Gezondheid & Jeugd (GR DG&J) en voert in opdracht van de 10 aangesloten gemeenten in de regio Zuid-Holland Zuid de volgende kerntaken uit: de inkoop van jeugdhulp, contractvorming en bewaking van de kwaliteit en kosten van de zorg; ondersteuning van de jeugdteams en andere partijen door de inkoop van zorgvormen, budgetbewaking en informatievoorziening; beleidsmatig uitwerken en sturen op de uitvoeringsprogramma's en het faciliteren van de stuurgroep Jeugd en het AB en DB van de DG&J; accountmanagement welke zorg draagt voor de verbinding tussen de Serviceorganisatie, de Stichting Jeugdteams en de gemeenten. Een gezonde dosis empathisch vermogen, luisterend vermogen en een scherpe, kritische blik, waarbij je in staat bent om op een open innovatieve manier naar ontwikkelingen te kijken. Je bent stressbestendig en blijft ook onder tijdsdruk goed presteren, waarbij kwaliteit en flexibiliteit hoog in jouw vaandel staan!  Daarnaast beschik jij bij voorkeur over: Hbo werk- en denkniveau; Aantoonbare ervaring in een soortgelijke functie, aangevuld met de kennis van (hoog)specialistische jeugdhulp. Enthousiast geworden, solliciteer direct via de sollicitatiebutton. Voor inhoudelijke informatie over de functie kun je contact opnemen met Guus Krähe, manager Beleid & Inkoop, via telefoonnummer 078-770 2352 (secretariaat).  Acquisitie stellen wij niet op prijs.

title: Product Analyst ll, Payments
summary:
Data Analyst, or other type of data analysis-focused functions.
Ability and experience in extracting insights from data, and summarizing learnings / takeaways.
description: About the Role We are looking for a Product Analyst to join our Money Data Science & Product Analytics team, and make significant contributions to our mission to streamline and optimize Uber's payment experience(s). You will shape the direction of Uber's payment experience by analyzing vast quantities of data to gather insights, identify opportunities, and ultimately prioritize product and engineering initiatives. In this role, you will work closely with senior leaders in Product, Data Science, Engineering, and Operations on fast-moving, high-stakes problems. A deep analytical passion and the ability to execute on key business priorities is a must for this role. Who you are 5+ years experience as a Data Scientist, Product Analyst, Sr. Data Analyst, or other type of data analysis-focused functions. M.S. or Bachelors degree in Math, Economics, Bioinformatics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, or other quantitative fields. Advanced SQL expertise Basic understanding of experimental design (such as A/B experiments) and statistical methods Ability and experience in extracting insights from data, and summarizing learnings / takeaways Experience with Excel and some dashboarding/data visualization (i.e. Tableau, Mixpanel, Looker, or similar) Bonus if you have Ability to build effective visualizations to communicate data to key decision-makers. Ability to learn and adapt to new methodologies for data collection and analysis. Ability to deliver on tight timelines and prioritize tasks while maintaining quality and detail. Ability to work in a self-guided manner. Superb communication and organization skills. Prior experience within the payments industry is strongly desirable.

title: Market Intelligence Manager
summary:
A market analist supports you in this role and you will report to the Vice President Marketing.
You will work in a professional Marketing team where your market…
description: Are you both a market research passionate and a strategist with serious analytical and statistical skills who can drive change? What are you going to do? The Market Intelligence Manager(MIM) is responsible for building and deepening an integral view of our business through both internal and external quantitative and qualitative market research and data analysis, in order to deliver insightful and actionable marketing strategies. You ask the right questions, know where to seek the answers, and revel in making the complex simple and actionable.  The role of MIM is to understand Enza Zaden’s global markets by analyzing its dynamics and advise the Marketing & Sales leadership team how to optimize EZ’s value creation through strategies and tactics.  You are responsible to gather information and data in a structural and systematic way and make or facilitate regular reports on Enza (global) market position, (crop and segment) market trends and competitor scans. In this position you stand in the center of all our strategic marketing initiatives. The availability and use of up to date information on target markets will build a bridge between R&D, Portfolio Management, Marketing Management, Innovation Management and Sales.  Market research is a critical component of the start of a new product. As a seed company we want to satisfy any unmet needs of our customers (producing top vegetables) and their end consumers (eating and enjoying). For new product development you wil conduct as a preliminary step (online) surveys, product testing, and focus groups with customers and end users. This requires both an analytical and creative mind.  You will support global, regional and local marketing and sales teams by gathering information that focuses on food industry & consumer insights, analyzing industry data, consumer and market trends. You transfer these findings and opportunities in ways that can be easily disseminated throughout the business for use by sales, marketing, breeding research and management decisions.  You will serve as ‘change agent’ and be one of the advocates of further professionalizing market research practices. One of your key tasks is to design and carry out marketing surveys to define target markets and determine existing and future trends.  Establishing a network in the seed industry and with market research companies will also play an essential role in growing our business and creating new strategic market activities.  The team You will work in a professional Marketing team where your market intelligence helps them to turn data into actionable insights that drive tangible outcomes, improve performance and help Enza Zaden lead the market. A market analist supports you in this role and you will report to the Vice President Marketing. Your power We are looking for a marketing professional who knows how to translate in-house collected market data and third-party company surveys to market intelligence in order to drive business optimization. That demands an impact-driven, business-minded, pro-active candidate with strong analytical capabilities. You have excellent and clear communication skills in English. You are creative, accurate and have an eye for detail. Furthermore you are a team player with a positive attitude and global mindset. You stay on top of the latest market developments in the seed business and are able to transfer this knowledge to your colleques. You look for the best possible way to achieve goals and are able to connect and collaborate effectively with both internal and external parties.  You live in Holland or are willing to move there and are willing to travel frequently.  In short, you; Have a Master degree in Marketing Analytics or Business Information. Have at least 10-12 years working experience in a similar position. Are an outstanding analytical and conceptual thinker. Are a analytics translator. Have a strong attention to detail. Our power Enza Zaden is a vegetable breeding company that develops vegetable varieties. We produce and sell the seeds of these varieties all over the world. Both for conventional and organic growers. In order to explain this properly (and as briefly as possible) we have made an animation.  For more than 80 years we are working with the best that nature offers. We support this with state-of-the-art technologies to speed up our breeding process. That is really necessary, because currently the development of a new vegetable variety takes up 6 to 10 years.  The results? Strong, healthy, tasty and climate-proof vegetable varieties with higher yield per square meter and less need of crop protection products or fertilizer.  Our strength? More than 2300 passionate colleagues worldwide working together on the vegetables of tomorrow. Therefore, we continuously invest in knowledge and skills with our Enza Academy and under the flag of enzActive we organise various sports activities to stay healthy. Contact Please, send your application to our HR department, via the button below.  More information: Martine Rook, Corporate Recruiter, +31 655220474 or e-mail; m.rook-wijnker@enzazaden.nl

title: BUSINESS ANALYST
summary:
Ontwerpen en opstellen van rapportages op het gebied van data-analyse;
Als Business Analyst heb je een passie voor het vertalen van data naar inzichten door…
description: De boodschappen in de supermarkt. Modeartikelen in kledingzaken. Een biertje op het terras. We vinden het heel normaal dat dit soort producten altijd en overal verkrijgbaar zijn. Maar iemand moet er natuurlijk wél voor zorgen. Als medewerker van Nabuurs lever jij hier een belangrijke bijdrage aan. Nabuurs is een familiebedrijf in logistieke dienstverlening. Wij ontwikkelen en implementeren innovatieve supply chain concepten voor FMCG (fast moving consumer goods) binnen de branches food, retail en horeca. Met onze winnaarsmentaliteit en wendbare logistieke operatie verrassen wij onze klanten elke dag weer. Binnen onze organisatie werken een kleine 1.000 enthousiaste en klantgerichte mensen. Voor onze Finance Afdeling in Haps zijn we op zoek naar een collega met teamspirit die zich goed staande weet te houden in een dynamische omgeving. Inhoud van jouw job Als Business Analyst heb je een passie voor het vertalen van data naar inzichten door middel van visuele rapportage. Vanuit je begrip van zowel financiële als business drijfveren ontwerp je dashboards die belangrijke besluitvorming ondersteunen en bent constant op zoek naar verbeterpotentieel. Je overlegt en werkt samen met de diverse business units, IT afdeling en Key-users. Je rapporteert in deze functie aan de Senior Business Controller. Het actief vertalen van rapportageverzoeken naar bruikbare dashboards die belangrijke besluitvorming en KPI-monitoring ondersteunen; Ontwerpen en opstellen van rapportages op het gebied van data-analyse; Analyseren en rapporteren van afwijkingen; Uitvoeren van bedrijfseconomische analyses; Onderkennen van kansen voor verbetering door een actief oog te houden op toekomstige eisen en de ontwikkeling van ons rapportagelandschap; Proactief communiceren tijdens ontwerp en ontwikkeling van dashboards met de diverse stakeholders; Het rapportagelandschap optimaal en opgeschoond houden; Functionele ondersteuning bieden aan de business bij het ontwikkelen van dashboards; Het continue initiëren, uitwerken en implementeren van verbetervoorstellen/proces optimalisaties; Deelnemen aan projecten; Projecten (mede) voorbereiden en zorgdragen voor rapportages m.b.t kosten en ROI; Ondersteuning bieden bij tenderprocessen en de bepaling van klant KPI’s; Periodiek verzorgen van nacalculaties van de orderportefeuille. Jouw specificaties HBO werk- en denkniveau (Logistiek, Business Administration, (Technische) Bedrijfskunde of vergelijkbaar); Minimaal 3 jaar werkervaring in een vergelijkbare functie in een logistieke omgeving; Goede kennis van PowerBI is een pré; Goede communicatieve vaardigheden in combinatie met goede presentatie skills zijn een must; Je communiceert accuraat en helder (NL en Eng); Uitstekende kennis van MS Office (met name Excel); Je gaat graag oplossingsgericht te werk en bent een echte teamplayer; Je bent proactief en neemt initiatief; Je beschikt over een groot analytisch vermogen; Een VOG kan onderdeel uitmaken van deze procedure. Wat mag je van ons verwachten? Goed salaris en aantrekkelijke secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden; Veel ruimte voor eigen initiatief binnen een platte organisatie; Je maakt deel uit van een betrokken en professioneel team waarbinnen je ruimte krijgt voor persoonlijke en inhoudelijke ontwikkeling; Werken bij een van de grootste familiebedrijven in de logistieke dienstverlening. Verder met Nabuurs Naast carrièreperspectief en werk waar je voldoening en waardering uit kunt halen, geven we je ook graag de tijd en ruimte voor wat er verder belangrijk is in jouw leven. In de vorm van een goed salaris en aantrekkelijke secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden. Maar bijvoorbeeld ook door je volop kansen te bieden om je persoonlijk te ontwikkelen via bijvoorbeeld ons uitgebreid E-Learning aanbod. Lees meer op www.nabuurs.nl/werken-bij. Solliciteren Solliciteren kun je middels de button solliciteren onderaan de vacaturetekst. Meer weten over deze functie? Neem contact op met Richard Renkens (Senior Business Controller): +31 6 82473185.

title: Analyst Continuous Service Improvement
summary:
Collects data to identify root cause of problems.
Develops metrics that provide data for process measurement, identifying indicators for future improvement…
description: In a constantly changing world, we work together with our people, clients and communities to enable them to fulfill their potential to do great things. We believe that by bringing everyone together, we can solve problems using innovative technology that can create a world that is sustainable and secure. At NTT, we encourage you to remain continuously curious, as that is what keeps you fast, flexible and relevant. No two days will be the same but that is what will help you grow and realize your full potential. The power is in your hands to do great things. It’s time to lead the change, be the authentic you, to solve difficult challenges, to set the pace of change and to unleash your potential. Want to be a part of our team? Plans, performs and implements process improvement initiatives (such as Lean or Six Sigma). Diagrams and evaluates existing processes. Organizes, leads and facilitates cross-functional project teams. Develops metrics that provide data for process measurement, identifying indicators for future improvement opportunities. Collects data to identify root cause of problems. Measures performance against process requirements. Aligns improvement to performance shortfalls. Provides consultation on the use of re-engineering techniques to improve process performance and product quality. May deliver presentations and training courses including measurement, analysis, improvement and control. Surveys and analyzes best practices for techniques and processes. Communicates team progress. Performs cost and benefit analyses. Working at NTT What will make you a good fit for the role? Standard career level descriptor for job level: Seasoned and experienced professional Has full understanding of specialisation area Resolves wide range of issues in creative ways Fully qualified, career level, career journey-orientated Uses good judgement in selecting tools and methods to solve problems Networks with senior internal and external people in own area of expertise Receives little instruction on day-to-day work, receives general instructions on new assignments Typically requires demonstrable related experience with a Bachelor’s or equivalent degree; or moderate level experience and a Master’s or equivalent degree; or a PhD or equivalent degree without experience; or equivalent work experience Join our growing global team and accelerate your career with us. Apply today. Equal opportunity employer NTT is proud to be an equal opportunity employer with a global culture that embraces diversity. We are committed to providing an environment free of unfair discrimination and harassment. We do not discriminate based on age, race, color, sex, religion, national origin, disability, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, veteran status, or other protected category.

title: Senior Data Analyst
summary: The perfect candidates need to have a background of quantitative/technical approaches, experience working with large data sets, and confidence of data-driven…
description: Data Science - Netherlands - D7 Didi Chuxing (“DiDi”) is the world’s leading mobile transportation and convenience platform. The company offers a full range of app-based transportation and life services for over 550 million users across Asia, Latin America, Australia, and Russia, including Taxi, Express, Premier, Luxe, Bus, Designated Driving, Enterprise Solutions, Bike Sharing, E-bike Sharing, Automobile Solutions, Food Delivery, and Payment. Tens of millions of drivers who find flexible work opportunities on the DiDi platform provide over 10 billion passenger trips a year. DiDi is committed to collaborating with policymakers, the taxi industry, the automobile industry, and communities to solve the world’s transportation, and environmental, and employment challenges with localized smart transportation innovations by leveraging its AI capabilities. By continuously improving user experience and creating social value, DiDi strives to build a safe, inclusive, and sustainable mobile transportation and convenience ecosystem for cities of the future. DiDi uses technology to improve mobility in our world. As such, we always look for people from every background who want to support our vision, through equal opportunity and nondiscriminatory, fair and impartial treatment, completely free of prejudice related to race, nationality, religion, gender, ethnicity, age, political affiliation, sexual preference, marital status, disabilities or family responsibilities. For more information, please visit: www.didiglobal.com/news  Why this role At DiDi, we value data-driven mindset in decision making. And it is extremely important when it comes to market expansions as we need to make sure key business aspects can be quantified and improved on in a fast iterative manner.  As Senior Data Analyst, you will work seamlessly with local team in Europe as well as operation/product management/R&D experts in Headquarter to turn your insights into real products and operational decision on a regular basis. This experience will equip an analytical mind with a priceless entrepreneurship which will grow you into an expert of a much wider span of domains. In long term, a data analyst will evolve into either a more senior expert in analytical track or a professional in other tracks because of the entrepreneurship derived from global expansion.  The perfect candidates need to have a background of quantitative/technical approaches, experience working with large data sets, and confidence of data-driven decision making. The role will be located in Europe and need to communicate quite often with Beijing headquarter.  Responsibilities Define key metrics to measure success; refine as business evolves. Conceptualize, create, and maintain dashboards to reveal operational efficiency and decision quality. Design and evaluate experiments on key product change, dive deep into root cause of metric mover. Build models to identify patterns of business trajectory, improve understanding on user behavior, business ecosystem and long-term trends. Explore opportunity and optimize operational strategies regarding user growth and marketplace improvement. Investigate root causes of certain decisioning errors or inefficiencies, create mitigation proposals and work with product teams, engineering, and operations to execute the changes. Communicate with various teams, demonstrate leadership to drive influential decisions.  Requirements 2+ years experience with quantitative analysis. BA/BS in Engineering, Math, Statistics or other technical field. Advanced degrees preferred. Experience in SQL or distributed computing (Hive/Hadoop). Experience with analysis tools such as R, Python is a plus. Ability to initiate and drive projects to completion with minimal guidance. Ability to communicate the results of analyses in a clear and effective manner. Basic understanding of statistical analysis. Speaks fluent English. Basic/Fluent Chinese is a plus but not required.

title: Media Analyst with Japanese and English - remote work
summary:
 Experience in using MS Excel data tools (working with large data sets, using filters and pivot tables).
 Best performing analysts are offered a Multisport…
description: Opis stanowiska Whether you’re looking for a job with flexible working hours, you want something with more variety, or you’re just really interested in pursuing a passion you haven’t been able to utilise in your current role – freelancing is a great way to break out of the 9-5 and go it alone. The purpose of the role is to carry out analysis of English, as well as Japanese press articles and social media coverage. The company also process content in other languages, and therefore speaking other foreign languages will be seen as an advantage. Media analyst’s job is to read press articles or social media posts, pick up relevant information from it, and record it in a strictly formatted manner.    Wymagania na stanowisko  Japanese and English at C1 level (min advanced)  Most projects do not require work over weekends, but you are free to work weekends if you choose to do so  Experience in using MS Excel data tools (working with large data sets, using filters and pivot tables)  Working Windows PC with MS Office 2010 or newer and a stable internet connection fast enough for stable video conferencing  Ability to stay connected and communicate efficiently across multiple online platforms (emails, Microsoft Teams, OneDrive, Google Docs)  Ability to plan own work independently to meet deadlines    Oferujemy  The basic contract is a zero -hours contract, “umowa o dzieło” under Polish law, the zero-hours contract can be a B2B (via “indywidualna działalność gospodarcza” in Poland) but is not required  You can choose when you want to work  100% remote, flexible hours  Full, comprehensive paid training in the role of Media Analyst  Comfortable, modern co-working space in Poznań  Best performing analysts are offered a Multisport card  Effortless recruitment process by phone/skype  The salary is based on amount of work completed (please note that this is just estimate: from 28.07zł to 54.10zł per hour, with average 5 articles per hour)  Weekly online language classes (English, German and Spanish)  Free access to therapy (up to 20 therapy sessions a year)  We particularly welcome applications from candidates from disadvantaged backgrounds If you feel you would be an ideal candidate for this position and wish to join our client’s expanding team, then we want to hear from you! The recruitment process will involve a submission of a CV and a covering letter explaining in English: your suitability for the role and reasons for expressing interest in remote work Please send your cv with covering letter to: sylwia.ottka@myworknet.pl

title: Data Engineer
summary: You will work closely with our software engineers, infrastructure engineers, data analysts, data scientists, and even other data engineers on data projects and…
description: We are looking for a dynamic Data Engineer to join our growing team of infrastructure engineers and domain experts at Movares. As one of the data engineers, you will be responsible for expanding and optimizing our data and data pipeline architecture. You responsibilities will include wrangling data from Dutch infrastructure giants, IoT systems, and our internal teams and optimize their flow, storage, utility and discoverability. You will work closely with our software engineers, infrastructure engineers, data analysts, data scientists, and even other data engineers on data projects and initiatives. You must be self-directed and comfortable supporting the data needs of multiple teams, systems and products. The right candidate will be driven by the prospect of improving and perhaps reengineering our company’s data architecture to support our next generation of products and data initiatives.  Je profiel Experience working with and creating modern data architectures. Proficient in Software Development (Python at least, C# is a plus). Experience with distributed data/computing tools: Map-Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Kafka etc. Experience querying databases and using statistical languages: Python, SQL, etc. Experience with cloud-native development. Experience visualizing/presenting data for stakeholders using: Tableau, PowerBI, Periscope, D3, ggplot, matplotlib, seaborn, etc. Ons aanbod A challenging position for 32-40 hours at a company that focuses on the sustainable future of the Netherlands, corporate responsibility and social innovation The space to find your optimal work / private balance A permanent position Excellent secondary conditions; profit distribution, 2.5% year-end bonus and a good pension scheme (Stichting Pensioenfonds Public Transport) 36.5 vacation days based on full-time employment Owning Movares: through our unique share construction Office in the heart of Utrecht, within walking distance of Utrecht Central Station De afdeling De groep Digitale Transformatie bestaat uit circa 40 collega’s en maakt onderdeel uit van de afdeling Digitale Transformatie en IT. De uitdaging van deze groep is om de engineeringprocessen van Movares zo snel en vergaand mogelijk te automatiseren. De digitale revolutie speelt een cruciale rol in de toekomst van ons ingenieursbureau. We gebruiken steeds meer data om te inventariseren, voorspellen en vraagstukken op te lossen. Handmatige processen worden geautomatiseerd waarbij we gebruikmaken van innovatieve software. Het team is jong, gedreven en inventief. Zo kun je regelmatig deelnemen aan hackathons waarbij complexe problemen getackeld worden. Eigen initiatief en innovatieve ideeën zijn zeer welkom en noodzakelijk om elkaar steeds weer naar een hoger niveau te tillen. Werk je bij een bureau en wil je een kandidaat voorstellen? Bedankt, maar wij werven onze nieuwe collega graag zelf. Mocht dit niet lukken, dan schakelen we met bureaus waar we vaste afspraken mee hebben.

title: Business Analist
summary:
Informatieanalyses, proces-, functie- en data-analyses uit en stelt adviezen op voor vervolgactiviteiten;
Voert pakketselecties uit en brengt aanschafadviezen…
description: 108 - Amsterdam Functie of project omschrijving Analyseert relevante (beleids) ontwikkelingen, wijzigingen in wet- en regelgeving en/of gebruikerswensen en geeft de consequenties aan voor de informatiesystemen. Stelt probleem – analyase, situatie – analyses en definitiestudies op voor nieuwe en voor wijziging van oude informatiesystemen; Voert pakketselecties uit en brengt aanschafadviezen uit binnen de kaders van het technologieplan; Voert informatieanalyse uit op basis van business-cases; Informatieanalyses, proces-, functie- en data-analyses uit en stelt adviezen op voor vervolgactiviteiten; Adviseert over de inrichting van de informatievoorzieningen de mogelijkheden en noodzaak van systeemaanpassingen en aanschaffingen; Analyseert relevanteontwikkelingen op het terrein van ICT-gebieden geeft de mogelijkheden en consequenties daarvan aan voor Dienst Uitvoering Onderwijs; Begeleidt inhoudelijk de verdere ontwikkeling van het informatiesysteem (technisch ontwerp, functioneel ontwerp, bouw, implementatie, documentatie, nazorg enz.); Stelt kosten en baten analyses op. Gevraagde skills en professionele expertise Academisch werk- en denk niveau; Kennis van en ervaring met ontwikkel-, analyse- en testmethoden en technieken; Kennis van organisatie en de bedrijfsprocessen; Kennis van en ervaring met systeemontwikkeling, organisatieontwerp en bedrijfsprocesmodellering; Inzicht hebben in de gebruikerswensen; Kennis van organisatieontwerpen, in het bijzonder van de administratieve organisatie en afhankelijkheid- en kwetsbaarheidsanalyse (A&K) Ervaring met projectmatig werken. Startdatum: Zo spoedig mogelijk Duur: 3 maanden (met optie op verlenging) En wat nu verder! Ben jij geïnteresseerd in de projectvacature van Business Analist? Reageer dan direct met behulp van onderstaand formulier! Wij ontvangen voor de volledigheid graag een recent CV met persoonlijke motivatie, je beschikbaarheid en uurtarief.

title: Compensation Analyst
summary:
Provide guidance, statistical analysis, data modelling, and cost analysis.
At least 2 years of analytical experience; interpreting data and using the…
description: Do you already have some analytical experience in the Compensation & Benefits work field? Ready for the next step? This is an exciting opportunity to be part of a team where you will have the ability to influence the strategy of the combined Just Eat Takeaway Reward Team. Our story (the bitesize version): Since our first order back in 2000, we've grown from an attic start-up to become a food delivery powerhouse. As Just Eat Takeaway, we serve millions of dishes every day with brands across 23 countries. The key ingredient in our success is people. From our innovative tech teams to marketing experts and Reward specialists, we're always looking to attract the best global talent. All about the role: In this role, you will be responsible for identifying, implementing, and maintaining the right compensation structures to support the strategic direction of the business. Reporting into the Reward Manager, a varied position covering BAU compensation activities and project work. Key responsibilities Compensation analysis; assist in the annual cycle and administration for salary and bonus programs, including executive compensation analysis (e.g LTI programs) and sales incentive programs.
