Provide guidance, statistical analysis, data modelling, and cost analysis Assist in benchmark surveys participation, project managing submissions, providing analysis of survey results and insights/recommendations Provide analysis and advice on compensation packages for employees in line with the compensation framework Build and maintain reports and dashboards in Workday to support the team, HR and management requirements. Draft compensation administrative procedures and communication materials Contribute to the development of the compensation strategy Support and provide guidance to the respective HR team and management as needed Deliver knowledge on the market and competitor remuneration and advise accordingly Assist in the planning and implementation of compensation (and wider reward) programs and projects. Can you deliver... Here are the ingredients we need from you: MSc in Business Administration/Law/Economics or equivalent At least 2 years of analytical experience; interpreting data and using the information to inform business options and outcomes. Good understanding of job evaluation, pay structures, bonus plans and related legislation. Experience with benchmarking (Mercer, WTW, Hay and Radford) Strong communicator, with the ability to influence at all levels Demonstrable project management skills Able to hit the ground running Ability to operate in a multinational and fast-moving business environment Experience with Workday Generalist HR experience Experience with sales incentives, share plans, tax, global mobility and benefits What we offer Like the perfect food pairing, your skills and these great rewards belong together: Variety in your work within a young, dynamic and international team and an informal atmosphere A challenging environment that will stimulate you to grow as a professional Responsibility with great opportunity to learn and take ownership Competitive salary and paid travel costs Monthly lunch allowance Full-time basis with 26 holiday days a year Interested in this role? Apply today!

title: Senior Data Scientist Search
summary: You will be working with software engineers, other data scientists, product owners and data/business analysts to optimize every step of the search journey, from…
description: How do you make our customers happy? On a busy day, we process over 4 million customer search queries. This provides us with 4 million opportunities to put a smile on someone’s face. And it means we’re equipped to handle this kind of volume and have a tremendous wealth of data to learn from. So how can we use all of this data to correctly interpret our customers’ needs, and genuinely understand them? Are you ready to apply the potential of data science to improve the search journey? Our customers eagerly await your algorithms! Your responsibilities as Senior Data Scientist Search Search is in a continuous state of evolution. Our catalog is constantly changing, as are our customers and their expectations. So the compelling challenge is to continuously improve our algorithms and models, so they always reflect our customers’ needs and surpass their search expectations! When they start their search journey, we need to assure them we understand their question by providing relevant guidance, products and rankings. First impressions matter. And we only have their search query to work with … As Senior Data Scientist Search, you are in the lead to create and improve machine learning solutions to customer problems. And for maintaining current models and keeping them (and yourself) responsive during peak hours. To be successful, you’ll need experience in Natural Language Processing and/or Information Retrieval, and extensive programming experience in Python, Java or any other language. You will be working closely with colleagues in other disciplines, which challenges the entire team to keep an open mind and approach problems from different perspectives. As our environment is constantly changing, we expect our data scientists to be eager to learn and constantly develop their skills. 3 reasons why this is(n’t) for you Because you have considerable experience in Natural Language Processing, Information Retrieval or other related fields Because you have an affinity for coding Because you like to take a leading role in projects and challenge fellow data scientists in your team Not if you’d rather use the latest techniques to create a cool model than the right tools to create the best model for the job Not if you don’t like to brainstorm, discuss ideas or work together with colleagues from other disciplines Not because when it looks like things might come crashing down, you run and hide Where you’ll work A great data scientist is still just one piece of the Search puzzle. You will be working with software engineers, other data scientists, product owners and data/business analysts to optimize every step of the search journey, from latency to UI elements. The setting is informal, pragmatic and innovative. Our success is based on collaborating as equals, working with each other to solve problems and continuously learning from each other to keep improving Search. You can get far by yourself, and farther still when you team up. What you get cd /benefits-all Attention to you We are continuously focused on innovation and getting better every day. Because we work in a dynamic environment and our organization is growing rapidly, your development will grow together with bol.com. Money and more... Working at bol.com is challenging and therefore you get something in return. Besides salary, you will receive a yearly bonus, holiday allowance, holiday entitlement of 29 days, travel allowance, group insurance and more. A blue and safe landing We warmly welcome our new colleagues, so they feel home as soon as possible. During your onboarding program, we give you all the ins and outs about bol.com!

title: Quantitative Analysts
summary:
Are you our new quantitative analyst?
We know that you have a strong analytical (academic) background and that you love data mining.
description: We know that you have a strong analytical (academic) background and that you love data mining. Of course you have been programming in Java, or is C++ your language?  Guess what, your skills can change the world.  In our case the world of finance. Not only will you design, develop, implement and calibrate new models but actually have impact! To tell you a little bit about our company: What we do effects the life of business owners all over the world. We believe that entrepreneurship is important and that entrepreneurs should be stimulated to do and be known for what they do best. But in order to be successful capital is required. That is no problem for corporates but small and medium enterprises face a lot of difficulties. So we built an amazing platform which stimulates entrepreneurs to do what they do best. The practical tools help them to present their business in a way that financiers understand the risk. But what the models do go way beyond that. The G-20 decided the solution the Trefi platform provides was worth a price, so we received a medal out of the hands of Obama. But we want more. We want to continuously improve our platform. We need your dedication to perform various research activities to discover, develop and document enhanced valuation models. Does stochastic optimisation, clustering algorithms, neural networks and simulation techniques make your heart sing? Are you our new quantitative analyst? Can we stop searching and invite you for a cup of coffee or a beer? Let us know!

title: Associate Sales Operations Analyst
summary: Medscape, a division of WebMD, develops and hosts physician portals and related mobile applications that make it easier for physicians and healthcare…
description: Medscape, a division of WebMD, develops and hosts physician portals and related mobile applications that make it easier for physicians and healthcare professionals to access clinical reference sources, stay abreast of the latest clinical information, learn about new treatment options, earn continuing medical education credits and communicate with peers.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.  Job Description Medscape, a division of WebMD, develops and hosts physician portals and related mobile applications that make it easier for physicians and healthcare professionals to access clinical reference sources, stay abreast of the latest clinical information, learn about new treatment options, earn continuing medical education credits and communicate with peers. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status. Responsibilities: WebMD, the leading health information company, is looking for an Associate Sales Operations Analyst to join our Medscape Education organization to help manage our growing global business. This role is directly responsible for impacting revenue, anticipating risk, and facilitating solutions while working in a fast-paced environment. The successful candidate will be a bright, hardworking individual who demonstrates superb work ethic and reliability and possesses excellent grammar, interpersonal, problem-solving, and prioritization skills. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Project tracking: Communicate daily with sales team to update project status Serve as cross-functional liaison to obtain critical program details and distribute information to the organization Perform data management Communicate daily with the Contract Management team to kick off all contract requests Ensure compliance with internal policies  Qualifications: BA/ BS or equivalent experience required 1-2 years’ professional experience in a sales support role Demonstrate superb work ethic and reliability Possess excellent grammar, interpersonal, and prioritization skills Proficiency when using Google Suite required Preferred  Experience with Salesforce and Workfront preferred

title: Data Analist
summary:
Dan ben jij de data analist die wij zoeken.
Wat zit er voor jou in als data analist bij dit bedrijf?
Voor een online warehouse in de buurt van Utrecht zijn wij…
description: Utrecht Meer details Match criteria Opleidingsniveau HBO WO Data Analist ROPP31308 €2300 - €2600 | 40 uur | Ben jij net klaar met je HBO/WO ICT gerelateerde opleiding en wil jij niets liever dan als data analist aan de slag? Lees dan snel verder! Data Analist - Functie omschrijving Voor een online warehouse in de buurt van Utrecht zijn wij met spoed op zoek naar een data analist. Jouw werkzaamheden bij dit bedrijf: Je ondersteunt in het analyseren en optimaliseren van alle processen en koppelingen die lopen of nog ingericht worden om te komen tot een optimale performance van de applicaties; Je werkt nauw samen met alle betrokkenen binnen Sales, E-commerce, het Central Warehouse, Sales/Sales Support en Customer Service; Je draagt zorg voor het inrichten, beheren en monitoren van de diverse koppelingen (EDI, webservices e.d.); Je doet kennis op om toekomstig ook een rol te spelen in het beheer van de applicaties binnen de organisatie; Tot slot ben je in staat om verbeterprojecten te initiëren, uit te voeren en te implementeren. Data Analist - Bedrijfsprofiel Het betreft een online warehouse. Het bedrijf heeft een vestiging in de buurt van Utrecht en in Duitsland. Tot de klantenkring behoren zowel de particulieren als de grote winkelketens (denk aan de Bijenkorf en de Hema). Om deze klanten beter van dienst te zijn is er naast de ontwikkeling van de producten ook hard gewerkt om de IT architecturen aan te passen aan de veranderende markt. In de afgelopen jaren is er sterk geïnvesteerd in het applicatie landschap. Zo is er onder andere een nieuw ERP, WMS, BI, Webshops, PDM en een PIM gekomen. Dit tezamen met de implementatie van een Enterprise Service Bus oplossing geeft ze de mogelijkheid om ook met het gebruik van systemen een nauwere band met de klant te creëren. Om dit proces nog efficiënter in te richten zijn ze nu op zoek naar uitbreiding van het team. Samen met twee andere collega's ben je verantwoordelijk voor de applicaties, het verwerken van data en het inrichten van processen.  Op de werkvloer heerst een informele en gezellige sfeer. Het is van oudsher een familiebedrijf en dat voel je. Plezier in je werk hebben vinden ze ontzettend belangrijk en je kan altijd terecht bij je collega's voor vragen. Ook jouw persoonlijke en professionele ontwikkeling vinden ze belangrijk. Een cursus of training volgen? Dat kan hier zeker, je zal alleen zelf met het initiatief moeten komen! Data Analist - Salarisindicatie Wat zit er voor jou in als data analist bij dit bedrijf? Een uitstekend starterssalaris tussen de €2300 en €2600; Goede secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden; De ruimte om je te ontwikkelen op zowel persoonlijk als professioneel vlak; Gedreven en gezellige collega's om je heen. Data Analist - Functie eisen Wie ben jij? Jij hebt een HBO bedrijfskundige informatica of technische bedrijfskunde/ICT diploma op zak (of soortgelijk); Jij hebt tijdens je studie ervaring opgedaan met het opstellen van dashboards; Jij hebt kennis van SQL, SSIS, webservices en mapping software; Jij beheerst naast de Nederlandse taal ook de Engelse taal uitstekend (bij voorkeur ook nog de Duitse taal). Als persoon ben jij: zelfstandig, analytisch, communicatief vaardig, initiatiefrijk en proactief.  Herken jij jezelf in bovenstaande? Dan ben jij de data analist die wij zoeken. Solliciteer vandaag nog en begin snel aan jouw droombaan!  Solliciteren tijdens #corona? Bij ons kan je kiezen uit een online gesprek of een persoonlijk gesprek (met inachtneming van de RIVM-richtlijnen).  Jelling is gespecialiseerd in vacatures voor Data Analisten. Kijk voor meer informatie en vacatures op www.jelling.nl  Jelling IT Professionals streeft naar gelijke kansen op de arbeidsmarkt voor iedereen. Wij selecteren niet op geslacht, leeftijd, afkomst, etc. en nodigen daarom iedereen die zich herkent in bovenstaand profiel van harte uit om te solliciteren. Locatie Utrecht Regio Utrecht, Gelderland Publicatiedatum 07.01.2021 Contactpersoon R. de Jong E: rutger@jelling.nl

title: Data & Analytics Consultant
summary: Artefact is a new generation of a data service provider, specialising in data consulting and data-driven digital marketing, dedicated to transforming data into…
description: Who we are Artefact is a new generation of a data service provider, specialising in data consulting and data-driven digital marketing, dedicated to transforming data into business impact across the entire value chain of organisations. We are proud to say we’re enjoying skyrocketing growth. Our broad range of data-driven solutions in data consulting and digital marketing are designed to meet our clients’ specific needs, always conceived with a business-centric approach and delivered with tangible results. Our data-driven services are built upon the deep AI expertise we’ve acquired with our 1000+ client base around the globe. We have 1000 employees across 20 offices who are focused on accelerating digital transformation. Thanks to a unique mix of company assets: State of the art data technologies, lean, AI, agile methodologies for fast delivery, and cohesive teams of the finest business consultants, data analysts, data scientists, data engineers, and digital experts, all dedicated to bringing extra value to every client. Role & Responsibilities As a Data and Analytics Consultant you will be conducting projects in the transformation of our clients’ businesses through the effective collection, processing and activation of data. We expect you to ensure quality and continuity of the full range of Data & Analytics services meanwhile actively contributing to the expertise level and competencies of the team. Your work will be done in close collaboration with the other divisions (Media & Activation, Creation, Consultancy, Data Science and Technology) to provide comprehensive services to our clients. Among your responsibilities will be the execution of our Data & Analytics projects ensuring delivery including: Analytics and Media Implementation Tag management setup, data layering, media tagging and custom scripting Performing audits, reviews and creating best-practice analytics setups Media tagging and conversion support Solution design, documentation and creating developer guidelines Data Collection & Enrichment Setting up and improving data collection (web, apps, offline, pos) Best practice Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics and Firebase implementations Lighter coding (JavaScript, Python, SQL, R) Data aggregation and channel attribution Data Visualisation and Storytelling Dashboarding (Data Studio, PowerBi, Tableau) Basic and advanced reporting Presentations and consulting work We expect you to stay up to date on developments within the industry, to share best practices and contribute to Artefact’s institutional knowledge. Your Profile Academic level of education (Bachelor or Master) A minimum of 1 year of work experience in a data-driven working environment Verifiable knowledge and experience of web analytics platforms like Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics etc. Familiarity with tag management systems like Google Tag Manager, Tealium iQ Ensighten etc. Familiarity with website optimization tools like Optimizely, Google Optimize, Convert, AB Tasty etc Optionally, familiarity with Data Management Platforms like BlueKai, Adobe Audience Manager, Tealium Audience Stream, etc. Basic knowledge of web-related technologies (JavaScript, CSS and HTML) and database techniques (REST-APIs, SQL, No-SQL) Knowledge of data processing and data modeling algorithms and techniques would be an advantage Fluency in English is a must, preferably also Dutch What we offer you A team that values professionalism. We are driven entrepreneurs that are eager to make a dent in the industry. Personal development. Every day offers new challenges and new opportunities to learn. This is a chance for you to take your career to the next level! A social working environment. We enjoy each other’s company both on and off the clock. Great office location in central Utrecht. A competitive salary package.

title: Business Analyst - User Stories
summary: Business Analyst - An international business based out of Breda in the Netherlands is currently looking for a Business Analyst to join their team on a contract…
description: Business Analyst - Development projects  Business Analyst - An international business based out of Breda in the Netherlands is currently looking for a Business Analyst to join their team on a contract basis.  Working as liaison between IT and the business, you will lead the functional requirements for the project. You will elicit requirements and use these to produce relevant and accurate specifications, and groom high level User Stories so that these can be built by the development team.  The successful Business Analyst will need to have demonstrable experience creating User Stories, and will be comfortable producing the Process Map. You will have excellent stakeholder engagement skills, and be able to work with all areas of the business, including the Front Office teams, technical development teams and Data Reporting teams to assist with the successful scheduled delivery of the project.  If this sounds of interest then please get in touch at your earliest convenience for more information by sending an up to date CV to the details below.

title: Python Data & Machine Learning Engineer
summary: Ben je werkzaam in data gedreven omgevingen als Data Engineer, Data Sciencist of Data Analyst, heb je affiniteit met het ontwerpen en bouwen van Data Pipelines…
description: Wat bieden wij: Kleinschalige organisatie zonder corporate gedoe en zo plat als maar kan. Een organisatie en team captain die om je geven en oprechte aandacht hebben voor wie je bent, waar je blij van wordt en hoe dat samen te bereiken. Een open en inspirerende omgeving met veel ruimte voor eigen inbreng, groei, samen, delen en uitdagende opdrachten bij leuke klanten. Gelijkgezinde collega’s die hun vakgebied op de voet volgen, er goed in zijn en er een menig over hebben. Socials, meetups, training, hackatons, conferenties… Financiële zekerheid: een vast contract en een maandelijks salaris. Jaarlijkse winstdeling. Omdat je dagelijks ook van A naar B wilt, krijg je een mobiliteitsvergoeding waarvan je de invulling (OV, eigen vervoer, leaseauto, etc.) zelf mag bepalen. Laptop naar keuze: macOs, Lunix, Windows... En ja, je mag op vakantie en als je lang genoeg blijft mag je ook een keer met pensioen. Regelen we allemaal voor je.  Interesse? Geïnteresseerd neem dan contact op met: Eyup Yagmur eyup@codebeez.nl Tel: +31 (0)6 526 593 77  Je hebt een onuitputtelijke interesse in, een passie voor en meer dan 5 jaar ervaring met de magische en snelst groeiende taal Python. Ben je werkzaam in data gedreven omgevingen als Data Engineer, Data Sciencist of Data Analyst, heb je affiniteit met het ontwerpen en bouwen van Data Pipelines en Machine Learning oplossingen, dan zijn wij op zoek naar jou. Ook als je jezelf niet geheel herkent in onze omschrijving, mag je contact met ons opnemen. Schrik je niet van trefwoorden als: Python, Python, Python, Python, Python en Python. Python libraries en frameworks als Pandas, scikit-learn, PySprak, Keras, TensorFlow, Airflow en Flask en al die andere mooie Python dingen…of tools als Kafka... Ervaring met het ontwerpen en bouwen van Data Pipelines. Ervaring met Machine Learning modellen in productie omgevingen. Ervaring met Software Testing. Kennis van methoden zoals Agile, Scrum en DevOps: CI/CD pipelines / Jenkins / Containerisation (Docker/Kubernetes) / etc... Kennis van Relational en NoSQL databases. Kennis van Cloud (Azure, AWS, etc).

title: Salesforce Administrator
summary:
Maintain data quality and hygiene across sales, finance & marketing tools, guaranteeing data reliability and accuracy;
Define and implement the sales process;
description: The Challenge  Today, people all over the world are connected. All day, every day. At CM.com we firmly believe that technology exists to enhance people’s lives. We enable our customers to be part of those lives. Constantly searching for ways to better connect people with each other is what drives us.  To help us achieve this mission we are looking for Salesforce Administrator.  As Salesforce Administrator you become part of our Sales Operations team, located in Breda (HQ). You love playing with data and enjoy solving (technical) problems. You thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic team environment as a proactive self-starter. You are curious and always look for the root cause of issues. The mission of the Sales Operations team is to optimize sales processes and give our sales reps a boost to be more efficient and impactful.  What you’ll do  As Salesforce Administrator you will be responsible for the day-to-day execution, configuration, support, maintenance, and improvement of CM.com’s CRM platforms. Together with the team, you ensure that our Sales teams can work efficiently and effectively by properly structuring processes in the CRM. Sales Operations will drive value by providing strategic direction, streamline sales processes, trainings, reporting, data analyses, sales forecasting, planning,, and smooth operations management. You should manage the CRM systems in such a way that sales reps can focus on selling. This role is part technical project manager, part administrator and part CRM analyst.  Apart from that, your responsibilities are: Implementation, set up and maintain CM.com’s CRM systems (including new CRM Salesforce); Define and implement the sales process; Operate and administer CRM and related services; Handle administrative functions including workflows, process builders, flows, dashboards, reports and various system configurations; Perform installed package and integration upgrades as needed; Assess operational risks and propose technical solutions that will meet service expectations; Develop, test, review, debug, document, enhance and integrate components to ensure that systems meet functional requirements and business needs; Provide ongoing maintenance of applications and systems, working with key members to complete projects and troubleshoot issues. Evaluate and follow through on issues and problems until resolved or escalated; Field internal requests or issues from team members; assess common challenges of users; and then devise and implement solutions, automated processes, or documented procedures; Maintain data quality and hygiene across sales, finance & marketing tools, guaranteeing data reliability and accuracy; Integrate and maintain various additional sales tools; you ensure that these tools all work seamlessly with each other; Prepare and provide analytical analysis on numerous project launches and initiatives; Partner up closely with our Sales, Marketing and Finance teams and advise management with insights to guide the sales team; Collaborate with IT to ensure application performance, security and availability expectations are met; Ensure that Sales have the right knowledge and skills to be successful, by providing employee (sales) training programs and classes on the use of sales processes and the CRM system; Be the point of reference for the sales teams to troubleshoot issues and increase operational efficiencies.  What you offer  Strong interest and passion in sales operations; Bachelor or Master degree in Business Economics / Finance / Math or equivalent studies; At least 2-3 years’ work experience in a role as administrator / application manager / specialist or similar, preferably in IT / SaaS / Software; Experience in working with sales teams and understand sales processes well; Demonstrated experience in implementing and working with CRM systems; experience with Salesforce is a pre; Strong affinity with IT; programming skills are nice to have, but no must; Energetic, proactive and a hands-on approach; Demonstrated ability to take initiative and show agility; Strong analytical skills and logical decision-maker; Able to multi-task and work on various small projects simultaneously; Strong interpersonal and stakeholder management skills; Excellent social and communication skills, in English; understanding of Dutch is strongly preferred.  Next to this  You have can-do mentality and a continuous improvement mindset; You are flexible and like working in a rapidly changing organization. Located in travel distance of one of our offices is an advantage; Availability: Full time job.  What we Offer  A challenging job within an innovative and international fast-growing company; Competitive salary; The opportunity to shape your job with your own skills; Working together with motivated and entrepreneurial colleagues; Onboarding and buddy program to help you to get up to speed; Plenty of opportunity for personal and professional growth through courses and training, by among others the CM Academy; Post Corona we hope to go back to regular (social) events such as Q-meetings, ski-and summer trips, parties, Friday afternoon drinks, sport lessons and a healthy lunch.  CM.com as a Company  CM.com is a global leader in cloud software for conversational commerce. We enable businesses to deliver a superior customer experience. Our communications and payments platform empowers marketing, sales and customer support departments to automate engagement with customers across multiple mobile channels.  Consumers expect real-time contact and personal interaction from businesses. We make sure businesses can respond to these customer needs by automating and personalizing their customer interactions on mobile through the favorite channel of their customers, such as WhatsApp, Apple Business Chat, SMS and Voice. These communications channels blended with our seamless payment capabilities drive sales, gain customers and increase customer happiness.  CM.com was founded in 1999 in Breda, the Netherlands. As of February 2020 we are listed on the Amsterdam stock exchange. Our global team consists of around 500 employees in offices around the world. The CM.com headquarter is located in Breda.  Apply now and ‘Start the Conversation’  Are you the candidate we are looking for? Please apply via our company website with your résumé and tell us what excites you about this opportunity. An assessmentwill be part of our recruitment process. We look forward to hearing from you.  Kind regards, Sanne Koenraads Corporate Recruiter CM.com

title: Technisch medewerker – Sloten
summary:
Wij denken groots op kleine schaal!
In deze functie telt namelijk iedere mm.
Vele sleutels en cilinders wachten op jouw kennis en kunde.
description: Wij denken groots op kleine schaal! In deze functie telt namelijk iedere mm. Vele sleutels en cilinders wachten op jouw kennis en kunde. Daarbij verwacht de klant een grote mate van nauwkeurigheid en precisie en wij verwachten een flinke dosis leergierigheid van jou!  Technisch medewerker: dit ga je doen. Samen met jouw directe collega start je de dag. Samen bespreken jullie de planning van de dag. De telefoon gaat, het eerste belletje van de vele die nog zullen volgen. Je gaat van de ene taak naar de andere maar verliest nooit het einddoel uit het oog. Alles moet netjes en strak geregeld zijn en zonder problemen naar de klant worden verstuurd. Kwaliteit staat voor jullie hoog in het vaandel!  Jouw concrete taken: Uitpakken van materiaal vanuit de leveranciers; Verpakken van materiaal voor klanten; Controleren van zendingen; Sleutels maken; Steken van cilinders; Up-to-date houden van de voorraad en de bestellingen via onze computersystemen; Telefoon beantwoorden. Dit ben jij. Je voelt je thuis in de informele bedrijfscultuur van een familiebedrijf. Je woont in de regio Zoetermeer e.o.. Je hebt MBO niveau >2 met aantoonbare affiniteit m.b.t. de functie inhoud. Je bent leergierig. Je bent nauwkeurig. Je bent cijfermatig sterk. Je bent klantvriendelijk. Je bent oplossingsgericht. Je bent communicatief vaardig. Dit bieden we jou. Werken in een hecht team met betrokken collega’s. We investeren in je vakkennis met opleiding en training. Grip op je loopbaan door ruimte voor initiatief en doorgroeimogelijkheden. Leuke en nieuwsgierige collega’s die hun vakkennis en praktijkervaring met je delen. Fijne klanten voor wie je praktische bouwoplossingen bedenkt. Welkom bij Mastermate! Mastermate is de technische groothandel die gaat voor het maximale resultaat van klanten. Onze klanten kunnen bouwen op ons assortiment, deskundig advies en doordachte oplossingen. Mastermate bestaat uit zeven intensief samenwerkende familiebedrijven. ‘Landelijk opererend met regionale betrokkenheid’, is een belangrijk motto van deze krachtenbundeling. De combinatie van landelijke slagkracht met een sterke verbinding in regionale netwerken maakt de aanpak van Mastermate uniek in de branche. Onze klanten zijn bouwbedrijven, aannemersbedrijven, vakmensen, woningcorporaties, onderhoudsbedrijven, technische diensten en industriële bedrijven. Meer weten over Mastermate? Ga naar onze website.  Jouw team Bij Mastermate hechten we waarde aan samenwerken. Je komt in dienst bij Mastermate VBTC Service B.V.. Dit is één van de familiebedrijven binnen Mastermate.  Meer weten? Wil je meer weten over deze functie of over Mastermate? Neem dan contact op met Maarten van Blijswijk, proces & Data Analist via telefoon 06 – 53588204 of kijk op www.mastermate.nl.  Waarom solliciteren bij Mastermate  Samenwerken in een betrokken team  Grip op je loopbaan  Investeren in je vakkennis

title: Information Security Analyst
summary: In support of Fugro’s digitalization journey and nature of its business as a geo-data company, there is a need to improve the Information Security posture.
description: Job Description For our HQ in Leidschendam we are looking for an Information Security Analyst. In support of Fugro’s digitalization journey and nature of its business as a geo-data company, there is a need to improve the Information Security posture. You will work on key projects and initiatives throughout the organization and you collaborate closely with stakeholders across all functions. Fugro’s risk exposure has grown, to manage this you will ensure that the Information Security Management System is well understood and implemented. Your role You have a healthy degree of business acumen and will acquire a good understanding on key assets and processes. Together with stakeholders risks are evaluated and reduced to acceptable levels. In essence, you will help the various teams to achieve organizational objectives while not compromising the security posture; You work with Project Managers, Business Analysts, architecture and other stakeholders across functions to ensure Fugro Information Security standards are being followed; You are a conduit for business and management. You give feedback into Information Security Programs, in support of continuous improvement and setting priority areas; You achieve positive change to the information security posture, through regular engagement and collaboration; You actively share knowledge and insights to increase Information Security awareness throughout the organization. What you bring along You have a BSc or MSc degree in Information Security, Information Technology or relevant professional experience and at least 3 years experience in both project management and information security; You have knowledge on Information Security standards, such as SOC2/1, ISO 27001 standards and relevant legal compliance aspects; Information security cetifications, such as CISSP, CISA or ISO 27001 Lead Auditor are seen as a plus You are fluent in English; You have experience working with internal and external auditors and demonstrated experience in application security practices and IT Risk & Security governance. You can count on these employment conditions A good salary; 29 holidays per year based on a fulltime employment (of which 4 are appointed by Fugro management) and the possibility to purchase 12 additional days; Extensive career & training opportunities both nationally and internationally; Flexible working hours and in accordance the opportunity to work from home; Commuting allowance; Modern pension scheme; Collective health insurance; Good parking; Possibility to register with our corporate fitness plan. Are you interested? Please visit our Company Page to find out more on what it is like to work at Fugro. If you have any further questions, please contact Bianca Schraag, Corporate Recruiter, tel. +31 (0)6 -28352861. #LI-BS1 After you have applied You will receive an automated confirmation-email of the receipt of your application. When we see a match, we will invite you for the first interview within a couple of days. Of course, you will also receive a message if we will not invite you; After a successful first round, you will be invited for the second round. If we are both still positive after the second interview, we will make you an offer, and with that we hope to welcome you at Fugro! Disclaimer for recruitment agencies: Fugro does not accept any unsolicited applications from recruitment agencies. Acquisition to Fugro Recruitment or any Fugro employee is not appreciated .

title: manager financial planning & analysis
summary:
Recognizing trends in data and performance and creating sound analyses.
Experience in leading and mentoring a team of associates/analysts and work independently…
description: purpose As manager Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A) you oversee the entire operational business and financial operations of citizenM and facilitate financial decision making. The Manager FP&A is the main link between finance and the (internal and external) stakeholders and vice versa. You are the spider in the web and know how to connect the financial dots, whether this is at operational or strategic level. Because of how this position is located within the organization, it gives you an unique exposure and visibility to the entire business and board. Within the team you will work independently and manage and support the team on a daily basis. In this respect he or she ensures timely communication and reporting between all relevant parties, with the focus on business planning. Due to our growth strategy you will encounter challenges, which requires you to look beyond existing procedures and own solutions to solve these problems. Our location is in the Netherlands, but you will oversee the global financial performance of our company. We have a unique business model with an operational (hotel) business, but also a development business. We are a strong brand and company, supported by blue chip shareholders (as APG and GIC). The company is fast growing and was valued pré-Covid at EUR 2 billion, with a committed pipeline of EUR 1.5 billion. Even though 2020 was a challenging year for the hospitality industry, we opened 3 new hotels and re-designed our costumer journey (including the launch of our app and new website). key responsibilities Providing periodic insights in financial performance to the board, shareholders and banks; In this role you directly report to the Director FP&A where you will be responsible to lead different workstreams within the team (currently 4 FTE) on a daily basis Responsible for the annual budgeting and long term forecasting process Supporting the management board and external stakeholders with analyses and information they need to facilitate decision making Supporting the organization by giving insights in business performance; business cases and KPI’s Forecasting financial performance, settings targets and aligning the company’s strategy with the (future) financial performance Recognizing trends in data and performance and creating sound analyses Taking active part in the development of business processes and procedures in order to improve business performance and company profitability. Working with the financial control team to assure month-end closing processes are complete and accurate Identify opportunities for FP&A improvements, best practice implementation and opportunities for standardization qualifications / skills MSc in Finance / Accounting / Economics; Solid experience in accounting/finance/M&A/consulting Able to perform financial analysis, identify trends, and to understand the ‘story’ behind the numbers Experience in leading and mentoring a team of associates/analysts and work independently Strong communication skills and are able to communicate and report on findings on various levels and with different stakeholders (including senior department heads) Advanced Microsoft Excel & Power Point skills Keep the broad overview, whilst also having eye for detail You are able to work under pressure Preferably have PowerBI skills locations / hours Voorschoten Support office. This is a full-time position. citizenM is an affordable luxury hotel chain for mobile citizens of the world. With style that will knock your socks off, we offer citizens a real home from home, plus the world’s fluffiest pillows. Our typical guest is a frequent traveler who is quality and design driven, and value conscious. We currently have hotels in the Netherlands, France, UK, Switzerland, Denmark, USA and Asia, with more to come soon. We are proud to put hospitality back into the hospitality industry, and have received numerous awards for our groundbreaking approach. We like to do things differently. This means our hotels are not traditional… and neither are our support offices. We're open-minded, with kind hearts and global minds. citizenM loves diversity. We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome applications from anyone. #MS

title: Senior Strategic & Market Intelligence Analyst
summary:
Due to data privacy reasons we do not handle any applications sent by email.
Responsible for business performance benchmarking against markets and peers based…
description: Job ID: 41462 Date: Mar 13, 2021 Job function: Marketing & Sales Experience level: Experienced Hire Business: DSM Protective Materials Senior Strategic & Market Intelligence Analyst DSM – Bright Science. Brighter Living.™ Royal DSM is a global, purpose-led, science-based company active in Nutrition, Health and Sustainable Living. DSM’s purpose is to create brighter lives for all. DSM addresses with its products and solutions some of the world’s biggest challenges while simultaneously creating economic, environmental and societal value for all its stakeholders – customers, employees, shareholders, and society at large. DSM delivers innovative solutions for human nutrition, animal nutrition, personal care and aroma, medical devices, green products and applications, and new mobility and connectivity. DSM and its associated companies deliver annual net sales of about €10 billion with approximately 23,000 employees. The company was founded in 1902 and is listed on Euronext Amsterdam. More information can be found at www.dsm.com .  Senior Strategic & Market Intelligence Analyst Geleen  Purpose of the position This person brings relevant strategic and market insights from the external world into DSM. He/she is responsible for adequately and timely generating or acquiring and analyzing of relevant data and information, and more importantly developing strategic insights for business decision making.  Position context DPM business is facing multiple end use industries, for some which, such as government military programs, the data availability can be scarce and difficult to access. DPM is increasing facing competition from Chinese players, which are mostly private companies, and therefore the intelligence on those competitors can be difficult to access or validate. Senior Strategic & Market intelligence Analyst is aware of existing and applied methodologies for acquiring information and insights, and needs to be creative in data collection and interpretation. He/she also needs to constantly look for room to make improvements. The role should work on both tactical (data acquisition) and strategic level (insights for the business). Key areas of accountability / responsibility Has the maturity to work and influence business leadership team; Responsible for the generation, analysis and interpretation of specific business and market intelligence information as well as competitor intelligence; Responsible for business performance benchmarking against markets and peers based on data and facts; Responsible for tracking market share in various definition of market scope; Act as partner to Marketing & Sales group. Support and also challenge business decision and growth strategy by bringing in market perspective and competition landscape; Provide general support to VP Strategy in running market studies; Responsible for consolidating and managing knowledge on markets and competitors that’re scattered within the organization; Constantly look for improving efficiency of BI work by leveraging digital tools and other new concept; Maintain and expand a network with external vendors and partners for data supply, market studies, insights on industry trends.  Knowledge and educational level Bachelor’s or master’s degree in a Marketing, Science or Technical discipline. Required level of experiences Knowledge and past experiences on high performance materials as a plus; Ability to quickly understand rules of the market and play with them in a meaningful way; Experience with managing external contacts and networks; Influencing skills and consultative skills needed as well as good vision and judgment skills; Good verbal and written skills of English are necessary; The ability to work unbiased with independent facts; Has technical affinity; Can use the input of multi-disciplinary teams. Procedure & Contact Interested in this position? Please apply on-line by sending us your CV & motivation letter in English. Due to data privacy reasons we do not handle any applications sent by email. Please be so kind to use the link provided. For additional questions you can contact, Martin Zwart / Recruitment Business Partner ( martin.zwart@dsm.com ).  Reference check procedures and an assessment can be part of the DSM Recruitment & Selection Process. You will be informed when these procedures are required. Royal DSM is an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, protected veteran status, status as a qualified individual with a disability, or any other characteristic protected by law. Royal DSM and its associated companies deliver annual net sales of about €10 billion with approximately 23,000 employees. The company is listed on Euronext. For more information about DSM see http://www.dsm.com or connect on

title: Data Platform Engineer
summary:
Build processes supporting data transformation and data structures;
Most transformations now take place there, so less data needs to be moved around and…
description: Are you an experienced Data Platform Engineer who is excited by the prospect of optimising or even re-designing our company’s data architecture to support our next generation of products and data initiatives? Then you might be our new colleague! Wherever you are in the world, we will happily help you with relocation right to the center of Amsterdam. Get in touch! Purpose We are looking for a Data Platform Engineer to join our Data Platform team. You will be responsible for our new Data Platform consisting of a Snowflake and AWS Redshift Data Warehouse and a Data Virtuality Logical Data Warehouse running on AWS EC2. With the latter it’s quick and easy to connect to different types of data sources and ingest data, without the need to code and maintain data pipelines ourselves. We’re moving from ETL to ELT (sometimes something in between) since we have Looker as our new Analytics tool. Most transformations now take place there, so less data needs to be moved around and analysts can transform most data quickly and easily themselves. You must support them in doing that and where they are not self-sufficient, build solutions for them.  Requirements Experience with and knowledge of AWS cloud services: AWS Redshift, EC2, S3. Advanced SQL knowledge; Experience building and optimising Data Warehouses, ETL/ELT processes and data sets; Strong analytic skills related to working with datasets; Build processes supporting data transformation and data structures; Agile mindset and/or experience; Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment; 3+ years of experience in a similar role; Experience/knowledge of Python is not required, but would be nice. We offer A fast-growing e-commerce environment An international office hosting over 40 nationalities Competitive compensation, relocation support and lots of benefits A social atmosphere (lunch, Friday drinks, parties, sports, etc.). To be resumed Post COVID-19! An informal, fun and driven culture A central location in one of Europe’s most vibrant cities, Amsterdam!  COVID-19 update For the safety of our employees and following the measures implemented due to COVID-19, we currently work differently. Our Amsterdam and Nijmegen offices are closed while our production facility in the Hague is operating with proper safety and health measures. Our Recruiting process is currently entirely remote via phone and video calls. Our new hires will have a remote onboarding since the well-being of our employees is our number one priority. For the time being, most of you will be working from home until further notice. This situation can change at any time.

title: BI Specialist
summary:
Interest in data analysis and a drive to take a leading role to translate data into understandable analysis by using data analyses tools;
No 9 to 5 mentality.
description: The job description of BI Specialist The BI specialist is a new role within the business unit and he or she will report to the director Finance within the Finance and IT department. The Finance and IT department include plant controlling (4 plants), sales controlling and is responsible for the best use of our information systems. The finance and IT team currently consists of 9 people. The BI specialist is using analytical skills for analyzing (financial) data. You are not only able to analyze and interpret the data in the right way, but you also know how to make the connection with commerce, to use this data to create opportunities. As a data analyst you have strong communication skills and you know how to translate the "technical" language into concrete feedback and ideas for your colleagues. Top 100 food company Every day 100 million consumers worldwide eat a meal with a little bit of Vion. This quantity comes with a big responsibility. At Vion we work passionately every day on the global food challenge: feeding 9 billion people in 2050. How can you contribute to this? The main responsibilities of your role can be described as follows: As a result of the Vion strategy 2020-2024 ‘towards a sustainable future’ a new business unit Retail has been established during the end of 2019. This business unit is responsible for our prepacked and processed meat activities including our newly started business in Leeuwarden for meat alternatives. Support the development of business intelligence processes within the business unit retail; Be the linking pin to the central data analytics competence center and participate in the BI implementation project; Align and prioritize with key account management team on management information requirements and translate insights into a sales dashboards by using internal and external data sources; Align and prioritize with our operations team on management information requirements and translate insights into a relevant KPI dashboards; Assist in improving and standardizing management information, reporting and KPI’s based on best practices identified; Perform data-analysis to improve management information and business and sales controlling; Participate in projects to optimize business intelligence processes and the use of our financial and ERP systems; Prepare ad-hoc analyses and decision support to the management team, financial and key account management.  What do we expect from you? We are looking for a responsible and energetic young professional, ambitious, willing to invest in his or her own development in a (international) environment, working in our offices in Boxtel and Groenlo. Our candidate has: Master degree in business information management, business information technology, information management or other relevant education; 2 - 4 years of relevant working experience in a similar position; Knowledge of business intelligence processes, related tools (PowerBI) and visualization of data through this tooling; A self-starter mentality for preparation of management reporting; Interest in data analysis and a drive to take a leading role to translate data into understandable analysis by using data analyses tools; Good working knowledge of PowerBI, MS Office (expert user of Excel), ERP systems and databases and/or the willingness to develop expert skills; Fluent in Dutch and English (both orally and in writing), while German is a big plus; No 9 to 5 mentality. What can you expect from us? In our company you will have an attractive, versatile and challenging position within a leading international food company, with around 12.000 employees worldwide, innovative market concepts and clear core values. We offer good working conditions and an inspiring environment to work in an enthusiastic team. Are you interested? In case you think you are the right candidate to become our new colleague, or would you like to have more information about this position? Share your talents with us by sending your application letter and resume before March 15th via the ‘apply’ button below. For information ask Christel van Oers via phone number +316 187 499 79. For this position Vion is looking for direct contacts with potential candidates; we appreciate if companies do not offer their services in this.

title: Product Owner
summary: Our spatial computing products deliver a new standard for learning and workforce data, empowering organizations, and individuals to make better talent and…
description: Talespin is building the platform to transform talent development and skill alignment for the future of work. Our spatial computing products deliver a new standard for learning and workforce data, empowering organizations, and individuals to make better talent and career decisions. We're looking for an experienced Product Owner for our authorizing tools team to help drive our mission to transform the way humans learn, work, and collaborate. We are looking for a highly motivated, agile, and experienced Product Owner. You will report directly to the Product Manager, and will be responsible to contribute to the program vision, continuously improve product quality and value, while managing those strategic goals into actionable tasks. You will work with stakeholders across the organization to map and manage requirements and priorities in the backlog for cross-functional teams (both internal and external). The Product Owner will be responsible to manage deliverables through each stage of the development process from design and prototype through deployment and maintenance. The ideal candidate will have systems, design and coding experience, to compliment their exceptional organizational and leadership skills. If this sounds like you, we'd love to hear from you! In This Role You Will: Create stories, epics, and themes and ensure work priorities are aligned with product strategies to deliver maximum user value. Take personal accountability for ensuring that team actions and backlog are consistently and fully aligned to the technical needs, strategic needs, and objectives of the business and/or client(s). Document product technical requirements for the development and IT organization in line with market problems communicated by the product leadership, and collaborate with the development team to ensure backlog (tickets and Epics) contain the necessary detail to ensure efficient prioritization, coding, testing, and client validation. Regularly prioritize, monitor, and track progress of the team backlog and commitments against targets, communicating this with the team to manage expectations and suggest additional support when needed. Present complex information and ideas through open, transparent communication to engender trust and ensure mutual understanding. Gather additional insight directly from the client and other external sources of expert information to offer unique and current perspectives on the overall product vision and backlog. Be an expert at identifying and acting against complex and distant potential road blockers, holding team members accountable for identifying and addressing individual road blockers to personal progress. Consistently demonstrate excellent technical knowledge and proficiency, sharing this with others in their team to improve performance. Consistently demonstrates effective time management across challenging and overlapping projects, supporting others in the team with managing their schedule. Lead Backlog Grooming and Sprint Review sessions, while making sure to attend all other sprint events as an active participant. Bring commercial expertise, sound business judgment, and draws on external sources to prioritize and help reshape the product vision and road map. Establish and keep to budgets and resources available that align with other departments.  What We Look For in a Candidate: Bachelor's (BA or BS) in business, computer science, or related field Minimum of five years' previous experience as a Product Owner, Scrum Master, Business Analyst, or in a related field. Prior experience working in a technology start-up environment In-depth understanding of Agile methodologies, technical understanding of products, and up-to-date on industry standards and best practices Experience with Jira and Confluence High sense of urgency and ability to work well in and navigate a matrix environment. Effectively interface with development, business, analytics, operations, systems, and marketing personnel. Excellent leadership and decision-making skills. Advanced oral and strong written communication skills. Advanced product management, project management, and organizational skills. All applicants must have EU citizenship, or an EU work permit.

title: Data Analytics Consultant
description: Jij houdt van statistieken. Het liefst meet jij alles, maar kan jij ook goed bepalen wat relevant is om daadwerkelijk te meten. De resultaten van jouw metingen kan jij presenteren in heldere dashboards, rapportages en actiepunten zodat jouw klanten en collega’s zich kunnen richten op de juiste strategie. Web Analytics heeft voor jou geen geheimen, toch? Wat ga je doen? Als Analytics consultant bij RIFF Digital Marketing ben jij verantwoordelijk voor advies, implementatie en kennisvergroting op het gebied van Analytics. Als Medior Analytics Consultant werk je elke dag aan projecten van diverse klanten. Je bent een expert op het gebied van web analytics en data analyse. Je beschikt over een brede kennis van online marketing en bent gespecialiseerd in de technische kant van web analytics. Deze kennis weet je over te brengen aan je klanten. Je adviseert ze en denkt strategisch met ze mee over optimalisatie en verbetering op het gebied van analytics en data.  Wie ben jij? Jij bent een communicatieve consultant die het liefst alles data-driven doet. Met jouw expertise op het gebied van analytics en data en je sterke communicatieve vaardigheden weet je iedere klant te voorzien van het beste advies en strategie. Jij laat je klanten steeds zien dat jij net een stapje verder denkt en het overzicht nooit uit het oog verliest. Samen met je team zorg je ervoor dat RIFF de beste data en analytics service kan bieden aan iedere klant. Jouw collega’s neem jij graag mee in de vergroting van jouw kennis.  Functie-eisen 3 jaar ervaring als web analist of meer; Goede beheersing van Nederlandse taal in woord en geschrift; Kennis van verschillende online marketing gebieden; Kennis van Google Tag Manager en Google Analytics (360) /of andere tag management / analytics pakketten; Kennis van Google BigQuery of andere databases / datawarehouses; Hands-on ervaring met DMP/CDP systemen is een pre; Kennis van JavaScript / HTML / CSS / R / Python / SQL is een pré  Wie zijn wij? RIFF Digital Marketing helpt met het inrichten van een optimale klantreis. Binnen RIFF Digital Marketing werken we dagelijks aan het succes van onze klanten op het gebied van search, online advertising, content, conversie optimalisatie, e-mail, social media etc. Op deze manier zetten wij ons in voor een uitmuntende klantbeleving. Zo kan RIFF klanten volledig ontzien in hun digitale transformatie.  Wat bieden wij jou? Een warme werkomgeving waar innovatief werken voor de mooiste opdrachtgevers centraal staat. Onderling is er een open sfeer van samenwerken en kennis delen. Om voorop te blijven, investeren wij doorlopend in de ontwikkeling van onze medewerkers in de vorm van kennis, opleiding en loopbaantrajecten. Daarnaast zijn er ook andere voordelen aan het werken bij RIFF: Goede primaire en secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden; Een uitdagende baan voor 32/40 uur per week; Reiskostenvergoeding en pensioenregeling; 25 vakantiedagen en mogelijkheid voor een sabbatical; Een jong dynamisch bedrijf met stevige ambities; Kans om mee te werken aan een succesvol groeiend bedrijf; Een collegiale en energieke werkomgeving; Sinds de Corona uitbraak werken wij net als veel anderen vanuit huis. Ons motto is ‘Be Digital Stay Human’, daarom verwachten we in de toekomst ook nog gedeeltelijk vanuit huis te kunnen werken, waarbij we ook een deel van de tijd met onze collega’s nog naar kantoor zullen komen!

title: Junior Data Analist (Marketing)
summary:
Zijn woorden als big data, data science en data marketing jou op het lijf geschreven?
Voor de functie van data analist is nog geen vastomlijnd profiel, maar…
description: Bedrijf Ben jij net hbo of wo afgestudeerd? Ga jij grote hoeveelheden data niet uit de weg? Zijn woorden als big data, data science en data marketing jou op het lijf geschreven? Lees dan snel verder! Onze klant in Utrecht is op zoek naar net afgestudeerde dataspecialisten die klaar om in te stappen in hun trein voor uitdagingen op het gebied van data-analyse, dataverwerking en alles wat hierbij komt kijken. Op het gebied van klant gedrag gaat dit bedrijf net een stap verder dan andere bedrijven. Met zo’n 20 man personeel, helpen zij de eindklant met het registreren, analyseren en interpreteren van hun klant gedrag. Door zowel on- als offline kanalen samen te voegen, zijn zij in staat om een uitgebreid klantprofiel te creëren. Functie Omdat zij de toekomst in handen hebben en hier graag in door willen groeien, zoeken zij een zeer gemotiveerde starter (één of twee jaar ervaring is ook welkom!) die zijn eigen pad kan gaan bepalen binnen het bedrijf. Na een gedegen inwerkperiode ga jij samen met je collega’s aan de slag bij een van de eindklanten om te bepalen welke werkwijze nodig is, welke tools en technieken nodig zijn en door dit te combineren zet je een platform neer waar de klant uiteindelijk zijn marketingstrategieën op kan baseren. Voor de functie van data analist is nog geen vastomlijnd profiel, maar zoeken ze iemand die affiniteit heeft met de online wereld en op een enthousiaste manier de klanten kan adviseren met betrekking tot het optimaal inzetten van de online data. Om zo relevanter te kunnen zijn in hun uitingen naar de eigen klanten. Eisen Hbo/ wo Informatica of andere relevante opleiding Maximaal 2 jaar werk ervaring Ervaring met data analyse Consultancy vaardigheden Aanbod Salaris tussen de € 2250,- en € 3000,- Mogelijkheid om 4 dagen te werken (4 x 9) 8 % vakantiegeld Flexibele werktijden Auto van de zaak

title: Paid Social Executive (m/f/d)
summary: Artefact is a new generation of a data service provider, specializing in data consulting and data-driven digital marketing, dedicated to transforming data into…
description: Who we are Artefact is a new generation of a data service provider, specializing in data consulting and data-driven digital marketing, dedicated to transforming data into business impact across the entire value chain of organizations. We are proud to say we’re enjoying skyrocketing growth. Our broad range of data-driven solutions in data consulting and digital marketing are designed to meet our clients’ specific needs, always conceived with a business-centric approach, and delivered with tangible results. Our data-driven services are built upon the deep AI expertise we’ve acquired with our 1000+ client base around the globe. We have 700+ employees across 16 offices who are focused on accelerating digital transformation. Thanks to a unique mix of company assets: State of the art data technologies, lean AI agile methodologies for fast delivery, and cohesive teams of the finest business consultants, data analysts, data scientists, data engineers, and digital experts, all dedicated to bringing extra value to every client.  The Role You will be part of the paid social team and focus on the day-to-day running of paid social marketing campaigns across a range of clients and markets, delivering exceptional performance on sales and/or branding goals. You will work together with our data analytics team to provide high standards of tracking & tagging campaigns. You will research and prepare analysis, undertake paid social delivery work and liaise with clients, third party suppliers and internal teams to ensure optimal delivery, account development, and the strengthening of client relationships. Next to that, you work together with the other media specialists (programmatic, SEA, SEO, and marketplaces) to deliver data-driven results for our clients. General responsibilities Support the team with the day-to-day running of paid social marketing campaigns with a focus on Facebook advertising Understand and explain the role of social media advertising to reach the business objectives for our clients Take responsibility for key areas of paid social delivery assigned to you by members of the team Carry out research for existing projects and for new business Research and prepare reports, budgets, presentations, analysis, and campaign delivery Coordinate with internal project teams and third-party suppliers Take on ad-hoc tasks as required Paid social responsibilities Traffic, implement, and optimize social ad campaigns. Troubleshoot issues with campaigns, creative, and implementations as they arise Create social ad campaigns for any vertical and strategy (branding, prospecting, retargeting) Take an analytical approach to interpret data to adjust our strategy Work with your colleagues to optimize campaigns and maximize performance across common KPI’s – ROI, CPA, COS, Revenue, Clicks, Impressions and Reach Align with media partners on campaign implementations, including using their ad servers, as necessary Own and manage in house reporting tool to retrieve data for campaign delivery analysis and optimization recommendations Develop and build out the relationship with the client: providing accurate reporting, present results, providing advice, and build performance-oriented paid social campaigns with a strong focus on quality and deadlines Who are you? 1+ year experience in a paid social environment Academic and working ability at the higher professional education level (HBO) or higher Entrepreneurial, engaged, flexible and data-driven mindset Ability to multi-task in a fast-moving environment Excellent attention to detail Demonstrate knowledge in Paid Social ads platform: Facebook Business Manager Pre: Certified Facebook Blueprint marketing associate or higher Good understanding of site-centric tools (Google Analytics preferred) Strong skills in spreadsheets (Excel/sheets) and creating presentations Great communication skills Ability to work full time Fluency in Dutch and English is required What do we offer? Attractive benefits package The chance to work in a diverse and growing team The opportunity for professional and personal growth and development Excellent (international) career opportunities The opportunity to work with major advertisers and brands on a national and international level Fun colleagues and an informal and open atmosphere A great office in the heart of Utrecht (Stationsplein) Fun activities, such as drinks and excursions A full lunch, fresh fruit and great coffee daily What makes us unique? We have experienced colleagues from the Netherlands and abroad. We achieve our ambitions together We are the only independent online performance marketing agency that operates worldwide We are growing fast: at Artefact Benelux, aspirations and fun go hand in hand

title: EMEA SC Business Analyst
summary: Experiment and seek opportunities for different and innovative approaches on data flows, data models, data storage solutions and other tools and technologies…
description: EMEA SC Business Analyst     At Bayer Crop Science, we’re harnessing the spirit of innovation to shape what’s possible for farmers, consumers, and the planet. Using the creative spark that comes from human ingenuity, we seek to deliver world-class innovation, set new standards in sustainability, and drive digital transformation. Within this fast moving environment we are looking for a Business Analyst in the Performance Automation & Analytics team,  This position will be based in Amsterdam in The Netherlands.  Your tasks and responsibilities. The purpose of this role is to support the Performance Management strategy and roadmap within EMEA Supply chain management. Where you drive acceleration and engagement for reporting in the area of SCM. You will do this by leading and supporting related projects on the digitalization and development of data standardization and data governance.  More in dept you will: Drive the standardization of data, reports and dashboards across EMEA. Guarantee integrity and accuracy of data and provide standardized reports. Support and pursue a modern Supply Chain vision to meet business and enhance the customer experience. Champion the development of a culture of continuous improvement, of a data centric mindset and build strong relationships with stakeholders to accomplish business goals and strategy. Actively participate in leveraging data and insights to drive digitalization in SCM functions to increase efficiency and advance customer-centric solutions. Experiment and seek opportunities for different and innovative approaches on data flows, data models, data storage solutions and other tools and technologies that would benefit the organization. Stay informed of industry trends to challenge the status quo, to lead and inspire your colleagues. Apply Lean methodology and mindset aiming for standardization and best practices.  Who you are? For this position we expect you to bring a Master or higher in Business administration, Supply Chain, Informatics or related study that will support the tasks in this position. Also you have at least 5 years of experience as Business Analyst in Supply Chain or related business area. Also we ask: Knowledge on Spotfire, Tableau and SQL. Data Stewardship mindset, Data integrity focus. Outstanding analytical skills, ability to trouble-shoot, outstanding communication. Coaching, mentoring skills and strong ability to influence. Fluent in English communication.  What Bayer offers you. At Bayer you have the opportunity to be part of a culture where we value the passion of our employees to innovate and give them the power to change. Bayer Crop Science employees benefit from good employment conditions, such as: Excellent salary including 8,33% holiday allowance. 25 days of annual leave. Lots of international growth opportunities. A team of enthusiastic, professional and driven colleagues.  Interested in this position? At Bayer, we are committed to improving lives through a food system that is better for farmers, consumers and the planet. These targets will be both ambitious and time-bound, with a combination of long-term thinking and short- to mid-term goals.  We cannot realize this vision alone. Turning today’s impossibilities into tomorrow’s breakthroughs requires strong collaboration with scientists, innovators, regulators, and farmers. Please check this link to get more insight into Bayer Crop Science Reach out to us by clicking the ‘Apply’ button! In case of any questions you can contact Suzan Felix via Suzan.Felix.ext@bayer.com. Applications via email will not be processed. Do you want to know more about what our people do at Bayer? Check our social wall via www.career.bayer.be/en/sociall-wall/ and follow us via #TeamBayerBenelux!  #LI-BNL #Corona  Locatie: Nederland : Nederland : Amsterdam  Divisie: Crop Science  Referentiecode: 225002

title: Functioneel / Systeem Analist | Supply Chain | € 3800 - € 4500
summary:
Heb je gedegen (3+ jaar) Supply Chain / Logistiek / Distributie ervaring?
Schakel je graag met de klant en met de interne developers?
description: Heb je gedegen (3+ jaar) Supply Chain / Logistiek / Distributie ervaring? Schakel je graag met de klant en met de interne developers? Ben je bekend met ETL, Oracle en Data Integraties? Lees dan verder, want dan hebben wij een interessante vaste aanstelling bij een mooi bedrijf voor je! Wat ga je doen als Functioneel/Systeem Analist? Je gaat gaat met externe corporate retailers schakelen om de service intern te optimaliseren op kijkende naar de klantbehoefte; Je gaat je bezighouden met Data Integraties van Oracle Apex bijvoorbeeld naar de Talend Cloud oplossing (je zal functioneel aan de slag gaan, developers gaat met de techniek aan de slag); Je test en hertest je oplossingen; Policies, procedure en models leer je kennen of ken je al van de retailers; Je werkt op een corporate manier maar het bedrijf is wel internationaal maar 50 mensen groot over de wereld dus kan meer impact maken. Wat ervaring heb je? 3+ jaar ervaring in Supply Chain / Logistiek / Distributie ETL processen begrijpen SQL queries kunnen draaien Oracle (ERP) ervaring Wat krijg je ervoor terug? Een salaris van tussen de € 3800 - € 4500 euro per maand, afhankelijk van jouw kennis en ervaring. Vakantiegeld. Laptop en telefoon. Goede & Stabiele pensioenregeling Volop ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden Flexibele werktijden. Lijkt het jouw leuk om bij dit bedrijf als Functioneel/Systeem Analist op gesprek te gaan? Solliciteer dan snel! Deadline sollicitaties: 8-3-2021 Soort dienstverband: Fulltime, Bepaalde tijd, Onbepaalde tijd Salaris: €3.800,00 - €4.500,00 per maand Aanvullende betalingen: Vakantiegeld Arbeidsvoorwaarden: Budget voor professionele ontwikkeling Extra vakantiedagen Flexibele werkuren Pensioen Reiskostenvergoeding Telefoonplan Vrijdagmiddagborrel Werk vanuit huis Werkschema: Dagdienst Flexibel werkrooster Ervaring: Oracle: 1 jaar (Aanbevolen) Supply Chain / Logistiek / Distributie: 3 jaar (Vereist) SQL: 1 jaar (Aanbevolen) ETL: 1 jaar (Vereist)

title: Data Architect
summary:
Working with analysts and development teams to define and document physical data structures,.
Conducting data modeling sessions with business and technology…
description: Role : Data architect Job Type: Permanent Location: Amsterdam, Netherlands JOB Description : What are you going to do? · You will contribute to a variety of exciting projects ranging from designing robust and fully automated ETL/ELT processes to building tools for improving company-wide productivity with data. You have a passion for designing, implementing and operating stable, scalable and efficient solutions to flow data from disparate sources into data lake, and make sure data modelling are handled as per standards. You, as the Data Architect, will influence data architecture and technology decisions for best practices. Conducting data modeling sessions with business and technology representatives to identify data and usage requirements, Responsible for the creation and maintenance of a set of related logical models that represent the way our business works, Performing detailed data the analysis required for creation and validation of the models, Working with analysts and development teams to define and document physical data structures, Responsible for metadata capture, gating, and rationalization, Build a scalable distributed data store that will be the central source of truth, Own data quality for the pipelines and make them auditable, Build self-service tools that helps the business users to extract, analyze and visualize data faster and perform advanced analysis, What do you need to do the job? · BS/MS with quantitative focus (e.g. Computer Science, Economics, Mathematics, Physics, Statistics) or equivalent practical experience, · 5+ year experience performing logical data modeling for a variety of subject areas, · Demonstrated experience modeling for a big data analytics environment, cloud databases like Google Big Query, Amazon Redshift or Snowflake is highly desirable · Thorough understanding of both SQL and NoSQL physical implementations, · Demonstrated experience with the implementation of multiple modelling techniques (star schema, data vault, snowflake, etc.) · Advanced data analysis and profiling skills, · Experience with Shell Scripting/Crontab. Bonus Points for; · Experience in designing ETL / data pipeline solutions (AWS Glue/Apache Airflow preferred), · Experience with AWS Cloud Formation is a plus, · An eye for automation and instrumentation in all data-related aspects, · Positive outlook towards work, strong work ethic and ability to work in a team environment. Who are we looking for? · We want to work with people who are passionate about big data modelling, building data warehouse platforms, enjoy solving complex analytical problems - all in a challenging, fast paced environment. You should have a solid professional background in data architecture, and a deep understanding of databases. Given the versatile nature of the role, we’re looking for someone who can learn fast, enjoys working with others, and is a pragmatic decision-maker. · The team · We are a young & ambitious Data Organization, composed of Data Engineering & Architecture, Data Science and Digital Analytics teams. You will be part of Data Engineering & Architecture, tasked to build next generation Data Lake and Data Governance Structure, leading the designing of a robust infrastructure for batch and real-time analytics. You will play a critical role in shaping our “Global Data Hub”. In our team, we know new analytics technologies are emerging every day and we are excited about the impact they will have – we hope you share our enthusiasm! · What do we offer? · We offer a start-up atmosphere, but with the backing of one of the world’s leading fleet management companies. You can expect a competitive salary and benefits, room to grow and plenty of can-do attitudes. Most importantly? You’ll get the opportunity to help shape the future of an exciting, dynamic industry. This role is based in Amsterdam and a pre-employment screening is part of the selection process Job Types: Full-time, Permanent Experience: Data architect: 3 years (Required)

title: ERP Data Analyst
summary:
Provide suggestions to streamline the extraction of data, and data transfer processes;
Understand and support data standards and processes to support master…
description: BALR. is on the lookout for an ERP Data Analyst! Do you have an interest in fashion/lifestyle and would you like to play a key role in reaching the full potential of our brand? Check out this position.  BALR. is an international luxury lifestyle brand known for its high-end fashion, travel products and accessories for men, women and kids. As an Amsterdam-based brand we have created a complete range of high-quality items that inspire to live the life of a BALR. Founded in 2013 by Demy de Zeeuw, Juul Manders and Ralph de Geus, BALR. is the embodiment of a modern lifestyle brand. Aspirational, focused and in-sync with its young and ambitious audience, we bring the luxurious lifestyle of extraordinary athletes within arm’s reach of everyone who works hard to live the dream.  The role As ERP Data Analyst at BALR. you'll support the processes of several departments of the company, like Finance, E-commerce, Wholesale, Retail and Product Development. In this role, you'll be working as part of the IT team, streamlining the flow of information and data between several systems, with focus on the ERP, in our case, Oracle NetSuite.
