You responsibilities Execute extraction, transformation, and load of data from and into the ERP system; Identify and communicate efficient ways to collect, cleanse and maintain data between systems; Develop and pre-configure templates to collect and import data into the ERP.; Developing, testing and deploying functional improvements in NetSuite; Creating and optimizing reports and dashboards in order to service other users of the ERP; Perform and/or coordinate data validation, quality assurance (Q/A), user interface (UI) verification activities related to the data flows; Prepare and/or update operating procedures and other documentation needed to support data migration activities; Provide suggestions to streamline the extraction of data, and data transfer processes; Work with project teams to find solutions to complex technical, managerial, or operational problems and evaluate options based on relevant information, resources; Maintain and organize multiple excel spreadsheets to ensure data integrity; Understand and support data standards and processes to support master data transfer; Communicate data needs effectively and timely across departments and project teams.  Your profile At BALR. we are looking for an analytical and proactive ERP Data Analyst. With your data driven mindset and analytical skills you’ll act as an advisor for the business. It’s important you feel comfortable in a fast paced fashion and lifestyle environment. Therefore, an interest in fashion and lifestyle product is a plus.  Bachelor degree; At least 2 years of experience in a similar role; Experienced in working with ERP solutions, Oracle Netsuite is a huge plus; Advanced knowledge of Excel is a must, SQL is a plus; Excellent Dutch and English communication skills, both verbally and in writing; Interested in fashion and lifestyle products; You are analytical, proactive, consistent and you have an eye for detail; Available for a fulltime Amsterdam based position.  What we offer Competitive salary and attractive benefits; An important and challenging role within a fast growing international lifestyle brand; The opportunity to make real impact; Plenty of room for your own initiatives and personal growth; A dynamic and fun working environment with young and ambitious colleagues; Lots of autonomy and responsibilities; Daily lunch.  Are you up for the challenge?

title: UX Researcher
summary:
Analytical Eye: You're not a data wizard, but you're familiar with Excel and know how to visualize and interpret data.
The UX Research Lab is your focal point.
description: Do you want to be part of the grocery revolution? Picnic offers you the opportunity to work in an innovative scale-up culture where everything you do matters. With a human-centered approach we have built an incredible service. Testing on a weekly basis, we rely on customer insights to help us improve, develop and evolve our service. We are looking for a UX Researcher to strengthen our growing UX Research lab and help us take the lab to the next level. Where you fit in As our UX Researcher, you will be part of a diverse team. You'll work collaboratively with Data Analysts, Product Owners, and Designers to develop the full user experience of Picnic's products. With an open personality, you're able to empathize with end-users on a weekly basis, whether that's by guiding users through prototypes or investigating a new topic. The UX Research Lab is your focal point. Half of the week, you initiate, plan and execute hands-on research activities. The other half is used to observe and analyse user behaviour and communicate those insights effectively to various teams and stakeholders. You experiment with research approaches to answer big questions. Why do people churn? Why do some customers never use the search feature? How can we improve first order conversion? Every week presents a new question or challenge to explore, evolve, and evaluate. Understanding both the big picture and the details, you examine insights from unique angles to bring a deeper understanding of customer experience and provide testable hypotheses. You combine quantitative and qualitative insights to help build new design features. You are an instigator, outcome-driven and an excellent communicator. Your ideas make customer interaction more tailored, developed and engaging. With both curiosity and initiative, you can drive the UX lab, lead Picnic's design decisions, and shape the future of in-app grocery shopping. What you do Take ownership of the UX lab's research activities to bring deep level insights to persistent challenges Provide new hypotheses to test and experiment Collaborate with designers to gather and test prototypes on a weekly basis Document and review sessions to provide actionable insights to both consumer-facing and enterprise teams Be the face of Picnic and engage with customers Strive for continuous improvement to take our UX lab and research culture to the next level Who you are Master's Degree in a relevant field (e.g. Human Computer Interaction, Interaction Design, Product Design, Consumer Behaviour) or 2+ years of experience in UX Research Fluent in English, our company language, and a (near-)native speaker of Dutch or German (French is a plus!): we conduct research in these languages Analytical Eye: You're not a data wizard, but you're familiar with Excel and know how to visualize and interpret data Flexibility: Agile approach and ability to learn on the go Approachable: Can strike up a conversation with anyone Creativity: Outside-the box, unconventional thinking Eligible to work in the Netherlands Picnic perks Equipped with your favorite hardware and surrounded by like-minded people, you'll grow professionally and personally, while enjoying the scaleup life along the way. We like to keep our 40-hour work-week flexible around here. Our tech team consists of 15 product teams that handle tons of innovative projects. Sharing, mentoring and keeping up to date is a must at Picnic: Meetups, webinars, Lunch & Learn sessions, and our very own Tech academy make sure that's taken care of. Your soft skills will get some attention as well, with tailored training and courses. Our salaries are market competitive and our pension program will put your mind at ease. At Picnic we care about health and safety, so currently all interviews are done online and our team is working from home. It is possible to start working remotely with us - have a peek at how the remote onboarding is going here.

title: Teamleider Financiën en Control
summary: Daarnaast weet je het het overzicht te bewaren voor het team (data analist; debiteuren- en crediteuren) en ze te enthousiasmeren en motiveren.
description: Teamleider Financiën en Control (m/v) 32-40 uur per week Ter vervanging van een collega zijn wij op zoek naar een Teamleider Financiën & Control. Jij zorgt er voor dat het management van ESTG in “control” is door hen te voorzien van de juiste cijfers & inzichten en hen hierop te challengen. Daarnaast weet je het het overzicht te bewaren voor het team (data analist; debiteuren- en crediteuren) en ze te enthousiasmeren en motiveren. Als Teamleider rapporteer je aan de CFO. Dit vind je leuk om te doen samen met team er voor zorgen dat de organisatie beschikt over juiste, tijdige en volledige rapportages en een effectieve en efficiënte begrotings- en rapportagecyclus. Adviseren en (mede-) ontwikkelen van beleid op financieel- en bedrijfseconomisch gebied. Dit doe je onder andere door het voorbereiden van de begroting, het uitvoeren van risicoanalyses en het verstrekken van managementinformatie en rapportages zoals de jaarrekening. Vorm geven aan de verdere ontwikkeling en professionalisering van het team. Je vertaalt de doelen naar resultaatafspraken met je medewerkers. Hierbij bewaak je de kwaliteit en voortgang van de werkzaamheden en werk je ook mee in de uitvoering. Je waardeert de inspanning en goede resultaten van je medewerkers en bent tegelijkertijd kritisch en geeft feedback als je verbeterpunten signaleert. Jouw ervaring HBO Bedrijfskunde controlling; Aantoonbare leidinggevende ervaring; 3 tot 5 jaar ervaring met data, financiële analyses en financiële rapportages & processen; business control ervaring in retail/ecommerce is een pré; goede beheersing van de Engelse en Nederlandse taal is een must;. Grondige kennis van Excel; Ervaring met Power BI, Exact en Elvy is een pré. je beschikt over sterke sociale en communicatieve vaardigheden en bent een echte sparringpartner voor de business; je durft kritische vragen te stellen. Ons aanbod Een fulltime baan als Teamleider Financiën en Control bij een ambitieus, internationaal bedrijf gevestigd in Nederland; mogelijkheid tot parttime werken, maar je bent wel minimaal 32 uur per week beschikbaar (roostervrije dag gaat in overleg met het team) een jaarcontract met uitzicht op een vast dienstverband; Laptop van de zaak; Een goed salaris; Mogelijkheid tot het volgen van trainingen; Werken in een team met hetzelfde doel; Leuke bedrijfsuitjes; Reiskostenvergoeding en pensioenregeling; 25 vakantiedagen bij een fulltime dienstverband; Zzp'ers, uitzend- of wervingsbureaus hoeven niet op deze vacature te reageren. * Parttime uren: 32-40 per week Soort dienstverband: Fulltime, Parttime, Bepaalde tijd, Onbepaalde tijd Salaris: €3.000,00 - €4.000,00 per maand Aanvullende betalingen: Overuren uitbetaald Vakantiegeld Arbeidsvoorwaarden: Bedrijfsfeesten Budget voor professionele ontwikkeling Flexibele werkuren Kerstpakket Pensioen Reiskostenvergoeding Werk vanuit huis Werkschema: Dagdienst Flexibel werkrooster ma-vr Thuiswerken: Ja

title: I&A Business Manager
summary:
Coach, guide and develop other data analysts.
4 Years of experience in analyzing data.
One of the wings being high quality data & analysis.
description: I&A Business Manager Location: Hofplein – Rotterdam Fulltime Local conditions apply Are you ready to take the next great step in your career? Are you ready to join a dynamic world-class team? Are you looking for a job where you are fully responsible for developing advanced solutions that drive value to the business? Are you ready to work at the core of Unilever processes and have the freedom to bring great initiatives to the table? Are you ready to build the future of Unilever? If you are a dynamic, highly motivated, energetic and friendly individual with a strong background in technology, we’re looking for you! If you feel comfortable working in an agile team and drive value to the business, we’re looking for you! If you have a proven track record in using technology to shape the future of the products you are involved in, we’re looking for you! If you want to change the status quo and don’t settle for less than a great outcome, we’re looking for you! Background In this role you will work as part of the Unilever Benelux organization. Within the Information & Analytics (I&A) team we work to provide the wings for business to fly. One of the wings being high quality data & analysis. Being a member of the I&A team is working towards on creating one version of the truth and providing easily reachable answers of top business questions within Benelux organization. The 4 principles driving I&A are; end-to-end ownership maximized automation one version of the truth continuous improvement With our ambitious digital I&A agenda, we are focusing on different aspect. Creating backend solutions to fully automated end-2-end processes. But also working on frontend products to help colleagues to drive insights. JOB SUMMARY The link between the business teams (Marketing, Sales, Finance & Supply Chain) and the data engineers / system key users, solving both day-to-day and longer-term business questions. You are directly involved in building the technical solution. Ensure that the organization can work with one version of the truth and sustain the confidence on the data, whilst establishing a trusted, simple and intuitive user experience. YOUR MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES Responsible for the ways business teams analyze their problems and support their decision making via data driven tooling. You need to be critical on the current ways of working and be able to challenge yourself to come up with better, faster and more holistic (covering the angles from SC, Finance and CD) and therefore better solutions. Responsible for managing and delivering projects end to end, from feasibility to implementation and deployment across the organization – together with the more data driven part of the team. Play active role in the financial month end close process and be able to present financial results to business teams and in different meeting forums. Play an active role in bringing the entire MCO up to speed on new technologies and ways of working (more data driven and value oriented) - you are the filter on what question / information is relevant and what is not. Initiate the development of new or changing/improving existing systems, processes and formats. Play an active role in executing and continuously improving of recurring processes (I.e. planning / forecast / RSP tracking). Improve business teams’ decision making processes by supporting them with the right tooling (e.g. Power BI) and by driving the change towards fact based decision making on those things that matter. Optimize time spent in business teams by understanding key information processes throughout the organization and propose different ways of working by leveraging optimal use of data and systems. Coach, guide and develop other data analysts. KEY REQUIREMENTS SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE 4 Years of experience in analyzing data Master in Business (Finance, SC, Business) or Data/information management Fluent English and Dutch communication skills, verbal & written Proven ability to quickly read (business) processes and good understanding of business questions and challenges Proven ability to translate business questions into a technical solution and the other way around: be the link between business and technical experts Proven experience Excel (i.e. VBA), Power Query and Power BI development Experience with programming languages like Python Financial knowledge and experience with profit & loss and management reporting is an advantage COMPETENCIES Practical creativity Analytical ability Enterprising behavior Leading others Ability to learn Excited about the role? To apply, you must do so online. Please do not forget to upload your CV and a motivation letter. Your application will be reviewed against our requirements and we will be in touch shortly after the closing date to provide you with an update on the status of your application. Please note this is a Direct Search led by Unilever. Applications from agencies will not be accepted, nor will fees be paid for unsolicited CVs.

title: Business Analist ERP
summary:
Je bent daarnaast een zelfstandige, data gedreven, empathische en kritische sparringpartner.
Als Business Analist ERP in Rotterdam analyseer je data, IT…
description: Locatie Rotterdam Waar ga je als Business Analist ERP werken? Als Business Analist ERP in Rotterdam kom je te werken bij een landelijke service en retail organisatie met 2800 medewerkers die consumenten voorziet van technische zorg producten. Deze producten worden onderhouden en geserviced door een technisch team. Landelijk zijn er zo'n 70 winkelvestigingen, grote distributiecentra en rijden er ongeveer 300 service auto's rond om de klant te helpen. Wat ga je als Business Analist ERP doen? Als Business Analist ERP in Rotterdam analyseer je data, IT systemen en organisatie met als doel de primaire operationele én administratieve processen te verbeteren. Hiermee realiseer jij optimale kwaliteit én een maximaal rendement. Verder heb je de volgende taken: Analyseren, onderzoeken én in kaart brengen van de informatiebehoefte; Begeleidt de proceseigenaar bij innovaties én continue verbetertrajecten; Verantwoordelijk voor implementatie van procesverbeteringen; Behoefte van de klant vertalen naar functionele wensen/requirements; Signaleren van risico’s binnen de operationele processen; Verifiëren, valideren én prioriteren van de functionele wensen van de (gedelegeerd) proceseigenaar; Op het snijvlak van business en IT verantwoordelijk voor de portfoliobeheersing én implementatie van operationele veranderwensen; Het maken van Business cases; Het maken van rapportages en analyses van de prestaties; Vertaalt de wensen naar bruikbare en functionele oplossingen; Evalueert de primaire operationele processen van de business en signaleert verbetermogelijkheden; Wat neem je als Business Analist ERP mee? Als Business Analist ERP in Rotterdam ben je een positieve en ondernemende collega die de vertaalslag weet te maken van business naar IT. Je bent daarnaast een zelfstandige, data gedreven, empathische en kritische sparringpartner. Verder neem je het volgende mee: HBO werk- en denkniveau (technisch, bedrijfskundig of economisch); Je hebt kennis van bedrijfskunde en informatietechnologie; Bij voorkeur 3 à 5 jaar analisten ervaring binnen de wereld van ERP of aantoonbare werkervaring in soortgelijke rol / omgeving; Je bent een gesprekspartner op alle organisatieniveaus; Je hebt een hands-on mentaliteit ondersteund door bijbehorende praktische kennis en vaardigheden; Kennis en ervaring met LEAN is een pré. Wat hebben we jou te bieden als Business Analist ERP? Als Business Analist ERP in Rotterdam kun je de volgende arbeidsvoorwaardelijke zaken verwachten: Een passend salaris o.b.v. je ervaring; Reiskostenvergoeding / Mobiliteitsbudget; Veel aandacht voor ontwikkeling en opleiding; Ruimte voor initiatief en innovatie; Een moderne pensioenopbouw met lage premie; Daarnaast een korting op diverse verzekeringen; Een bedrijf met een lange termijn focus en korte communicatielijnen met een werksfeer die collegiaal en informeel is.

title: Global Service Logistics Analyst
summary:
Analyze data to identify problematic areas and suggest improvements.
Rubrik is the leader in cloud data management, delivering a single platform to manage and…
description: Rubrik is the leader in cloud data management, delivering a single platform to manage and protect data in the cloud, at the edge, and on-premises. Rubrik was recognized as a Leader in Gartner 2020 Magic Quadrant for Data Center Backup and Recovery Solutions. Enterprises choose Rubrik to simplify backup and recovery, accelerate cloud adoption, enable automation at scale, and secure against cyberthreats. Rubrik has raised over $553 million in venture funding, most recently at a valuation of $3.3 billion. We've been recognized as a Forbes Cloud 100 Company two years in a row and as a LinkedIn Top 10 startup.  We aren't shy about crafting products to solve problems no one has tackled or thought about before by defining the industry, instead of waiting for directions. Rubrik is the world's first platform to orchestrate data for hybrid cloud enterprises anytime, anywhere. We blend future-proof architecture with consumer-grade simplicity to pioneer a fresh approach to an old problem.  Our focus is on the people that can produce extraordinary results. We need individuals who feel comfortable in ambiguity and excited by the prospect of a challenge. Bottom line, if you have a limitless drive and like to win, we want to talk to you! Role : Global Service Logistics Analyst Location : EHQ Amsterdam, Netherlands Rubrik is hiring for a Global Service Logistics Analyst to conduct analysis and implement logistics plans pertaining to our service logistics processes. Your job will help us increase efficiency and reduce costs. In this role, you should have an analytical mind and a strong business acumen. Problem-solving skills and attention to detail are essential. If you also have experience in logistics and supply chain processes in a fast paced, high growth tech company we'd like to meet you. Your goal will be to help our Global Service Logistics supply chain run as smoothly and profitably as possible. Responsibilities  Global Depot Network Inventory Planning RMA Fulfillment within ERP and CRM systems Analyze data to identify problematic areas and suggest improvements Plan and implement reverse logistics supply chain optimization projects Oversee inventory procedures Optimize shipping modes and schedules Help foster trusting relationships with business partners Collaborate with IT professionals to implement effective systems Track KPIs and report on Service Logistics performance Process Vendor RMAs for critical part replacement Asset Recovery Management (defective parts) Provide logistics escalation support to the Customer Support Organization Requirements Proven experience as a Supply Chain Analyst, Logistics Coordinator, or similar role Experience in analysis and reporting in relevant domain Familiarity with supply chain processes (e.g. inventory planning, warehouse management) Working knowledge of MS Office, Salesforce, Netsuite or equivalent CRM Analytical mind with business acumen Problem-solving aptitude Attention to detail Excellent communication skills Outstanding organizational ability Bachelor's degree Fluent English, Dutch or German a bonus Rubrik provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Rubrik complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training. #LI-AW1

title: Dedicated Program - Algemene sollicitatie IT Traineeship
summary:
Hierbij kun je denken aanbijvoorbeeld business analyse, software development, data science en requirement engineering.
Hoe ziet dat er dan uit?
description: In een jaar groeien van afgestudeerde met veel potentie tot zelfverzekerde high-potential met een flinke dosis inhoudelijke en persoonlijke kennis! Met ons IT Traineeship bieden wij jou het beste van twee werelden: Enerzijds learning on the job in een professionele en innovatieve IT omgeving bij een van onze opdrachtgevers, waar jij jezelf in korte tijd inhoudelijk sterk kan ontwikkelen tot een volwaardige IT’er; Anderzijds een uitgebreid hard- en softskillopleidingsprogramma, persoonlijke begeleiding en niet te vergeten de kennissessies & sociale activiteiten bij Young Colfield.  Hoe ziet dat er dan uit? Je gaat een jaar lang via ons aan de slag bij een van onze opdrachtgevers. In het selectieproces bepalen we samen welke rol bij welke organisatie het beste matcht bij jouw ervaringen en ambities. We vinden het namelijk belangrijk dat jij op een plek terecht komt die bij je past, want als jij op je plek zit kun jij zijn wie je bent en zo waarde toevoegen vanuit jezelf. En dat is nou precies wat wij en onze opdrachtgevers graag willen! Daarnaast doorloop je tijdens dit jaar een persoonlijk ontwikkelingstraject bij Young Colfield.  Wat kan ik dan inhoudelijk gaan doen bij welke organisaties? Wij hebben een groot netwerk aan opdrachtgevers, waarbij je uiteenlopende uitdagende IT rollen kan gaan vervullen. Met dit traineeship kun je direct binnen stappen bij zowel gevestigde bedrijven, overheden of een innovatieve start-ups. Tijdens de eerste fase van het selectieproces gaan we met jou op onderzoek uit welke beschikbare rol bij de betreffende opdrachtgever het beste bij jou past. Hieronder vind je een kleine greep van de interessante rollen bij de organisaties waar wij zoal mee samenwerken: Fullstack Developer bij ING IT Developer bij ABN AMRO IT Business Analist bij ABN AMRO Datascientist bij ICTU Portfolio Analist bij NIBC Nieuwsgierig naar de inhoud van de rollen? We vertellen er graag telefonisch of tijdens een kennismakingsgesprek meer over!  Waarom Young Colfield? Bij Young Colfield helpen we jou om zelfbewuster te worden. Inzicht krijgen in waar je goed in bent, wat je valkuilen zijn én hoe je impact kan maken op een manier die bij jou past. Dat vinden wij belangrijk, daar krijgen wij energie van. Dit doen we door: het soft- én hardskill opleidingsprogramma, één op één coaching, het samen voorbereiden en faciliteren van evaluatiegesprekken met je opdrachtgever. En niet te vergeten, dit doe je ook samen met je team van 4-8 andere IT trainees. Met hen wissel je ervaringen uit, besteedt je veel aandacht aan teambuilding en houdt je regelmatig intervisiemomenten met elkaar. Het inhoudelijke opleidingsprogramma wordt afgestemd op de inhoud van de rollen die jij en je teamgenoten gaan vervullen. Daarnaast heeft iedereen een persoonlijk ontwikkelbudget voor eigen specifieke invulling. Oftewel, alles wat te maken heeft met jouw ontwikkeling is volledig gericht op jou helpen groeien.  Wat levert het Young Colfield Dedicated Program jou op? Het ontwikkelen van jouw talent, zowel inhoudelijk als persoonlijk, staat bij Young Colfield én onze opdrachtgevers centraal. Na een jaar loopt het trainingsprogramma af en bij een prettige samenwerking is de intentie dat de opdrachtgever het contract overneemt, waardoor je daar in dienst kan treden. Met een flinke dosis inhoudelijke kennis rijker, bewuster van wat je talenten en valkuilen zijn én een scherper kompas welke richting jij op wilt met je carrière.  Jij bent .. WO afgestudeerd met een bèta-achtergrond - Dit is een IT traineeship voor enthousiaste, WO-afgestudeerden met aantoonbare affiniteit met IT. De studierichting hangt af van de rol bij de opdrachtgever, maar met een technische(re) achtergrond zit jij zeker goed. Heb je affiniteit met IT maar weet je niet zeker of jouw studie technisch genoeg is?Geen probleem! Neem gerust contact met ons op om te zien of dit programma bij jou past. Nieuwsgierig naar persoonlijke ontwikkeling - Ook buiten de opdrachten om zorgen wij ervoor dat je jouw zelfbewustzijn vergroot door persoonlijke begeleiding van je Talent Manager en trainingen zoals persoonlijke effectiviteit, energie- en verwachtingsmanagement. Leergierig op het gebied van IT skills - Jij hebt ambitie om je inhoudelijk nog meer te specialiseren in het IT vak. Afhankelijk van de plek waar je terecht komt kun je verschillende richtingen kiezen. Hierbij kun je denken aanbijvoorbeeld business analyse, software development, data science en requirement engineering. Dit betekent maatwerk en kennismaken met de nieuwste technieken op het gebied van IT, want alles wat jij bij ons leert breng je direct in praktijk. Blendedlearning noemen we dat. Niet bang voor een uitdaging - Jij bent onbevangen, daadkrachtig en wilt reflecteren op jezelf. Daarnaast ben je niet bang om met een klein dynamisch team bij een van onze opdrachtgevers aan de slag te gaan, in een van de diverse rollen. Je begint in een uitdagende starterspositie waar je veel verantwoordelijkheden kunt pakken. Een echte verbinder – Jij bent een teamspeler en vindt in verbinding staan belangrijk. Niet alleen met jezelf, maar ook met anderen. Samen met maximaal zeven andere trainees vorm je een traineegroep, jullie inspireren en motiveren elkaar. Je leert van, met en door elkaar. Spreekt goed Nederlands. Al de trainingen en coaching is in het Nederlands, wel zo handig als je die kunt volgen!

title: Junior Content Marketing Analyst (m/f/d)
summary:
A data driven mindset - using data to improve content performance.
Analysing traffic, bounce rate, Google rankings, revenue and data from our internal CMS and…
description: We are the Global Savings Group, the leading European Commerce Content platform focusing on the delivery of consumer rewards, cashback, savings opportunities, and shopping content. Founded in 2012, we began our journey towards becoming the leading commerce content platform. After having specialized in the couponing sector, we extended our product portfolio with Pouch, our new shopping assistant, in 2018. This continued in early 2020 as we expanded the Global Savings Group family to include iGraal, France's biggest cashback player, and once more in 2021 with the addition of Shoop, Germany's leading cashback platform.  Today, our fast-growing team of more than 500 tech enthusiasts, online marketers, account managers and editors funnels more than 3 million purchases every month. By assisting millions of consumers to make smarter purchasing decisions, we enable our partners to reach high-intent users at scale in 20+ markets around the world. We operate 100+ digital assets with the world's leading publishers, helping them to monetize on their digital platforms.  As a part of our family in Amsterdam, you can look forward to... Becoming a part of the Global Savings Group international network A culture that supports your individual and professional development An open-minded team that embraces new ideas, perspectives and methodologies Having flexible working hours with the possibility of remote working Working in a cloud based company An international environment A fully stocked kitchen with fresh fruits, delicious (healthy) lunch at the office Virtual team get-togethers like team events, Friday drinks and Pub Quiz evenings  Want to be a part of an organisation where 45+ nationalities work together in a fast growing market?  We are looking for a data-driven Junior Content Marketing Analyst, who will be responsible for a portfolio of web pages for two market-leading, discount focused domains in the UK market. As part of the role, the chosen candidate will analyse their performance, identify areas of improvement, and recommend ways to increase affiliate-generated revenue and ROI, working closely with the Account Management team and remote freelancers. As a fully integrated member of Global Savings Group you will be:  Managing a portfolio of retailer landing pages, ensuring all content on the pages is clear, accurate and up-to-date Analysing traffic, bounce rate, Google rankings, revenue and data from our internal CMS and Affiliate Networks, in order to increase conversion rates Coordinating with freelancers, account managers and other departments to execute and optimise effective marketing campaigns Ensuring we accurately promote all valid vouchers and money-saving opportunities to appeal to our customers, as well as add incremental value to our partner brands Carrying out detailed quality checks to consolidate and remedy content-related issues, maximising engagement, conversion and revenue Developing and implementing account based strategies with the commercial team to improve page competitiveness in the SERP and conversion performance  We are a match if you have... An excellent ability in English, both written and spoken A Bachelors/Masters degree in Marketing, Business or a related field A data driven mindset - using data to improve content performance Experience with SEO and Google Analytics Experience in Digital Marketing Strong problem-solving skills Strong time management skills A team player mentality  Are you up for it? Don't miss your chance! Upload your application in English (CV, Cover Letter, relevant references and certificates).  Any questions? Get in touch with Rosa today.

title: Business Analist ING
description: Werken in een team wat verantwoordelijk is voor de Extraction, Transformation en Load van financiële datastromen is een unieke stap in jouw carrière. Ga jij meewerken aan de ontwikkeling van één van ING haar belangrijkste systemen? Dan is dit jouw kans! Wat maakt deze functie aantrekkelijk voor jou? Je verdient een goed salaris tussen de €6.750,- en €7.200,- bruto per maand (o.b.v. 36 uur per week); Je krijgt een grote verantwoordelijkheid in de wereld van data en business IT; Je krijgt de verantwoordelijkheid voor ING één haar belangrijkste systemen! Wat ga je doen? Je werkt als Business Analist in het ALM Data team. Dit team is verantwoordelijk voor de Extraction, Transformation and Load (ETL) van financiële datastromen in de huidige ALM-engine van ING; die de Quantitative Risk Management (QRM)-tool wordt genoemd. Je werkt zowel aan de business als aan de IT kant van de ALM processen. Je verbetert en vereenvoudigt dataladingen en ETL-processen ondanks de verschillen in landendata. Hierdoor wijzig je gegevensstromen, tabellen, interfaces en maak jij bestaande gegevensstromen transparanter. De onverwachte verschillen in gegevens spoor jij in een vroeg stadium op en analiseer je zorgvuldig. Ook ben je sparringpartner in deelprojecten en heb je een adviserende rol in de verwerking van data aan architecten en andere ontwikkelaars. Werken bij een grote bank als ING betekent dat je veel kansen krijgt om jezelf te ontwikkelen en met veel internationale collega's samen kan werken. De projecten waar je aan werkt zijn onderdeel van een van de belangrijkste wereldwijde programma's die momenteel binnen ING lopen. Waarom kies jij voor deze functie? Je bent een data expert en het eigen maken van complexe data en ETL processen is jou niet vreemd. Doordat je bekend bent met ALM data en Business requirements vind je het leuk om nieuwe functionaliteit te bouwen voor het verwerken en afhandelen van big data stromen. Als spin in het web kan jij goed schakelen tussen diverse afdelingen en kan jij binnen Risk en Finance wereldwijd gemakkelijk collega's bereiken en begrijpen. De manier van Agile werken stroomt door je bloed, waardoor ING een bank is die bij jou zal passen. We hebben nog wel een aantal harde eisen: Je hebt een WO diploma; Je hebt veel ervaring met MS AQL Server en ETL processen (zowel ontwikkeling als configuratie); Je hebt ervaring met ALM data processen; Je hebt ervaring in een zelfsturend team; Je hebt werkervaring bij een bank- of verzekeringsmaatschappij; De Engelse taal spreek en schrijf jij foutloos; Ervaring met Agile (Scrum) is een pré. Waarom kies jij voor Carrierecafe? Carrierecafe streeft naar werkgeluk op de lange termijn. We leren de persoon achter jouw CV graag kennen. Onze recruiters hebben jarenlange ervaring in de financiële wereld en daarom weten we waar jij het beste tot je recht komt. Mogelijk is dat bij de opdrachtgever van deze vacature. Misschien zien we een andere loopbaankans voor je. We helpen je om succesvol te worden op je eigen manier. Carrierecafe communiceert transparant naar jou. We zijn overal eerlijk en concreet over. Voor en ná je sollicitatie. Je toekomstige takenpakket, het beoogde salaris dat daarbij hoort en zelfs je kansen op een openstaande functie, we doen nergens geheimzinnig over. Carrierecafe gaat graag een lange reis met je aan. Eerlijkheid duurt het langst! Dus wil jij succesvol en gelukkig worden op de werkvloer? Kies dan voor Carrierecafe! En natuurlijk hebben we ook secundaire voorwaarden!

title: Business Development Internship
summary:
You have experience in data analysis with for example Excel or Python.
No surprise then that data is our friend and for us, learning never stops.
description: Join our HelloFresh family At HelloFresh we love food and our mission is to change the way people eat forever. That change comes conveniently packaged in a box - a HelloFresh Box, filled with the best fresh ingredients. With our meal boxes with easy to cook recipes and fresh ingredients, we are driving change in the quickly evolving food industry. From developing our recipes to delivering the boxes - the customer is at the center of everything we do. Our aim is to make every meal a moment to look forward to, for everyone at the table. No surprise then that data is our friend and for us, learning never stops. We make quick but informed decisions and as a fast-growing company, we value flexibility and speed. We need you For our young and passionate team, we are looking for a business development intern starting in August. Working in the Business Development & Business Intelligence (BDBI) team, you are supporting the growth of HelloFresh – from analysis to implementation. You will analyze huge chunks of data and provide tangible opportunities that touch upon all teams from procurement to marketing. For larger projects, you will support the business analysts in doing analyses and coordinating on project management, giving you the change to really develop yourself. You'll be working on: Analyze customer behavior and provide recommendations for improvement. Questions you will answer are "Why do customers decide to pause?" and "How is our current performance in France?" Manage projects from the beginning to end. Examples of projects are gathering more customer data via 1 on 1 interviews and benchmark our performance against competitors. Support business analysts during bigger projects, such as country roll-outs and new product introductions. Are you our perfect new colleague? For this internship, you on the one hand have excellent analysis skills so that you can crunch the numbers while at the same time having the social skills to make projects happen. You have experience in data analysis with for example Excel or Python. In addition, you like to work together with colleagues to get the most out of projects and have proven to be a great collaborator during previous internships and/or extra curricular activities. Lastly, you enjoy leaving your mark on HelloFresh and take ownership to get things done. What do we offer you? Make a serious impact on the growth of HelloFresh A lot of learning- and development opportunities within a young and dynamic e-commerce company; Freedom of idea and initiative, execution and implementation of your own ideas and initiatives; You can make use of the company benefits, which is the current situation means bootcamp sessions in the park, virtual meditations and online pub quizzes and game nights with colleagues; Next, to that, you also get a discount on the HelloFresh box; And of course, you'll earn a compensation of 500 EUR gross per month, based on a 40-hour work week. We hear you thinking, what to do if I'm interested? Well, after applying we take a look at your resume and cover letter. If we see a match, we will invite you for an online interview. Are we still positive? We will schedule a video interview with the team. We will schedule the interviews one after the other quickly, in order to let you know as fast as possible if you can start at HelloFresh! And, yes, very important: we celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. Let's apply! Nice, good choice! Please click on the 'apply' button below and fill out the mandatory fields. Upload your resume and cover letter and that's it. Applications sent by email will not be processed. Before applying please make sure you are eligible to work in the Netherlands, unfortunately, we do not sponsor any work visa or permits for this position. We'd like to recruit for our own vacancies with our own resources. If we would like your help, we will reach out to you.

title: Data Analyst Risk Data & Modelling (Non-Financial Risk Data)
summary:
You have experience in data processing and data modeling.
It helps that you are able to deal with data and perform extensive data analyses.
description: Do you also see the great importance of integrity risk management within the financial sector? Are you driven to help ABN AMRO improve its role as a social gatekeeper to combat financial and economic crime? In addition, do you have an affinity with data to further fulfil this role within the Non-Financial Risk domain of our bank? Then Data Analyst is an interesting position for you within this department! Your job As a Data Analyst within the Non-Financial Risk domain, you make a crucial contribution to making relevant and high-quality data available to internal stakeholders and external regulators. From your role in the scrum team you will work together with various business parties (such as Compliance, Security & Integrity Management and the Detecting Financial Crime department) on the drafting of data related requirements. You develop these requirements into technical solutions and together with your team you make sure that these solutions are actually realized. It helps that you are able to deal with data and perform extensive data analyses. All data pieces ultimately form an information puzzle with which the bank has a correct picture of its customers at the right time and can detect and stop unwanted transactions. Your working environment The Non Financial Risk Data (CoDaC) team is part of the Risk Data & Modelling Grid. The ambition of the Grid is to optimize the risk data landscape, so that both our customers and ABN AMRO can do business with integrity. The CoDaC team is responsible for and engaged in collecting, transforming and integrating data to feed reports and enable analysis. At the same time, we are in a transition to a data platform on the public cloud (Microsoft Azure).  The atmosphere within the team and the department as a whole is open and informal. You will work in a diverse team with many different nationalities, and a good male-female and junior-senior relationship. We work hard, but there is certainly plenty of room for fun! Your profile You have affinity with the non-financial risk knowledge domain (fraud, terrorism financing, money laundering, etc.) and you know your way around in your search for the right data and analyzing it. Furthermore, you get energy from working with both the business stakeholders in the organization and the software developers in your scrum team. Not only do you have a strong drive to continuously maintain your own expertise, but you also want to actively contribute to the further development and innovation of the field. You are also good at transferring your expertise to others and like to learn from your technical colleagues.  Do you think you fit in with us? Check your profile: You have a completed Bachelor or Master education and at least 3 years of relevant work experience in a data environment You have experience in analyzing data and defining logic You have experience in data processing and data modeling You have the skills to refine data requirements and dare to challenge stakeholders You have proven experience in SQL, Python and/or Pyspark You have experience working on Cloud environments. Experience with Azure is an advantage Affinity with the non-financial risk domain is an advantage You know and have experience with working Agile What we offer Given the attention paid by regulators to mitigating integrity risks and the responsibility we have and feel as a bank to bank with integrity, it is a challenging and responsible position. The success of our organization depends on the quality of our people and the ideas they have. We believe that new insights emerge from an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. Diversity is therefore very important to ABN AMRO.  In addition, we offer: The ability to work flexibly (in terms of working hours, location, etc.) Salary in line with the market An additional benefit budget of 11%, with which you can buy flexible terms of employment (including vacations, contribution to telephone, (electric) bicycle and additional salary) 25 vacation days In addition to the training budget for the department, you will receive a personal development budget of € 1,000 per year to be saved up to a maximum of € 3,000 An annual public transport subscription A good pension plan Interested? If you are interested in this position, please apply via de apply button.  We look forward to meet you.  Employment agencies are requested not to reply to this vacancy.

title: Customer Support Specialist
summary:
Advanced data analytics and ‘big data’ issues in healthcare excite you;
Our team of over 300 international experts – managers, consultants, data scientists,…
description: WE ARE LOGEX LOGEX delivers analytics solutions that enable data-driven decision making in every area of healthcare – from operations and finance, to clinical and patient outcomes, in order to achieve the best possible value. The right people make this all possible. That’s why we’re constantly on the lookout for brilliant minds from a wide range of expertise: medicine, mathematics, health economics, software development and more. If you enjoy solving complex problems for the greater good, En and working in a dynamic, entrepreneurial culture, this is the company for you.  DRIVEN BY DATA, POWERED BY PEOPLE Data is at the core of the solutions we offer, but people are at the heart of everything we do. Our team of over 300 international experts – managers, consultants, data scientists, analysts, and experts in technology, healthcare economics, medicine, mathematics and statistics – are values for building long-term, mutually fulfilling partnerships with all our customers.  THE CHALLENGE Over 90% of hospitals in the Netherlands have opted for LOGEX’ solutions to analyze their operational and financial data for benchmarking and financial forecasting. One of the crucial points for our growth is the quality of service we provide to our customers. We always go the extra mile and make sure our customers get the best customer experience. When they have a problem, we listen, enable and empower. The Customer Support Specialist ensures our customers receive superior service and supports them in the optimal use of our solutions.  What you'll be doing You are the voice of the company, and interact with our customers in a friendly, professional and personal way; You enjoy finding the cause of any problem our customers are facing and help resolve or provide a solution; You will work with other colleagues to continuously improve the customer experience when using our products; You continuously look for ways to improve the way we support our customers, e.g. identifying common queries and making sure these are addressed in self-serve articles, but also improving service delivery time/quality and enhanced customer satisfaction.   Experience & skills HBO/University degree with a quantitative/beta/technical background; Analytical and client facing work experience, preferably with a link to the health sector; You’re a real ‘number cruncher’ with great analytical skills; Advanced data analytics and ‘big data’ issues in healthcare excite you; You have experience with Microsoft Excel, Powerpoint, and preferably also with SQL; Very strong organizational, verbal and interpersonal skills; Ability to work on your own as well as being a team player; You speak and write Dutch and English fluently.  We offer You will be part of a young and ambitious team of consultants and developers that share the mission of creating cutting-edge analytical models that help our customers gain actionable insights into the complexity of their data; A challenging and diverse job; The company is growing fast and therefore plenty of opportunities to grow; Besides excellent working conditions, a nice working environment in a young, international, enthusiastic and talented team where hard work and having fun go hand-in-hand. We have regularly fun team activities; Training and coaching; The opportunity to have a valuable social contribution to optimize the healthcare of the Netherlands.  Interested? We would like to tell you more about this exciting opportunity! If you'd like to drink a digital cup of coffee, for more information or if you have any questions you can contact Dafna Elkabas via dafna.elkabas@logex.com. Please send your application in English

title: BI Specialist
summary:
You work closely together with the business analysts and data engineers to realize successful projects.
You like structuring and modelling data;
description: Have you ever seen a pig with a smartphone? Who are you? Are you the specialist that will bring business intelligence in the stable? Do you want to contribute to innovation in our food production? Are you keen on working with others, and do you enjoy participating in our quest for the best solution? If so, we are looking for you! Your responsibilities As BI Specialist you will be part of the Analytics team. You work closely together with the business analysts and data engineers to realize successful projects. These projects vary from a couple of weeks to a couple of months in length. Your main tasks are: You can, together with the business analyst, convert information needs of customers to a design of good reports and dashboards; You are able to implement and optimize these designs with PowerBI; You like structuring and modelling data; With your knowledge and experience you can propose improvement initiatives and advice the product owner and product manager; You are continuously updating your knowledge with the developments in PowerBI.  Your profile Work and think at a Higher Professional Educational level; Have at least 2 years of practical experience as BI specialist, BI consultant or a similar position; Experience with the Microsoft BI Stack (SSRS, PowerBI); Excellent social and communicative skills; You are fluent in English; Flexible and pragmatic approach, a real team player.  Where would you come for work? With us! We are a group of over 60 innovative colleagues divided over three countries and working in 14 scrum teams. Together we create and develop software for the agricultural market. We support farmers by automating their working environment, ensuring their data exchange runs smoothly and providing them with smart devices and accurate reports to ensure optimum operations in their businesses. This mainly concerns dairy farmers, pig farmers and arable farmers (crops). Get to know us better via our company movie.  To give a better idea of what we’re doing: We have developed a product that determines the best composition of feed for cows. The software calculates this on a daily basis and our program instructs the feeding robot in the byre to ensure cows receive the proper feed.Watch this video (Dutch) to see the use of FeedProfitMonitor in practice. We help our farmers determine the most effective time of the week to protect their potatoes against diseases. Based on the farmer’s location, weather data from their own weather stations and Internet weather forecasts, our software establishes the best time to take action and protect crops. Watch this video(Dutch) to learn more about CropVision Gewis. With our Analytics reporting we bring figures to life to give pig famers an overview with all information they need. We bring data that the farmer entered using our app together with data from feeding stations, slaughter houses and breeding organisations to provide an overview in one central place. Watch this video(English) to see the use of the Operational Monitor in practice.  Our offer We are offering a full-time position in an informal working environment and a challenging job in a rapidly developing sector. We believe in personal growth and development and focus on allowing you to develop by drawing up a personal development plan with you and providing you with the support and additional training required. We also periodically organise hackathons where you can work on your innovative ideas in an informal setting.  Want to know more? If this is something that fires your enthusiasm and you are interested in joining our team, send your CV to hrm@agrovision.com  Acquisition as a result of this vacancy is not appreciated. If unsolicited CVs are nevertheless forwarded, we reserve the right to approach the candidates ourselves.

title: Junior Consultant Health
summary:
The position of business analyst at The Decision Group.
Projects and education with a digital focus (a.o. e-health, data, AI).
Might be the perfect job for you!
description: DATE September, 2020 SUBJECT Vacancy Junior Consultant Health The Decision Group Are you interested in the field of health and life sciences and looking for a challenging job within a fast-learning organization? The position of business analyst at The Decision Group might be the perfect job for you! Join the pioneering strategy consulting firm The Decision Group: a company with a strong focus on health care & life sciences. Deliver and help clients to focus on creating value by using the most cutting-edge knowledge in the field of health and life sciences in our day-to- day practice of consulting, doing research, and making executive education programs. Business Analyst Health We are looking for a full-time colleague who (minimally) has a master’s degree on a university level and affinity with health and life sciences. You will team up with a consultant managing multiple projects, from account management and client relations to educational projects which involves taking a deep-dive into various healthcare. Together you will work on all aspects of a project, ranging from client contact to marketing to small administrative tasks. We are looking for someone with 1. Fluency in both Dutch and English; 2. A master’s degree in the field of health & life sciences; 3. Interest/affinity and preferably experience in: a. Value-Based Health Care and Value-Based Health Care implementation projects and education with a digital focus (a.o. e-health, data, AI) b. Digital transformation and services/products (internally and for clients); c. Business (a highly developed sense of commercialism and experience in marketing/communication); d. (Project) Management (planning skills, able to prioritize and work within deadlines, keeping an overview in hectic surroundings); e. Client relations and adding value for them; f. Willingness to work internationally; g. Consulting and change management experience or proven interest; 4. The following competencies: a. Positive and enthusiastic; b. Thorough; c. Hands-on mentality; d. Entrepreneurial and independent; 5. Excellent skills in MS Office.  What we offer 1. Fast-learning by doing; 2. Informal but professional and challenging surroundings; 3. Critical feedback loops to get the most out of you; 4. Working closely together in a team with great colleagues; 5. Freedom and responsibility; ‘head-first’, initiative and creativity; 6. All can build the company, you are important! How to apply Interested? Please send your application, together with your CV and a recent list of grades to info@thedecisiongroup.nl or call +31 (0)20 4040 111 for more information.

title: Cyber Security Analyst
summary: Broad hands-on knowledge of firewalls, intrusion detection systems, anti-virus software, data encryption, and other industry-standard techniques and practices •…
description: Key Responsibilities: Strategy & Planning: • Develop, implement, maintain, and oversee enforcement of policies, procedures, and associated plans for system security administration and user system access based on industry-standard best practices • Design and implement disaster recovery plan for operating systems, databases, networks, servers, and software applications • Assess need for any security reconfigurations (minor or significant) and escalate to system owner • Keep current with emerging security alerts and issues • Conduct research on emerging products, services, protocols, and standards in support of security enhancement and development efforts Operational Management: • Keep up to date with the latest security and technology developments • Research/evaluate emerging cyber security threats and ways to manage them • Plan for disaster recovery in the event of any security breaches • Monitor for attacks, intrusions and unusual, unauthorised or illegal activity • Test and evaluate security products • Design new security systems or upgrade existing ones • Use advanced analytic tools to determine emerging threat patterns and vulnerabilities • Engage in 'ethical hacking', for example, simulating security breaches • Identify potential weaknesses and implement measures, such as firewalls and encryption • Investigate security alerts and provide incident response • Monitor identity and access management, including monitoring for abuse of permissions by authorised system users • Liaise with stakeholders in relation to cyber security issues and provide future recommendations • Generate reports for both technical and non-technical staff and stakeholders • Maintain an information security risk register and assist with internal and external audits relating to information security • Monitor and respond to 'phishing' emails and 'pharming' activity • Assist with the creation, maintenance and delivery of cyber security awareness training for colleagues • Give advice and guidance to staff on issues such as spam and unwanted or malicious emails • Ensure the security of databases and data transferred both internally and externally • Design, perform, and/or oversee penetration testing of all systems to identify system vulnerabilities • Design, implement, and report on security system and end user activity audits • Monitor server logs, firewall logs, intrusion detection logs, and network traffic for unusual or suspicious activity. Interpret activity and make recommendations for resolution • Recommend security patches, disaster recovery procedures, and any other measures required in the event of a security breach • Download and test new security software and/or technologies • Provide on-call security support to end-users • Manage and/or provide guidance to junior members of the team • Ensure EPSON remain cyber essentials compliant Knowledge, Skills and Experience: • Broad hands-on knowledge of firewalls, intrusion detection systems, anti-virus software, data encryption, and other industry-standard techniques and practices • In-depth technical knowledge of network, PC, and platform operating systems, including Windows client/server, Unix based system • Working technical knowledge of current systems software, protocols, and standards • Strong knowledge of TCP/IP and network administration/protocols • Hands-on experience with devices such as hubs, switches, and routers • Knowledge of applicable practices and laws relating to data privacy and protection • Knowledge of law enforcement practices and procedures, such as GDPR • ISC2 SSCP certification or similar • Intuition and keen instincts to pre-empt cyber attacks • High level of analytical and problem-solving abilities • Ability to conduct research into security issues and products as required • Strong understanding of the organization’s goals and objectives • Strong interpersonal and oral communication skills • Highly self-motivated and directed • Strong organizational skills • Excellent attention to detail • Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment • Able to work in a team-oriented, collaborative environment What do we have to offer? Epson makes products and delivers solutions for a wide range of customers and we are committed to having a diverse workforce. We offer a competitive salary with an outstanding suite of benefits. Colleagues based in our European Headquarters in Amsterdam feel valued as part of our global community and work in an excellent location with close proximity to Amsterdam Bijlmer Arena stations (bus, train, metro). Job Reference: EEB00740

title: Sales & Operations Analyst
summary:
Responsible for global master data management with regard to demand planning within the forecasting software (OMP).
This to head emerging risks & opportunities.
description: Corbion develops sustainable solutions to improve the quality of life for people today and for future generations.  As our new Sales & Operations Analyst, you are member of the S&OP team by driving/leading the monthly S&OP cycle through scenario preparation and planning, initiating recommendations for tactical and strategic business decisions. Forecast, assess and analyze S&OE and allocation management data, signal discrepancies and recommend actions accordingly. Connect, manage and drive communications around analyses and recommendations with internal stakeholders (commercial teams, OPS, and others). Influence business strategies accordingly together with the S&OP Director.  Responsibilities:  Manage preparation of business scenario's for use in S&OP meetings and ad-hoc to drive and initiate for tactical and strategic decisions. This to head emerging risks & opportunities. Work independently on documenting ongoing S&OP assumptions, new or changing assumptions, decisions made, decisions required and action items throughout each cycle in order to Influence business strategies accordingly. Provide high quality and detailed information and analysis to business areas for decision taking. S&OP S&OE (incl. regional Sales) Supply Planning Product Management Finance Responsible for global master data management with regard to demand planning within the forecasting software (OMP) Back up - for S&OP meeting lead and S&OE and allocation management Long term forecasting with support of statistical tooling from forecasting software, translating complex data to understandable overviews and allign these with internal stakeholders. Tracks performance metrics and analysis to identify both opportunities and risks. Troubleshoots underperforming metrics and develops a plan to increase compliance levels in a multidisciplinary effort. Represent, connect and manage the communications around the above result areas between the commercial-, operations teams and other internal stakeholders. A strong leader who can leverage appropriate resources and develop relationships across the organization.  About you:  Msc or BSc education in relevant science ( business administration, technology, etc.) At least 3 years in Demand or Supply planning, S&OP, or finance experience. Scenario planning and problem solving. Data analysis 1-5 years. Use of ERP systems (SAP – Pré). Expert/Proficiency in Excel, Powerpoint. BI/Power BI environment. Advanced Planning System (OMP, Anaplan similar). Team player with ability to perform individually. Fluent in English. Applicant must be based in the Netherlands for this position.  About Corbion  Corbion is the global market leader in lactic acid and its derivatives, and a leading supplier of emulsifiers, functional enzyme blends, minerals, vitamins, and algae ingredients. We use our unique expertise in fermentation and other processes to deliver sustainable solutions for the preservation of food and food production, health, and our planet. For over 100 years, we have been uncompromising in our commitment to safety, quality, innovation and performance. Drawing on our deep application and product knowledge, we work side-by-side with customers to make our cutting-edge technologies work for them. Our solutions help differentiate products in markets such as food, home & personal care, animal nutrition, pharmaceuticals, medical devices, and bioplastics. In 2019, Corbion generated annual sales of € 976.4 million and had a workforce of 2.138 FTE. Corbion is listed on Euronext Amsterdam. For more information: www.corbion.com  Corbion does not accept unsolicited resumes from individual recruiters or third party recruiting agencies in response to job postings. No fee will be paid to third parties who submit unsolicited candidates directly to our hiring managers. All candidates must be submitted by approved Corbion vendors who have been expressly requested to make a submission by our Talent Acquisition team for a specific job opening. No placement fees will be paid to any firm unless such a request has been made by the Corbion Talent Acquisition team and such candidate was submitted to the Corbion Talent Acquisition Team.

title: Innovation Analyst Internship
summary: You are very comfortable playing with numbers and data to discover interesting trends and angles in our user-friendly data platform and turn them into a…
description: Job description - Innovation Analyst Internship  The rapid growth of Dealroom.co requires a keen and curious Innovation Analyst Intern who is genuinely interested in innovation, technology trends or the startup & scaleup environment. You are eager to provide meaningful insights and content in support of our community, and able to recognise a good story when you see one. As part of the Intelligence Unit your primary objective is to derive original, creative and solid insights from our database, containing intelligence about startups, innovation and venture capital investments. You are very comfortable playing with numbers and data to discover interesting trends and angles in our user-friendly data platform and turn them into a compelling narrative for our readers, create influential reports, data charts and eye-catching taglines. You will also be working directly with our clients to understand their needs into mutual success. The mission of the Intelligence Unit is to reveal insights about solutions, surface new opportunities for innovation and support the delivery of projects around innovation solutions. An internship in our office is a learning experience which will provide you with a 360-degree view on how technology is shaping our future. If you are keen, focused, and creative, with a good understanding of technology and a proactive mindset, please read further!  About Dealroom Dealroom is Europe’s leading provider of startup data & insights. Founded in Amsterdam in 2013, our mission is to support entrepreneurship and innovation, by providing the most trusted intelligence and insights on the journeys of companies. We enable Venture Capital firms, corporates, advisory firms, and governments to stay at the forefront of innovation, discover the world’s most promising organisations, and identify strategic opportunities.  Our core products: 1. The Dealroom SaaS platform offers an intuitive interface to identify and track promising startups and analyse broader industry/business model trends. 2. The Dealroom API, enables our clients to integrate Dealroom’s investment-grade data straight into their own applications and processes. 3. Custom research projects combine Dealroom data with expert insights, to create market-leading industry deep-dives and trend analysis. 4. Dealroom Ecosystem Solutions, provide open-access community startup data platforms to support local governments, founders, and investors. Our curated and crowdsourced data and insights foster industry connections and showcase domestic tech sector strength on the global stage. Examples include Berlin, The Netherlands, and the United Kingdom.   Our clients include world-leading firms such as Mckinsey, BCG, Deloitte, Google, Amazon, Microsoft, Sony, Sequoia, Insight VP, Balderton Capital, EQT, and many others, which all rely on Dealroom Data in their strategic decision-making.  Team We operate from the heart of Amsterdam. Our passion for startups, scale-ups and innovation lives in our work, informing reliable intelligence and new insights for our users. Our team is ambitious, diligent, and proactive, but with a strong sense of fun, as seen at weekly team drinks! We continuously strive to live our 6 company values: Empathy, Courage, Positivity, Curiosity, Focus Outward, and be Hungry While we’re currently obviously working entirely remotely, we do have a spacious office available when and if it suits you.   Your tasks and responsibilities As an Innovation Analyst Intern you will Analyse our database and external sources to generate noteworthy insights and trends Take responsibility for unique and influential content for reports, posts or presentations Identify and drive process improvements, including the creation of standard and ad-hoc reports Control the quality and curate the content of Dealroom.co database Understand the needs of the hiring organization or client in order to target research to their benefit Work closely with Partnerships and Customer Success Teams to engage with customers in delivering influential content  Who you are / Your background Currently enrolled in last year of undergraduate or graduate level studies with a declared major in Finance or similar field of study. Interest in and passion for technology, startups and venture capital markets Proficiency with Google Suite & Microsoft Office, with a strong emphasis in Sheets, Slides, Excel and PowerPoint Advanced speaking and report-writing skills for effective communication Organised, logical and number-oriented person Strong analytical and problem solving skills Attention to details and a commitment to accuracy Fluent command of English; any other European language is a great advantage  What we can offer you Internship fee Freedom and responsibility to execute on your own ideas Positive, empathic, and outward-focused colleagues, and customers working at the forefront of innovation and technology Perks designed to set you up for success in a new reality: Flexible working hours Home-office setup (screen, etc) Travel reimbursement Additionally: Take your birthday off Learning & development budget More to come!

title: Data Engineer
summary: You will be responsible for expending and optimizing our data and data pipeline architecture as well as optimizing the data flow and data collection.
description: Grasp the Opportunity The key to success of a winning trade can be found in the fluid processing of the latest relevant data. As Data Engineer your first focus will be designing, building and operating our database systems. You will be responsible for expending and optimizing our data and data pipeline architecture as well as optimizing the data flow and data collection. The design, architecture and configuration needs to meet the high performance requirements of the business. You will work closely with the data analysts to translate questions from the traders into visualization tools. Together with the software engineers you’ll streamline data flows and develop trading algorithms that beat the markets. As Data Engineer you have extensive experience in SQL and database architectures. You have experience with Java and are familiar with JSON/REST API’s. Knowledge of big data and cloud solutions as well as visualization possibilities is nice to have as it will enable you in building a data architecture foundation ready for the future. Interested? Do you like to see the trading in real practice or directly want to apply for this job? Please submit your resume, motivation and grade list to careers@northpool.nl or contact us at +31(0)88 2400 300. We will respond to your application as soon as possible. Acquisition based on this vacancy is not appreciated. Contact us We ask: An analytical, quantitative or IT degree at BSc or MSc level 3+ years of work experience in commercial environment Strong analytic SQL skills Java backend experience Knowledge of Database architectures Good social and communication skills Natural drive to deliver solutions We like: Experience with big data solutions Knowledge of cloud solutions Common with data visualization tools Flexible work mentality Familiar with Oracle, JSON/REST API and/or Python etc. We offer: Competitive compensation package Annual company performance-based bonuses A non-hierarchical workplace Young and highly motivated teammates High responsibility An office that’s fun to work in

description: Job Type Contract  Location Amsterdam  Area Netherlands  Sector Enterprise Cloud  Salary Market related  Start Date ASAP  Job Ref TP0164  Description Currently Templeton and Partners BV is looking for an Experienced Change Manager to join one of our international clients for a position in Amsterdam, The Netherlands of 12 months minimum with option of extension. title: Head of Data Visualization
summary: The role focuses on the quality and effectiveness of data visualization processes as well as leading the company in data visualization solutions.
description: Limitations No time limit Employment full-time Starting date As soon as possible Application deadline 31.03.2021 The Head of Data Visualization at Miele X is the point of contact for our stakeholders driving data insights via compelling infographics, storyboards, charts, and other visuals. The role focuses on the quality and effectiveness of data visualization processes as well as leading the company in data visualization solutions. The role oversees a team of Data Visualization Analysts. Your responsibilities Work with the business on creating the vision, strategy, and goals around visualization of information. Together with your team conceptualize, design, and build engaging infographics and data visualizations to answer business needs. Develop and implement a roadmap for enhanced visualization solutions and utilization of self-service data tools in the organization. Collate and analyze multiple data sources to provide extensive dashboards to tell the story of the work done for a variety of internal audience. Maintain a repository of design assets such as charts, reports, figures, interactive graphics for various stakeholders. Guide and mentor your team to create compelling visuals and storyboards to translate complex information into non-technical language. Your profile Bachelor's Degree in Communication, Multimedia Design, or a related field. Master's Degree preferred. 6+ years experience as a data visualization specialist. Excellent portfolio showcasing storytelling via data, presentation design skills and a clean design aesthetic. Portfolio review is required. Experience with different dashboarding systems, automated reports, and BI tools and charting and other visualization techniques. Ability to work with a wide variety of file formats, optimizing media and creating presentations across a broad range of delivery platforms (print, laptop, mobile, etc.). Strong teamwork and communication skills (both in writing as verbally). Project management skills and analytically minded. Fluent in business English (business level). We are looking for your application @Miele-X jobs@miele-x.com

title: Lead Business Analist Finance
summary:
Wel, als je 6+ jaar werkervaring hebt op het gebied van Finance, Control, big data, business intelligence en/of data science.
Hoe maak jij onze klanten blij?
description: Hoe maak jij onze klanten blij? Bol.com verandert retail om het dagelijks leven van 12 miljoen Nederlandse en Belgische klanten makkelijker te maken. Op die missie worden we vergezeld door 39.000 partners die klanten verrassen met unieke proposities. Samen bieden we zo’n 33 miljoen artikelen op ons retail tech platform aan, goed voor bestelpieken tot 700 orders per minuut (Black Friday, 2020). Een enorm rijke klanttevredenheidsmotor dus. Maar ook een motor die pas soepel loopt als financiële processen soepel verlopen. Aan jou om daar een grote en dus klantrelevante bijdrage aan te leveren. De grootste uitdaging Bol.com groeit snel en doorlopend. Dat is mede te danken aan constante investeringen die groei faciliteren en aanjagen. Vaak gaat het dan om investeringen in slimme en schaalbare IT tools en oplossingen. Als dergelijke innovaties financiële data beïnvloeden of creëren, is het cruciaal dat die informatie correct wordt verwerkt. Alleen als alle informatiestromen goed zijn aangesloten op de financiële informatieservice, kunnen we klanten blij maken met de juiste prijzen, intern sturen op het juiste kostenniveau en klantgedreven investeringsbeslissingen nemen. Maak jij dat werkelijkheid? COVID-19 en het sollicitatieproces Lees meer info over COVID-19 en ons sollicitatieproces Wat je doet als Lead Business Analist Finance Je bedenkt en ontwerpt oplossingen voor datavraagstukken met behulp van (big) data in de cloud. Daarbij denk je vanuit een breed, strategisch kader. Je wilt als lead niet ‘zomaar’ een project opleveren, maar maximale waarde en impact creëren voor klanten, partners en de bol.com organisatie Je draagt jouw uitgebreide analytische ervaring met enthousiasme uit, zowel binnen als buiten het team: zo inspireer je collega’s om data-gedreven te werken! Je werkt nauw samen met een brede range stakeholders en managet de wederzijdse verwachtingen op inlevende en overtuigende wijze Je coacht, begeleidt en ontwikkelt je collega-analisten, zodat ze steeds data-savvier worden Je viert successen samen met al je collega’s Als Lead Business Analist Finance werk je in het Finance IT team dat innovaties op financiële datastromen doorvoert. Dat betekent dat je bijdraagt aan een grote verscheidenheid aan finance projecten. Soms in een hoofdrol, en altijd als verlener van focus en structuur voor het team. Je voorziet hobbels op de weg, faciliteert kennisdeling en begeleidt, overtuigt en coacht jouw collega’s en overige stakeholders, zodat we in het juiste tempo dezelfde kant op bewegen. Daarbij ben jij je bewust van de verschillende sterktes binnen jouw team en span jij je maximaal in de krachten (wie is waar exceptioneel goed in?) optimaal in te zetten. Je zoomt in op het verhogen van de kwaliteit van de financiële verwerking van de diverse datastromen. Vanuit het hele bedrijf en (dus) inclusief de complexe achterliggende processen. Een enorm breed en uitdagend speelveld! Een belangrijk onderdeel van de rol is het ontwikkelen van technische oplossingen waarmee businessinnovaties op onze financiële informatieservice kunnen worden aangesloten. Om sturing op basis van financiële data te faciliteren, verzorgt jouw team aanbevelingen, innovaties en procesautomatisering . Zo help je mee om financiële data en management informatie uit te laten blinken in actualiteit, begrijpelijkheid en betrouwbaarheid. Om de juiste inzichten boven tafel te krijgen en van de juiste context te voorzien, schakel je continu met andere teams en duik je diep in onze rijke dataomgeving, waarbij SQL en Big Query je beste vrienden zijn. De oplossingen die jij hebt geanalyseerd en geprioriteerd, worden door de dedicated IT ontwikkelaars van het team gebouwd. Daarna ben jij aan zet om de evaluatie te verzorgen en op basis van die inzichten, verbeteringen door te voeren. Ook vragen over bestaande functionaliteiten worden door jou en je team beantwoord. En dus trek je graag, vaak en intensief op met de IT ontwikkelaars die de door jou bedachte oplossingen naar de digitale realiteit vertalen. Met jouw inhoudelijke ondersteuning, speel je ze vrij om te bouwen! Een rol dus waarbij je met twee benen in de datamodder staat en aan den lijve ervaart wat en hoe groot de impact van je keuzes is. Waarom jij het verschil kunt maken Omdat je een enthousiaste collega bent die (financieel georiënteerde) analytics ademt en leeft. Je combineert bewezen technische skills met het vermogen om ‘abstracte’ inzichten te vertalen naar concrete verbetervoorstellen. Met jouw kennis en ervaring ben je een inspiratiebron voor collega-analisten, kun je het team uitdagen om verder (of anders) te denken en stakeholders overtuigen van de meerwaarde van jouw adviezen. Je krijgt energie als innovaties ‘zachtjes’ binnen bestaande processen landen, denkt in data-gedreven, schaalbare oplossingen en opereert met een mix van business begrip en realiteitszin. Als teamspeler vier je successen met collega’s en beschouw je eventuele tegenslagen als gezamenlijke leerervaringen. De rol vraagt om een menselijke leiderschapsstijl, gestoeld op vertrouwen, autonomie en verantwoordelijkheid. Je faciliteert een ‘veilige’ en prettige werkomgeving, waarbinnen openheid, reflectie en feedback vanzelfsprekend zijn.
