Dit gebeurt deels intern door gebruik te maken van de expertise die intern aanwezig is, maar ook door het aantrekken van (kant-en-klaar) oplossingen en expertise uit de markt. Organisatie Het team “Facilitair en Inkoop” van IBS Bedrijfsvoering werkt als System Integrator voor de interne klant Shared Service Organisatie (SSO) Centrum Facilitaire Dienstverlening (CFD). We zorgen er voor dat SSO CFD zo goed mogelijk wordt ondersteund met IT middelen. SSO CFD levert producten en diensten op het terrein van facilitaire dienstverlening, huisvesting en inkoop aan zowel medewerkers van de Belastingdienst als van andere rijksdiensten. SSO CFD staat voor de uitdaging processen te centraliseren, uniformeren en optimaliseren. Het team Facilitair en Inkoop van IBS BV bestaat uit ongeveer 15 mensen. We werken voornamelijk met SAP en daarnaast met aangekochte systemen. Het team werkt volgens scrum, in twee-wekelijkse sprints. Functie Als consultant voor het domein Facilitair & Inkoop help je mee aan het ontwikkelen van oplossingen op het gebied van de inkoopproces van het Belastingdienst. Dit kan gaan om oplossingen in SAP of oplossingen van de markt met (meestal) een koppeling met SAP, op zowel operationeel als tactisch niveau (zowel het operationeel bestelproces als tactisch contractmanagement wordt vergaand geautomatiseerd ondersteund). We zoeken een functioneel ontwerper/consultant die ons gaat ondersteunen op het gebied van de inkoopprocessen. Je werkt hierbij samen met een van onze eigen medewerkers binnen het Facilitair & Inkoop Agile team. Eén van de opdrachten bestaat uit het ondersteunen bij de inrichting van processed controlled workflows in SAP SRM. We zoeken teamleden die “t-shaped” zijn, dat wil zeggen die breed inzetbaar kunnen en willen zijn en die naast ontwerp ook affiniteit hebben met bouwen en testen. De functioneel ontwerper is gespecialiseerd in het opstellen van ontwerpen voor nieuwe informatiesystemen. Hij stelt samen met gebruikers en de opdrachtgever de functionele specificaties op waaraan een informatiesysteem moet voldoen. De functioneel ontwerper stelt het ontwerp op (mede) op basis van de input van een informatieanalist en of business analist die specifiek de eisen aan informatie bij de gebruikers analyseert en vaststelt (en modelleert). Het beheer en onderhoud van een informatiesysteem ligt meestal bij een functioneel beheerder en/of een applicatiebeheerder. De functioneel ontwerper levert ook een bijdrage aan testplannen voor functionele en acceptatie testen. Functie-eisen Opleiding, Certificaten, Kennisniveau Minimaal 5 jaar ervaring met functioneel ontwerpen Minimaal 5 jaar ervaring met SAP SRM, CRM en ECC Minimaal 5 jaar ervaring als Software consultant Minimaal 5 jaar ervaring met Inkoop processen Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring met SAP SRM Process Controlled Workflows Gevraagde competenties: Samenwerken Analyseren Plannen en organiseren Communicatie Klantgerichtheid Flexibiliteit Initiatief ontplooien Eigenaarschap tonen Gevraagde aanvullende kennis: Je bent een generalist met ervaring als software consultant in het Inkoop domein. Je hebt kennis en ervaring met Inkoopprocessen. Je hebt ervaring met het werken met ERP systemen. Je hebt ervaring met het werken met inkooptooling. Je hebt ervaring met koppelingen van inkooptooling met ERP/SAP. Je hebt kennis van / ervaring met Agile/SAFe/Scrum werkomgevingen. Je hebt ervaring met S4/HANA. We zoeken teamleden die “t-shaped” zijn, dat wil zeggen die breed inzetbaar kunnen en willen zijn en die naast ontwerp ook affiniteit hebben met bouwen en testen. Kennis van en ervaring met het werken in een overheidsorganisatie is een pré.  Aanbod Startdatum: 1 april 2021 Einddatum: 31 december 2021(optie op verlenging) Inzet: 36 uur per week. Inlichtingen Voldoe jij aan alle gevraagde eisen, dan zie ik jouw Nederlandstalig CV graag tegemoet. Heb je nog vragen dan bel of mail gerust!

title: Technisch Business Analist (inhouse, 40 uur per week)
summary:
Aangezien wij met veel (eind)klant-data omgaan, zal je data-beveiliging altijd in je ontwerpen meenemen.
Minimaal 10 jaar werkervaring, waarvan minimaal 4 jaar…
description: Full time Nieuwegein Active Ants is op zoek naar een ervaren Technisch Business Analist. Ben jij servicegericht en wil je werken bij het beste e-fulfilment bedrijf van Nederland? Dan zijn wij op zoek naar jou! Functieomschrijving In deze afwisselende functie ben je primair verantwoordelijk voor het oppakken van een klantvraag en deze te vertalen naar een functioneel ontwerp. Je klanten zullen alle gebruikers zijn van ons Warehouse Management Systeem (WMS), zowel intern als extern.  Onderdeel van je werkzaamheden is het opstellen van een business case per voorgestelde functionele wijziging en het maken van een impact analyse. Je gaat mede de prioriteit van op te leveren aanpassingen bepalen. Je controleert de kwaliteit van opgeleverde IT wijzigingen en borgt dat deze conform vastgelegde criteria zijn gebouwd. De functie is in-house en concentreert zich rond ons WMS en de meer dan 200 webshops die hierop aangesloten zijn. Ons WMS is het kloppend hart van ons bedrijf. Miljoenen orders per jaar worden in dit systeem verwerkt. Kwaliteit is bij ons erg belangrijk en daarom zal dit ook een speerpunt van deze functie zijn.  Wie zijn wij? Active Ants is één van de snelst groeiende e- fulfilment bedrijven van Nederland, met als focus: E- commerce. Active Ants is uniek doordat ze 30 jaar kennis van logistiek combineert met 15 jaar kennis van E-commerce. Momenteel verzorgt Active Ants voor meer dan 200 webwinkels de complete logistieke en financiële afhandeling van de bestellingen. Het hoofdkantoor van Active Ants is gevestigd in het centrum van Nederland, in Nieuwegein. Daarnaast hebben we een gloednieuw warehouse in Roosendaal en wordt er hard gewerkt aan uitbreiding in België en Duitsland. Binnen enkele jaren zal Active Ants in meer dan 10 Europese landen vestigingen hebben. Met een team van meer dan 400 mensen maken wij een mooie groei door in een sterk veranderende markt. Active Ants heeft klanten zoals Grolsch en Dille & Kamille. Maar ook pure internet retailers zoals Loavies en MrMarvis.  Functiewensen In het bezit van een HBO- of WO-diploma in een business- en/of IT-georiënteerde opleiding, bij voorkeur technische bedrijfskunde, bestuurlijke informatica/informatiekunde of soortgelijk. Minimaal 10 jaar werkervaring, waarvan minimaal 4 jaar als (technisch) business analist. Ervaring met eCommerce en logistieke processen. Klantgericht en je hebt uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden. Jouw gesprekspartners kan je in het Nederlands en Engels te woord staan. Bedrijfsprocessen Engelstalig documenteren en inzichtelijk maken en je bent in staat om handleidingen en procedures te maken en te onderhouden. Jij snapt dat je als business analist ook zal optreden als tester van de geleverde oplossingen en hebt daar ervaring mee. Kennis van businessproces improvement; requirements engineering, analysis en modelering (UML) en een uitstekende kennis van relevante data- en systeemarchitectuurmethoden. Kennis van relevante wet- en regelgeving, met name op het gebied van GDPR. Aangezien wij met veel (eind)klant-data omgaan, zal je data-beveiliging altijd in je ontwerpen meenemen. Up-to-date kennis van IT ontwikkelingen (o.a. Cloud technieken en toepassingen) en proces optimalisatie technieken waaronder bijvoorbeeld Lean/Six Sigma. En zeer belangrijk: jij bent een echte team-player die in het krachtenveld van project managers, support medewerkers en ICT-ers zijn/haar mannetje staat. Wij bieden Een unieke en hele uitdagende functie voor iemand die graag zelfstandig werkt, houdt van het analyseren en graag een expert rol op zich neemt. Een dynamische functie met veel verantwoordelijkheid en vrijheid om dingen op jouw manier aan te pakken. Een kans om onderdeel te zijn van een innovatief bedrijf dat constant aan het groeien en aan het verbeteren is. Je vindt bij ons veel enthousiaste collega’s en bent lid van een gedreven team in een grotere internationale onderneming. Marktconform salaris en pensioenregeling. 27 vakantiedagen. Reiskostenvergoeding. Ruimte voor opleidingen. Solliciteren Wil je ons beter leren kennen? Reageer via onderstaande button of bel voor meer informatie rechtstreeks naar Kristel, onze Corporate Recruiter, 030-2271000. Voor deze vacature werken wij niet met recruiters.

title: Customer Support Analyst
summary: Having experience with human-generated data (in contrast to data from machines/ systems), i.e. affinity/ understanding of how users use a (digital) product and…
description: About the team With the recent rapid growth of Miro, customer feedback grows too. While we already have many people from user research, customer insights, analytics, customer support, design among other teams to incorporate the feedback from our users, we are forming a new team to bring together all the customer insights. This cross-functional team will partner with analytics, user research, design, marketing, customer support and many other teams to synthesise insights. To make this team successful we are hiring for multiple roles from managing the User Insights platform till collecting and consolidating the underlying data. About the role Customer Support Analyst will be the main partner to our 30+ Customer Support team to work together on analysing support-specific metrics (SLAs, ticket volumes, load planning), building self-serve dashboards and to drive research projects. Miro is the leading whiteboard collaboration platform with more than 13M users across the globe: managers, designers, agile coaches, marketers and other professionals, including teams inside Netflix, Twitter, Skyscanner, Qlik, Upwork, Expedia, Spotify, eBay, Cisco, Sapient, Geometry, Unbounce, Autodesk, PwC, Deloitte and others. We at Miro are working on creating best in class user experience and strongly believe that user's voice is a substantial foundation for our product strategy and roadmap. What you'll do Independently performing analyses and interpreting the results Communicating analyses and findings to relevant stakeholders Creating dashboards with key metrics for internal teams Participate in pro-active research projects where we provide novel insights to internal teams What you'll need 2+ years of experience in analytics & insights within product customer-centric organizations Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Experience with 3rd party apps related to customer support (Zendesk, Salesforce) The ability to (independently) perform SQL queries (strong requirement) and experience with statistical/ data analysis tools (strong preference; preferably Python/ R) Having experience with human-generated data (in contrast to data from machines/ systems), i.e. affinity/ understanding of how users use a (digital) product and the type of data this generates The ability to work independently and pro-actively pick up tasks but also keen to be part of an experienced group of data analysts, scientists and user researchers What's in it for you Stock Option Grant Medical Insurance coverage Allowance to facilitate remote working during WFH period Weekly remote team activities to keep the spirits high Opportunity to work for a truly global multicultural team Lunch, snacks and drinks provided when back in the office About Miro Miro is an online collaborative whiteboard platform that enables distributed teams to work effectively together, from running brainstorming sessions and workshops to planning projects, from designing new products and services to facilitating agile ceremonies. With around 10 million users and counting, Miro is trusted by Dell, Cisco, Salesforce, PWC, EY, Deloitte and many more global companies of all sizes. At Miro, we are a team of dreamers. We look for individuals who dream big, work hard and above all stay humble. Collaboration is at the heart of what we do and through our work together we hope to create a supportive, welcoming, and innovative environment. We strive to play as a team to win the world and create a better version of ourselves everyday. If this sounds like something that excites you, we want to hear from you! Check out our career page for all our open roles or hop onto this Miro board to learn more about us!

title: Ervaren Microbiologisch Analist
summary:
Ervaring met elektronische data verwerking.
Invoeren van testresultaten en data-analyse/trending maken en eventueel deze beoordelen.
description: Ervaren Microbiologisch Analist Location: Boxmeer Contact: Pascal Lagendijk Job type: Temp to Perm Contact phone: +31 (0)20 406 97 50 Industry: Pharmaceutical , Life Sciences, Biotechnology, Microbiology Contact email: pascal_lagendijk@oxfordcorp.com Heb jij werkervaring in de microbiologie en ben je op zoek naar dé plek om jouw carrière en jezelf verder te ontwikkelen bij een internationaal toonaangevend bedrijf? Functieomschrijving Voor een van onze opdrachtgevers zijn we op zoek naar een ervaren laborant die ervaring heeft microbiologische testen die zich graag wil ontwikkelen binnen de microbiologie. In deze positie ben je verantwoordelijk voor het opleiden en trainen van junior collega's, verder hou je je bezig met het signaleren en opvolgen van deviaties, CAPA's en verwerken van de resultaten van kwaliteits testen. Er wordt onder strakke GMP-richtlijnen gewerkt dus ervaring met kwaliteitsystemen is een vereiste. Verantwoordelijkheden Uitvoeren van kwaliteitscontroles zoals steriliteitstesten / bioburden / toxines Trainen en opleiden van collega-laboranten en operators Invoeren van testresultaten en data-analyse/trending maken en eventueel deze beoordelen Opstellen en uitvoeren van deviaties Registreren van afwijkingen en een bijdrage leveren in troubleshooting en/of oplossingen Leveren van een bijdrage in verbeteringsprojecten Profiel Afgeronde MLO/HLO opleiding in de richting microbiologie of life sciences Enkele jaren werkervaring in de microbiologie Ervaring met elektronische data verwerking Je bent resultaatgericht, kwaliteitsbewust, initiatiefrijk, flexibel en je hebt schakelvermogen Je beschikt over goede communicatieve en sociale vaardigheden Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal Arbeidsvoorwaarden Dienstverband: Start via Oxford Global Resources (verlenging mogelijk) Salarisindicatie: van €2600 tot €3000 Euro per maand Werktijden: 40 uur per week Regio: Oost-Brabant Vacaturenummer: 16997 Imporatant note; Residence permit is required. Please do not apply if you do not have a residence permit to live and work in the Netherlands. Your application will not be processed Oxford Global Resources is het grootste recruitmentbureau binnen de vakgebieden Science, Engineering en IT. Al onze recruiters hebben zelf een relevante achtergrond binnen deze gebieden en helpen je graag bij het vinden van de perfecte baan in ons uitgebreide netwerk. Als gespecialiseerde partij hebben wij een groot aanbod aan laboratorium vacatures op het gebied van Quality Control (QC) en Research &Development (R&D) binnen diverse sectoren, waaronder de Farmaceutische industrie, Biotechnologie, Contract Manufacturing, Contract Research, Voedingsmiddelenindustrie, Chemie, Milieu en Plantensector. Oxford is altijd op zoek naar talent met expertise op het gebied van Biotechnologie, Immunologie, Biochemie, Virologie, Microbiologie, Moleculaire Biologie, Life Science, Analytische Chemie, Fysische Chemie, Polymeerchemie, Petrochemie en Diagnostiek. Wij komen graag in contact met kandidaten die ervaring hebben met een of meerdere van de volgende technieken: USP (Upstream Processing) DSP (Downstream Processing), Bioprocesses, viruskweek, celkweek, ELISA, FACS, Western Blot, SDS-page, PCR, RT-PCR, qPCR, kloneren, sequencing, eiwit zuivering, purificatie, HPLC, UPLC, chromatografie, fysische chemie, viscositeit, smeltpunt, pourpoint, pH, XRF, GC, GC-MS, LC, LC-MS, ICP ICP-MS, AAS, UV, titraties, Karl Fisher, formuleren, steriliteit, determinaties, bioburden, environmental monitoring, LIMS, GMP, GLP, GCP, GDP, ISO17025. Vind je deze vacature interessant? Of ben jij op zoek naar een functie op MLO, HLO, BSc, WO, MSc of PhD en heb je interesse in de vacature laboratorium Assistent, Laborant, Laborant monstervoorbereiding, Analist, Technician, Assistant Scientist, Associate Scientist, Scientist, Manufacturing Specialist, Process Engineer, Validatie Engineer, QA (Quality Assurance) Officer, RA (Regulatory Affairs) Officer, Supervisor, Teamleider, Afdelingshoofd, Hoofd Laboratorium, Manager, Director, etc. Neem dan direct contact met ons op! Apply Now

title: Network Development Analyst
summary:
Collection and Analysis of NWD data:
Assist the Network Development Manager in converting the outcome of the data analysis into a professional communication…
description: About Q8 Kuwait Petroleum International, known by our trademark Q8, refines and markets fuel, lubricants and other petroleum derivatives outside Kuwait. Our main activities are focused on Europe and the Far East. Established in 1983, Kuwait Petroleum International is the international subsidiary of Kuwait Petroleum Corporation, which brings together all the state owned elements of the Kuwait oil sector under one corporate umbrella and is recognized as one of the world’s top ten energy conglomerates. Our business encompasses the marketing and sales, research and refining of petroleum products. Q8 markets fuel via over 4,000 service stations across Europe and operates a direct sales operation, providing road fuel and heating oil. Our International Diesel Service (IDS) is dedicated to the needs of international road transport companies; Q8Aviation provides jet fuel at more than 60 airports internationally and Q8 Oils manufactures and markets some of the world’s finest lubricants. For more information: http://www.q8.be/ or http://www.q8.com  We are currently looking for an Network Development Analyst within IDS.  PURPOSE Assist the IDS Network Development Team in collecting and analyzing internal and external data/information in order to support business decision-making and control, as it relates to current and future planned activities.  Assist the Network Development Manager in converting the outcome of the data analysis into a professional communication package/business cases for management reporting.  For the purpose of this Job Description reference to Q8 Global Cards refers to IDS activities in all countries except Denmark and Sweden where IDS activities are managed locally.  PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTABILITIES Collection and Analysis of NWD data: Collect and maintain all relevant Network Development information (competitors, number of sites, number of lanes, etc.) and develop a database which will enable reporting and support future decision making Cooperate and communicate effectively with main stakeholders being IDS Management Team, NWD Team, Strategy and Market Team, Sales Teams and Business Analyst as well as the support teams of Supply Logistics and IT in order to achieve valuable data collection Management Reporting and Presenting: Develop and maintain, in alignment with the Network Development Manager, templates to be used for Management Reporting purposes (KPNWE Investment Board, IDS Pricing Committee, M meetings etc., External meetings with partners, etc…) Participate in Network Development periodic as needed and assist with project implementation Participate and present in internal meetings and selective external meetings with Q8 Global Cards partners Assist the Network Development Team in Network Development projects: Maintain and follow up contract renewals of CO lease rental contracts and Hospitality and Card Acceptance Assist the Network Development Regional Managers in coordinating communication with internal and external stakeholders relating to ongoing and future projects HSSE: Apply and comply with all corporate HSSE policies and procedures in order to ensure a safe working environment for all Q8 Global Cards staff and other personnel  NECESSARY EXPERIENCE Experience Minimum of 2 years’ experience in an analytical role, ideally within the petroleum sector Knowledge of the Commercial Road Transport business, customer and/or network perspective Knowledge in (financial) analysis, reporting & control Education/Minimum Qualifications University/ Bachelor degree in Business Economics/ Finance/ Accounting/ Engineering Languages Fluency in English (prerequisite) Other European languages (preferred) Other Experience in an international & multicultural organization Expert Microsoft Office & Power Point user Knowledge of SAP, SAP BW & BO Commercial minded Structured Analytical Flexible Team player Self driven Good communicator Capable of challenging given assumptions Inquisitive and tenacious  We offer Q8 offers you an exciting and responsible position within an international, rapidly expanding company that is one of the market leaders in the fuel sector. You will be part of smart and sustainable solutions that make our customers’ lives more comfortable. You will discover an innovative, stimulating environment and community, focusing on accountability, collaboration, experimentation, personal growth and development, along with highly motivated and capable colleagues. In return for your solid commitment, you can count on an attractive salary package including an extensive package of extra-legal benefits, additional vacation days and a work policy that encourages and enables a positive work-life balance through ea. remote work. Your work home base will be The Hague.

title: Customs Specialist
description: Are you a customs specialist and would you like to work in an advisory role? Then read on! As a Customs Specialist, you are an all-round advisor for our clients. You play a very important role in the international flow of goods. Without proper customs clearance, our customers will not be able to dispose of their goods on time. You are familiar with mapping out various processes and writing procedures. As a person you have a flexible work attitude, you are independent, honest and open. You work independently, enjoy a challenge and have a natural power of persuasion. Furthermore, you are good at translating laws and regulations into efficient and effective organisational processes and you are strong in risk management. What are you going to do? Our clients are diverse and therefore the requests and activities will vary. This can vary from applying for customs permits (AEO, Customs warehouse, etc.) to acting as Trade Analyst or Compliance Manager and giving you advice on legal issues related to customs. Your working environment Customs Support has an (international) Consultancy department where you will work independently for our customers. Our clients are very diverse, ranging from small young organisations to large multinationals. We not only have a diversity of clients, but also customs related issues. In short, a very challenging job! This is you: This position is ideal when you have a few years of experience as a Customs Specialist and you are ready for the next step in your career. You have a professional, flexible and service-oriented attitude. This is a requirement in order to be able to advise our clients properly; You are familiar with the current customs legislation and regulations; You have experience with the classification of goods; You have several years of work experience as a declarant You have experience with AEO processes and applying for customs permits, such as a customs warehouse; You have knowledge of Incoterms; You have knowledge of strategic (dual-use) goods; You have knowledge of the Brexit; Affinity with IT, familiar with various data flows; You speak and write in both Dutch and English. What do we offer? You work in an ambitious team where your colleagues share the same passion for customs related issues. Customs Support is a leading player in the field of customs and of course offers a competitive salary with excellent fringe benefits. In addition, we find it important that you continue to develop yourself through education and training. You will also find yourself working at a very pleasant and fast-growing company with an unprecedented good working atmosphere. Job Type: Full-time Schedule: Monday to Friday Language: Dutch (Preferred)

title: Product Analyst Internship
summary:
No surprise then that data is our friend and for us, learning never stops.
You will receive guidance from experienced analysts throughout your internship and…
description: Join the HelloFresh Family At HelloFresh we love food and our mission is to change the way people eat forever. That change comes conveniently packaged in a box - a HelloFresh Box, filled with the best fresh ingredients. With our meal boxes with easy to cook recipes and fresh ingredients, we are driving change in the quickly evolving food industry. From developing our recipes to delivering the boxes - the customer is at the center of everything we do. Our aim is to make every meal a moment to look forward to, for everyone at the table. No surprise then that data is our friend and for us, learning never stops. We make quick but informed decisions and as a fast-growing company, we value flexibility and speed. We need you!  For our young and passionate team, we are looking for a Product Development Intern. Working in the Business Development team you will facilitate the growth of HelloFresh in the Benelux and France by driving projects for our HelloFresh Market: our 100+ portfolio of curated products which our customers can add to their mealbox. You will support in the success of the HelloFresh Market by analyzing data and come up with recommendations as well as project management and implement your recommendations Analyze HelloFresh Market performance and come up with tangible improvements; Initiate and lead these improvements and product optimization projects for the HelloFresh market while motivating others to execute change; Coordinate product portfolio changes throughout the supply; Develop new products and product functionalities to offer our customers a great experience; Perform customer, competitor and market research to distill insights to improve the HelloFresh Market. Are you our perfect new colleague?  You are currently pursuing a master degree in business, economics or engineering and would like to explore whether a combination of business strategy and analytics is your strong suit. You have experience with (a) previous internship(s) and you bring two main characteristics with you: good with data and good with people. You are proficient in Excel and can find your way around. In addition you know how to communicate and interact with people so 'get things done'. You will receive guidance from experienced analysts throughout your internship and you can increasingly work individually on your projects and analyses. Wat hebben wij jou te bieden? Make a serious impact on the latest HelloFresh innovation A lot of learning- and development opportunities within a young and dynamic e-commerce company; Freedom of idea and initiative, execution and implementation of your own ideas and initiatives; You can make use of the company benefits, like food and fruit in the office, sports classes, such as yoga, boot camp, and boxing class. An amazing team and office in Amsterdam check it out here! Next, to that, you also get a discount on the HelloFresh Box. And of course, you'll get compensated. What does the recruitment process look like?  Well, after applying we take a look at your resume and cover letter. If we see a match, we will invite you within 5 working days for a video call to get to know each other. Are we still positive? Then you will make an assessment after which we will schedule a face-to-face interview at our headquarters in Amsterdam. We will schedule the interviews one after the other quickly, in order to let you know as fast as possible if you can start at HelloFresh! Because of the Corona measures we will have the interviews online via Google meet in order to keep it safe! Are you hungry for more? Do you want to send us your application? Nice! Please click on the 'apply' button below and fill out the mandatory fields. Upload your resume and cover letter and that's it. Applications sent by email will not be processed. We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. Before applying please make sure you are eligible to work in the Netherlands, unfortunately, we do not sponsor any work visa or permits for this position. Proactive talent acquisition from third parties is not appreciated.

title: APPLICATIE BEHEERDER
summary:
Applicatiebeheer; gebruikersbeheer, updating en support bij master data beheer.
Op het gebied van data werk je nauw samen met onze Business Analist.
description: Jouw energie kunnen wij goed gebruiken! Heb jij de energie om onze strategiepijler “Data Driven” werken nog meer body te geven en concreet bij te dragen aan het realiseren van onze ambitie? In 2025 creëren we 100 miljoen energiemomenten met impact. Gio Coffee is een no-nonsens organisatie waar de lijnen kort zijn en schakelen niet snel genoeg kan gaan. Data gedreven werken en continue innoveren past ons goed. Met een gezonde ambitie en een aanstekelijke energie weet jij te het optimale uit IT systemen te halen!   Jouw baan bij Gio Coffee Op dit moment werkt ons projectteam samen met onze implementatiepartner aan een go-live van MS Dynamics CE/BC voor begin 2021. Vanaf dan ben jij in de lead. Vanuit business perspectief zie jij het als een kans om met de systemen binnen Gio Coffee impact te maken en daarmee onze dienstverlening te professionaliseren. . Je weet je in no-time vast te bijten in onze werkwijze door in gesprek te gaan met de verschillende teams en met oprechte interesse hun rol in het geheel te door gronden. Je denk in kansen en streeft naar het beste, waarin jouw mentaliteit in is gesteld op “beter dan nu” en daarmee snel stappen te kunnen maken. Jouw focus ligt op de optimale inrichting en werking van ons ERP Systeem. Hetgeen IT en Data raakt spreekt jou aan en ga je graag mee aan de slag. Kort gezegd: Applicatie beheer, Projectmanagement en IT & Data support is jouw span of control. Applicatiebeheer; gebruikersbeheer, updating en support bij master data beheer. Je gaat aan de slag met gebruikersvragen, lost incidenten op, signaleert trends en voert optimalisaties door. Daarnaast ben je verantwoordelijk voor een goede auditing van wijzigingen, up-to-date documentatie en het trainen van de gebruikers. Projectmanagement; vanuit klant- en gebruikersperspectief tuig je projecten op om systeem en behoefte nog beter op elkaar aan te laten sluiten. Je stapt pro actief de business in om de vraag achter de vraag te doorgronden en vertaalt deze naar technische oplossingen. Je focust je daarbij niet alleen op de inhoud, maar ook op de planning & scope, doorlooptijd en kosten. IT & Data support; IT vraagstukken grijp jij met beide handen aan. Naast je operationele werkzaamheden ben je scherp op een optimale inzet van middelen en systemen. Op het gebied van data werk je nauw samen met onze Business Analist. Innoveren, optimaliseren en groeien op data gedreven werken is jullie gezamenlijke verantwoordelijkheid. Je start onder zijn begeleiding, maar streeft naar zelfstandigheid. Om de continuïteit van de business te borgen betrekken jullie elkaar in jullie werkzaamheden. Innoveren; Eén van onze 4 kernwaarden is innovatie, in deze rol vanzelfsprekend. Je zorgt dat je bij blijft op technische gebied en nieuwe functionaliteiten en oplossingen eigen maakt. Je kent de mogelijkheden en zet deze in voor de meest effectieve oplossingen.

title: Senior Fraud Analyst
summary: Working closely with cross-functional teams of data, Product owner, backend engineers, analysts, payment specialists, business teams.
description: Why Recharge.com At Recharge.com, we make recharging digital prepaid credit for yourself or someone else fast, safe & simple - anytime, anywhere. Our customers use our platform to recharge their accounts in various services from App Store & iTunes or Google Play, to call credit operators or prepaid credit card providers worldwide. Our customers love to share their experiences with us publicly which has led to our current Trustpilot score of 4.5! This drives us to ensure we live up to their expectations on a daily basis. Our work hard - play hard mentality keeps us going, to learn more about our culture check out our Instagram or browse our company website.  The Role We’re on the hunt for a world-class risk professional who is passionate about protecting customers and businesses from any fraudulent activities. As part of the Payments and Risk team, you will participate in the fraud strategy of the company with the use of data and fraud prevention tools to accurately identify and analyze fraud patterns, trends, assess risks and recommend actions to optimize our security flows to keep all fraud and risk KPIs under control.  What you have  Bachelor’s Degree in econometrics, statistics, mathematics, science or similar quantitative discipline At least 5 years’ work experience in Fraud, Risk and/or Compliance; preferably in the digital goods, financial or payments industry; Previous experience working in fraud detection and prevention, with an understanding of the impact that has on other areas in the company where business and product decisions are made Data analytics experience using SQL, Tableau and other big data tools; preferably in a financial services environment Strong analytical and statistical analysis skills in order to extract insights and recommendations Passionate about the details and ensuring reports are easy to digest, complete, accurate and meaningful Self-starter with high level of intellectual curiosity and growth mindset Great accountability & ownership that enables you to go the extra mile to solve and risk and fraud related matter Understanding of the Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS), PSD2 and other regulations in the payment industry Someone who likes to identify process improvements and brings ideas to the table  It's nice if you also have some extra skills such as... A super open mind & love for change to embrace new ideas, new ways of working, new cultures in our ultimate international workspace Relevant experience in the domain of ecommerce  You will work on things like  Acting as a fraud data expert for the business and be the point of reference for any fraud related queries or escalations made by the team or by other departments Supporting Recharge.com and its business in preventing, detecting and investigating fraud Daily monitoring of dashboards and reporting of fraud trends, attacks and actions taken. Monitoring and reporting of risk and fraud performance of new payment methods, markets or product launches Ensuring that fraud risk issues identified are monitored and reported to relevant departments and higher management and corrective actions are taken Proposing new and creative ideas on how to tackle fraud and improve security flows in a digital goods space Adjusting rules in risk engines, building experiments to test your hypothesis, and getting your hands on experience Lead monthly business reviews with risk suppliers to analyze risk performance and feed all this information back into the systems and risk models Collecting feedback from Customer Care and agents on tickets, manual investigations, reports of scams, police, fraud alerts and other customer related complaints on payments and risk Communicating to Customer Care and all relevant stakeholders of any changes in fraud and risk that could impact the operations Working closely with cross-functional teams of data, Product owner, backend engineers, analysts, payment specialists, business teams Managing ad hoc fraud investigations and collate reports for higher management meetings where required  What We Offer 30 days vacation, good compensation, pension contributions & one of the best relocation packages in Amsterdam. Choice of a Macbook Pro (13” or 15”) or a HP An international English-speaking office & free Dutch courses to help out with daily Dutch life Free lunch & snacks with veggie & vegan options Weekly boot camps, yoga & Friday drinks* Regular parties & celebrations* Online during Covid-19 restrictions

title: Big Data Operations Engineer
summary: Understand the impact that moving large amounts of data can have on production networks, and develop strategies to ensure that data arrives in a timely manner…
description: Optiver is a leading trading firm driven by technology with over one thousand employees globally. We pioneer our own trading strategies and systems using clean code and sophisticated technology, running a global network with thousands of high-performance low-latency applications that solve problems in nanoseconds. We are seeking a senior level Data Operations Engineer to join our Data Engineering team. Data is the lifeblood of Optiver's trading business, and the Data Engineering team ensures that traders, quant researchers, risk and compliance analysts have timely, accurate and complete data sets to drive their activities. A successful candidate will become both steward and champion for the firm's trading data archives and the systems which capture, transform and load trading data into those archives. What will you do Develop data storage strategies which will stay ahead of the scale of our archives and will continue to meet the evolving requirements of our user base, and work with other engineers within infrastructure to implement those strategies. Understand the impact that moving large amounts of data can have on production networks, and develop strategies to ensure that data arrives in a timely manner without impacting real-time data flows. Continue to evolve Optiver's data capture and time synchronization infrastructure to ensure completeness and accuracy of our archived trading data. Provide support for the firm's NoSQL data stores which feed the firm's operational and quantitative research activities. Implement, maintain, monitor and improve the Data Engineering team's ETL pipelines. What you will need Significant experience programming with Python. Significant experience engineering business-critical real-time ETL pipelines. Experience working with petabyte-scale data lakes. Experience with network capture and time synchronization infrastructure. Experience with distributed, high performance SQL and NoSQL database systems. Experience with large, high performance file systems and other storage technologies. Hands-on Linux system administration skills Exposure to basic network engineering concepts. Protocol level network analysis experience is a plus. Experience working collaboratively in a shared codebase. Strong face to face and written communication skills. Knowledge of the trading industry is a plus. What you can expect from us We understand that our best work is done together. We constantly ask ourselves how to do better, which creates a stimulating and fun environment, where you are seriously rewarded for your performance. To be concrete, we offer excellent remuneration and great secondary benefits, such as an attractive profit sharing structure, training opportunities, fully paid first-class commuting expenses, a premium-free pension, breakfast and lunch facilities, sports and leisure activities, even weekly chair massages and of course Friday afternoon drinks. We are used to guiding expats through their relocation and offer relocation packages and discounts on health insurance. More information on how Optiver Europe processes your personal data can be found in our Privacy Policy.

title: Advanced Analytics Specialist
summary: Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies together with data engineers that answer key questions about the…
description: The Advanced Analytics Specialist works on a variety of technology projects and initiatives, with a focus on developing and implementing data mining approaches, advanced analytics solutions, data ETL solutions and automations for our Order to Cash process, with focus on Forecast to Plan. The Advanced Analytics Specialist is the key member of S&OP team for deploying the right data and tooling strategy to meet the need of our team as well as business stakeholders.  Roles & Responsibilities  Leverage the power of data, analytics, robotics, science and cognitive technologies to mine and uncover hidden relationships from the data in the process, generate insights and inform better decision-making. Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies together with data engineers that answer key questions about the Demand and Supply planning for O&P, from Feedstock to sales Design, develop, test, validate and deploy data models, using techniques including data mining, ML algorithm, statistical modeling, predictive modeling, natural language processing Visualize the analytic and reporting solutions Interpret the validity of model results and communicate the meaning of those results to both non-technical and technical stakeholders Enhance your personal knowledge on advanced statistical techniques, predictive analytics and machine-learning Python, R and other relevant ETL tooling Power BI; SAP BW and Tableau Support knowledge build up within the S&OP team on advanced statistical techniques Stay up-to-date with Intelligent Automation technologies, capabilities, business applications, process mining, and be aware of innovations in this area Be the focal point for any ad-hoc data-related questions or designing and implementing structural data analysis-based process improvements and business propositions Represent the European S&OP team within the LYB Data Science community Technically design and deploy end-to-end reporting and analytics processes to optimize key end-to-end KPIs Together with the data engineering and IT colleagues To keep data up to date and operate as efficiently as possible, design and deploy automation of all data management through rules. Collaborate and support the Data Analyst and the SOP team on the data and reporting matters and projects Investigate RPA opportunities and assist in: Automating processes or process steps using self-service tools (Alteryx, VBA, Tableau Prep, Microsoft flow) in documenting incoming IA demand for GPS Automation & Reporting identifying potential processes to be automated with recommendations for benefits and savings capturing the as-is process and business requirement for automation candidates conducting RPA process feasibility assessment and cost-benefit analysis maintaining and ensuring continuity of implemented RPA Job Specifications  This position requires an individual with a University degree in engineering, Chemistry, Finance, Economics or related field of study. Should have 5+ years of experience mostly in manufacturing, commercial or supply chain functions. Must be a recognized professional with strong interpersonal skills, and possess broad knowledge of the chemical industry business, planning and economics. Must display a high level of initiative and have outstanding communication skills. Good understanding of SAP, IBP and other IT-systems setup as well as Offer to Cash process. Qualifications  Bachelor’s / Master degree in Engineering/Chemistry/Finance/Economics/related field of study Experience in a commercial, business or supply chain environment; Other degree with a minimum 2 years' hands on experience within data science, data analytics, process automation or process mining will be considered. Fluency in English  Skills:  Proficiency with a wide range of analytics techniques, such as statistics, ML Algorithms, natural language processing, optimization, simulation Proficiency with data extraction, transformation and manipulation within relational databases Experience in programming languages such as R, Python, VBA, SQL, Power Query Experience in data visualization tool, such as Tableau, Power BI Strong Knowledge of databases and SAP Good understanding of end to end processes in Forecast to Plan, Lead to Cash Experience in an Offer to Cash process or Procure to Pay process Communication (English) skills as well as project management skills Self-starter  Critical Competencies/Behaviors:  Planning – can organize one’s work effectively Evaluation and Analysis Drive for Results – gets things done Flexibility Communication and facilitation Time Management Self-motivated Interested ? title: Manager Business Analysis
summary:
As part of Digital Realty, customers now have access to over 280 data centres in 24 countries across six continents.
What's in it for you?
description: What's in it for you? Competitive package Employee Performance Bonus Working in faced-paced & continuously changing environment, Healthy lunch at a reduced rates , Nearby Hoofddorp station What is required? People management skills Analytical Effective communication skills Why Interxion? The opportunity to make an impact Highly collaborative teams that build relationships with world-class customers A high-performing international business at the heart of the digital economy  The Manager Business Analysis is managing a team of 10 to 12 (Senior) Business Analysts (in NL & UK) and is accountable for the Consistency, Quality and Alignment of all the Business Processes within & between the company’s Centres of Excellence (CoE). Next to managing the team, the Manager Business Analysis is expected to continuously improve and optimize the BA practices and standards of the team, while also perform the role as an individual Senior Business Analyst in various projects. The BA team will collaborate with Business & Development Leads, Product Marketing, Process owners & practitioners as well as the development teams to translate business objectives into requirements and confirm that (new) business application systems can be developed and / or enabled to meet business needs. Due to the globalized nature of Interxion’s customer base, consistent and standardized customer experiences becomes increasingly important together with the goal to improve the efficiency, effectiveness and scalability of Interxion’s workforce. Therefore, it is imperative that the Manager Business Analysis has required End to End process experience within the Business Process arena. The Manager Business Analysis is reporting directly to the Director Project Office  What you’ll need Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Business Administration or related discipline from an accredited institution; At least 8+ years’ experience in a Senior Business Analyst Role in a Project based environment; Experience working closely with IT Development teams (working with both remote / off-site and on-Site teams); Familiar with financial considerations, business cases etc.; Experience in building strong and efficient teams with an eye for the group dynamics; Good Planning & Organization skills, exemplary Analytical Skills; Good communication skills, independent worker, self-starter; Fluent written and spoken English is essential. Any other European language is an advantage; willing to travel regularly, mainly within Europe.  Project Office at Interxion We’re at the heart of everything that happens in Interxion. As the business continues to grow and change at a rapid pace, our Business Analysts and Project Managers work together to deliver the projects that support this growth. This could involve anything from improving business processes in finance or introducing automation in our customer service centre, to planning a new office or data centre. It’s challenging, varied and exciting work that exposes us to every area of the business.  About us At the heart of the global digital economy, we provide fast, secure connections that enable businesses to thrive and people to access online services. In March 2020, Interxion combined with Digital Realty and we are now proud to be known as Interxion: A Digital Realty company in Europe. As part of Digital Realty, customers now have access to over 280 data centres in 24 countries across six continents. To learn more about Digital Realty click here.  Apply? To apply, click on “Apply now’. You will be redirected to our candidate management system which we will use to manage your application. #LI-DK1  Apply now

title: Global Sales Business Intelligence Analyst
summary:
Experience communicating directly with decision-makers and influencing their decisions through the use of data.
We work fast, grow fast, and build fast.
description: Join our team either remotely or in our office in Amsterdam. This role can be based in any location within the EMEA region. About us MessageBird is transforming the communications landscape as one of the fastest-growing software companies in the world. Our cloud communications platform makes it possible for businesses to instantly connect with over 7 billion phones globally, allowing them to speak with their customers in the same ways they talk to their friends. Our suite provides access to all major messaging channels, from SMS and Voice to WeChat, Messenger, Facebook, WhatsApp and more. We provide out-of-the-box solutions with our own applications like Inbox and Flow Builder, plus a robust set of APIs that simplify workflows and automation. With over 20,000 customers — including some of the world's biggest brands like Facebook, Deliveroo, Uber and WhatsApp — it's likely that you've benefited from MessageBird's omnichannel technology at some point. For small and mid-sized businesses, we also offer support and solutions through an Online Self-Serve (OSS) dashboard. Our global team is a powerhouse of 350+ employees, who work across eight international offices. We're excited that you're here and interested to #jointhenest. How we work We work fast, grow fast, and build fast. Life at MessageBird moves in fast-forward motion. We're a team that focuses on making an impact — right from day one. We are go-getters, industry leaders, and dreamers. Risk takers. Roll-up-your-sleeves-and-make-it-happen kind of people. We thrive on transparency, and we value solution-minded attitudes. We are all driven by one ethos: Get Shit Done. We love shaping things together and leveraging different perspectives, because that makes our products better. Our Birds are empowered with freedom and opportunity; in return, we expect honesty, courage, and agility. We own our work, and sometimes we fail. And then we get back up and cross the finish line — together as a team. Sound refreshing? We think so, too. The role: Global Sales Business Intelligence Analyst As part of our Global Sales Operations team, you will play a key role in delivering data driven insights to the global sales team. Your responsibilities will include building dataflows, dashboards on multiple platforms and tools, designing structure and automation to ensure scalability, and providing analytical support to a broad range of sales initiatives. You will be particularly passionate about providing the best user experience by exposing key insights in a visual and revealing manner. You love to be creative and go beyond the original ask from the users. Supporting hypergrowth is a demanding job, and we are looking for people who can thoroughly enjoy and learn from the challenges. In exchange, you will get a lot of autonomy to execute your ideas, see the result of your own work, and grow together with the company. We are a team of doers, who actively identify the biggest problems and take initiative to solve them. What you'll do Partner with the global sales team to understand business objectives and define key metrics Run complex analyses & build specific business intelligence dashboards Write SQL and help to build better models, forging a continuous improvement environment Work with data scientists to build complex statistical models to segment users and predict their behaviors Make recommendations that will guide every small and large decision What you'll bring You have 2+ years of working experience with SQL Experience analysing large data outputs and conducting critical analysis using Excel/Looker/whatever tool to derive business insights Enjoy communicating complex analyses, data-heavy insights to the team with a simple, clear story Experience communicating directly with decision-makers and influencing their decisions through the use of data A tech-savvy mind, with experience of building BI dashboards in a tool such as Tableau, Looker, Power BI or other similar tools A customer-driven focus and the ability to quickly pivot in a fast-paced environment Psst… some added perks The ability to Work Anywhere — literally anywhere you want, as long as it's in the same time zone as your team (yup… you read that right!). This comes with the added benefit of finding the right work-life balance for you by following our 80/20 rule. WFH office set-up allowance to make sure you have all you need to "get shit done" in an ergonomically-friendly manner. Top-notch work equipment (including Bose headphones!). MessageBird swag to keep you well-dressed. The occasional (virtual) company-wide and team events. A team of (fast-)forward-thinking, talented and fun colleagues from more than 50 countries! MessageBird is an equal opportunity employer. If you think you're a match for this role and can bring some great skills to the MessageBird team, please apply! We're excited to get to know you. Read MessageBird's Recruitment Privacy Statement #LI-VH1 #LI-REMOTE

title: Data architect
summary:
Wij zoeken data architecten in spé en ervaren data architecten die inhoudelijke verdieping zoeken.
Hands-on ervaring met het bouwen van informatieproducten, als…
description: Wat vragen we? Je hebt minimaal HBO denkniveau met een data / technische achtergrond; Je hebt voor veel verschillende organisaties gewerkt; Hands-on ervaring met het bouwen van informatieproducten, als analist, datawarehouse ontwerper of als ontwerper van data logistieke processen. Je bent zeer kritisch, je weet jouw keuzes goed te onderbouwen en je weet wat consequenties zijn van jouw keuzes voor de werkvloer. Wat krijg je van ons? Een goed salaris; Een 32 tot 40-urige werkweek; 25 vakantiedagen; Een ruim leasebudget, NS businesscard, telefoon en laptop; Een riante bonusregeling en een goede pensioenregeling; Ruimte en tijd om jezelf te ontwikkelen en vakinhoudelijke trainingen. Wat ga je doen? Wij zoeken data architecten in spé en ervaren data architecten die inhoudelijke verdieping zoeken. Jij denkt na over hoe informatie gebruikt wordt binnen een organisatie. Je geeft informatieoplossingen vorm die het best passend zijn bij de organisatie waarvoor je werkt en die de klant in staat stelt het datalandschap op eigen benen verder uit te bouwen. Wij zoeken architecten die niet bang zijn om achter hun beslissingen te gaan staan, maar wel altijd de organisatie meenemen in de keuzes die gemaakt worden en die niet bang zijn om hun eigen opvattingen ter discussie te stellen. Transparant zijn in wat je doet en waarom je het doet is kenmerkend voor hoe wij de architectuurdiscipline uitvoeren. Jouw groeipad Wanneer blijkt dat je daar gevoel voor hebt kan je doorgroeien naar project- of domeinarchitect. Je neemt dan de verantwoordelijkheid op je om het datadomein binnen een organisatie vorm te geven, te specificeren welke functionaliteit er geleverd moeten worden en ervoor te zorgen dat vraag en oplossingen op elkaar blijven aansluiten. Data architect Project- of domein architect Werken bij Clup Consultants Kantoor in Amsterdam Ruim 20 gelijkgestemde collega's De Randstad als werkgebied

title: Python/Data Engineer
summary:
Collaborate with domain experts, analysts and data scientists to solve data challenges.
Knowledge of data modeling and data warehousing concepts.
description: We are looking for a Data Engineer to join the data team at Matrixian Group, who will help design and develop the pipelines and algorithms to build and extend features in the Matrixian Platform. You will work with fellow data engineers to maintain and improve our infrastructure to collect, structure, improve and share data with downstream and client-facing applications for Real Estate, Address Intelligence and Urban Intelligence. Full-time · Amsterdam About the job role As a data engineer you'll work on data collection, data pipelines, ETL, databases, and APIs. You'll help further develop our Cloud and data center hosted infrastructure. Your work is instrumental to keep our complex, distributed platform resilient to data integrity issues, service disruptions and free from vulnerabilities. You will structure our data so it flows efficiently and securely through the data pipelines to meet client SLA’s and security standard requirements. Your passion is to work with the latest and greatest technologies that make working with large amounts of data easy. You are pro-active in keeping yourself up to date and are always looking for ways how to apply new technologies to our benefit. You will work closely and collaboratively in an Agile environment with our data scientists/analysts, Platform development engineers and product teams to take Matrixian data services from conception to production deployment. Job elements Collaborate with domain experts, analysts and data scientists to solve data challenges Apply data modelling methodologies and contribute to a robust data platform Design, develop, and test new data-related features for our platform Design, implement, and maintain scalable data pipelines Monitoring the already established data pipelines Create high-quality code that is scalable, reliable and reusable Optimize data pipelines and workflow to maximize operational performance and efficiency Give input on how to improve the scalability and security of our data platform Enable and run data migrations across different databases and different servers Manipulate, process and extract value from large disconnected datasets Manage individual project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables.   Requirements Strong programming skills in Python In-depth knowledge of data manipulation and transformation Hands-on experience building complex ETL data pipelines Experience in setting up/maintaining both SQL as well as noSQL databases Skilled in use of deployment and provisioning automation tools e.g. Docker Strong expertise/background with Linux Knowledge in security, authentication and authorization e.g. LDAP Knowledge of data modeling and data warehousing concepts Experience with version control/Git Strong written and verbal English communication skills Experience in Agile/Scrum Teamplayer Responsible Flexible Must-have skills MongoDB ElasticSearch MySQL Python 3.7 & 3.8 Experience with at least two of these Python packages: FastAPI, Flask, Requests, BeautifulSoup, Selenium Experience with at least two of these Python libraries: asyncio, concurrent futures, multiprocessing, threading Git / Version control Docker CI/CD Bash Linux Apache Airflow Web scraping What we offer Good salary 25 holidays 8% holiday pay Lots of responsibility, independence and room for initiatives and possibilities to make your mark

title: Math Analyst - Netherlands
summary:
Conducting and interpreting statistical testing on game simulation results and on RNG data.
Writing programs or scripts to manipulate, parse or reorganize large…
description: Math Analyst - Netherlands Haarlem, Netherlands Req #167 Thursday, February 18, 2021 See applied probabilities come to life as your work plays out on the casino floor. Casino gaming is more exciting than ever, with many games looking like action-packed video games. As Math Analyst, you’ll get a hands-on preview of these exciting new games before they hit the market. Working closely with the Engineering team, the Math Analyst devotes their time to finding solutions and fixing mistakes to ensure that each game works properly. This position is an entry-level opportunity for a graduate with a math background to apply their knowledge of probability, statistics and programming into a real-world application and working in standard game analysis, strategy game analysis, and/or random number generator (RNG) analysis.  Who We Are… We have been in the gaming industry for over 30 years but pride ourselves on looking forward. GLI is on the cutting edge of casino gaming technology and regulation, guiding clients through a dynamic, ever-changing landscape. We offer the stability of a global leader to both our clients and employees around the world.  Why You Should Work Here… Our many talented employees are the key to our success as a market leader. In addition to competitive salaries and benefits and the opportunity to engage with team members around the globe, we consistently invest in and support employee development so that you can continue to grow and succeed as you reach your full potential.  What You Will Accomplish Here…  A career with GLI opens up new pathways to success. As a worldwide market leader, we offer stability, along with a commitment to fostering your unique talents, allowing you to grow from entry-level to an expert in the field.  The Math Analyst’s main focus will be on the following:  Testing and Math Analysis Writing programs and performing other analyses to calculate needed mathematical features of games. Writing programs or scripts to manipulate, parse or reorganize large data files into standard formats for testing. Conducting and interpreting statistical testing on game simulation results and on RNG data. Reading and interpreting jurisdictional requirements, consulting appropriately for interpretation. Reviewing and Documenting Reading and modifying programs and analyses developed by others to meet testing needs. Reviewing, understanding, and documenting source code written in various languages. Writing project reports by summarizing the testing conducted and the results. Carefully reviewing analysis work conducted by others for accuracy. Communicating Externally and Internally Working with external clients, communicating professionally and courteously on topics of a technical nature Effectively communicating and collaborating with other members of the Math Department and other employees Experience, Education, Skills and Credentials: Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a closely related discipline Associate degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or 2+ years of equivalent experience may be considered; Certification, formal training, or experience may also be evaluated and considered in lieu of educational requirements Must have knowledge of Probability, Statistics, and Combinatorics Knowledge of a modern, object-oriented programming language such as C++, including appropriate use of object-oriented design is required Must have an understanding of core programming concepts and techniques Knowledge of Microsoft Excel is required Must have the ability to communicate, both orally and written, with other members of the team and external contacts Ability to handle and organize multiple projects and deadlines is required Must demonstrate a high degree of attention to quality, details, and correctness Must be able to pass a thorough background investigation Gaming Laboratories International (GLI) is a gaming company. Any of our employees may be required to obtain a gaming license within one or all of the gaming jurisdictions. If you are requested by GLI to obtain a gaming license, your continued employment may be contingent on your ability to obtain that gaming license.   This job description should not be interpreted as all-inclusive; it is intended to identify major responsibilities and requirements of the job. The incumbent may be requested to perform other job-related task and responsibilities than those stated above.  GLI is an Equal Opportunity Employer All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.   Other details Job Family Netherlands Pay Type Hourly

title: Business Analist Digital
summary:
Je hebt ervaring/affiniteit met data, informatie analyse, requirements engineering en user stories;
Informeel • Enthousiast • Bedreven • Agile • Scrum •…
description: • Informeel • Enthousiast • Bedreven • Agile • Scrum • Afwisseling • Team • Gezelligheid • Kennisdeling • Agency • Interim • Projecten • Workshops • Coaching • Ambitie • Digital • Tech •  Begon jouw hart zojuist iets sneller te kloppen bij het lezen van de keywords? Is het bouwen van digitale producten 'zeg maar helemaal jouw ding' en draai jij je hand niet om voor een sterk staaltje puzzel -en uitzoekwerk? Lees dan gauw verder, want dan kan deze rol als Business Analist jou wel eens op het lijf geschreven zijn.  Wie zijn wij? Noun is een Agile Agency binnen het Makerstreet Netwerk en levert interim Agile professionals en diensten. We zijn een gedreven groep bestaande uit: Scrum Masters, Product Owners en Business Analisten. We helpen elkaar graag nóg beter te worden in ons werk. Zo organiseren we geregeld een ‘Think and Drink’; een gezamenlijke sessie om onze kennis over -je raadt het al- Agile te vergroten. En oké, toegegeven: van een beetje gezelligheid op zijn tijd zijn we ook niet vies :-).  Wat ga je doen? Als Digital Business Analist bij Noun ga je op projectbasis aan de slag bij één van onze klanten. Van start-up tot corporate; onze opdrachtgevers hebben één ding gemeen: ze werken aan de ontwikkeling van toffe digitale producten of diensten. Uiteraard kom je daar niet alleen voor de gezelligheid (al is dat natuurlijk ook zeker niet onbelangrijk), maar wil je ook waarde toevoegen in de ontwikkeling van een digitaal product. Dit doe je door: Je team te ondersteunen om de sprint doelen te behalen; De klassieker, maar toch heel belangrijk: het fungeren als spil tussen business en IT; Het voortouw te nemen in refinements en sprint-planning sessies; Heel nauw samen te werken (en altijd helder te communiceren) met zowel het team als de Product Owner; Vragen op te halen bij de stakeholders en niet bang te zijn om diep in de details te duiken; De wensen van de business te onderzoeken -en vertalen naar functionele requirements  Wie ben jij?  Je hebt interesse -en ervaring in 'de Agile way of working'; Je werkt nu zo'n 3 jaar in een soortgelijke functie, het liefst al als Business Analist; Je hebt 'a thing' voor digital en innovatie; Het lijkt je leuk om bij veel bedrijven een kijkje in de keuken te nemen; Je beschikt over een HBO/WO-papiertje; Je spreekt -en schrijft vloeiend Nederlands en Engels; Je hebt ervaring/affiniteit met data, informatie analyse, requirements engineering en user stories; Je werkt precies en bent nieuwsgierig van aard. Kom jij een organisatie binnen? Geen deurtje blijft ongeopend. ***Please note: due to the nature of our work, only Business Analists who are fluent in Dutch can apply for this job***

title: Fleet Analyst
summary:
Responsibility for importing and maintain data within our internal systems.
Present data in a clear format for presentations and regular KPI reviews.
description: The Role  The Fleet Operations team are responsible for the optimization of our operating fleet vehicle assets across EMEA. The Allocation Analyst's main responsibility is to ensure the right vehicles at the right place can be sold at the optimal time, for the correct price. This role is critical to Tesla’s success, and directly impacts our business strategy, ability to achieve sales and delivery goals. You will be responsible for analysis and execution of allocation strategies for the European Vehicle Fleet including sold and unsold vehicles. The successful candidate will leverage their analytical skills and expertise to apply fundamental business concepts, which will ensure EMEA’s fleet is appropriately stocked. You will utilize your experience to build a robust data infrastructure to support the fleet inventory management program. You will be part of a collaborative team operating in a fast paced, evolving environment. This role is based in Amsterdam, Netherlands. Responsibilities: Create, evolve and utilize reporting and tools to analyze your business to support decisions that maximize sales, inventory turn and ultimately profitability across our European business. Create and maintain reports and tools for internal stakeholders in collaboration with the analytics team. Distribute dashboards that provide the field teams visibility into our allocation strategies. Create ad-hoc analysis and reports as business needs arises. Partner with Demand Planning & Logistics to route supply in accordance with regional markets needs Manage inventory brochure to ensure correct vehicle assortment is available per market Implement campaigns affecting vehicle pricing and options changes and migrations Audit pricing on inventory catalogues to ensure accuracy and consistency Responsibility for allocation of for-sale product as well as collaborating with assignment of our Operating Fleet Execute reallocation strategies and aide in ensuring that European stock is appropriately balanced. Aide in developing and executing quarterly allocation strategies for our European retail business. Provide accurate and insightful analysis and reporting of European stock balances based on aligned criteria and metrics. Present data in a clear format for presentations and regular KPI reviews. Responsibility for importing and maintain data within our internal systems Participate in department projects to improve systems or efficiencies. Gather requirements for systematic improvements. Assist with periodic physical inventory Fleet Audits Occasional escalation support, assuring customer satisfaction and operations readiness are secure Perform other related administrative and supportive duties as assigned. Requirements for the position include: Relevant previous working experience Experience within a planning or decision-driving analytical role would be highly desirable Strong quantitative critical thinking skills, with advanced knowledge of Excel Proficiency with Microsoft Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint Aptitude for learning new systems/technical applications Outstanding attention to detail, without losing sight of the big picture Ability to leverage, influence and inspire action in others High level of intellectual curiosity, coupled with ability to identify trends and make recommendations to maximize performance Ability to form strong cross-functional business relationships Demonstrated ability to implement and drive change and new processes from idea to conception Enthusiasm and aptitude for working in a fast-paced, collaborative environment, with a high degree of ambiguity Highly self-directed and results-oriented individual Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously and prioritize tasks based on demand despite changes in work scope or focus Open-minded, collaborative and team-oriented attitude with the ability to think outside the box for solutions to complex challenges Fluency in English required, additional languages would be beneficial

title: Business Analyst
summary:
Als analist ben je de schakel tussen de data en de business en werk je naast de business teams ook nauw samen met BI en Data Science.
Hoe maak jij het verschil.
description: We willen de #1 worden in hoofden en harten van gezinnen in Nederland. Dat is onze visie. Onze missie is om het leven van gezinnen in Nederland mooier én makkelijker te maken. Onze klanten vertellen ons dat geluk niet alleen in grote momenten zit, maar juist in de kleine dingen: een spontaan kussengevecht, een complimentje of een knuffel. Daarom bieden wij klanten elke dag ruimte voor verrassend mooie momenten. Dat is onze purpose. Zo willen wij het verschil maken. Hoe maak jij het verschil Binnen de afdeling Business Analytics & Reporting zijn we op zoek naar een business analyst. Je bent verantwoordelijk voor opstellen en beheren van rapportages, ad hoc analyses en modellen die input zijn voor verschillende afdelingen binnen Wehkamp.  Het doel is om het bedrijf beter te laten presteren op basis van de uitkomsten van jouw analyses. Om dit te bereiken stop je niet na het opleveren van een analyse, maar geef je gevraagd en ongevraagd advies en durf je je mening te geven. Je neemt deel in projecten en leert collega’s binnen onder andere Finance & Control, Buying & Sales en Customer & Operations hoe beschikbare BI applicaties en instrumenten te gebruiken.  Als analist ben je de schakel tussen de data en de business en werk je naast de business teams ook nauw samen met BI en Data Science. Het feit dat jouw analyses en inzichten bijdragen aan het succes van de nummer één online retailer in Nederland vormt de motivatie die je nodig hebt om het beste uit jezelf, en anderen, te halen. Wat breng je mee en wat zetten wij hier tegenover We zoeken iemand met sterk ontwikkelde intelligence capaciteiten met bij voorkeur een ruime dosis statistiek en wiskunde in de gevolgde WO opleiding. Je hebt ervaring met SAS Enterprise Guide, Databricks en/of Tableau (of vergelijkbare systemen) Je kunt daarbij goed uit de voeten met een programmeertaal als R, Python of SQL. Verder heb je affiniteit met (Online) Retail Grote databestanden bieden jou de uitdaging om net even verder te zoeken en je vindt het leuk om op de hoogte te blijven van de nieuwste analysetechnieken. Je pakt complexe problemen gestructureerd aan. Naast het feit dat je in staat bent om informatie en kennis uit data te behalen heb je sterk ontwikkelde communicatieve vaardigheden, die jou in staat stellen om jouw uitkomsten begrijpelijk te presenteren en anderen te overtuigen. Je vindt het leuk om in een team te functioneren, toont ambitie en neemt op basis van jouw kennis het voortouw. Hierbij verlies je natuurlijk het praktische en commerciële nut niet uit het oog. Vervolgstappen Wat gebeurt er na je sollicitatie? Voor deze vacature ziet het proces er als volgt uit: Sluiten jouw verwachtingen en onze wensen op elkaar aan? Dan nodigen we je uit voor een eerste interview Wanneer jij en wij enthousiast zijn plannen we een uitgebreide kennismaking met je in. Hierna hoor je zo snel mogelijk van ons of we je als onze collega zien. In dat geval doen we je een aanbod. Wanneer dat niet zo is, dan krijg je uiteraard goede feedback van ons waar je wat mee kan. Wehkamp aanvaardt geen ongevraagde hulp van intermediair/ uitzendbureaus of andere derden voor deze vacature. Toegestuurde cv’s (in welke vorm dan ook) door genoemde partijen aan enige medewerkers van Wehkamp zonder geldige schriftelijke zoekopdracht van onze HR Afdeling, worden beschouwd als publieke informatie. Er zal aan genoemde partijen geen vergoeding zijn verschuldigd in geval van een kandidaat wordt aangenomen van wie ongevraagd het cv en/of andere gegevens zijn toegestuurd.

title: Junior Operations Manager
summary:
Analyseren (samen met onze data analist) van grote hoeveelheden data, trends en ontwikkelingen, zowel in- als extern;
Wat krijg je ervoor terug?
description: Junior Operations Manager We zijn op zoek naar een enthousiaste junior Operations Manager, die actief wil bijdragen aan onze missie om deelmobiliteit voor iedereen beschikbaar te maken. Fulltime • Utrecht Binnen de Nederlandse Operatie bij GO Sharing is een vacature ontstaan voor een sterke Junior Operations Manager. Het Nederlandse Operations team bestaat uit regio managers, fleet coordinators en power rangers die gezamenlijk verantwoordelijk zijn voor de revenue operations in de gebieden in Nederland waar GO Sharing actief is. Deze rol, rapporterend aan het hoofd van de Operatie in Nederland, zal in hiërarchie tussen de regio managers instaan en heeft ten doel hen te helpen met het behalen van het beste resultaat. De primaire focus voor de Jr Operations Manager ligt op het opstellen en waarborgen van duidelijke en werkzame processen alsmede bij het dagelijks monitoren en waar nodig bijsturen van de operationele KPIs. Het is hierbij van belang dat de verschillende regio’s met elkaar verbonden en vergeleken worden om best practices te identificeren en over te nemen. Daarnaast wordt van deze rol verwacht een goede kijk te hebben op procesverbetering en projecten op te pakken om de operatie strakker in te richten (verhoging van de omzet en/of verlaging van de kosten). Voor deze rol is naast goed proces- en projectmatig kunnen werken een sterke affiniteit met de operatie en een “voeten in de klei” aanpakkersmentaliteit van belang. Hierbij is de verwachting dat de Jr Operations Manager regelmatig op de verschillende hub locaties in Nederland tijd doorbrengt om te proeven wat er ècht speelt in de operatie. Het snel doorgronden en analyseren van data en processen is hierbij van groot belang, maar op zichzelf staand niet voldoende. Juist het vertalen van theoretische kennis naar praktische implementatie is waar de Jr Operations Manager floreert.  Wat worden jouw taken en verantwoordelijkheden? Verzorgen van operationele management informatie richting COO, inclusief analyse en presentatie, ter ondersteuning van besluitvorming van het management; Analyseren (samen met onze data analist) van grote hoeveelheden data, trends en ontwikkelingen, zowel in- als extern; Functioneren als sparring partner voor zowel de COO als het regiomanagement, met specialisme en volwaardige ondersteuning voor het domein Operations; Tijdig identificeren, actie ondernemen en zo nodig escaleren van problemen die de performance van de bedrijfsvoering beïnvloeden; Proactief onderhouden, ondersteunen, adviseren en uitvoeren van de kwartaalplanning; Het opmaken, presenteren en sturen op een wekelijks operational heartbeat dashboard; Ondersteunen en uitvoeren van diverse ad-hoc/project werkzaamheden waarbij operationele expertise en proceskennis benodigd is; Deelnemen aan operationeel overleg met de regio’s voor transparantie en stroomlijning.  Wie ben jij? Je beschikt over een afgeronde HBO- of WO opleiding; Je hebt minimaal 1-3 jaar werkervaring op het vakgebied van operatie, project- en/of proces management; Je bent communicatief sterk en in staat om interne relaties op te bouwen; Je denkt en werkt aantoonbaar gestructureerd en kan goed plannen en organiseren; Je bent resultaatgericht, hebt een hands-on mentaliteit en bent niet bang je handen uit de mouwen te steken; Je bent uiterst behendig in MS Excel en MS Powerpoint; Je hebt een zeer goede beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal in gesproken en geschreven vorm.  Verder zouden de volgende elementen mooie pluspunten kunnen zijn voor een ideale kandidaat: Je hebt (een) diploma(’s) op het gebied van projectmanagement of procesverbetering; Je hebt ervaring met Operational Business Controlling Je bent meer taal/talen machtig, naast Nederlands en Engels.  Wat krijg je ervoor terug? Een veelzijdige en uitdagende functie met veel verantwoordelijkheid en exposure aan senior management; Een jong en zeer ambitieus team; Een moderne werkplek in Utrecht met uitstekende bereikbaarheid en heerlijke lunches (afhankelijk van de COVID-19 maatregelen); Een marktconform salaris met een zeer interessante pensioenopbouw (PMT); Een laptop en werktelefoon; Onbeperkt gratis GO Sharing scooter rijminuten!

title: Business Project Manager
summary: The perfect candidate will bring exceptional strategic and communication skills but also the know-how to interact with diverse stakeholders and the ability to…
description: About us Beat is one of the most exciting companies to ever come out of the ride-hailing space.
