One city at a time, all across the globe we make transportation affordable, convenient, and safe for everyone. We also help hundreds of thousands of people earn extra income as drivers. Today we are the fastest-growing ride-hailing service in Latin America. But serving millions of rides every day pales in comparison to what lies ahead. Our plans for expansion are limitless. Our stellar engineering team operates across a number of European capitals where, right now, some of the world’s most ambitious and talented engineers are changing how cities will move in the future. Beat is currently available in Greece, Peru, Chile, Colombia, Mexico, and Argentina. About the role We are looking for a Business Project Manager with a bias for action, a focus on effective communication and solutioning to help us shape our supply and demand. You will work on some of our most challenging problems Beat is solving today relating to price, dispatching and driver earnings. The perfect candidate will bring exceptional strategic and communication skills but also the know-how to interact with diverse stakeholders and the ability to utilise a strong team of analysts and data scientists. If you’re a strategic thinker who is excited to deep-dive into a dynamic marketplace landscape and who can support Beat to be the best it can be for its customers, business growth & efficiency, we want to hear from you. This is a unique opportunity to influence decision making in one of the fastest growing ride-hailing apps in the Latin America. You will report directly to the Head of Marketplace Operations. What you’ll do: The role will offer the opportunity to put your critical thinking and problem-solving skills into practice. You will have the chance to explore data, KPIs and reports to seek out strategic opportunities to improve and optimise Pricing strategy, Dispatch & Ride UX. You’ll apply your skills in Project Management to lead crucial projects, acting as a consultant within and outside the team, build processes for our workstreams and the communication with the stakeholders. By being a strong individual contributor and an empathic team player, you will have to: Daily check on the performance of our markets, discuss with the local operation teams about the challenges and the opportunities and come up with ideas for deeper analysis and actions Drive projects end-to-end around marketplace optimization Become a subject matter expert in the marketplace dynamics of the ride-hailing industry, understanding both the big picture and the small details Act as a point of contact for the stakeholders (LATAM Operation / Product / Engineering) of the team and drive alignment Prioritize initiatives based on business needs and requirements Develop a deep understanding of the business problem among the team, so to trigger the solution process Lead business analysis tasks and processes end to end in order to achieve required business results Update, implement and maintain processes. Review and analyse of current processes using operational metrics and reports  What do you need to have 3+ years of progressive experience in a PMO / Project Manager / Business Analyst / Consultant or similar role Business knowledge of the market, technology and competitive environment in the ride-hailing industry will be considered a plus Excellent Strategic thinking and interpersonal / communication skills Very good analytical and conceptual skills with ability to combine and integrate data from several sources Excellent Knowledge of MS Office suite Strong problem solving skills and ability to work under tight deadlines A degree in Business Management / Economics or relevant field is ideal What’s in it for you This is a unique opportunity to join a scaling successful business and at the same time still get a lot of freedom in your job. Actually we will expect you to approach things differently and beyond regular. You will join a team of people who grow this business as their own and are inspired by the idea of creating the best user experience in the world. You will be part of an environment which gives you unlimited opportunities for growth professionally and personally. And of course, you will enjoy numerous learning and career development opportunities, together with competitive salary and benefits, including flexible working hours and an amazing workspace.  As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, Beat is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, colour, national origin, ethnicity, gender, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion.

title: Global Procurement Analyst
summary:
Knowledge in data modelling in order to support data linkage and data quality initiatives.
Drive the detailed data analysis supporting the execution of Tenders …
description: We're currently looking for a Global Procurement Analyst to join our Procurement team! The Global Procurement Analyst position reports to the Global Procurement A & I Senior Manager within the CoE. The Analyst works closely with the sourcing teams across Europe as well as with Finance and occasionally with business functions within the Liberty Global group. What will you be doing? Drive the (monthly) performance reporting for selected global sourcing team(s) Drive the detailed data analysis supporting the execution of Tenders & Supplier Selection: understanding relevant data requirements, collecting data, analyzing data by running scenarios, price comparison, etc Drive the detailed data analysis supporting the execution of Contract & Supplier Relationship Management activities such as identification of KPIs, performance monitoring, warranties tracking, etc. Support the global supply market team savings calculation including Finance validation Collect and analyze meaningful external data on suppliers and supply markets to support the analysis needs of the relevant Procurement teams Execute ad hoc operational requests for the Supply Markets We tend to look for people with: Knowledge & Experience: Academic background (Master/Bachelor): a degree in a quantitative science (Statistics, Computer Sciences, etc.) or in an Economic science with strong analytical profile Experience as an analyst: including advanced Excel, Power Query & PowerBI knowledge is a plus Knowledge in data modelling in order to support data linkage and data quality initiatives Preferably understanding Procurement: ability to run independently procurement concepts such as TCO analysis, price benchmarking, cost-based price modeling, scenarios modeling for RfX analysis and procurement strategies and levers, supporting business cases, savings calculations, and general procurement management reporting . Preferably understanding Financial impacts. Seeks to turn data analysis into relevant business information. Demonstrates the ability to interpret data results and articulate financial rationale for key decisions. Fluency (oral & written) in English. Other languages from the LG footprint are a plus. Skills & Behaviour: Presentation skills Communication skills Global and Cultural Alertness Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment Customer/service focused Proactive/self-motivated Why Liberty Global?  Liberty Global is the world’s largest international TV and broadband company, with operations in 11 European countries under the consumer brands Virgin Media, Unitymedia, Telenet and UPC.. Our deep-rooted family heritage and entrepreneurial energy have shaped our unique culture and incredible growth journey. And the best is yet to come.  At times it can be a crazy place to work and navigate. You have to like a bit of chaos and be comfortable with ambiguity. Growing with us means taking a chance: to stretch outside your comfort zone, to grow through unprecedented and unpredictable change, to have the freedom to experience new possibilities, to supercharge your development.  The application process at Liberty Global includes a background check regarding, but not limited to employment, education, reference checks and may include a criminal background check.

title: Finance Analyst Global Functions Controlling
summary:
Aggregate various sources of data while maintaining data integrity and accuracy.
Excellent excel modelling skills with high attention to details and ability to…
description: We are looking for a Finance Analyst to join our Global Functions controlling team based in Coty’s headquarters in Amsterdam. You will be actively involved in a broad variety of topics, revolving around global functions cost controlling and transverse projects, exposing you to our senior stakeholders.  What You'll do: Act as a sparring partner to the Controlling Director Global functions Proactively work on monthly closing, reporting and analysis, constantly aiming at enhancing the quality of the deliverables Identify, track and solve issues Be a key player in the forecast, plan and strategic plan processes, working closely with the global functions controlling team and business planning Create and implement capabilities and drumbeat for Global Functions Controlling Provide senior stakeholders with ad-hoc high-quality financial analysis Strong team player to foster efficient delivery of all financial cycles Aggregate various sources of data while maintaining data integrity and accuracy Network intensively within and beyond Global Function’s controlling team to push for harmonization of processes, ways of working, tools Support the Finance director on transverse projects  What You'll bring: Experience in Finance (Controlling and/or Audit) Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Finance & Accounting preferred or equivalent work experience Profound Excel skills and systems experience (SAP, Hyperion and BI) Analytical thinking, strong ownership to take initiative and to drive action and results Outstanding written and verbal communication Self-motivated, high level of transparency and integrity, enjoy working in fast evolving business environment Excellent excel modelling skills with high attention to details and ability to manage large amounts of data from different sources Experience in project management especially as it relates to systemic tracking and reporting

title: Junior Consultant
summary: Onze ervaren consultants zijn bijvoorbeeld actief als projectmanager, business consultant, teammanager, bestuursadviseur, pensioenadviseur, data-analist,…
description: De pensioenbranche saai…?! Zeker weten van niet! Als er ergens een interessant carrièreperspectief te bieden valt, dan is dat binnen onze branche en bij PMT Groep! De komende jaren staan de stelselwijziging, robotisering, (data)migraties en procesverbeteringen uitgebreid op de agenda. Ter uitbreiding van ons bestaande team, zijn wij op zoek naar een aantal onlangs afgestudeerde hbo en wo-ers, die gaan werken in projecten en opdrachten bij onze opdrachtgevers (o.a. a.s.r., Nationale Nederlanden, MN, Achmea en Reaal/Vivat). Beelden zeggen meer dan woorden dus klik HIER voor onze korte bedrijfspresentatie. Wat ga je doen? Als consultant kom je bij verschillende verzekeraars of pensioenuitvoerders terecht. Iedere opdracht en iedere opdrachtgever is anders. De ene keer kom je als junior in een project terecht en ben je binnen no-time specialist op dat gebied. Een andere keer kom je op een algemene opdracht, en leer je weer hoe bepaalde wetgeving of beleid werkt. Je start je loopbaan als junior consultant met een intensief opleidingstraject, waarbij je veel gaat leren over het vakgebied pensioen, jezelf (persoonlijke ontwikkeling) en PMT Groep. Vervolgens ga je aan de slag! Je werkt in eerste instantie ondersteunend mee in diverse projecten bij de opdrachtgevers. Via interne opleidingen heb je in eerste jaar al je diploma’s Wft Basis, Wft Vermogen en Wft Pensioen op zak. Perspectief Na je oriëntatie ga je je steeds meer specialiseren, bijvoorbeeld richting de actuariële kant, projectmanagement, consultancy of ICT. Je krijgt ook steeds meer uitbreiding van taken en verantwoordelijkheden. In deze fase komt het aan op je inzicht in de materie, waarin je bent opgeleid en de administratieve ervaring hebt opgedaan. Op basis van je ontwikkeling en functioneren kun je doorgroeien binnen PMT Groep. Onze ervaren consultants zijn bijvoorbeeld actief als projectmanager, business consultant, teammanager, bestuursadviseur, pensioenadviseur, data-analist, actuarieel- specialist en ICT-specialist. Wie zijn wij? Wij zijn een ontwikkelingsgerichte, professionele en platte organisatie met ambitieuze collega’s, binnen de snel veranderende wereld van de pensioenbranche. We houden van gezelligheid, dus er is ook zeker tijd voor een borrel, sportief evenement, een etentje, of een PMT-weekend. Daarnaast houden we ook jouw privéleven in het oog, want jij bent op je best als je een goede balans hebt tussen werk en privé! Je wordt binnen PMT Groep opgeleid en bij je opdrachtgever(s) begeleid door ervaren consultants, die veelal de projectleider of teammanager bij je opdrachtgever zijn. Zowel binnen PMT Groep als bij je opdrachtgever is er dus volop begeleiding en coaching. Kortom, hoe snel jij je ontwikkelt, is vooral afhankelijk van jezelf! Wie ben jij? Als Junior Consultant breng je het volgende mee: Een (bijna) afgeronde hbo of wo-diploma; • Maximaal een tot twee jaar werkervaring; • Je woont in de Randstad omdat onze opdrachten veelal in de Randstad zijn; • Je bent ambitieus, flexibel en hebt een positieve instelling; • Je krijgt energie van de combinatie doen & denken. Wat bieden wij? Prima, flexibele arbeidsvoorwaarden met grote keuzevrijheid (€ 2.250,- bij aanvang, 8,33 % vakantiegeld, 25 vakantiedagen, plus 2 dagen bedoeld voor opleiding, kort verlof en calamiteiten, een reiskostenvergoeding). Een intensieve interne opleidingsperiode waarin je de basisbeginselen van het pensioenvak bijgebracht worden; • Een persoonlijk opleidingsbudget waarmee je ook na de interne opleidingsmaand continu erkende opleidingen kan volgen; • De ideale mogelijkheid om je te ontwikkelen binnen onze branche; • Uitdagende opdrachten en projecten bij gerenommeerde opdrachtgevers. Enthousiast? Ben je enthousiast geworden? Dan horen we graag van jou! Stuur je cv en een korte motivatie naar Tessa Stegman via stegman@pmtgroep.nl of naar Twan van der Poel via poel@pmtgroep.nl. Mocht je nog vragen hebben… bel gerust naar 06-34127713 of 06-23380641!

title: Analyst Advisory
summary:
We are looking for a experienced analyst to strengthen us in:
Analyze financial data of public / private records of companies and develop financialmodels for…
description: BNP Paribas is a leading bank in Europe with an international reach. It has a presence in 71 countries, with approximately 199,000 employees, of which more than 151,000 in Europe. The Group has key positions in its three main activities: Domestic Markets and International Financial Services (whose retail-banking networks and financial services are covered by Retail Banking & Services) and Corporate & Institutional Banking, which serves two client franchises: corporate clients and institutional investors. The Group helps all its clients (individuals, community associations, entrepreneurs, SMEs, corporate and institutional clients) to realise their projects through solutions spanning financing, investment, savings and protection insurance. In Europe, the Group has four domestic markets (Belgium, France, Italy and Luxembourg) and BNP Paribas Personal Finance is the European leader in consumer lending. BNP Paribas is rolling out its integrated retail-banking model in Mediterranean countries, in Turkey, in Eastern Europe and a large network in the western part of the United States. In its Corporate & Institutional Banking and International Financial Services activities, BNP Paribas also enjoys top positions in Europe, a strong presence in the Americas as well as a solid and fast-growing business in Asia-Pacific. In the Netherlands BNP Paribas is one of the largest and leading non-Dutch banks. Thanks to our global network combined with our local expertise, we unlock business opportunities across the world for our clients. For our Advisory team we are looking for an Analyst Advisory Netherlands The position: We are looking for a experienced analyst to strengthen us in: M&A advisory for private or listed companies; Equity Capital Markets transactions: capital increases, IPOs, accelerated bookbuilding,(subordinated) convertible bond issues and equity-linked transactions; Public Take Overs or Privatizations; Fairness opinions; Financial restructuring. Key responsibilities: Conduct fundamental research on a wide range of companies / industries to assist inthe preparation of pitch materials and reports; Analyze financial data of public / private records of companies and develop financialmodels for forecasting & valuation; Client management and managing day-to-day deal work: build relationships andmaintain direct contact with clients, prospective clients and professional advisors; Collaborate with and support other international teams and share information / insights; Take responsibility for expanding the BNP Paribas franchise; Operate under the following principles: integrity, responsiveness, accountability,creativity, innovation, and team work. The requirements: Master’s degree preferably in Accountancy / Finance / Economics or equivalent Previous internships and work experience (2-3 yrs) preferably at either a tier-one, bulge bracket, or boutique investment bank Fundamental understanding of financial valuation theory and methodologies A good understanding of M&A / ECM processes Excellent Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint skills Fluency in Dutch and English. Other languages would be an advantage A strongly developed strategic sense, team spirit and the ability to work underpressure, without losing your sense of humor.  Do you recognise yourself in this profile? We are looking forward to receiving your application! As part of the application procedure there is an assessment and Pre-Employment Screening (PES). A PES includes a check of your ID and credentials, a statement of good behaviour and a statement regarding liability at the time of commencement of employment.

title: Meld je aan voor onze Business & IT pool in regio Eindhoven!
summary:
Wij hebben verschillende Business & IT vacatures openstaan bij onze opdrachtgevers in regio Eindhoven.
Meld je aan voor deze vacature om op de hoogte te blijven…
description: Wij hebben verschillende Business & IT vacatures openstaan bij onze opdrachtgevers in regio Eindhoven. Meld je aan voor deze vacature om op de hoogte te blijven van de vacatures die bij jouw profielschets passen! Wat ga je doen?  De opdrachtgevers zoeken naar functies als, Business Analist, Big Data Engineer, Data Analist en DevOps Engineer. Er zijn mogelijkheden door heel Noord-Brabant. Wij bellen je zodra we een passende uitdaging voor je hebben. Waar precies weten we nog niet, maar één ding is zeker: je kan je oneindig ontwikkelen binnen een mooie organisatie.  Let op!: Dit is geen uitzendvacature. Het houden projecten in voor langere tijd, met als doel overname door de opdrachtgever. Wat wij bieden  Een open samenwerking in het vinden van de juiste match; Een uitdagende baan bij een van onze opdrachtgevers; Een marktconform salaris (40 u/pw) o.b.v. jouw kennis en ervaring; Kans om te leren en ontwikkelen binnen een organisatie.  Wat wij vragen: Minimaal een hbo-diploma; In de richting van IT; Ervaring met development/programmeren (bijv. Python/Java/etc.) Je bent leergierig en flexibel; Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse taal (C1).  Solliciteren Ben jij de perfecte kandidaat voor deze vacature en voldoe je aan de eisen? Klik dan op de knop 'Solliciteer direct!' en we nemen zo snel mogelijk contact met je op!

title: IT Test Engineer
summary:
Communicate with developer, data analyst, business analyst and business user for User Acceptance Testing (UAT) when require.
13th Salary Fixed and KPI Bonus.
description: Direct and/or collaborate with IT Testing Specialist to provide comprehensive test plans in accordance with existing requirements and document results Direct and/or collaborate to estimate man-day and provide timeline for testing. Direct and/or collaborate to prepare test cases in BDD format for application under test including Web app, Mobile app, and API testing. Direct and/or collaborate to perform all phases of testing including functional black-box test, regression and integration testing for continuous delivery. Communicate with developer, data analyst, business analyst and business user for User Acceptance Testing (UAT) when require. Writing SQL queries to conduct back-end testing. Executing automation test script, then analyze test result and send to project team. Create and/or update automation test script, test data, and configure for test run well at all test environments. Support to create data test for business user/business analyst when require (either using automation script or manual.) Participate in test case design and sprint planning sessions to provide input on functional requirements, product designs, schedules, or potential problems as associated with the test cycle. JOB REQUIREMENTS Must haves: Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Electronics and Telecommunications or related fields. 2+ years of experience in manual software testing is required. Intermediate level of English. Nice to haves: Experience in performance test is a great advantage. Familiar with BDD automation testing approach is a plus. Good at SQL query, building procedure. Experience of working in Agile environment. COMPENSATION & BENEFITS 13th Salary Fixed and KPI Bonus PTI Health Care for personal 24/7 Accidental Insurance 100% Social Insurance Meal + Phone Allowance Yearly Medical Checkup 15 Annual Leaves Professional and Transparent Working Environment Apply Latest Financial Technology in the World

title: Senior BI Analyst Data Quality
summary:
Advice on sharing data between multiple data systems where possible.
Design and build data quality dashboards such that active steering towards better data…
description: To continue LeasePlan's success story in the fast-moving automotive industry, we are actively building our digital presence to create the "future of Digital" in the mobility industry, and to achieve our vision of "any car, anywhere, anytime". The Senior BI Analyst Data Quality is positioned within the Business Intelligence team, which is part of the Product & Demand department in LeasePlan Digital. The BI team is responsible for: Translating Business, IT and specifically BI strategies into tactical plans for the project portfolio Ensuring data availability for the realisation of global - and local business opportunities Assessing major change - and project requests relating to the Business Intelligence domain Supporting entities on Functional Data Support The BI department is responsible for the support of Business Intelligence requirements for the LeasePlan Entities and LeasePlan Corporation. It also owns the Enterprise Data Warehouse (eDWH). What are you going to do? The Senior BI Analyst Data Quality's primary accountability is to improve the quality of the data used in the Finance and Risk domains first (later to be expanded to other domains) within the LeasePlan Group and LeasePlan Corporation. Primary accountabilities Gather data quality requirements for the finance and risk domains first (later to be expanded to other domains) and translate into technical automated validations. Liaise with global and local Data Stewards to conduct root cause analysis of the rule results, enable error rectification and develop preventative actions (to avoid recurrence). Continuously improve the data quality processes and implement (pre-emptive) controls to drive up the data quality. Design and build data quality dashboards such that active steering towards better data quality is possible. Management reporting to executive level on data quality. Advise on - and analysis of business requirements and the selection of technical solutions for major changes, execute these major changes and carry out enhancements in the BI environment, to solve business problems, enhance functional performance to satisfy our stakeholders / customers. Provide application analysis (Fleet Ops systems (i.e. NOLS, Alwin, SAP), Finance systems, Risk systems, external systems) and data modelling design to collect data for the Data Repository (SAP BW/4HANA). Advice on sharing data between multiple data systems where possible. This includes standardising data collection, developing methods for database design and validation reports. Advice on how to extract data from the LP source systems into the warehouses and present them in user friendly ways for our stakeholder / customers. Support the handling of the queue with outstanding incidents and change requests Advice on the testing and implementation of the BI solutions. What do you need to do the job? Knowledge and experience Expert knowledge of Data Quality applications & methodologies. Solid experience with Data Warehousing / Business Intelligence and supporting environments. Leasing, Insurance or Banking business knowledge, with focus on finance and risk data Expert knowledge across several BI platforms, processes, architectures, methodologies. Experience of application implementation within a corporate context Experience with Agile way of working & JIRA. Master degree (/or based on experience) working and thinking level. Minimum of 6-8 years experience in BI area application development. Skills Expertise in handling large and complex data sets. Familiarity with database management (SQL, Snowflake, etc.). Ability to systematically capture business requirements and convert to technical language/outcomes. Good qualitative and quantitative analytical capabilities, including experience with financial modelling. Ability to create, maintain and run business solutions for customers as required; customer-centric approach. Ability to analyse and resolve new complex customer situations. Ability to identify problems, develop technical solutions and to advise in the specified area. Ability to advice on tools, technologies and methodologies. Ability to recognise and articulate complex problems in the solution being implemented. Will initiate / execute improvements and has a role in development of new working methods and techniques. Ability to lead analysis, problem solving and evaluate activities. Ability to translate strategy and policy into improved processes, (new) guidelines standards and models. Ensures implementation and monitoring. Ability to communicate the results of analyses in a clear and effective manner, including experience presenting and collaborating with cross-functional teams. Initiates and manages tactical projects and/or leads projects. Ability to quickly evaluate the business impact of issues. Ability to understand technical concepts. Ability to work independently and perform parallel tasks. In depth knowledge and/or experience with Data Modelling tools like Erwin Data Modeler, Visual Paradigm. Skilled in focusing on desired results, determining what is important and urgent, clarifying next steps, and prioritizing work effectively to meet deadlines and achieve desired results. Diplomatic attitude. Good Fluent written and oral communication skills in English. Flexibility to travel at short notice in support of delivering objectives. What do we offer? We offer a dynamic and challenging atmosphere with the backing of one of the world's leading fleet management companies. You can expect a competitive salary and benefits, room to grow and plenty of can-do attitudes. Most importantly? You'll get the opportunity to help shape the future of an exciting, dynamic industry. This role is based in Amsterdam and a pre-employment screening is part of the selection process.

title: Product Owner Data
summary:
Tevens gaan we slimmer werken door data als basis te nemen voor besluitvorming en procesoptimalisaties.
Denkt mee en draait mee in tenders waarin data een…
description: Data vormt de kern van onze dienstverlening en gaan we data steeds meer gebruiken voor commerciële doeleinden. Tevens gaan we slimmer werken door data als basis te nemen voor besluitvorming en procesoptimalisaties. In deze rol zorg je voor de tijdige en kwalitatieve oplevering van data services aan interne en externe klanten. Je bent hét aanspreekpunt voor de business, coördineert de activiteiten om de oplevering te realiseren, voorziet scrum teams van informatie om snel waardevolle producten te kunnen leveren. Tot jouw taken behoren: De ontwikkeling van de product visie samen met stakeholders en vakspecialisten en deze vertalen naar een roadmap; Het vullen van de backlog en het uitlijnen van prioriteiten; Je zorgt dat jouw product vindbaar, bruikbaar en van uitstekende kwaliteit is Je bent overtuigd van het belang van jouw product voor de organisatie en draagt dit ook uit. Adviseert externe en interne klanten, afdelingen & scrumteams over de mogelijkheden van dataservices; Denkt mee en draait mee in tenders waarin data een belangrijk onderdeel vormt. Je profiel Om succesvol te zijn in deze rol ben je in staat klant- en business wensen te challengen en te prioriteren op basis van klantwaarde en impact. Je bent een relatiebouwer en weet deze uit te bouwen door uitstekend werk op te leveren. Daarbij draag je bij aan de ontwikkeling van de product strategie. Verder beschik je over: WO-opleiding, bij voorkeur computer science, data science of een gerelateerd; Min 5 jaar als product owner, business analist of product manager in een Agile omgeving; Kennis en ervaring met Data Science en Data Engineering, bij voorkeur in een omgeving met high volume high throughput data; Combineert domeinkennis, marktinzicht en technologische kennis. Je stuurt aan op het maximaliseren van business resultaat binnen een lange termijn doelstelling; Diepe kennis en ervaring met Agile methodologie; Uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal. Ons aanbod Een uitdagende functie voor 32-40 uur bij een bedrijf dat zich focust op de duurzame inrichting van Nederland, maatschappelijk verantwoord ondernemen en sociale innovatie De ruimte om jouw optimale werk/privé balans te vinden Direct een vast contract Uitstekende secundaire voorwaarden; winstuitkering, 2,5% eindejaarsuitkering en een goede pensioenregeling (Stichting Pensioenfonds Openbaar Vervoer) 36,5 vakantiedagen op basis van een fulltime dienstverband Eigenaar zijn van Movares: door onze unieke aandelenconstructie Kantoor in hartje Utrecht, op loopafstand van station Utrecht Centraal De afdeling De groep Digitale Transformatie bestaat uit circa 40 collega’s en maakt onderdeel uit van de afdeling Digitale Transformatie en IT. De uitdaging van deze groep is om de engineeringprocessen van Movares zo snel en vergaand mogelijk te automatiseren. De digitale revolutie speelt een cruciale rol in de toekomst van ons ingenieursbureau. We gebruiken steeds meer data om te inventariseren, voorspellen en vraagstukken op te lossen. Handmatige processen worden geautomatiseerd waarbij we gebruikmaken van innovatieve software. Het team is jong, gedreven en inventief. Zo kun je regelmatig deelnemen aan hackathons waarbij complexe problemen getackeld worden. Eigen initiatief en innovatieve ideeën zijn zeer welkom en noodzakelijk om elkaar steeds weer naar een hoger niveau te tillen. Werk je bij een bureau en wil je een kandidaat voorstellen? Bedankt, maar wij werven onze nieuwe collega graag zelf. Mocht dit niet lukken, dan schakelen we met bureaus waar we vaste afspraken mee hebben.

title: Data Analist
summary:
Alle domeinen binnen het bankwezen hebben behoefte aan inzicht in relevante data.
Banken zijn zeer afhankelijk van data en ze hebben jouw expertise hard nodig.
description: Data Analist. Baan van de toekomst. Banken zijn zeer afhankelijk van data en ze hebben jouw expertise hard nodig. Solliciteer direct! Wat maakt deze functie aantrekkelijk voor jou? Je verdient een goed salaris op basis van kennis en kunde; Je komt bij een bank in het dataparadijs terecht. Wat ga je doen? Je bent net een kind in een snoepwinkel wanneer je als Data Analist bij een bank aan de slag gaat. Data speelt een essentiële rol om processen beheersbaar te maken. Alle domeinen binnen het bankwezen hebben behoefte aan inzicht in relevante data. En daarbij komt de Data Analist om de hoek kijken. Het beheren van Data Dashboards is jouw voornaamste taak. Zodat interne belanghebbenden snel de feiten kunnen zien over hun eigen vakgebied. Uiteraard analyseer je doorlopend zelf de beschikbare data en de hypothesen die je daaruit haalt pak je op met (beslissingsbevoegde) collega's. Tijdens gesprekken met deze interne belanghebbenden krijg je regelmatig signalen over de kwaliteit of de toepasbaarheid van data. Als Analist is dit niet je voornaamste taak maar je bent wel mede verantwoordelijk voor het signaleren en vastleggen van deze problemen. Over het algemeen vertaal je deze signalen op de juiste manier en seint de Data Steward in om ervoor te zorgen dat deze issues opgepakt en beheerst worden. Binnen het bankwezen is er momenteel met name op de afdeling CDD veel vraag naar Data Analisten. De hoeveelheid data waarmee deze afdeling dagelijks te maken krijgt maakt het onmogelijk om efficiënt te werken zonder goede dataprofessionals. Carrierecafe heeft een groot netwerk in het bankwezen en plaatst regelmatig dataprofessionals. Waarom kies jij voor deze functie? De Data Analist omarmt het feit dat de wereld heel snel verandert. Meten is weten. Op Data-afdelingen van banken zitten over het algemeen zeer gemotiveerde professionals die op een hele positieve wijze tegen de wereld aan kijken. Om Data Analist te worden moet je daarnaast in staat zijn om complexe zaken op eenvoudige wijze uit te leggen aan verschillende belanghebbenden. Maar ook harde ICT-kennis is nodig: kennis van programmeertalen is nodig. De harde functie-eisen voor een Data Analist zijn: Je hebt een HBO/WO diploma in de richting van ICT (of een andere relevante richting); Je hebt kennis van programmeertalen zoals Python en SQL; Je bent bekend met Data Dashboards zoals Cognos of Azure Databrick; Je bent zeer vaardig met datawarehouse omgevingen; Je hebt kennis van de financiële wereld (over het algemeen een pre). Waarom kies jij voor Carrierecafe? Carrierecafe streeft naar werkgeluk op de lange termijn. We leren de persoon achter jouw CV graag kennen. Onze recruiters hebben jarenlange ervaring in de financiële wereld en daarom weten we waar jij het beste tot je recht komt. Mogelijk is dat bij de opdrachtgever van deze vacature. Misschien zien we een andere loopbaankans voor je. We helpen je om succesvol te worden op je eigen manier. Carrierecafe communiceert transparant naar jou. We zijn overal eerlijk en concreet over. Voor en ná je sollicitatie. Je toekomstige takenpakket, het beoogde salaris dat daarbij hoort en zelfs je kansen op een openstaande functie, we doen nergens geheimzinnig over. Carrierecafe gaat graag een lange reis met je aan. Eerlijkheid duurt het langst! Dus wil jij succesvol en gelukkig worden op de werkvloer? Kies dan voor Carrierecafe! En natuurlijk hebben we ook secundaire voorwaarden! #LI-DS1

title: (Junior) Business Analyst
summary:
Collect data from different platforms, and merge date into data sets.
Experience in using data analysis in a commercial environment.
What do we have to offer.
description: “Gaming Together, Wherever You Are!” GamePoint is one of the largest social game developing companies, based in the Netherlands. Every month we welcome large groups of unique players on Web, Facebook and Mobile from all over the world with our synchronous Bingo, Social Casino, Card and Board games. Some of our games are among the top 100 best earning games in the world. Due to the unique social features, users play an average of 120 minutes per day within our games. Our current top games are GamePoint Bingo, RoyalDice, GamePoint Casino and CardParty. We are committed to entertain and support a live global audience, building long term relationships with all of our players on a daily basis. Our dedication to localized community management and support is second to none.  Operating from The Hague and Kiev, we cultivate brilliant talented team members and we only hire the best from around the globe to complement our growing teams. Since our founding in 1998, we’ve been building a company where we take risks and dream big. We currently have 160 international team members embracing a common vision for quality experiences and all have a passion for gaming. And together, we bring fun and entertainment to our millions of players across the globe!  See for more information our corporate Website: www.gamepoint.biz or play our great games on www.gamepoint.com.  Position Summary – Business Analyst We currently have a great opportunity for a data driven Business Analyst within our state-of-the-art Business Intelligence team. You will learn from and work together with our Data Analysts, a Data Engineer and our head of Data. As Business Analyst you will analyze current and past campaign efforts, analyze the effectiviness of our Sale Campaigns, crunch user data and identify trends. With the gained insights you will be supporting decisions and presenting findings to various stakeholders. Note: EU-residency is mandatory  Key Responsibilities Develop reports using BI tools and languages (e.g. Tableau, Amazon Redshift, SQL, Python or R) to help stakeholders track their progress & achievements Conduct the execution and integration of highly sophisticated analytics to promote understanding of different business areas or critical business challenges/opportunities. Aanalyze business needs, translating data into actionable insights and visualizing your findings to drive the commercial success Collect data from different platforms, and merge date into data sets Reports actionable insights and statitics to various teams: Monetization, Marketing, User Acquisition & Game Development Work on new projects to further improve analytics across departments  Educational & (Work) Experience An academic quantitative degree (BSc) is required preferably in Econometrics/Economy, Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science, Artificial Intelligence or another related field with a strong emphasis on quantitative analysis Experience in using data analysis in a commercial environment Experience in E-Commerce is highly rated  Essential skills Knowledge of Google/Firebase analytics, Google Ads, Commercetools, SFMC and marketing attribution is a big plus Excel: Pivot tables, table structure, formula creations SQL: Query writing, query optimization, ability to handle huge databases Ability to create visualizations of your analysis, solid knowledge of Tableau is required Being able to do in-depth analyzes like for example customer lifetime value, cohort analysis, sales forecast, customer segmentation, customer churn modelling;  Additional qualifications Fluent English (written & spoken) and good communication skills Comfortable in presenting analysis to higher Management  What do we have to offer We offer a competitive package packed with pension benefits, a lunch arrangement and a fun and casual work environment, frequent team building events and lots of more fun and perks! We have a casual international work environment in a beautiful historical building in the middle of the center of The Hague!  Contact Do you have what it takes? Submit your resume and motivational letter explaining your history and why you think you should be a good fit for this role, our team. If you would like more information regarding this unique position within GamePoint B.V. please contact Inge van der Burg (HR Manager) by phone: +31 (0)70 – 3110110 or by e-mail: iburg@gamepoint.com.  See for more info information our corporate Website: www.gamepoint.biz  Please do not contact us for sales purposes

title: Assistant Vice President, ETL Developer
summary:
Demonstrated knowledge of data warehouse concepts (data normalization, star schema, etc).
Good understanding of physical and logical data modelling.
description: Would you like to work for one of the World's largest banks in an exciting, dynamic and international environment? We are currently searching for a Assistant Vice President, DWH - ETL Developer for our MDS team as part of the Systems Division in Amsterdam. MUFG Bank Europe N.V. (MBE) is a fully-owned subsidiary of Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group (MUFG), one of the largest ranked Financial Groups in the world in terms of assets. A world-class set of businesses and more than 180,000 employees in 50 markets. MUFG offers stability in an ever-changing market, providing services to high-profile clients worldwide. For more than 50 years MBE offers commercial banking services to both Japanese and non-Japanese corporate customers in The Netherlands and, through its branches, in Central and East Europe. The goal is to be among the top performing foreign-owned banks operating in The Netherlands, providing value-added banking services and excellent operations, fulfilling both Japanese and non-Japanese customers' needs. The MBE subsidiary based in The Netherlands is a growing network of branches, managed from Amsterdam. Our vision? To become the world’s most trusted financial group. You’ll help us achieve it. Purpose of the function The position is open in the MBE Data Store (MDS) team of the IT delivery department. MDS is a strategic asset of the MUFG Bank Europe being aimed to accumulate and process bank’s information for both reporting to regulators and supporting internal business processes. DWH / ETL developer will work closely with the Solution/ Data Architect to design, build interfaces and integrate data from a variety from internal and external data sources into the Enterprise Data Warehouse environment with the use of MS SQL SSIS. The ETL Developer will be responsible for developing ETL primarily utilizing Microsoft technologies within industry recognized ETL standards, architecture and best practices. Responsibilities Act as a technical expert in the designing, coding, testing, supporting and debugging of new software or significant enhancement to existing software Troubleshoot and debug ETL jobs and creating unit tests for ETL jobs. Assess query performance and actively contribute to optimizing the code Develop stored procedures when needed Write technical documentation and specifications Work with DBAs and Data Architects to plan and implement best ETL strategies Work with business systems analysts to create technical design specifications, gaining a sound understanding of business processes for related applications so that integration processes fulfill the end-user requirements Create a solution following the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) Communicate with Business Analysts to understand requirements, socialize ideas among peers, and document work product Support internal audit by submitting required evidences Qualifications: Proven work experience as an ETL Developer Expert level of knowledge of Microsoft SQL services and technologies (SSIS, SSAS, SSRS and SQL Server 2012+) Experience with MS Visual Studio Experience in BIML development Experience in SQL; Strong SQL scripting knowledge, able to create complex SQL queries Good working knowledge of at least one scripting language (Bash, Python or Perl) is an advantage Advanced knowledge of relational databases Demonstrated knowledge of data warehouse concepts (data normalization, star schema, etc) Good understanding of physical and logical data modelling Ability to troubleshoot and solve complex technical problems Good understanding of software development best practises Working experience in Agile projects Experience in working in high priority projects (high pressure on delivery) Some flexibility outside 9-5 working hours Able to communicate complex information clearly and concisely. Able to work independently and also to collaborate across the organization Highly developed problem-solving skills with minimal supervision Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English Competencies Integrity and Responsibility Balance Risk with Opportunity Customer Focus Demonstrate Global Perspective Professionalism and Teamwork Drive For Results Collaborate and Build Partnerships Communicate Effectively and Professionally Challenge Ourselves To Grow Influence and Inspire Others Lead Change & Seek Continuous Improvement Think Strategically We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and committed to leveraging the diverse backgrounds, perspectives and experience of our workforce to create opportunities for our colleagues and our business. We do not discriminate in employment decisions on the basis of any protected category. Language skills Verbal and written communication skills in English are essential.

title: Business Analyst
summary:
2-4 years of experience in business analyst role.
This is a data intensive role within the Product Operations team that will be working with different internal…
description: Our mission is to usher in a new era of trust and predictability to transportation and logistics, but there's still a lot of work to be done. The industry is massive, as is the opportunity. We're looking for bright, ambitious individuals to join our growing global team and help us enable a more productive and successful world. We're changing the way the world ships, and we're looking for you to help us get there! Why project44? Take an inside look into our culture! Ranked 2nd most innovative company by FreightWaves in 2018 and 2019 (right after Amazon who is our customer) "Best Places To Work" by Built In Chicago Our culture is more than a ping pong table, but we do host quarterly ping pong tournaments  Business Analyst (Carrier Network): Description: At project44, the Product Operations Team's goal is to ensure we create the right products that move our business forward. This is a data intensive role within the Product Operations team that will be working with different internal stakeholders on business reporting, process optimizations, and business insight generation. This team member will form part of the analytics back bone of the Product Operations team. As a business analyst on the team, you will drive continuous improvement to Project44's carrier programs by flexing your analytical muscles to break down the most complex and interesting challenges and opportunities. Responsibilities: What you'll do Analytics – Support carrier network teams by creating and executing various end to end analytics projects; including the development of metrics, reports/dashboards, BI tools & insights Project Management - Identify, plan, and execute projects and root cause analyses to improve our existing carrier programs Operations Management - collaborate with carrier teams to identify process inefficiencies, build solutions, and drive operational efficiency (e.g. centralizing repeatable processes, customer success strategy and growth, weekly reporting) Stakeholder Management - organize and structure work across a variety of cross-functional teams to deliver on shared goals and priorities Product - work with product operations and product teams to develop business cases and insights from the carrier operations team Support EU leadership on projects, development of business cases & market insights Requirements: The experience you should have 2-4 years of experience in business analyst role SQL Proficiency Experience with Microsoft Excel Ability to balance multiple projects with competing priorities Must be organized to keep track of various projects and milestones Experience developing and executing end-to-end projects Preferred Qualifications SaaS or software and/or logistics industry experience Experience with Python & Tableau Experience working with JIRA, Confluence, APIs (XML and JSON), EDI Experience with statistical analysis & A/B testing About project44 Since 2014, project44 has been transforming the way one of the largest, most important global industries does business. As transportation and logistics continues to evolve and customer expectations around delivery become more demanding, industry technology must rise to the occasion. In just a few short years, we've created a digital infrastructure that eliminates the inefficiencies caused by dated technology and manual processes. Our Advanced Visibility Platform is used by the world's leading brands to track shipments, collaborate with supply chain partners, drive operational efficiencies, and create outstanding customer experiences.

title: Marketing Data Analyst
summary:
4+ years of experience as data analyst, which required good stakeholder management and communication skills.
Fixing the data issues and communications around it…
description: Senior Marketing Data Analyst Do you have 4+ years of experience as a data analyst after you finished your Bachelor's degree? Are you a master in SQL, (PostgreSQL and Big Query) combined with experience with programming in Python or R? Would you like to work for a ambitions growth organisation as CarNext.com in an exciting and constantly changing (online) market? If you answered yes to the above questions, please apply for this challenging position as our Senior Marketing Data Analyst in our international scale-up environment!  This is CarNext.com CarNext.com is a scale-up with a start-up mentality. We're bold and have a passion to change the status quo. We're building a transparent digital marketplace that customers can trust. And it's the same at CarNext.com. We're proud of our open culture, collaborative ethos, vibrant environment and can-do approach. As we grow our business, we're keen to hear from people who understand what we're about and can help us achieve our mission.  Help us build the future of mobility! As the Senior Marketing Data Analyst, you will make a crucial contribution to the insight and utilization of data within the company. Whilst being a valuable member of the Marketing Department, you will work with all parts of the company to help them give the right business decision. It's important to us that our new Senior Data Analyst is someone who works with precision, is decisive, has a great set of analytical skills and loves driving business decisions coming from data.  In this role you will be: Identifying trends Analyzing patterns in measurement data, expanding validation options; Fixing the data issues and communications around it Creating new metrics after doing all the necessary checks Testing hypothesis Participate in project teams for custom measurements and data flows; Developing the data collection of new meters; Support in the daily activities of the Data team; Organizing imports and exports of data (APIs); Contributes actively to securing and transferring knowledge in the organization; Building knowledge meters and protocols;  Must haves for this role: Bachelor's degree (undergraduate program completed), preferably in Engineering, Business, Marketing or other relevant fields, a Master's degree is a nice to have 4+ years of experience as data analyst, which required good stakeholder management and communication skills Stakeholder Management and good communication skills Statistical knowledge and data modelling is required Really analytical mindset and eye for business needs Mastered in Excel Mastered in SQL, (PostgreSQL and Big Query) Have experience with Programming Languages – Python (or R) Statistical knowledge and good understanding of mathematical theorems English (fluent, verbally and written), and second language is a nice to have  Skills that you need in order to succeed in this position: Ambition and self-motivation Energetic, flexible and always looing to learn new things; An amazing team player and willing to go above and beyond in delivering great work; Have a proactive and flexible mind set, with an attitude to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced, start-up like environment.  The team You will work in a small team in which you will get every opportunity to further develop yourself.  Grow with us CarNext.com provides ample opportunities for personal and professional growth. If you feel this is a great match with your skills, Go ahead, apply and send us your CV

title: Applied Data Scientist with a Data Engineering Focus
summary:
Experience with deploying data-processing pipelines.
Even though deep learning definitely has its place within Owlin, we also particularly value models that can…
description: Founded in 2012 and based in Amsterdam, Owlin turns news into actionable intelligence. Our international client base is growing rapidly, and more prospects come knocking at our door every day. That is why we need a best-in-class Applied Data Scientist to join our team. Instead of sitting in a cubicle in a corporate environment, working at Owlin means that you will be making a visible impact while working in an ambitious, fast-growing team and bringing exciting products to the global financial market.  About the job You will be working in a young and dynamic Data Science Team that aims to deeply understand our clients’ business challenges and build solutions that answer those needs. We leverage cutting edge technologies from NLP and other areas of ML or develop entirely new techniques in-house if need be. Even though deep learning definitely has its place within Owlin, we also particularly value models that can be introspected and adjusted on the spot by data analysts.  About you You are not the type of person that needs or asks for instructions. You are expected to proactively engage with what is already in place and pitch ideas for improvement. You will make sure your ideas are understood, validated, and implemented in practice as well. You have a passion for technology and the way it is changing traditional markets and institutions. You want to be part of that revolution and are looking for an adventurous job where you can make a real difference.  Responsibilities As part of the Data Science Team, you have a central role in extracting value and insights from our data (mostly structured and unstructured text as well as time series data of various kinds) and translate this into new tools and resources for our clients. As an Applied Data Scientist with a Data Engineering Focus, your core objective is to support the team in turning ideas into production-ready models, infrastructure and code. You’ll get your hands dirty on the command line of Linux servers, and help us develop data pipelines both on and off the cloud. If you also possess bona fide research skills, you are more than welcome to let it show. How you develop yourself within Owlin is limited only by your own ambitions and capabilities.  Hard skills 3+ years of professional experience as a Data Scientist / Engineer Problem solving and analytical thinking Demonstrable programming proficiency Ability to implement algorithms in Python / NumPy Numba / Cython / C(++) / JavaScript (NodeJS) / GO are a bonus Solid understanding of data structures and algorithmic complexity Experience in Deep Learning and ML general (PyTorch / TensorFlow, Scikit-learn, SciPy, ...) Experience in NLP Experience with deploying data-processing pipelines Experience using Linux Familiarity with relational and non-relational databases Familiarity with REST APIs and their deployment (Flask, FastAPI, Nginx, passenger) English: full professional working proficiency We also really appreciate: Strong mathematical and statistical background An intuitive understanding of business problems  Soft skills Authentic and ambitious Entrepreneurial and pragmatic mindset High degree of personal motivation Ability to manage your own schedule Deep care for end users and their experience  Benefits We offer a wide array of perks to help our employees find an ideal work-to-life balance. We’re all about increasing productivity by maximizing joy. Here are some of the benefits that we have to offer: Competitive pay: good primary and secondary benefits Great place to work: a beautiful office with a view right in the city center of tech hub Amsterdam. Great WFH-support to make sure you have all you need to “get shit done”. International team Personal development: surrounded by the best and brightest tech talent Flat hierarchy where your work will directly touch our clients Fun(virtual) company-wide events. Daily lunch and Friday afternoon drinks when things are back to normal! In a (post-)COVID world, we are flexible and accommodating when it comes to working remotely. The office is available for those who need to use it (within limits in line with governmental public health safety guidelines), but the infrastructure and routines are in place to facilitate working remotely for everyone, all while staying engaged, motivated and productive.  If you think this position has your name written all over it, we sincerely hope to hear from you. If so, please submit your resume and motivation letter.

title: BI Specialist
summary: Together with the data engineer and data manager, you investigate which data is required to build the dashboard and together you determine how much time it will…
description: In fast changing markets, customers worldwide rely on Thales. Thales is a business where brilliant people from all over the world come together to share ideas and inspire each other. In aerospace, transportation, defence, security and space, our architects design innovative solutions that make our tomorrow's possible. The Enterprise Information Management team of Thales in the Netherlands is looking for an allround Business Intelligence specialist to further professionalize information management.  About the job Thales in the Netherlands has committed to the objective to become a ‘data-driven company’, where facts and unambiguous information are leading in decision making. As a Business Intelligence specialist, you will be responsible for gathering the requested business information and designing clear dashboards for our internal customer, the business user. At the start of the week you check the sprint backlog to see what tasks are assigned to you. You align with the product owner and business analyst of the team and you are in touch with the business user to sharpen the information specifications. Together with the data engineer and data manager, you investigate which data is required to build the dashboard and together you determine how much time it will take to extract and validate the data. You are capable of executing ETL activities independently. In the meantime, you start designing a component of the new dashboard in PowerBI. You are in close contact with the business user to agree upon the visual design. At the end of the 2 week sprint you deliver the new component of the new dashboard, and in the next sprint you will extend your work with a new component. Furthermore, you deliver the weekly hour registration report and you will help your colleagues in the EIM team to extend their knowledge of PowerBI. You play an important role in the internal digital transformation journey of Thales in the Netherlands. There is a lot of work to be done; you are a ‘go-getter’ and consider this assignment, which we accepted as a team, to be a journey full of chances and possibilities. You are flexible and know how to overcome challenges along the way. You are someone who dares to challenge the status quo and someone who brings new energy into our team. Also, you have strong communication skills and you know to address different audiences. At Thales, we offer you a career. There are many possibilities to develop yourself within the domain of BI, Data and IT. You are encouraged to spend a day at another squad, or to join an improvement project to broaden your horizon. The most important activities are: Develop and design dashboards in PowerBI to meet the information demands of the business user ETL activities to extract and format data for the dashboards which need to be developed Contribute to the improvement and standardization of our work processes About you We are in search for a colleague who: Is ready for his/hers second career step in BI Holds a relevant Bachelor degree (University of Applied Sciences / HBO) (preferably IT-related or Business&IT) Has extensive knowledge of PowerBI Has extensive knowledge of SSIS and SQL and the ability to complete ETL activities independently Can align the business information request with the technical possibilities Is proactive, flexible, a go-getter, and enthusiastic Knowledge of Oracle EBS is a pre Good understanding of the Dutch language What's in it for you Become part of a great team in a high tech, innovative international organization (International) opportunities for growth in tech-, management- and commercial roles Attention for personal development and own initiative A nice workplace in a modern building, where we value a good work-life balance and flexibility 40 leave days per year, travel expenses and a flexible benefits à la carte package with options like purchase/sale of leave hours, internet costs, bicycle plan, company fitness, trade union contribution or relocation costs Interested? Apply now! Click on the button below to upload your profile and show your interest. To ensure that we are a good match, we can ask you to participate in an assessment. According to the Security Screening Act (in Dutch: Wet veiligheidsonderzoeken) this role is designated a "position involving confidentiality" (in Dutch: vertrouwensfunctie). Therefore a Security Clearance, which takes the form of a ‘verklaring van geen bezwaar’, VGB (literally ‘a statement of no objection’ on national security grounds) is required for this role. Please take into account that applicants must be eligible to obtain and maintain the level of clearance as set out by AIVD. To learn more about clearances please visit – https://english.aivd.nl/topics/security-screening/the-security-screening At Thales we provide CAREERS and not only jobs. With Thales employing 80,000 employees in 68 countries our mobility policy enables thousands of employees each year to develop their careers at home and abroad, in their existing areas of expertise or by branching out into new fields. Together we believe that embracing flexibility is a smarter way of working. Great journeys start here, apply now!

title: Data Engineer
summary: Working closely with data scientist and analysts as well as software engineers in the field of telematic and other data to create a data pipeline and…
description: Are you an ambitious Data Engineer, with lots of passion for data processing and transformation? At Webfleet Solutions we are looking for the best and finest minds in data engineering to contribute and lead our efforts to structure vehicle telemetry, fleet behaviour and telematic data. As a member of a cross functional team, including data scientists and engineers, you will be responsible for building up and maintaining a steady inflow of data, ensuring and facilitating that productization as well as exploration of data opportunities will materialize as part of our Line of Business Data Solutions and Innovations. Here is a little taste of your challenge: Creating, improving and maintaining of our data pipeline architecture to create complex datasets. Implement and oversee quality metrices to ensure and preserve the business value Proposing technical concepts to handle and process data generated internally and externally enabling advanced analytics and new products Continuously look for improvements, increased scalability and automation of manual processes to accelerate consolidation and insight generation for hundreds of millions different data sets. Making sure data is separated, secured and meeting local as well as international data security and privacy standards such as GDPR, CCPA and other. Working closely with data scientist and analysts as well as software engineers in the field of telematic and other data to create a data pipeline and infrastructure and leverage business growth from it. Who are you? There is no set route to become our new Data Engineer. But to be successful in this role, this is the kind of profile we have in mind: You have 2-3 years’ hands-on experience with building and optimizing reliable, scalable, mission critical data pipelines in a production environment. Advanced knowledge and experience in SQL and relational as well as non-relational data bases. Personal must-haves: analytic mind, achievement orientation, sense of quality, flexible thinking and good communication skills. You are a self-driven team player with entrepreneurial touch and a passion for good software engineering and automation. You have profound knowledge and experience with Python, Java / JEE or any other object-oriented programming language. Control of other development, scripting, and mark-up languages as for example XML, XSD, WSDL, Bash will be of advantage You were able to gain insight into and experience with Big data technologies like: Spark, Hadoop, and Kafka Cloud services for data processing: Azure, AWS, Google Stream orientated processing: Storm, Spark-Streaming You have experience with as many as possible of the following: design patterns, ETL principles and best practises, interface contracts and interface stability, design and programming by contract, variant management. What can you expect? An adventure in software product development within a rapidly growing business unit of a globally renowned brand and various opportunities for your professional development. Being part of a team of professional and passionate developers, contributing to building and adapting the technology for our Webfleet Solutions Service Platform. Brilliant minds. Learn from your colleagues – pioneers and experts who are changing the world. Different cultures. Our employees come from all over the world, with 55 nationalities and counting. Practically Speaking, what's in it for you: Competitive salary. Benefits package in addition to the salary: Retirement and disability pension Life and accident insurance Flexible holiday plan. Birthday off! Plenty of formal training for new joiners + access to LinkedIn Learning. Who are we? The Data Solutions & Innovation is one of our Line of Business within the newly created Business Unit “Bridgestone Mobility Solutions”, headquartered in Amsterdam, and belonging to Webfleet Solutions, a Bridgestone company. This new Business Unit and the Data Solutions & Innovation line of business is forming the core of new digital driven business assets to support Bridgestone on its way of the digital transformation from the world leading tire and rubber company to a brilliant Mobility Solution Provider. Webfleet Solutions is one of the world’s leading telematics solution providers, dedicated to fleet management, vehicle telematics and connected car services. Its main Software-as-a-Service solution WEBFLEET is used by businesses of all sizes to improve vehicle performance, save fuel, support drivers and increase overall fleet efficiency. In addition, Webfleet Solutions provides services for the insurance, rental and leasing industries, car importers and companies that address the needs of businesses as well as consumers. Webfleet Solutions has over 50,000 customers worldwide and services drivers in more than 100 countries, giving them the industry’s strongest local support network and widest range of sector-specific third-party applications and integrations. Our customers benefit every day from the high standards of confidentiality, integrity and availability of our ISO/IEC 27001:2013 certified service, re-audited in November 2018. Webfleet Solutions is part of Bridgestone Europe NV/SA (“Bridgestone”), a subsidiary of Bridgestone Corporation, a leader in advanced solutions and sustainable mobility.  Want to join us? If that’s a yes, then please apply to say hi. Complete the online form and attachments in English, please. Do note that online technical evaluation and pre-employment screening are part of the selection process. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status.

title: Junior Product Developer – AFS Energy - Product Development Team
summary: You have at least 1-3 year experience with roles that combine both analytical and commercial skills, or you are able to prove you are a data driven solution…
description: Posted by: Janneke Dijkstra Corporate Recruiter View profile & contact Are you the type of person that – when an innovation hits the market – immerses oneself into investigating it thoroughly until you know all the ins and outs? Whether it’s a new iPhone, crypto currency or an app like Clubhouse; you’ll get to the bottom of it. You weigh pros and cons, sifting through every little detail. And once you know all the ins and outs, you use your knowledge to your advantage. Sounds familiar? Then let’s talk! Job description For our Energy Product Development team, we are currently looking for a Product Developer who is able to combine his or her analytical skills with a commercial mindset. The renewable energy market is fast developing as more and more countries set ambitious goals to decarbonize the energy consumption. Innovative projects are initiated to fulfill these ambitions. Industries experiment with green hydrogen, waste become a feedstock for renewable fuel and renewable energy projects pop up everywhere we look. Renewable generation becomes cheaper every day. An overwhelming set of possibilities! And this is where you come in. As our Junior Product Developer you’ll do a deep dive into new legislations around renewable energy and environmental commodities. You are the eyes and ears in this continuous developing market and know (or are eager to get to know) every little detail like the back of your hand. You oversee consequences of amendments in law and regulations, but you are also able to translate small changes into big commercial opportunities. You bring solutions and strategic concepts to the table that contribute to our client’s needs. You are resourceful, you like a challenge, your glass is always (half) full and you’ll blow your colleagues and clients away with creative well-founded solutions in this whirlwind of a market. We’ll promise you a job that is never boring and ask for your full commitment in return. Be on top of your game and keep scouting for opportunities so we service clients in the best way. We will reward your effort by flying across Europe to go to the latest conferences, meet international associations and institutions to visit new initiatives (When Covid-19 is over, of course). You might even become our key player (if you like a challenge, that is). At the end of the day, it is the rush of coming up with new ideas that will be providing our clients with the best service in the market and come up with solutions that others haven’t thought of yet. That gives you the drive to make it happen. What we expect: You are full of ambition and drive and are passionate to succeed You want to be the best; scouting for new opportunities is your passion You translate market developments into impact for our clients You are eager and curious to learn about our products You are a serious sparring partner and expert for both your teammates as our clients You have at least 1-3 year experience with roles that combine both analytical and commercial skills, or you are able to prove you are a data driven solution factory. You preferably have (some) understanding of or affinity with the renewable energy market Bachelor’s degree or higher The more languages you speak, the better, but other than English this is not a hard criterion The AFS Energy department AFS Energy is always on a mission to make ideas, products and opportunities a great success. The Product Development team consists of a group of ambitious and highly motivated analysts, consultants and intermediaries that are continuously looking for new products, markets, deal opportunities and advisory services to support our clients in the best possible way. Our team is also involved in the more complex transactions such as product swaps, (corporate) energy purchase contracts and cross border trading. We have a nose for creating products and solutions that will add value to companies all around Europe involved in renewable energy; and we are proud of it! As a Product Developer you can expect a team that motivates you to be the best. We will be a sparring partner, in order for you to develop that ingenious strategy that will convince your clients in a heartbeat. We provide you with various courses and training sessions with your peers in order to make you the best Product Developer you could be. What we offer We’ll promise you a job that is never boring and ask for your full commitment in return. Working in an awesome, ambitious and driven high performing team; Energetic and friendly colleagues from all over the world; A versatile full-time position in a fast growing and professional organization; One of the most interesting work environments in Amsterdam, the old trading floor of the historical Amsterdam Stock Exchange; Competitive renumeration and training possibilities; 27 holidays per calendar year; NS Business card (depending on your residence); Free inhouse fitness; A variety of activities with the team. Get in touch! Are you ready for a new challenge and do you want to become a member of this motivated team on the Amsterdam Stock Exchange? Please submit your application via the application form. Invited for a job interview? 1st round: Quick phone call with recruitment to get to know each other better 2nd round: Job interview with one of your future colleagues 3rd round: Job interview with your future manager Last round: Wow, this is super, you will meet the Head of the Energy desk, don’t forget to convince him and show him why everybody from round 1, 2 and 3 is vouching for you We are happy to recruit our AFS colleagues by ourselves. We do not need help from external parties. If we receive resumes from unaffiliated recruitment agencies, we reserve the right to contact the persons involved directly and treat candidates as regular candidates. Posted Date: 09 Mar 21

title: Rewards Analyst
summary:
Collect compensation and benefits data, conducting checks and validation as well as data analysis.
; sales or revenue-generation; market surveys or statistics/…
description: The Willis Towers Watson Rewards Data & Software Practice is a global center of excellence for compensation, benefits and employment practices information – helping clients to understand the pay and benefits markets and reward trends in which they operate. As a Rewards Analyst you become a key player in conducting a wide variety of compensation and benefits surveys and related projects. You are expected to become a primary relationship manager for key client groups. The Business We are organized as a Benelux team. As such, we provide advice to companies in Belgium and the Netherlands. In addition, we partner with colleagues across Western Europe and the globe on a daily basis to support our global and multinational clients. In our team, you will experience an international, high demanding and high energy environment. We offer you a very steep learning curve, and we also expect you to create and grab opportunities whenever they arise. Our compensation teams are the global leaders in effectively aligning executive and broad-based employee pay and other rewards with the interests of our clients’ stakeholders. Our team consults to a broad array of clients on matters related to compensation and benefits The Role Conduct a wide variety of compensation and benefits surveys and related projects. Collect compensation and benefits data, conducting checks and validation as well as data analysis Ensure client’s understanding of survey content and methodology Help our clients ensure that their reward programs are competitive by performing benchmarking analyses Partner with consultants and clients to design compensation programs to attract, reward and retain talent Help raise client awareness of products and services and identify sales opportunities Assist product leaders, account managers and reward consultants to ensure client satisfaction and engagement from pre-sales through post-sales Support the day-to-day relationship of large accounts under the guidance of the account manager Support preparation of client-facing meetings and presentations The Requirements You have a Master’s degree You are interested in discovering the consulting environment and desire to work with multiple clients across the world and sectors and in a fast paced environment Strong interest in one of the following is absolutely required: HR (compensation and benefits, recruitment, payroll etc.); sales or revenue-generation; market surveys or statistics/ data. You are enthusiastic, creative and a team player. You have strong written and verbal communication skills You have excellent analytical skills; accuracy and attention to detail; You are proactive, flexible and have a can-do mentality. You have excellent skills in Microsoft Excel & PowerPoint Fluency in English and Dutch is required Equal Opportunity Employer

title: Business Analist / Informatie Analist / Product Owner
summary: Als Business Analist, Informatie Analist of Product Owner sla je bruggen tussen de wens en de oplossing, tussen de business en de IT, tussen de gebruikers en de…
description: Actief Als Business Analist, Informatie Analist of Product Owner sla je bruggen tussen de wens en de oplossing, tussen de business en de IT, tussen de gebruikers en de IT-specialisten. Je interviewt stakeholders om de behoefte in kaart te brengen en vertaalt deze naar oplossingsrichtingen. Je toetst de haalbaarheid van verschillende oplossingen. Je stelt requirements op en prioriteert deze in nauwe samenwerking met de klant. Op basis van deze informatie ben je in staat om heldere documenten te schrijven, bijvoorbeeld vooronderzoeken, use cases, user story’s, impactanalyses, business cases, proces modelleringen, verbetervoorstellen of eventueel functionele ontwerpen. Wie zoeken we? Jij bent de beste in je vak of hebt de ambitie en de potentie om de beste te worden. Je hebt de passie om te blijven leren, je nieuwe technologieën eigen te maken en jezelf continu te ontwikkelen. Je hebt de pioniersgeest en drive om nieuwe technologieën, methodieken en concepten toe te passen in projecten en bij klanten. Je vindt het leuk om kennis te delen met collega’s, klanten en vakgenoten. Je bent een ware professional en ambassadeur voor CIMSOLUTIONS. Je voelt je thuis in een informele, collegiale en professionele sfeer waar de aandacht voor de klant en voor de medewerker centraal staan. Je toont initiatief, hebt organisatiesensitiviteit en bent analytisch. Je hebt ervaring met het maken van impactanalyses, modelleren van processen en informatiestromen. Wij spreken graag Business Analisten, Informatie Analisten of Product Owners met meerdere jaren ervaring. Wat breng je mee? Een afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding met een sterke ICT-component en basiskennis bedrijfskunde; Kennis van en ervaring met het in kaart brengen, analyseren en beschrijven van requirements; Kennis van en ervaring met modelleren (o.a.
