In addition, Webfleet Solutions provides services for the insurance, rental and leasing industries, car importers and companies that address the needs of businesses as well as consumers. Webfleet Solutions has over 50,000 customers worldwide and services drivers in more than 100 countries, giving them the industry’s strongest local support network and widest range of sector-specific third-party applications and integrations. Our customers benefit every day from the high standards of confidentiality, integrity and availability of our ISO/IEC 27001:2013 certified service, re-audited in November 2018. Webfleet Solutions is part of Bridgestone Europe NV/SA (“Bridgestone”), a subsidiary of Bridgestone Corporation, a leader in advanced solutions and sustainable mobility.  Want to join us? If that’s a yes, then please apply to say hi. Complete the online form and attachments in English, please. You can also send your CV and the reference of the position you are applying to us in an email to ana.delacruz@webfleet.com.

title: Research Analyst Intern
summary:
Experience with data analysis tools and/or data processing.
Assisting in online consumer research, programming and testing surveys, and processing data.
description: Global research in gaming and digital media has been in Newzoo’s core for almost a decade. With the demand for digital media growing rapidly, so does the demand for data on their consumers. As Research Intern, you will assist Newzoo’s data team carry out studies on games, tech, digital media, and other relevant topics. You’ll be involved in every aspect of the project, from writing and programming surveys to managing fieldwork and processing the data. Next to this, you’ll assist with data analysis, reporting, and be presenting the results visually, getting them ready to be delivered to Newzoo’s clients.  For this internship, you will be required to work from our Amsterdam office* at least 32 hours per week. The internship can be combined with a research or personal development project while enrolled at an educational institution, but that is not mandatory.  Your Responsibilities  Keeping track of developments in the games, tech, and digital media industries Analyzing data from various sources, help creating reports, and presenting results in a visually appealing format according to Newzoo’s design guidelines Assisting in online consumer research, programming and testing surveys, and processing data Providing your expertise on client or partner challenges Managing your research or development assignment  Your Profile  Bachelor or Master student enrolled in Business Administration, Psychology, Marketing, Market Research course, or relevant field Affinity with internet and digital media (a strong interest in video games, in particular, is a plus) Experience with data analysis tools and/or data processing Strong analytical and statistical skills, can answer client questions independently with statistically sound advice based on the available data Ability to work independently, problem solver, eager to learn Good PowerPoint and Excel skills Ability to work in Amsterdam (Newzoo does not assist in getting a valid work permit to work in the Netherlands) Available for 4-6 months, starting asap  Our Offer  A workplace overlooking the harbour of Amsterdam An internship with a very international outlook in a dynamic, ever-changing and fun industry Includes lunch and an internship compensation Plenty of room to develop yourself and shape your career Be part of a fast-growing, ambitious, young, and energetic team

title: Business analist medior
summary: De processen, die voor verbetering in aanmerking komen en waar de business analist een rol in speelt, zijn op operationeel/tactisch niveau.
description: Ben jij iemand die nieuwe ontwikkelingen oppikt en deze kan vertalen naar efficiënte, praktische oplossingen? Kun jij business en IT écht aan elkaar verbinden? Dan zoeken wij jou!  WAT GA JE DOEN? Als Business Analist (h)erken je behoeftes vanuit de business om te veranderen of te verbeteren. Je houdt je bezig met analyses van bedrijfsprocessen en/of systemen voor een specifieke afdeling. Je vertegenwoordigt de business voor systeem en proces aanpassingen en geeft advies over de uitvoering en kan deze tevens implementeren. Alles is gericht op het verbeteren van de effectiviteit van verschillende processen. De processen, die voor verbetering in aanmerking komen en waar de business analist een rol in speelt, zijn op operationeel/tactisch niveau. Even sparren om te kijken of het wat voor je is? Stuur ons een email! Succesvolle business analyse vereist helder begrip van communicatie over vaak complexe informatie. Daarom zoeken wij collega’s met uitstekende analytische capaciteiten en communicatieve vaardigheden! TAKEN: Analyseren van bedrijfsprocessen en systemen Vertegenwoordigen van de business voor systeem- en procesaanpassingen Beoordelen en nemen van beslissingen over in productie te nemen ICT wijzigingen en releases Maken van kosten-/batenanalyses over ICT issues en coördineren veranderingen Prognoses opstellen en ontwikkellen modellen om in te spelen op (externe) ontwikkelingen Ondersteunen bij het opstellen van requirements en het omzettennaar een functioneel ontwerp Sparringpartner voor teamleiders en afdelingshoofden Deelprojecten leiden op het eigen aandachtsveld en begeleiden van de betrokken projectmedewerkers in hun dagelijkse werkzaamheden WIJ VRAGEN: Aantoonbaar HBO/WO denk- en werkniveau Minimaal vijf jaar relevante werkervaring binnen de utility branche Ervaring met het voorbereiden van veranderingen (maken van impactanalyses, opstellen van business cases, ontwerpen van processen) Ervaring van het inventariseren en vastleggen van requirements, het opsporen van knelpunten en daaraan koppelen van verbeteradviezen Kennis van de deelgebieden: Front-Office; Contractverwerking; Berichtenverkeer; Mutaties; Datacollectie; Facturatie; Incasso Kennis van utility BackOffice applicaties (als SAP / MS Dynamics) DAARNAAST BEN JE: Communicatief vaardig Analytisch Overtuigend Resultaatgericht Initiatiefrijk WIJ BIEDEN: Een uitdagende functie waarin je begeleid wordt door interne collega’s. Wij bieden een marktconform salaris en secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden, zoals een pensioen- en mobiliteitsregeling. Wij ondersteunen persoonlijke groei met opleidingen en ontwikkeltrajecten die naar eigen keuze in te vullen zijn. WIE ZIJN WIJ? ICE Utility Professionals (ICE UP) is een professionele detacheringorganisatie met een landelijk netwerk. Wil jij het maken in de utility branche, dan kun je niet om ICE UP heen. Als specialist voor deze sector hebben wij verspreid door het hele land. Bij multinationals, maar ook bij lokale energiebedrijven. Wij krijgen interessante opdrachten van o.a. de volgende prominente spelers in de markt: Alliander, Essent, Enexis, EDSN, Fudura, Vitens, TenneT, Engie, Delta en Vattenfall. SOLLICITEREN OF GEWOON NIEUWSGIERIG Ben jij nieuwsgierig naar de dynamische wereld van energie & water en wil jij aan de slag in de richting van Business & IT, Data & Analytics, Operational Expert of Process & Performance? Wacht dan niet langer en neem contact op met: Esther Klarenbeek E-mail: sollicitatie@ice-up.eu Telefoon: +31 (0)6 5129 1506

title: Equity and Funds Operations professional
summary:
Maintain and develop control activities and data quality initiatives.
In this role interacting and working together is important, next to working with deadlines…
description: Summary: Are you a business-minded operations professional who thrives in a fast-changing environment collaborating with commercial departments? NIBC is looking for an Analyst/Associate to join our Equity & Funds Operations Team! Job Description: What will you do? Together with your team members your main activities will be: Initiate and manage cash flows to and from investments and investors; support the commercial investment managers executing operational processes; process investment and fund-transactions in two dedicated systems; originate, prepare, control and publish investor reports and annual accounts; communicating with clients and investors about financial and administrative issues; and cooperation with other supporting departments such as Finance, Legal, Fiscal and IT. Next to that we expect you to take actively part in projects and meetings to continuously improve our servicing: Initiate, prepare and implement lean improvements; contribute to department-wide and bank-wide initiatives; maintain and develop control activities and data quality initiatives. Your team Operations supports the commercial activities of NIBC during the initiation phase of a transaction and delivers after-care until maturity. We aim to realize the business objectives in a highly effective and efficient manner. Operations typifies as an open environment with a continuous improvement culture. Our professionals are engaged and service oriented. The Equity & Funds Operations Team is part of the Operations department. The team services the commercial departments who initiate equity investments and equity funds. Operations Equity & Funds supports the operational processes, administrates the products and funds in dedicated systems and reports to clients and investors. The team consists of 4 professionals with a diverse background, who are working across all disciplines. The collective responsibility for above mentioned duties, backed up by good team work, is of vital importance for our department. What do you bring? A pro-active team player with a continuous improvement mentality, effective communication skills, strong analytical skills and a critical eye for quality and detail: Interest in learning the high-quality Equity and Funds services and domain; Higher Vocational Education, preferably business economics or business administration; Fluent in Dutch and English both verbally and written; The suitable candidate will be part of a dedicated team of professionals who together are responsible for the activities described above. In this role interacting and working together is important, next to working with deadlines and being comfortable with (financial) data. NIBC as employer NIBC is best suited to help entrepreneurs at their decisive moments. Now and in the future. As a bank for entrepreneurs, we are committed to cultivating our ‘THINK YES’ mentality by being flexible and agile and by matching our clients’ can-do attitude. We support our corporate clients in building their businesses. For our retail clients in the Netherlands, Germany and Belgium we offer mortgages, online savings and brokerage products that are accessible, easy to understand and fairly prices. Operating in the Netherlands, Germany and UK, our corporate clients business (mainly mid-market) offers advice and debt, mezzanine and equity financing solutions to entrepreneurs across select sectors and sub-sectors in which we have strong expertise and market positions. See also: https://www.nibc.com/about-us/our-purpose-and-corporate-values What’s in it for you? Our purpose is to make a difference at decisive moments for our clients. The inventiveness of our solutions often determines our ability to do this. And inventive ideas arise from diverse teams. We are therefore looking for people with different profiles and who want to contribute to the openness and inclusiveness of our culture. To increase our professionalism we also focus on giving each other continuous feedback. An annual personal development budget, to be spent at your discretion; Activity based working, enabling you to choose the right time and place to do your job properly to maintain a healthy work-life balance: as for now, we mostly work from home until otherwise is possible; Continuous feedback is aimed at your results and developing your skills. The continuous nature of our Grow to Make a Difference program enables you to be in charge of your own development; Vitality program in support of a healthy and sustainable lifestyle; Annual companywide sports & leisure day; No vacation registration and officially 31 holidays; And, of course, a competitive salary. Interested? Don’t wait and click the apply button! To upload multiple documents, click the upload button again after uploading a document. In a motivation letter we would like to learn more about your ambitions and why you think this role at our bank is your ideal next move. Please note that an assessment will be part of the application procedure. If you would like to know more, please contact the team lead, Joris van Dijk, at joris.van.dijk@nibc.com . If you would like to know more about the procedure you may contact the HR Info desk at askhr@nibc.com .

title: Business Analyst
summary: Owning data accuracy, completeness and consistency for Beerwulf stakeholders in coordination with the data engineers.
description: HI SOON-TO-BE NEW BUSINESS ANALYST OF BEERWULF.com We’re a pretty young company (4 years young), and we've recently evolved from start-up to scale-up phase. We are active in 10 European countries, and offer a dynamic and innovative work environment where you can truly make an impact. Our team is a selected blend of around 70 beer and eCommerce specialists. We're looking for a Business Analyst to join our dedicated finance team who can help us form business cases and guard the customer lifetime value. The ideal candidate has super sharp analytical, numerical and problem solving skills. You'll be the person giving recommendations based on your analyses. You'd be the spider in the web when it comes to data!  IN THIS ROLE, YOU WILL FOCUS ON USING DATA TO DRIVE BUSINESS DECISION MAKING WHICH CHANGES THE FUTURE OF THE COMPANY The role reports into the CFO and works directly with all departments to support in financial and business analysis. Your key tasks: Owning data accuracy, completeness and consistency for Beerwulf stakeholders in coordination with the data engineers Assessing success of previously developed products and functionality Analysing customer purchasing behaviour to drive actions to maximise customer lifetime value Preparing & presenting recommendations based on analysis to business leadership Raising the analytical ability of the whole organization through training in data interpretation and basic analysis THE THINGS YOU BRING TO BEERWULF AS A BUSINESS ANALYST 5 years experience in analysing data and driving business decision making at a senior level, preferably in an e-commerce company Strong numerical, analytical and problem solving skills Ability to find useful information despite imperfect data Advanced SQL, Microsoft Excel and financial modelling experience are essential. Proficiency in languages for data modelling /analysis /visualization is a plus: Python, R, Matlab Strong levels of communication, both written and spoken with ability to influence at all levels Ability to cut through complexity and find efficiencies Please note you must be eligible to work in the Netherlands! But above all, you have a healthy amount of beer-love and are excited to work for the online beer retailer that is conquering Europe!  MEET THE TEAM Catherine Safaya  CFO  Asta Baradulinaité Head of Financial Reporting  Tereza Kuncova Reporting & Accounting Specialist  Rodrigo Carbonell BI Analyst

title: Business Analyst FP&A
summary: Develop and interpret financial data/analysis in conjunction with operations management to make recommendations for business and cost improvement.
description: Location: Corporate Office THE ROLE: The Financial Planning and Analysis (FP&A) Department plays a crucial role within the Finance Department: Owner of Group management reporting framework Owner of Group budgeting & forecasting proces Owner of Group strategic modelling & scenario planning Maintain rules and compliance to Group management reporting standards for internal & external reporting Oversight of Group wide Business analysis function Operational coordination of consolidated monthly management reporting, and annual budget processes. Support for other finance functions; Group Accounting, Treasury, Tax and IR on an as needs basis Direct ad-hoc support to CFO and NMC on management reporting and Group financial analysis KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES Key Responsibilities The Business Analysts of the FP&A cover following areas: Strategic financial planning and analysis Produce monthly/quarterly management reporting on operational and financial results, consolidated/per site Develop and interpret financial data/analysis in conjunction with operations management to make recommendations for business and cost improvement. Develop models and coordinate discussion to support strategic operational analyses, including business viability evaluations, operational modifications and marketing evaluations. Maintenance and operation of Group strategic financial models Maintenance and operation of mining valuation & impairment models Maintenance and operation of DTA recoverability and going concern analysis models Financial / operational analysis and interpretation of variances vs plans on mining/refining site results Support for controlling function Provide active management, guidance, & coaching of mine/refining site BAs Provide site FMs/BAs with specialised analysis Build mining/smelting variance analysis models Coordinate budget cycle Key Relationships The Business analyst FP&A will report to the Head of FP&A Internal relationships: Accounting Department, IT, Compliance, Operations, Senior Finance Management, Treasury, Technical teams on sites External relationship: Cash management banks, Facility Agents and Programme Banks, Financing Banks and Institutions, Legal Advisers  QUALIFICATIONS/EXPERIENCE Experience Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Finance or Accounting 5-10 years of experience in a financial/analytical role Mining or metal smelting experience highly desirable Key attributes Excellent English written and oral communication skills\ Numerically minded Excel, cashflow modelling, ability to handle and treat and large amount of data, macros Objectives focussed, ability to handle multiple objectives efficiently Proven planning and organisational skills Strong/resolute personality Adaptable with ability to take on ideas and concepts in a short period of time Accuracy with speed, attention to detail.  APPLICATION: If you are interested in applying for this position, please send us your CV: HR.CorporateOffice@nyrstar.com. We look forward to hearing from you. Please note that only applicants who progress to the next stage will be contacted. Thank you for your interest in applying for this position. For more information on Nyrstar, please visit www.nyrstar.com. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and take pride in a diverse workforce. We do not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or other employment practices for reasons of race, colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, marital or veteran status, medical condition or handicap, disability, or any other legally protected status.

title: Senior Data Analyst
summary:
Didi Chuxing (DiDi) is the world’s leading mobile transportation and convenience platform.
The company offers a full range of app-based transportation and life…
description: Didi Chuxing (DiDi) is the world’s leading mobile transportation and convenience platform. The company offers a full range of app-based transportation and life services for over 550 million users across Asia, Latin America, Australia, and Russia, including Taxi, Express, Premier, Luxe, Bus, Designated Driving, Enterprise Solutions, Bike Sharing, E-bike Sharing, Automobile Solutions, Food Delivery, and Payment. Tens of millions of drivers who find flexible work opportunities on the DiDi platform provide over 10 billion passenger trips a year. DiDi is committed to collaborating with policymakers, the taxi industry, the automobile industry, and communities to solve the world’s transportation, and environmental, and employment challenges with localized smart transportation innovations by leveraging its AI capabilities. By continuously improving user experience and creating social value, DiDi strive  Apply Now at Mustakbil.com  This job was originally posted on Mustakbil.com

title: Risk Analist
summary:
Je hebt veel kennis van Excel en affiniteit met data (bijvoorbeel R of Pyhton).
Wil jij jouw analytische kwaliteiten inzetten en ben je leergierig?
description: Wil jij jouw analytische kwaliteiten inzetten en ben je leergierig? Lees dan verder want wij zijn op zoek naar jou. De functie Als Risk Analist ga jij aan de slag met een grote variëteit aan taken. Je kunt de ene dag bezig zijn met het implementeren van verbeteringen terwijl je de volgende dag een analyse maakt naar de gevolgen van COVID-19. Eveneens help je de business met het verbeteren van bepaalde registratieprocessen en vertegenwoordig je de afdeling Risk in diverse IT-projecten. Als laatste voorbeeld richt je het acceptatiebeleid in het systeem in. Zoals je leest is het takenpakket van de toekomstige Risk Analist enorm gevarieerd. Daarom is het nodig dat jij goed ontwikkelde analytische skills hebt waardoor jij het overzicht bewaart en snel kan schakelen tussen de verschillende taken. Jij deelt in je rol van Risk Analist proactief je bevindingen met het team en met de business. Daarbij ben je natuurlijk altijd alert op kansen en ontwikkelingen en kun je verbetervoorstellen doen en uitrollen. Je komt te werken in een team van 8 man. Het team is onder meer belast met het managen van kredietrisico’s binnen de organisatie. Ook wordt het kredietacceptatiebeleid vastgesteld en ingeregeld en tot slot ontwikkelt het team kredietrisicomodellen. Arbeidsvoorwaarden Vast dienstverband met een vaste werklocatie Een goede werk-privé balans: 33 vrije dagen, regelmatige uitjes en borrels Een laptop van de zaak, de mogelijkheid gebruik te maken van aantrekkelijke private leaseregelingen Goede pensioenregeling De organisatie Onze opdrachtgever is een groot concern en een belangrijke speler met internationale merken in hun assortiment. De sterk gemotiveerde medewerkers in deze organisatie houden dit bedrijf aan de top door een goede managementstructuur, uitstekende faciliteiten, nog betere arbeidsvoorwaarden, prachtige werklocaties en constante inhoudelijke kennisdeling en opbouw. Ze hebben een sterke groeiambitie. De cultuur omschrijft zich als professioneel, resultaatgericht en toch informeel. De organisatie is altijd in beweging. Functie-eisen Een afgeronde wo-opleiding bij voorkeur in financiële richting Minstens 3 jaar relevante werkervaring Je hebt veel kennis van Excel en affiniteit met data (bijvoorbeel R of Pyhton) Je bent zelfstandig, betrokken en kunt goed samenwerken Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal Reageren? Dat kan via onderstaand contactformulier of mail je CV met een korte motivatie naar youssef@wervingopmaat.nl. Voor meer informatie kun je mij bellen of appen op 06-28346666. ID nummer: 1416

title: Junior Cloud Solution Architect
summary:
Understand customers’ overall data estate.
Understand Data Platform Strategies and Advanced Analytics roadmaps to ensure long term technical viability of new…
description: We are looking for a highly motivated and passionate Junior Data Platform & Advanced Analytics Cloud Solution Architect to support in driving high priority customer initiatives on the Microsoft Azure Platform. This is a customer facing role, supporting the overall technical relationship with the customer on Microsoft Data, Advanced Analytics and Artificial Intelligence Platform. You own Data Platform & Advanced Analytics technical customer engagements including architectural design sessions, specific implementation projects and/or pilots. The ideal candidate has experience in a customer-facing role and deep technical discussions with Data Engineers, Data Analysts and/or Developers to drive Data Platform and Advanced Analytics solutions to production. Responsibilities Key responsibilities include: Understand customers’ overall data estate. Apply technical knowledge to architect solutions that meet business and IT needs. Understand Data Platform Strategies and Advanced Analytics roadmaps to ensure long term technical viability of new deployments, infusing key big data, analytics and AI technologies where appropriate (e.g. Azure Synapse, Azure Data Factory, Azure ML, ML Server, Big Data, Data Lake, Azure Databricks, etc.). Ensure all solutions exhibit high levels of performance, security, scalability, maintainability, and appropriate reusability and reliability upon deployment. Develop deep relationships with key customer Engineers, Analysts, and Architects to enable them to be cloud specialists. Collaborate with Senior Cloud Solution Architects in developing complex end-to-end Enterprise solutions on Microsoft Azure platform. Share insights to remove key blockers. Maintain technical skills and knowledge; collaborate and share with the technical community within Microsoft and customers on Azure platform. Qualifications Required 1-5 years of professional experience Capabilities in relationship building, problem solving, collaboration Technical experience with cloud and/or hybrid platforms Subject matter expertise in one or more of the following Data Platform Cloud solutions: SQL including OSS (Postgress, MySQL etc), Azure SQL NoSQL Databases including OSS (Maria DB, Mongo DB, etc), Cosmos DB Big Data including SQL DW, Snowflake, Big Query, Redshift Advanced Analytics including Azure Databricks, visualization tools as PowerBI, Tableau Data Governance Data estate workloads like HDInsight, Hadoop, Cloudera, Spark, Python  Preferred Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineer or similar Certification in one or more of the following technologies: Cloud, mobile, Database, Big Data, BI, Data Science, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence Demonstrated self-learner of new technologies and understands relevant cloud trends. Competitive Landscape: Knowledge of cloud development platforms.  Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.  Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

title: Senior Data Analyst - Freelancer
summary:
Ideally have experience with analyzing clickstream data with markov chains.
One of the biggest online companies in the Netherlands is seeking a Senior Data…
description: Senior Data Analyst - Freelancer 80-100 per hour Amsterdam 4 months One of the biggest online companies in the Netherlands is seeking a Senior Data Analyst to join them to work on some exciting online projects. The ideal Senior Data Analyst will: Have a strong technical skillset in Python and SQL Have worked in an ecommerce environment and have experience analysing online user behaviour Ideally have some experience within Web Analytics and Digital Marketing, preferably some SEA experience Be fluent in Dutch and English Be confident communicating with technical and non-technical stakeholders Ideally have experience with analyzing clickstream data with markov chains. For more information please click the Apply link on this page.

title: Scientist Virological Assays (GMP)
summary:
Critical review of generated data;
For an innovative research oriented international company we are looking for skilled scientists with experience in leadership…
description: Scientist Virological Assays (GMP) Location: Leiden Contact: Nicol Heijtbrink Job type: Contract Contact phone: +31 (0)20 406 97 50 Industry: Pharmaceutical , Life Sciences, Biotechnology Contact email: nicol_heijtbrink@oxfordcorp.com For an innovative research oriented international company we are looking for skilled scientists with experience in leadership and solid hands-on experience with development and validation of analytical & biochemical assays. Job Description Within this company we are looking for an experienced scientist with a background in pharmaceuticals. You will work in a multidisciplinary and dynamic environment on various projects such as Corona Vaccine, polio vaccine, etc. You will work with state-of the art technology with systems / techniques such as: qPCR, ELISA, SDS-PAGE, VNT, TCID 50, etc under GMP conditions. You will be involved in designing studies, writing protocols and reports, training technicians, optimizing methods and analyzing samples.  Responsibilities Design, setup, perform and analyze experiments on a regular basis, to support the assay development processes; Generating high-quality scientific reports Maintaining technical prowess by following relevant literature and knowledge in the field; Activities must be executed according to Good Clinical Laboratory Practice (GCLP) quality requirements. Remain aware and tackle any assay-related issues and potential areas of improvement in the laboratory. Responsible for instructing associate and assistant scientist on the scientific fundamentals of the assays you are responsible for; Critical review of generated data; Requirements Relevant experience in a biotechnology or biopharmaceutical industry environment involving techniques such as ELISA, (q)PCR, cell-based and virus-based assays; GMP experience and pharmaceutical technology transfer skills; Experience/knowledge of HPLC, SDS-PAGE and Western blotting is favorable; Good command of the English language (written and spoken). Benefits Contract: start with a contract of one year, directly at the company, with outlook on a permanent position Salary: €4000 - €4800 gross per month Holidays: 25 Hours: Full time,32h discussable Region: Leiden Vacancy number: 17040 Oxford Global Resources is het grootste recruitmentbureau binnen de vakgebieden Science, Engineering en IT. Al onze recruiters hebben zelf een relevante achtergrond binnen deze gebieden en helpen je graag bij het vinden van de perfecte baan in ons uitgebreide netwerk. Als gespecialiseerde partij hebben wij een groot aanbod aan laboratorium vacatures op het gebied van Quality Control (QC) en Research &Development (R&D) binnen diverse sectoren, waaronder de Farmaceutische industrie, Biotechnologie, Contract Manufacturing, Contract Research, Voedingsmiddelenindustrie, Chemie, Milieu en Plantensector. Oxford is altijd op zoek naar talent met expertise op het gebied van Biotechnologie, Immunologie, Biochemie, Virologie, Microbiologie, Moleculaire Biologie, Life Science, Analytische Chemie, Fysische Chemie, Polymeerchemie, Petrochemie en Diagnostiek. Wij komen graag in contact met kandidaten die ervaring hebben met een of meerdere van de volgende technieken: USP (Upstream Processing) DSP (Downstream Processing), Bioprocesses, viruskweek, celkweek, ELISA, FACS, Western Blot, SDS-page, PCR, RT-PCR, qPCR, kloneren, sequencing, eiwit zuivering, purificatie, HPLC, UPLC, chromatografie, fysische chemie, viscositeit, smeltpunt, pourpoint, pH, XRF, GC, GC-MS, LC, LC-MS, ICP ICP-MS, AAS, UV, titraties, Karl Fisher, formuleren, steriliteit, determinaties, bioburden, environmental monitoring, LIMS, GMP, GLP, GCP, GDP, ISO17025. Vind je deze vacature interessant? Of ben jij op zoek naar een functie op MLO, HLO, BSc, WO, MSc of PhD en heb je interesse in de vacature laboratorium Assistent, Laborant, Laborant monstervoorbereiding, Analist, Technician, Assistant Scientist, Associate Scientist, Scientist, Manufacturing Specialist, Process Engineer, Validatie Engineer, QA (Quality Assurance) Officer, RA (Regulatory Affairs) Officer, Supervisor, Teamleider, Afdelingshoofd, Hoofd Laboratorium, Manager, Director, etc. Neem dan direct contact met ons op! Apply Now

title: Data Engineer
summary:
Collaborate with domain experts and analysts to solve data challenges.
Apply data modelling methodologies and contribute to a robust data platform.
description: At Picnic we care about health and safety, so currently all interviews are done online and our team is working from home. We keep a close eye on the developments around Covid-19, and support your relocation to Amsterdam when it is safe to do so. It is possible to start working remotely with us - have a peek at how the remote onboarding is going here. Do you want to be part of the grocery revolution? At Picnic you get the chance to join a young and forward-thinking start-up culture, where everything you do matters. With a data-driven approach and an incredible service, Picnic strives to make grocery shopping simple, fun, and affordable for everyone. Known for our just-in-time supply-chain and a unique last-mile delivery strategy, we have become one of the fastest-growing companies of the Netherlands! We rely on our Data Engineers to glean insights from large data sets and promote business intelligence. Working with next generation technologies they write the future of in-app grocery ordering. We're on a quest for new Data Engineers to join our all-star team. Where you fit in Picnic is data-driven. As one of our engineers, you play a critical role in each aspect of our business. From route planning, delivery of groceries, to analyzing supply chains. You ensure that each level of our operation is supported, adjusted, and predicted with data. There's no two ways about it – you're a Data Wizard or Witch. While manipulating data, you bring out detailed information and quirky insights. You find what others can't and glean business opportunity from numbers. Collaborating with our analysts, you find practical solutions to persistent problems. By working towards a reliable data pipeline, you allow the team to mine and crunch data. You analyse, experiment, and promote statistics that pique your interest. Do you think you've spotted how to ensure our large fleet of electric vehicles is used in the most efficient way? Test, evaluate, and evolve your ideas alongside our dedicated Distribution team. More interested in customer behavior? That's fine – work on in-app analytics to ensure our mobile store remains smooth, speedy, and robust. You have the opportunity to work on what you love while writing the future of in-app grocery shopping! We're using the Snowplow Framework to improve our store. If you want more motivation to apply, check out this case-study here. What challenges await you Design, implement, and maintain scalable data pipelines Collaborate with domain experts and analysts to solve data challenges Develop advanced data reporting and visualizations Apply data modelling methodologies and contribute to a robust data platform Who you are Master's degree in Computer Science or equivalent Experience with SQL and relational databases Experience with one or more programming languages (Python or Java preferred) Strong understanding of data models (Data Vault and Kimball) and data warehouses in general Fluent in English, Dutch not required ‍ Technologies you'll use Python, SQL Snowflake, MongoDB, PostgreSQL, Tableau Elastic MapReduce, Snowplow, Kinesis AWS, Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform, Vault Hungry for more? Check out https://stackshare.io/picnic-technologies for an overview of our tech stack. Picnic perks Located in Amsterdam, our fun-filled office is the best place for you to focus on your Picnic projects. Equipped with your favorite hardware and surrounded by like-minded people, you'll grow professionally and personally, while enjoying the startup life along the way. We like to keep our 40-hour work-week flexible around here. Our tech team consists of 15 product teams, which handle tons of innovative projects. Sharing, mentoring and keeping up to date is a must at Picnic: Meetups, webinars, Lunch & Learn sessions, and our very own Tech academy make sure that's taken care of. Your soft skills will get some attention as well, with tailored training and courses. Our salaries are market competitive and our pension program will put your mind at ease. Relocation package? Sure! If you join Picnic from abroad, we'll cover your trip to Amsterdam, sponsor your Visa, and offer you a month of accommodation while you settle in. If you are joining us from a country that doesn't allow traveling to the Netherlands just yet due to Covid-19, there's a chance that your onboarding could take place remotely. We had lots of new team members starting their Picnic-journey remotely already, you can have a peek at how it's going here. What are you waiting for? Get in touch! And no worries, the whole process is currently fully remote, to keep everyone safe and healthy.

title: Senior Benefits Operations Analyst Central
summary: Process Management: Perform complex Benefits or Leave data-related changes that require specialized knowledge and ensure data accuracy in SAP.
description: Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world’s best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At NIKE, Inc. it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game. NIKE, Inc.’s uncompromising focus on human potential extends to its workforce. Nike Human Resources teams help attract, retain, and reward the world’s most innovative people by creating programs to help them thrive. They accelerate company growth as stewards of culture, organizational effectiveness, talent and change. The global Human Resources community includes experts in talent planning, talent acquisition, talent development, compensation and benefits, employee relations and more. Together, they develop a motivated, diverse and engaged global team. WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR As our HR Senior Benefits Operations Analyst (Austria, Germany, Switzerland), you will contribute to the administration and implementation of benefits programs for Nike’s European Headquarters in the Netherlands. Within the Benefits Operations Team you will provide high level support to internal Nike customers as well as external vendors. Involvement in the roll out of new Benefit programs, like a Pension plan, in partnership with our Benefits COE will be in the scope of this position. WHAT YOU WILL WORK ON Process Management: Perform complex Benefits or Leave data-related changes that require specialized knowledge and ensure data accuracy in SAP. Handle situations that require complex research, auditing and detailed knowledge of applicable area to resolve issues quickly and accurately. Coordinate work of external vendors and track performance. Interprets customer needs, assesses requirements and identifies solutions to non-standard requests involving all necessary stakeholders.  Service Excellence: Deliver service excellence to employees and Human Resource Shared Center teammates by responding in a professional, accurate and timely manner to all calls, emails and CRM Tool (Right Now) issues concerning Benefit or Leave programs. Communicate updates to other Global Shared Services departments to ensure timely and accurate workflow of data. Includes submitting all information changes to Data Management/Payroll via appropriate format (forms, email, systematically, etc.) to facilitate entry in HR systems. Explains difficult issues and works to build consensus.  Process Improvement: Active contributor to continuous process improvement, relevant and effective knowledge data base and adequate utilization of HR systems and tools. Applies best practices and knowledge of internal/external business challenges to improve products, processes or services (Recommends change to metrics, service level agreements with vendors and vendor relationship improvements based on analysis and objective construct and review of data). Responsible for account reconciliation of all payments made from the benefit plans. Ensures accuracy of vendor invoices and payments are delivered to vendors on time. Projects: Participate in projects as a functional expert, for example connected to payroll. WHO YOU WILL WORK WITH This role includes working closely with other functional teams such as Workforce Administration and Payroll, Benefits and various vendors. You will be cooperating with internal and external EMEA teams along with local HR teams. You will report to the Benefits Operations Manager. WHAT YOU BRING Previous experience with Human Resources (Benefits) Operations environment is required, 2-4 years at least. Strong vendor management experience as well as affinity with HRMS systems (SAP preferred). It is crucial to have strong analytical skills, attention to detail and problem-solving attitude. We require a team player who easily adapts to a dynamic and changing environment. You will have first class communication skills to connect and partner with the various Nike departments. Written and spoken English and German required. Knowledge of German labor law and social security system is a plus. NIKE, Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Nike offers a generous total rewards package, casual work environment, a diverse and inclusive culture, and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location, or the role, every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete* in the world. NIKE, Inc. is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.

title: (Junior) data analist
summary:
Weet jij zeker dat jij de data analist bent die wij zoeken?
Het begeleiden van data stagiaires.
Het ontsluiten, verrijken en leveren van data.
description: Ben jij net HBO/WO afgestudeerd of zit je in de afrondende fase van je studie (bijvoorbeeld bedrijfskunde of bedrijfseconomie), heb jij big data altijd al interessant gevonden en ben jij óók nog eens een ster in Excel? Dan zijn wij op zoek naar jou! Wat ga je doen? Definiëren van de strategie, het in kaart brengen van bedrijfsprocessen op het gebied van Big Data en de bijbehorende impact op het gegevenslandschap van de organisatie Werkt samen met het MT-team op het gebied van procesontwikkeling Ontwikkelen van standaarden, kaders en richtlijnen rondom data, processen en procedures Zorg dragen voor kwaliteit van data, door systematische controle op juistheid, volledigheid en tijdigheid Het ontsluiten, verrijken en leveren van data Beheren van datamigratie activiteiten en het opnemen van de nieuwste dataconversie gerelateerde innovaties; Opstellen en initiëren van rapportages Het begeleiden van data stagiaires Continu bezig zijn met bedrijfsprocessen en dataverwerking optimaliseren door het ontwikkelen en implementeren van nieuwe datamodellen. Zorgen voor een goede structuur van alle data stromen Zorgen dat alle datasystemen goed gekoppeld worden in samenwerking met onze digital marketeer Jij: Hebt affiniteit met (big) data en het maken van rapportages en/of het beheren van applicaties Beschikt over sterk analytisch vermogen Bent proactief, werkt goed zelfstandig en bent communicatief vaardig Hebt HBO/WO werk- en denkniveau Beschikt over high-end Excel-skills Beheerst de Nederlandse taal uitstekend in woord en geschrift Bent bij voorkeur 32 tot 40 uur per week beschikbaar Gaat de "extra mile" om jouw doelen te behalen Wij bieden: Marktconform salaris Afwisselende functie met veel ruimte voor eigen inbreng Doorgroeimogelijkheden binnen het bedrijf Een kantoor in hartje Den Haag Een geweldige werksfeer! Stuk voor stuk jonge en ambitieuze collega's De leukste IVB borrels en events Reiskosten Vakantiegeld Waar ga je werken Invorderingsbedrijf BV is een jong en snelgroeiend creditmanagment bedrijf. In een record tempo zijn wij binnen 8 jaar uitgegroeid tot een speler van formaat binnen de markt. Invorderingsbedrijf biedt advocaten, juristen en deurwaarders onder 1 dak. Wij bieden klanten de best mogelijke oplossing voor het innen van elk soort vordering in binnen- en buitenland. Wij zijn vastbesloten de groei de komende jaren door te zetten door klanten een breder pallet aan producten aan te bieden. Producten die hen helpen om hun financiële risico’s te beperken. Weet jij zeker dat jij de data analist bent die wij zoeken? Solliciteer dan nu via bovenstaande button of neem voor meer informatie contact op met Yasmin Aouragh (070 217 1557)! *Acquisitie n.a.v. deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld Parttime uren: 32-40 per week Soort dienstverband: Fulltime, Parttime Salaris: €1.900,00 - €2.700,00 per maand Arbeidsvoorwaarden: Vrijdagmiddagborrel Werkschema: Dagdienst ma-vr Ervaring: Data: 1 jaar (Aanbevolen) Taal: Nederlands (Vereist) Thuiswerken: Nee

title: Geo-data analist
summary:
Ben jij een junior Geo-data analist die diverse stakeholders wil adviseren over ecologische & veilige routes in de energietransitie?
Jij staat bij ons centraal.
description: Ben jij een junior Geo-data analist die diverse stakeholders wil adviseren over ecologische & veilige routes in de energietransitie?  Wat jij gaat doen Als Geo-data analist zorg je voor de verwerking van aangeleverde assetgegevens (door derden) in het GIS systeem van de klant (specifiek GIS systeem, vergelijkbaar met ArcGIS, Qgis, GBI etc). Het gaat om het omzetten van de Asset Data (luchtfoto en AutoCAD). Het gaat om een verantwoordelijke rol in data omzetten, invoeren en converteren. Hierin zul je de kans krijgen om ervaring op te doen in stakeholdermanagement, een pittige rol waarin je belanghebbenden adviseert.  Ben jij de kandidaat? WO werk- en denkniveau Aantoonbare ervaring met Arcgis, Qgis, GBI, dgDialog, Geoweb of vergelijkbaar Aantoonbare ervaring met Excel Aantoonbare ervaring met Microstation Ervaring met Spatial Workshop en AutoCAD is een pré Je beschikt over uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden, zowel in het Nederlands als in het Engels    Wat wij bieden Voor deze functie kom je bij Voort in dienst. Jij staat bij ons centraal. Elk moment van jou vinden wij bijzonder. En vieren wij samen. Wij zorgen dat jij op de juiste werkplek belandt. Waar jij past. Waar je techniek op de kaart zet. Want dat is jouw vak. En samen werken we aan jouw ontwikkeling. Zodat je blijft groeien op technisch en professioneel vlak. Je krijgt van ons: een mooie baan bij onze opdrachtgever een goed salaris om rond te komen en leuke dingen te doen 3 trainingen per jaar bij de Voort Academy om aan je ontwikkeling te werken een opleidingsbudget van €1250,- per jaar zodat je blijft groeien secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden zoals een aandraagbonus 25 vakantiedagen (overige vrije dagen zijn afhankelijk van de cao van de opdrachtgever)    Waar jij gaat werken Onze opdrachtgever is een landelijke semi-overheid met diverse grote kantoren.

title: Data Analytics Traineeship
summary:
Heeft het werken met data jouw interesse?
BI is het gehele proces rondom het verzamelen en structureren van data binnen een organisatie teneinde deze data om te…
description: Heeft het werken met data jouw interesse? Ben jij analytisch en vind jij het leuk om te puzzelen? Dan is het Data Analytics Traineeship van Smart Data People voor jou de volgende stap! Dit zijn namelijk de skills die wij zoeken om complexe (bedrijfs) processen en datastromen in kaart te brengen en te optimaliseren. Smart Data People is gespecialiseerd in Business Intelligence (BI). BI is het gehele proces rondom het verzamelen en structureren van data binnen een organisatie teneinde deze data om te zetten in bruikbare beslissingsondersteunende informatie (intelligence). Deze informatie kan vervolgens worden gevisualiseerd in een rapportage of dashboard met rapportagetools waardoor er beslissingen kunnen worden genomen op basis van feiten en cijfers. Smart Data People start in maart 2021 wederom een Business Intelligence Traineeship waarin jij door specialisten met ervaring uit de praktijk opgeleid wordt tot een Junior Business Intelligence Professional/ Data analist / Data engineer. Naast technische skills wordt er ook aandacht aan soft skills besteed, omdat wij weten hoe belangrijk het is dat jij een goede start maakt bij je nieuwe werkgever. Dit gehele traject zal één jaar duren, waarbij je de eerste twee maanden fulltime wordt opgeleid (theorie, examens en praktijk). Na de opleidingsperiode begeleiden wij je richting een passende opdrachtgever in de regio van jouw woonplaats, waar jij je opgedane skills in de praktijk zal brengen onder begeleiding van een senior. Wij beschikken over een uitgebreid netwerk van potentiële opdrachtgevers in diverse branches zodat jij altijd bij een passende organisatie in jouw regio aan de slag kunt gaan. Denk hierbij aan marketing, accountancy, gemeenten, zorg, retailers, bouw, infra, ziekenhuizen, banken, e-commerce, techniek en hier komen regelmatig nieuwe opdrachtgevers en branches bij! Opdrachtgevers waar we op dit moment al mee samenwerken kun je hier vinden. Je werkzaamheden zijn uiteenlopend en inhoudelijk verschillend per opdrachtgever/branche waar je gaat werken, maar denk hierbij aan: Het verzamelen, optimaliseren en inzichtelijk maken van (bedrijfskundige) data- en informatiestromen; Het in kaart brengen van de huidige en de gewenste situatie; Diverse KPI's (prestatie indicatoren) opstellen, identificeren en visualiseren in BI rapportages of dashboards; Het opzetten en inrichten van een datawarehouse; Het schrijven van Business Rules in SQL; Op basis van je bevindingen advies geven over de huidige en toekomstige bedrijfsvoering; Helpen de organisatie bewuster te worden op het sturen op informatie (data driven). Je zal hierbij gebruik maken van diverse Business Intelligence tools welke je in het traineeship geleerd krijgt. Communicatief vaardig zijn is belangrijk aangezien jij de juiste informatie en stromingen binnen een organisatie inzichtelijk moet maken door het stellen van de juiste vragen. Bedrijfskundig inzicht is dan ook van toegevoegde waarde. Wat hebben wij jou te bieden Een specialistisch data traineeship gedoceerd door erkende (Microsoft) gecertificeerde trainers; Het behalen van diverse erkende (Microsoft) certificeringen die aansluiten op de behoefte in de markt: SQL, Power BI, Azure Fundamentals, Implementing an Azure Data Solution, Python en Scrum/Agile; Toegespitste tool-kennis passend bij jouw opdrachtgever: o.a. Qlik, Tableau, SAP BusinessObjects en Cognos Analytics; Kennis en ervaringen vanuit de praktijk; Een gedegen inwerktraject door een ervaren Business Intelligence specialist; Begeleiding en coaching vanuit een persoonlijke Talent Manager die zorgt voor een goede instroom en welzijn bij de opdrachtgever waar je gaat starten; Baangarantie bij een opdrachtgever in een branche die bij je past en uiteraard in de regio van je woonplaats. Vereisten Een afgeronde wo bèta of bedrijfskundige opleiding; Je hebt aantoonbare ervaring of affiniteit met BI, data en/of databases; Ervaring met data gerelateerde programma's als Matlab, Python, R, VBA of SQL is een vereiste; Ervaring met BI tools als bijvoorbeeld Power BI, Tableau of Qlikview is een pré; Je bent leergierig, analytisch, enthousiast, oplossingsgericht, zelfstandig en hebt de drive om je kennis up-to-date te houden; Je beschikt over goede communicatieve vaardigheden; Je beheerst naast de Nederlandse taal ook de Engelse taal; Je bent fulltime beschikbaar vanaf maart 2021. Waarom Smart Data People Waarom zou je voor Smart Data People kiezen? Wij hebben zowel specialistische BI kennis als jarenlange ervaring in het opleiden van jonge high potentials in huis om jou van de beste start in je carrière te voorzien. Een gaaf uitgebreid opleidingsprogramma met erkende certificeringen, specialistische begeleiding, gedegen inwerktraject en minimale reistijd. Dat is waar wij van Smart Data People voor staan! Solliciteer direct en ga het gesprek met ons aan om er zelf achter te komen wat wij voor jouw toekomst kunnen betekenen. Verwachte startdatum: 8-3-2021 Soort dienstverband: Fulltime Arbeidsvoorwaarden: Extra vakantiedagen Pensioen Reiskostenvergoeding Vrijdagmiddagborrel Werkschema: ma-vr Opleiding: Master (Vereist)

title: Financial Analyst
summary: Are you passionate about working with financial data and is it your ambition to grow within an international Business control department?
description: At Corbion, we exist to champion preservation in all its forms, preserving food and food production, health, and our planet.  Are you passionate about working with financial data and is it your ambition to grow within an international Business control department? Are you detail-oriented, analytical, and interested in understanding not only the numbers but also their business context?  As a Financial Analyst in our team you will have a diverse portfolio of responsibilities, support different business controllers, interact with various business teams and get the opportunity to learn and develop yourself.  The Financial Analyst is part of the Business Control organization. The Business Controllers are acting as business partners for the commercial and operational teams and are focused on value creation. You will report to the Senior Finance Director Lactic Acid and Specialties (LAS) and have a dotted reporting line to the Finance Director R&D and Algae.  Responsibilities  Sales and Margin Reporting – deliver and continuously improve pipeline, sales and margin reporting. Function as key user of our management reporting tool(s) and collaborate with IT Department on change requests and issue resolution. Expense Control – responsible for consolidating, reporting and analyzing monthly expenses for different business areas, including R&D hours. Support the budget and forecast process in collaboration with the business teams. Finance Business Partner for LAS Marketing and Business Excellence team – finance support for VP LAS Marketing and Business Excellence and his team, covering both expenses and CAPEX projects. Implementation new management reporting tool – contribute to the transition of our new management reporting tool (planned in 2022), most likely including report design, set-up and roll-out and training. WBSO (subsidy) – linking pin between subsidy consultant, financial administration and business leads, ensure that all submissions are prepared on time and ensure good quality of information. Support on Innovation KPI’s calculation Support Business Controllers on various Commercial and Innovation topics as well as other ad hoc finance projects/activities.  Requirements  We are looking for a pro-active financial analyst with high level analytical skills who’s interested in understanding our business, would like to further develop controlling skills and has ambition to grow in the organization.  University degree in finance (or international equivalent) Qualifications and experience Up to four years working experience in a finance function High Potential with the ambition to further develop within the finance organization Fluent in English Strong analytical skills, accurate and pro-active Excellent communication skills International Mindset Hands on mentality IT literate - mainly Excel, Powerpoint, SAP experience is a benefit  Our offer  We offer competitive remuneration and benefits. What makes Corbion special is the way we consciously create that connection between the product of our work and our individual lives and use it to shape our choices and our priorities as a company. We have a great company made up of talented, dedicated people – people who share a purpose and a vision. When we all understand how we intend to get there in the same way, there’s no telling how far we can go. We offer you the chance to join a company with a: Culture to empower people and where your initiatives and ideas make a real difference International focus with truly diverse teams Unique possibility to be trained by our internal expertise in the world of biobased products We invest in relevant training courses related to your particular discipline, that will give you the opportunity to grow into an industry expert Lastly, we offer a friendly, informal culture in a demanding professional environment  In addition, we actively embrace diversity in how we work together and contribute toward our shared objectives and values. By joining Corbion, you will become an employee in a company where you can feel pride in your achievements and develop your career with global prospects.  About Corbion  What makes Corbion truly special is our talented global team of people, who are consciously dedicated to connecting the work we do together with the difference it makes in the lives of consumers, including our own friends and families. At Corbion, innovation is in our DNA; we explore, we discover, we create, and then we do it all over again, finding ever-better ways to help the world solve some of its most pressing challenges. When you come to Corbion, you will find that for us, sustainability is not simply a corporate program, it is at the very heart of our business, giving direction to our work, our investments and our creativity. We exist to preserve what matters.  As a company where day-to-day priorities and decisions are shaped by a shared purpose and vision, we enjoy a working environment energized by empowerment and opportunity. By joining Corbion, you can be part of :  A culture open to great ideas wherever they come from, and where your work can make a real difference in the world An organization that values diversity of thought, background and experience A company ready to invest in you, helping you grow toward your personal ambitions A workplace that’s friendly and informal, while being focused and professional An international team small enough to stay agile, but large and talented enough to make an impact today, and for future generations  Our corporate values – Collaboration, Care, Courage and Commitment – define what it takes to overcome obstacles and create the sustainable breakthroughs the world sorely needs. As a member of the Corbion team, you’ll see these values put into action every day, and you’ll have the chance to make your own unique contribution to our collective achievements. Corbion does not accept unsolicited resumes from individual recruiters or third party recruiting agencies in response to job postings. No fee will be paid to third parties who submit unsolicited candidates directly to hiring managers. All candidates must be submitted by approved Corbion vendors who have been expressly requested to make a submission by our Talent Acquisition team for a specific job opening. No placement fees will be paid to any firm unless such a request has been made by the Corbion Talent Acquisition team and such candidate was submitted to the Corbion Talent Acquisition Team.

title: Commerce Insights Lead
summary: Drive tooling decisions for increasing data availability, automation and data quality, working closely with sales enablement and commerce leadership.
description: Full-time · Amsterdam Hi, we are Mollie! Our mission is creating a greater playing field for everyone. By offering convenient, safe and worldwide payment solutions we remove barriers for companies of all sizes to compete on equal terms.  Your opportunity: Mollie is a pioneer in online payments. We are one of the fastest-growing payment service providers in Europe. We help businesses of all sizes sell and scale more efficiently with a solid and easy-to-use payment solution. With the help of our simple and clear payment API, we offer various payment methods in one go. We are making a complex process super simple. Mollie is very ambitious. We are trusted by over 100.000 customers in the Benelux, Germany, and France. Our mission is to become the most loved online payment provider in Europe and we are making great progress towards that goal. As part of the Commerce Optimisation team, you will be the authority on Mollie’s commercial performance: measuring key metrics, delivering forecasts & reporting to leadership and the sales teams. You are involved hands on with analytics and focus on delivering actionable insights via Looker dashboards, and covering ad-hoc analysis needs. Overseeing a small team of motivated analysts, you closely monitor our commercial performance and support our Commerce stakeholders with steering. What you'll be doing: Analyze trends and find root-cause, and report on these in weekly and monthly business updates to the commerce leadership team, functioning as the thought partner to understand drivers behind performance Conduct sophisticated and creative analysis on complex data and translate the results into actionable deliverables to our Commerce stakeholders Manage a team of two analyst and together be the driver of all commercial insights and analytics across Partnerships, Marketing and Sales. Manage and deliver recommendations on ad-hoc analysis needs (eg: Suggesting new KPI’s, executing further root-cause analysis as needed) Oversee, expand and improve our BI library in Looker Own the quarterly forecasting & commission process for all countries and teams, constantly improving the forecasting accuracy Drive tooling decisions for increasing data availability, automation and data quality, working closely with sales enablement and commerce leadership Working cross-departmentally with our Data & Finance teams Meet the team Rick  Head of Commerce Optimization  Lotte Customer Success Strategy Manager  Nate Commercial Analyst  Anna Commercial Analyst

title: Senior Data Engineer
summary:
Work with data analysts to gather requirements;
And turning it into information to be used by the data analysts for internal and external dashboards;
description: At the Rainforest Alliance, we are building an alliance to create a better future for people and nature by making responsible business the new normal. To advance our mission, we focus on amplifying our impact on the ground through systemic transformation: change across the entire supply chain, change in the relationship between people and nature, and change within our own organization. We achieve this transformation by working in collaboration with a wide range of stakeholders to create a stronger Alliance. Together, we amplify the voices of farmers and forest communities, improve livelihoods, protect biodiversity, and help people adapt to climate change in bold and effective ways. We embrace transparency because we believe that the best way to build trust across our alliance is through openness about our tactics, our impact, and partners on the ground. Together, we can achieve our vision of a world where people and nature thrive in harmony.  Position summary: As Rainforest Alliance we believe in the value of data. We want our organization and our stakeholders to be able to make data-informed decisions. Therefore, it is key that they can access the information they need in an easy, timely and digestible way.  To enable this, we've built a Data Analytics Platform (DAP) where we ingest data from multiple sources, integrate and serve it as information to the end users. The Data Engineer will be responsible for the DAP, ensure that the data is properly ingested, modelled and delivered, and to manage a small team of data engineers/modelers.  Responsibilities: Conceptual, logical and physical data warehouse modelling; Build data pipelines (ETL/ELT); Integrate data from different sources (Salesforce, Outsystems, Chainpoint, Sharepoint, Netsuite, etc.) and turning it into information to be used by the data analysts for internal and external dashboards; Peer review the work of other data engineers; Guide, mentor, coach, and teach junior DWH/ETL developers; Maintain the Data Analytics Platform (DAP) Work with data analysts to gather requirements; Oversee the day-today management of a small team, including performance evaluations, mentoring, and guiding professional development opportunities; and Other duties, as assigned.  Qualifications: Bachelor degree in Computer Science or equivalent; or, equivalent professional qualification or work experience 7 years of experience as a data (warehouse) engineer, modeler or in a similar role Strong SQL knowledge Experience in dimensional modeling Experience with data integration tools Familiar with/experienced in Data Vault methodology Familiar with/experienced in Azure Synapse Familiar with/experienced in Infrastructure as Code (Terraform) Fully fluent in English Knowledge of Power BI is a plus  Salary: Commensurate with experience.  Deadline: March 26, 2021  Notes: Only candidates authorized to work in The Netherlands will be considered The Rainforest Alliance encourages diversity and inclusion across the global organization. With this commitment to diversity, we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate on the basis of gender, race, color, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, ages, disability and any other protected group.  If you have any questions about the job vacancy, please contact the HR department: recruitment@ra.org

title: (Senior) Reporting Analist
summary:
Je inventariseert de rapportagewensen van klanten en modelleert de data in samenwerking met IT.
Jouw inzichten en rapportages spelen een sleutelrol in het…
description: Dit ga je doen  Als (Senior) Reporting Analist ben je direct betrokken bij het ontwikkelen van stuurinformatie binnen DAS en werk je bovendien samen met veel verschillende bedrijfsonderdelen. Ben jij een teamplayer met een sterk analytisch vermogen en help jij DAS graag bij het ontwikkelen en opstellen van operationele rapportages (dashboards)? Dan is DAS op zoek naar jou!  Dit ga je doen DAS is volop in beweging en wij zijn bovendien ons primaire proces 'Juridische Hulpverlening' opnieuw aan het inrichten. Het tijdig en correct beschikbaar hebben van de juiste stuurinformatie is van het grootste belang. Hier ga jij een belangrijke rol in vervullen! Als (Senior) Reporting Analist heb je verder de volgende verantwoordelijkheden: Je bent verantwoordelijk voor het ontwikkelen van dashboards die triggeren tot actie Je werkt met veel verschillende stakeholders en brengt in kaart wat voor hen werkelijk belangrijk is om zo de juiste managementbeslissingen te kunnen nemen Je adviseert Capaciteits- en Business Analisten over hoe rapportages en dashboards het beste kunnen worden ingericht Je inventariseert de rapportagewensen van klanten en modelleert de data in samenwerking met IT Je neemt het voortouw bij het onderzoeken en implementeren van nieuwe functionaliteiten binnen de beschikbare BI-tools en het verbeteren van de processen binnen Reporting Je beheert de nog te ontwikkelen Data Dictionary  Waar kom je terecht? Je komt terecht in een leuk en ambitieus team dat net als DAS volop in beweging is. Finance Reporting bestaat uit 4 medewerkers die zich inzetten voor een betrouwbare reporting aan verschillende onderdelen binnen DAS en daarbuiten. Binnen deze rol rapporteer je aan de Manager Reporting. Je werkt voornamelijk aan rapportages voor de afdeling Juridische Hulpverlening, waar een nieuw proces wordt neergezet en nieuwe rapportages nodig zijn om te bepalen of het nieuwe proces effectief én efficiënt is. De samenwerking met de afdeling Juridische Hulpverlening wordt intensief, op die bewezen manier hebben jouw rapportages maximaal impact op de dagelijkse bedrijfsvoering. Jouw inzichten en rapportages spelen een sleutelrol in het besturen van DAS, en zijn instrumenteel in de realisatie van een data-gedreven cultuur. Onze organisatie wordt gekenmerkt door het mensgerichte karakter en collegialiteit. Onze cultuur is uit te drukken in de volgende waarden: menselijk, slim, open, betrokken en optimistisch. Jouw werkplek is goed te bereiken met het openbaar vervoer. Vanaf Amsterdam Bijlmer ArenA is het slechts 5 minuten lopen. Conform de adviezen van de regering werken alle medewerkers van DAS op dit moment volledig vanuit huis i.v.m. COVID-19 (het coronavirus). De sollicitatiegesprekken worden daarom gevoerd via zoom.  Must have Minimaal 3 jaar werkervaring in soortgelijke functie Ervaring met Business Intelligence tools Sterk analytisch en conceptueel vermogen Klantgericht Focus op het behalen van resultaten Accountable gedrag  Nice to have Ervaring met Qlikview/Qliksense is een pré  Ons aanbod Een marktconform salaris, inschaling is afhankelijk van opleiding en ervaring Een 38-urige werkweek, 8% vakantiegeld en een 13e maand 25 vakantiedagen op fulltime basis en de mogelijkheid tot het opbouwen van spaaruren Collectieve verzekering voor zorg- en inkomen en een pensioenregeling Jezelf blijven ontwikkelen met een ruim aanbod aan online trainingen via Goodhabitz De mogelijkheid om gebruik te maken van de collectieve regeling bedrijfsfitness  Belangstelling Klik op de knop ‘direct solliciteren’ en lever jouw cv en motivatiebrief in. Zien wij een match? Dan bestaat de procedure uit een telefonische kennismaking, twee vervolggesprekken, een e-assessment en pre-employmentscreening. DAS heeft de pre-employmentscreening uitbesteed aan Validata-Group. We doen onderzoek naar deskundigheid en betrouwbaarheid, waarbij voor sommige functies onderzoek gedaan wordt naar jouw financiële achtergrond. Toch nog vragen? Voor inhoudelijke vragen kan je contact opnemen met Bas Butzelaar via scl.butzelaar@das.nl. Voor vragen over de procedure kan je contact opnemen met Céline Berings via c.berings@das.nl.  Job Reference: FR00084

title: Data Engineer
summary:
Experience with data pipelines, data warehousing and Big Data processing.
As a Data engineer you work to enable the analysts, data scientists and insight…
description: Data Engineer | IKEA Consumer and Market Insights | Core Business Franchise Delft (The Netherlands), Full-time You see things a little differently. So do we! We believe that what you value is more important than what your CV says. We offer positions that will challenge your skills and let you grow. Come see things a little differently with us. Who we are The world is changing and the IKEA business is changing with it. For IKEA though, one thing will always remain the same our vision to create a better everyday life for the many people. We will strengthen and develop our competences in order to meet the needs and dreams of the many people around the world. And to be accessible and relevant, wherever and whenever they wish to meet IKEA. About IKEA Consumer & Market Insights (ICMI) ICMI has the assignment to contribute to IKEA people making well founded decisions based on actionable and timely insights. ICMI delivers Consumer Insights, Strategy & Market Insights, and Brand & Range Insights. Each of these three areas develops and/or operates insight products to IKEA people across our value chain. As a Data Engineer, you will be part of the Data Engineering and Analytics chapter in ICMI. Key responsibilities As a Data engineer you work to enable the analysts, data scientists and insight specialists to efficiently gather, manage and use data. You are involved in shaping the data sets needed for successful analysis and is comfortable with using modern ways to transform and curate the data. You lead the creation of data sets and make sure they can be efficiently worked with in a modern cloud based environment. You help communicate the challenges and opportunities connected with your role both inside and outside your product team and strive to show how data is helping the team fulfill the product vision. You work with your product team every day, but especially data scientists and insight focused colleagues to provide the team with the data needed to efficiently deliver to the product roadmap. You take your colleagues by the hand and you advise in understandable language what is needed to enable you and the team to use data in the most efficient way.  You will: Combine, organize and analyze raw information from different sources across the IKEA ecosystem and external sources. Drive all aspects of collecting, integrating, modelling, processing and refinement of data as needed by your product team or area. Build, test and maintain data systems and pipelines. Evaluate business needs and objectives in collaboration with Product Team and other stakeholders. Explore ways to enhance data quality and reliability. Identify opportunities for data acquisition. Contribute to the development of analytical tools and programs, ensuring easy and standardized access and sharing of data. Work closely together with partners, peers and other relevant roles like data scientists, analysts or architects across IKEA as well as in your team. Ensure application and consistency with relevant digital frameworks, principles, guidelines and standards. Document and make the relevant know-how available. Knowledge Strong knowledge in designing efficient, robust and automated data pipelines and ETL workflows. Hands-on experience with database design in varying concepts. Expertise with data modelling and related concepts, incl. relational, non-relational and multi-dimensional modelling. Excellent knowledge in programming, preferable of several programming languages. Experience with data pipelines, data warehousing and Big Data processing. Knowledge about cloud infrastructure and computing environments. Capabilities Great numerical and analytical skills. Find solutions to tricky problems. Make decisions based on judgement, data and situation. Solve problems proactively and navigate through road blockers and obstacles. Build and maintain relationships and collaborate across Inter IKEA Group. Excellent team work and communication skills. Understand the complexity of the IKEA business and technology landscape. Able to work closely together with colleagues with complimentary skills, e.g. data scientist, business analysts etc. Required/ Relevant work experience At least Bachelor’s degree within Engineering, Computer science, Information Systems, Mathematics or related fields Preferred: Master’s degree within Engineering, Computer science, Information Systems, Mathematics or related fields Previous experience working with Data Engineering Experience as a project member in agile project environments and methodologies as well in running business activities Preferred: previous knowledge of the IKEA retail system Motivation Passion for retail and the possibilities that digital brings. Lead by example and share the IKEA culture and values. Like working in the unknown and with lots of different stakeholders. Motivated by being a key contributor to digitalise the IKEA Franchise offer and the IKEA Concept.  More Information  This is a full time position (40h/week). Travelling may be required based on business needs. Please send your application – CV and motivation letter – by 8 March 2021. Please note that we are continuously interviewing candidates.

title: Analyst, Regulatory Reporting
summary: The focus of this position is Regulatory reporting, and within this field specifically on those reports that are data-oriented rather than conventional reports,…
description: Would you like to work for one of the World's largest banks in an exciting, dynamic and international environment? We are currently recruiting for an Analyst, Regulatory Reporting for our offices in Amsterdam. MUFG Bank Europe N.V. (MBE) is a fully-owned subsidiary of Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group (MUFG), one of the largest ranked Financial Groups in the world in terms of assets. A world-class set of businesses and more than 180,000 employees in 50 markets. MUFG offers stability in an ever-changing market, providing services to high-profile clients worldwide.  For more than 50 years MBE offers commercial banking services to both Japanese and non-Japanese corporate customers in The Netherlands and, through its branches, in Central and East Europe. The goal is to be among the top performing foreign-owned banks operating in The Netherlands, providing value-added banking services and excellent operations, fulfilling both Japanese and non-Japanese customers' needs. The MBE subsidiary based in The Netherlands is a growing network of branches, managed from Amsterdam.  Our vision? To become the world’s most trusted financial group. You’ll help us achieve it. Overall Purpose of Job: Design, prepare and review financial information for customers (internal / external) of the finance function, including the contribution of subject matter expertise in reporting change initiatives. Function positioning: The function forms part of Finance Division, responsible for Regulatory Reporting. The task of Regulatory Reporting is to manage all data-oriented reporting and processes to ensure delivery of accurate and concise reporting and a high standard of facilitated service. Essential Functions: The focus of this position is Regulatory reporting, and within this field specifically on those reports that are data-oriented rather than conventional reports, such as AnaCredit, Loan data requests, DGS Single Client View files, and the annual data deliveries to the Dutch Tax Administration. Produce and review reports and data sets for management, regulators, and other external parties, in an accurate, compliant, and timely manner Perform variance analysis. Respond to a wide range of enquiries from internal customers, auditors and supervisors, defining and monitoring appropriate follow-up. Review, interpret and apply rules and regulations applicable to statutory reporting (IFRS) and regulatory reporting (CRD IV/CRR and DNB statistics reporting guidelines). Translate new requirements and gaps between current practice and existing requirements, to corrective actions warranting compliance. Facilitate cooperation across finance, and between finance and other functions. Continuously maintain and upgrade procedures, policies, guidelines, tools and methodologies. Test new functionality delivered by IT and new versions of software packages used. Education: The function requires an University level Master’s degree (‘Wetenschappelijk Onderwijs’) preferably in economics or applied mathematics and limited experience in the financial services sector, whether as an employee or as a consultant or auditor. Executive Master level education such as a chartered accountant or controller’s degree is preferred. Functional/Technical Skills and Knowledge requirements: The function requires knowledge of the business processes and of the applicable legislation. The Analyst will further keep his/her knowledge and skills up-to-date by external or internal education and engages with regulatory program office staff, practitioners at other banks, and consultants to gather new professional insights and developments. Verbal and written communication skills in English are essential

title: Distribution Systems Expert
summary: Strong organizational skills (especially as they relate to data collection and reporting), a multi-tasking style and project management approach.
description: Location of job: Tilburg / Netherlands The Staff Business Systems Analyst (BSA) is responsible for supporting, enhancing, implementation, system maintenance for technology projects specifically related to Edwards’ distribution, transportation, warehousing, and labeling systems across the organization globally.
